Name: Business Analyst
Description: Integration Point is a global trade management software provider – meaning, we build software to help thousands of companies manage international trade. Our software helps companies get their products across borders and into the hands of consumers like you. Our clients are truly global and span all industries (apparel, automotive, pharmaceutical, and electronics – just to name a few). We’re looking for smart, creative team members to work directly with our clients and implement our software.What you’ll doWork closely with Fortune 500 clients to understand their supply chain processes and provide excellent customer service at all timesImplement our software to meet each client’s unique business requirementsPerform project management, configuration, and testing tasks for global implementationsAnalyze data to support the global trade management operations of our clientsWork as part of an international team of business analystsWhat you needSuperior analytical, problem solving, and troubleshooting skillsAbility to work independently and in a team environmentExceptional attitude towards customer serviceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsTravel, as needed, to client sites to assist with implementationsBachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, International Business, Industrial Engineering, Management Information Systems, or related fieldGPA of 3.2 or aboveLegally able to work in the United States without sponsorshipBonus pointsCasual attireWorld-class team of industry and technology professionalsTeam outings at the U.S. National Whitewater Center, Topgolf, escape rooms, bowling, and moreCharitable opportunities such as 5k runs and fundraisersEasy walking distance to several restaurants, including Starbucks for that midday slumpRunning groups, pick-up games, several co-ed sports leagues, and a gym to keep you movingMedical, dental, and 401(k)

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Req ID: 31677     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst to join our team in Charlotte, North Carolina (US-NC), United States (US).        POSITION SUMMARY  The Business Analyst uses business and technology knowledge to serve as a liaison between business initiatives and IT in order to determine the correct course of action to achieve desired results. This person collaborates with business and technical resources to determine business information and application needs and assists clients in the analysis of a proposed idea and performs the review, determines the systems potential, conducts documentation, testing (as needed) and follow through.     RESPONSIBILITIES  Analysis and Solution Definition Documents client organization's direction, structure, business processes and requirements.Liaison between the business and development teams throughout the project.Analyzes business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how the application can best function to fulfill those needs.Provides input to buy vs. build decision based on input received from the business and other functions within Technology.Identifies cross impact to other systems.Proposes solutions to problems and considers timeliness, effectiveness, and practicality in addressing client needs.  Project ExecutionUnderstands project plans and is able to clearly articulate roles, project goals, and timelines.Adheres to and facilitates project standards.Creates, consolidates and presents documents relating to use cases, functional requirements, data mapping, privilege provisioning and authorization models, maintaining them throughout the project, including traceability back to requirements.Ensures with the quality management team that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, and that testing plans have been completed.May execute test plans or follow-on testing.Assembles and documents all test results.Provides a business or process perspective during design reviews.Accurately employs methodology and documentation tools.Establishes responsible deadlines and personal work plans and manages time effectively.Participates in change control process throughout the project.Contributes to continuous improvement and proactively supports knowledge sharing within the team and across Technology.Proactively carries out project support /administrative functions.  Communication & TeamworkListens to others and accepts input from team members.Clearly articulates ideas and thoughts verbally.Accurately prepares written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective and professional.Demonstrates flexibility in day-to-day work.Establishes harmonious working relationships with team members; appreciates each team member's contributions and values each individual member.Values internal and external clients and responds to their needs as they arise.Establishes effective working relationship with clients; uses good judgment in what and how to communicate with clients. BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree in business or related field3-5 years of experience as business analystUnderstands basic Internet and client/server architecturesPossesses basic knowledge of HTMLProficient in Microsoft Office suiteExperience in systems implementation, business analysis, and/or project managementAdvanced communication and time management skillsExperience in working with development teams preferredKnowledge of data structures, databases or query tools preferredRapidly adapts and responds to changes in environment and prioritiesExcellent communication, interpersonal, problem solving and analytical skills       This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Company Description null  Job DescriptionMain areas of responsibility:  • Lead requirements definition for complex projects and multi-year strategic initiatives. Identify and translate business needs into clearly defined requirements, and create documentation inclusive of business use cases, process flows, data flows, traceability matrices and report mock-ups.  • Plan, facilitate, and conduct requirements gathering sessions, meetings, and presentations.  • Lead review sessions for completed business/functional requirements with key business users focused on gaining consensus and final business approval.  • Build strong relationships within the business units and support functions to understand the business needs.  • Collaborate with development and testing teams to provide subject matter expertise, ensure that out of the box functionality is leveraged and assist in troubleshooting and resolving issues.  • Ensure that proposed solutions are focused on improving efficiency and effectiveness of the business processes, and are consistent across products where possible.  • Participate in the development and planning of the User Acceptance Testing activities, including test plans and scripts, based on requirements.  • Facilitate UAT execution phase and work with business lead and project manager to obtain user acceptance test signoff.  • Provide direction and leadership to one or more IT Business Analysts.  • Travel as required, approximately 10%.  Qualifications, Skills and Experience:  • 7+ years of business analysis or underwriting experience in Commercial Property & Casualty insurance, including General Liability, Inland Marine, Property, Auto, and Workers Compensation.  • Strong experience with policy administration solutions. Experience with Guidewire PolicyCenter preferred.  • Expert understanding of Commercial Lines products (e.g. WC, GL, Commerical Auto, Property) and underwriting processes, including risk selection, pricing, exposure recognition, application of controls, hazard group identification, and frequency and severity management.  • Exposure to insurance functions, including Claims, Premium Audit, and Loss Control  • Experienced preferred with Agile SCRUM methodology and business analysis methodologies; working knowledge of both SDLC & PMLC processes.  • Experience with business process analysis and improvement is helpful, but not required.  • Hands-on experience writing High-level Business requirements documents and user stories is preferred.  • Knowledge and experience leveraging both IT solutions and business process improvements.  • Experience operating and interfacing with business management, including negotiation and presentation skills.  • Proven track record of creating clear, concise deliverables that reflect a deep understanding of business needs and the out of the box software functionality.  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Understands communication channels and escalates appropriately.  • Proficiency with process modeling tools (e.g., Visio) and other visualization tools is beneficial.  • Experience supervising small teams.  • Strong initiative; able to self-manage. Comfortable with ambiguity and able to work through it to get the right things done.  • Must be able to see tasks through to completion without significant guidance.  • Personal time management skills and ability to meet individual and team deadlines.  • Experience using standard project and business tools including, Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, SharePoint.  • Team player who works well with technical and business resources.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Career Area: Information Technology Experience Level: Experienced Available Work Locations: North Carolina (Charlotte) Ally Requisition #:18-6266 Job Description:Position Description The ideal candidate will have prior experience working as a DevOps engineer & enjoys keeping technical skills reasonably current; to the point that he/she can contribute to architecture discussions. The candidate would be responsible for deploying, automating, maintaining, troubleshooting and improving the processes, environments & systems that keep the delivery channels running smoothly. The role requires you to have hands-on technical experience and a can-do approach towards automation and continuous improvement.  A successful candidate will collaborate across teams to create technology roadmaps. This will include helping innovate, re-engineer and/or invent new value-add services layered on top of the existing services offered currently by the team. Job ResponsibilitiesExperience with OpenShift, Ansible, AWS, Docker or other container/PaaS technologiesExperience administering application servers & webservers (JBoss, Apache, WebLogic, Tomcat, Nginx etc.)Strong Automation skills and Scripting experience (Groovy, bash, yaml etc)Experience with monitoring (AppDynamics, ScienceLogic etc) & analytical tools (Splunk, Kibana etc)Experience with Bitbucket & other version control systemsProficiency in building deployment workflows using Bitbucket, Jenkins, HelmTroubleshoot and fix issues identified in code quality, test and scanning reports with a focus on minimizing impact to our customersExperience with JEE & JavaScriptProduce and maintainquality documentation on installations, procedures and system requirementsExperience with Agile methodologies, and actively participate in Engineering Scrum and design meetings to drive quality deliverables.Excellent verbal & written communication skillsCollaborative & team focusA strong technical foundation in build, release and traditional environmentsEagerness to learn about whatever tools & tricks are needed to get the job doneAbility to occasionally work off-hours / weekendsQualifications1+ years of experience with container frameworks like Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift,3+ years of DevOps, CI/CD environments5+ years of system engineering background with system engineering on OS like Linux, Solaris5+ years of Technical Experience in JEE Application Servers and Webservers5+ years of Java/JEE & JavaScript experienceImplemented & managed build lifecycle through CI/CDExperience with Bitbuckets, Jenkins & HelmAlly Overview Ally Financial Inc. (NYSE: ALLY) is a leading digital financial services company and a top 25 U.S. financial holding company offering financial products for consumers, businesses, automotive dealers and corporate clients. Ally's legacy dates back to 1919, and the company was redesigned in 2009 with a distinctive brand, innovative approach and relentless focus on its customers. Ally has an award-winning online bank (member FDIC), one of the largest full service auto finance operations in the country, a complementary auto-focused insurance business, a growing digital wealth management and online brokerage platform, and a trusted corporate finance business offering capital for equity sponsors and middle-market companies. Business Unit/Enterprise Function Ally's Information Technology (IT) organization is focused on supporting and improving the position of our industry-leading business franchises through cost effective, innovative IT solutions, as well as overseeing critical functions that enable the day-to-day operations of the entire Ally Financial enterprise. IT is also responsible for the administration and execution of information protection, disaster recovery and IT risk management. Total Rewards Information Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid-time-off program including time off for volunteer opportunities. Ally's Total Rewards Program is designed to enrich your life at work -- and outside of it and includes: Industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributionsWellness program encouraging healthy living with financial rewardsFlexible health insurance options including dental and visionPre-tax Health Savings Account with generous employer contributionsPre-tax commuter benefitsOther work-life integration benefits including parental and caregiver leave, adoption assistance, backup child and adult/elder day care program, child care discounts, tuition reimbursement, LifeMatters® Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programsAlly is an Equal Opportunity Employer We extend equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionCorporate Finance plans, tracks, analyzes and reports financial results; manages the company’s balance sheet, including liquidity and funding, capital and investments; oversees internal real estate needs; drives acquisitions; is responsible for financial controls; and leads corporate strategy. Corporate Finance identifies areas of financial risk and mitigates efforts appropriately. It works with capital markets to provide lowest possible costs of incremental funding, subject to capital and financial risk management constraints. It improves financial performance by analyzing business unit performance and recommending areas of improvement. The group strives for excellence in customer service and client support by exhibiting behavior that is fair, reasonable, ethical, and professional.  This position will play a critical role within the Corporate Development Recovery and Resolution Planning team. Given the complex regulatory nature of the program and criticality of successful yearly submission, the team will require a Business Initiatives Consultant to be aligned to each of the divisional workstreams.  This individual will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of each of the RRP Deliverables required for their division, which will include a variety of Strategic Action Playbooks and Reverse Due Diligence documentation. This position will be required to establish partnerships across horizontal & vertical workstreams in order to meet the yearly objectives defined by the regulators for RRP. Business Initiatives Consultant responsible for assisting with the end-to-end planning, tracking, communication and execution of all deliverables and objectives aligned to their respective workstreamCollaborate with partners and stakeholders to create execution plans and ensure that all deliverables and objectives are successfully met per the intended scope and timeline outlined in the RRP Program Calendar.This includes analysis and understanding of the actions and requirements needed, as well as the associated impacts and risks relative to the successful completion of each target milestone.Appropriately report any/all risks and issues, and ensures appropriate escalation to the Corporate Development RRP ProgramEffectively lead routine workstream meetings and ensures active engagement from all required stakeholders throughout the development of all deliverables and committed milestonesPartner with the Senior Deal Manager aligned to their workstream, along with the associated external consultants, to complete an assessment of resource needs to determine the amount of ongoing full time support requiredRemain closely engaged with the Corporate Development RRP Program to ensure alignment with standards and success of the overall RRP Program goals and milestonesAssist in maintaining routine reporting materials to be used for the workstream team, Corporate Development RRP Program and senior managementRequired Qualifications •6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: project management, implementation, or strategic planningCompany DescriptionOur services incorporate face-to-face meetings, in-depth interviews, continuous contact and on-site recruitment services. Unlike other agencies where sales and recruitment are separate, our sales and recruiters function as a unit where both are involved at all stages of engagement and both are accountable for client satisfaction. This unique process helps us develop close client relationships and ultimately function as an extension of their team.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Snapshot Employee Type: Contractor Location: Huntersville, NC Job Type: Information Technology Experience: Not Specified Date Posted:11/6/2018Job Description JOB DESCRIPTION for the Business Analyst  Seeking a Senior Business Analyst to be an intermediary between business partner stakeholders and IT technology teams to ensure the delivery of solutions that meet our company's business needs. This position will assimilate and document business requirements, and translate them into functional and non-functional requirements that the IT development and Infrastructure staff will use to deliver a high quality solution.  The Business Analyst is responsible for identifying business requirements, assessing the impact of system or process changes, eliciting and documenting business process flows and requirements, and providing insight to ensure requirements are traceable to and translated into workable solutions. This role is also responsible for facilitating the definition and execution of user-acceptance testing and providing post implementation support to business stakeholders and end-users to ensure solutions meet the prescribed business requirements. In order to be successful, this Business Analyst must have a thorough understanding of the business processes and functionality of business applications, including our web portal and associated applications. This position must be able to facilitate road-mapping and requirements gathering conversations with business partners. He/she will then support solution design by providing insight at design sessions with IT teams to help translate requirements into business solutions.  Qualified candidates will possess 6+ years of equivalent experience and have a strong understanding of the BA role and associated methodologies. He/she will also have the ability to juggle competing priorities in a fast paced environment. This is an opportunity in an organization transitioning from start-up to mature.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS of the Business Analyst  Elicit and document business process flows, functional and non-functional requirements for business applications.  Facilitate conversations with application developers and ensure they understand requirements and can translate them into a technical design.  Provide traceability between requirements and design.  Define user acceptance criteria for a solution; facilitate UAT execution.  Assist the business in defining change management activities associated with new or changing processes and solutions.  Utilize and understand BA methodologies and tools.  Contribute to improving and maturing the BA practice.  Contribute to the adoption of maturing project methodologies.  Contribute to the initiative intake process.  Contribute to risk and issue lifecycle management.  Prepare and present project information and task details to project team members.  Proactively resolve conflict among team members and functional teams.  Develop and maintain positive working relationships across the company.  Develop and maintain a culture of continuous improvement.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILL SET & QUALIFICATIONS of the Business Analyst  Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, CIS or related field and 6 years of experience in business analysis or a related field OR 8 years of comparable experience without a degree  Minimum of 6 years of Business Analyst experience.  Able to write Business Rules Documents and Requirements  Able to write Tests Cases  Able to lead testing scenario planning and manage test execution  Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and Visio  Experience with Wire Frames  Experience with Flow Charting  Experience in utilizing various methodologies and SDLCs, including waterfall and agile.  Must be able to manage time, work under pressure and deliver on tight deadlines.  The ability to work collaboratively across several IT and business functions.  Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.  Demonstrated success in working within a matrix organization.  PREFERRED SKILLS for the Business Analyst  Six-Sigma green or black belt  Certified Agile SCRUM leader  Job Requirements  Digital Intelligence Systems, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because they inquired about, discussed, or disclosed compensation. Email recruitinghelp @ ********* to contact us if you are an individual with a disability and require accommodation in the application process.Digital Intelligence Systems, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because they inquired about, discussed, or disclosed compensation. Email recruitinghelp @ ********* to contact us if you are an individual with a disability and require accommodation in the application process.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: JAARS mission is to make Bible translation and language development possible, especially in the most remote and difficult places on earth. We do that by enabling locally appropriate and sustainable solutions in transportation, technology, media, and training. We partner closely with SIL International, the organizations of the Wycliffe Global Alliance, and with other organizations locally and globally. JAARS has a 70-year history of innovation and excellence in supporting Bible translation around the world.  We (www.jaars.org) are a 501(c) (3) non-profit Christian ministry headquartered on a beautiful 500+ acre campus just south of Charlotte, NC. Our campus includes extensive training facilities, an airfield, office and commercial facilities, guest housing, food services, recreational areas, clinic, on-site childcare, and youth and family ministry support for staff and partners. We are pleased to have more than five hundred people serving on our campus with JAARS and several partner organizations.  The ministry is experiencing tremendous growth opportunities globally. We recognize that to realize our full potential we need to evaluate our current systems and enhance them for the future. Our leadership team is looking for people with the skills and experience to make this happen.  As JAARS responds to strategic opportunities locally and globally, we are seeking a Business Analyst to bea team leader supporting the JAARS Customer Relationships Management (CRM), and Human Resources environments by establishing and maintaining a close relationship with our business staff, designing and improving business processes, leveraging system functionality for greater effectiveness, coaching and training end-users, and overall operations. The Technology Business Analyst is a member of the Technology & Business Solutions department. This position is a full-time position requiring 40 hours per week. As the nation's premier tire distributor, ATD's coast-to-coast distribution network provides approximately 80,000 customers across the U.S. and Canada with rapid and frequent delivery of high quality tires, custom wheels and shop supplies. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Company Description CapTech is an award-winning national management technology-consulting firm with an enterprising, entrepreneurial environment. We have achieved four straight years ranked in the Top 10 of Consulting Magazine's Best Firms to Work For, including a #5 ranking overall in 2015. Additionally, we placed 28th within the Vault Consulting 50 for the second year in a row, including a #5 ranking in work/life balance.  At CapTech you'll experience a flat organizational structure with access to constant learning -- where your career path isn't set in stone, and you have unlimited potential for growth. CapTech is based upon a culture of mutual respect. We look for, and hire the best. Job Description Business Analysts (BA) at CapTech work side-by-side with key business and technical stakeholders to elicit solution requirements, drive the solution design, and ensure the finished product meets the needs of the business. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description This position reports into the Enterprise Shared Service (ESS) director responsible for Operational Improvement. The role will support the identification, evaluation, management, and execution of process improvement initiatives undertaken by ESS utilizing skills, training, and experience working in a Shared Services environment (Human Resources, Finance, Procurement and Information Technology). The role will develop methodologies to define, measure, analyze, improve and control specific activities to improve areas within Shared Services. The job leads technical and functional areas to conduct process management, improvement and utilizing the skills and techniques within each of those areas, such as, but not limited to; Voice of Customer, Process Mapping, Data Analysis/Modeling, Fishbone Diagram, Regression Analysis and Process Control. The role leads technical and functional owners through a clearly defined Continuous Improvement activity requiring strong planning and relationship building skills combined with meaningful experience with data and performance management. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Marketing and Customer Experience Business AnalystFocus: SAP HANA - Understanding the customer and developing their journey Location: Charlotte, NC Job Description We are looking for a highly capable Business Analyst to join our Fortune 150 Utility client that is in Uptown Charlotte. This 12-month contract with conversion opportunity will focus on a SAP implementation project. This project is a large, multi-year program that will consolidate this company's four legacy billing systems into one customer service platform to deliver the universal experience our customers expect. You will gain extensive knowledge in the newest SAP technologies and become a SME throughout the project. Responsibilities The Business Analyst for Marketing & Customer Experience plays a critical and exciting role in this program by developing subject matter expertise of the Marketing & Customer Experience functions and the related new software capabilities, to develop the solution from a functional perspective on behalf of the programs functional leadership and business unit stakeholders. Functional development includes defining common future state customer journeys and business processes across jurisdictions, defining detailed business requirements, creating functional designs of new software components, configuring the software, defining testing scenarios, and executing test scripts.  The Business Analyst will not only be key in defining and configuring the solution, but will also partner across the broader program team to complete deliverables relating to analytics, reporting and advance the program, particularly with the change management, training, technical architecture and other delivery teams. Basic/Required QualificationsBachelor's degree from a four-year college or university or 3 years of related experience in lieu of a degree1-3 years of related experience in information technology, marketing, project management or process improvementPrevious experience as a business analyst on a large projectSQL ExperienceExperience with SAPDesired QualificationsPossesses a working knowledge of statistics, data mining , programming and predictive modellingExperience in functional software development and knowledge of related methodologiesExperience evaluating complex issues and influencing outcomes or decisions among management level stakeholdersInterest and ability to develop deep knowledge of software capabilities related to marketing & customer experienceFacilitation, communication and interpersonal skillsProject management or process improvement experienceProficient in MS Office products Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, SharePointAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and matrixed organizationKnowledge of SAP Customer Engagement & Commerce, Industry Solution for Utilities or HANA solutions Eight Eleven Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Full Job Description can be obtained from the link '************************************************************************************  The description below may contain some unreadable words or sentences, so you are advised to visit the job link for further details. =================================== PDF DESCRIPTION ================================== Sompo International Holdings Ltd. (Sompo International) is a specialty provider of property and  casualty insurance and reinsurance, established in March 2017 as the result of the acquisition of  Endurance Specialty Holdings Ltd. by Sompo Holdings Ltd. (Sompo).  Sompo's core business encompasses one of the largest property and casualty insurance groups in the  Japanese domestic market. In addition, Sompo is engaged in the provision of insurance services as  well as other related services through its global network of businesses operating in 32 countries  around the world.  Sompo International is the international operation and a wholly owned subsidiary of Sompo, which  trades on the Tokyo Stock Exchange. Through our operating subsidiaries, Sompo International  underwrites agriculture, professional lines, property, marine and energy, and casualty and other  specialty lines of insurance and catastrophe, property, casualty, professional lines, weather risk and  specialty lines of reinsurance.  As a leading global provider of insurance and reinsurance, we recognize that our success is derived  directly from those who matter most: our people. Sompo Internationals headquarters is in Bermuda  and we currently have offices in the United States, the United Kingdom, Continental Europe, and  Asia. At Sompo International, a shared commitment to integrity, teamwork, agility, execution, and  excellence define our culture, and we strive to create exceptional value for our clients and  shareholders and maintain Sompo International as a desirable place to work.  We are seeking a Business Operations Analyst for our Business Operations team in our Charlotte, NC  office. Business Operations acts as the primary source for requesting, ordering, gathering and  organizing pertinent Underwriting and policy information necessary for the achievement of company  goals relating to profit, growth, renewal retention, customer service and broker relationships.  The Business Operations Analyst has responsibility for ensuring Sompo International policy rating,  issuance and premium booking system(s) is functioning effectively for Sompo Internationals book of  business for their assigned line of business. This includes business impact analysis for proposed  changes and/or enhancements; problem analysis and resolution. In addition, provides adhoc training  for Business Operations and various business partners within Sompo International. This position  makes a positive contribution toward department goals by improving consistency, quality and  compliance of Insurance Department regulations as well as company specific guidelines, processes  and procedures. Duties and Responsibilities: Interact with internal departments (i.e. Home Office Underwriting, Premium Audit,  Underwriting) on special projects or tasks as they relate to implementation of changes  impacting business operations, regulatory or compliance requirements.  Review documentation and written materials from internal (i.e. HOU, State Filings) and  external sources (i.e. NCCI and Independent Bureaus) regarding processes, roles,  responsibilities, policy solutions system(s), regulatory and/or compliance related issues.  Communicate necessary  Act as a conduit to ensure ongoing information is provided in regard to system changes,  updates and problems that may impact their respective book of business.  Act as a subject matter expert (SME) that responds to questions regarding process, roles,  responsibilities, rating/policy issuance system, regulatory and/or compliance related  question/problems.  Research and analyze problems pertaining to premium, statistical/financial data or policy  related problems. Explain details of analysis to appropriate business partners when  needed. Makes recommendations to correct and prevent future occurrences, follows  through to implementation of workflow changes when needed. Qualifications 5 - 7 years experience in an operations environment with a strong emphasis in policy  solutions, statistical data and premium booking arena. Exposure to Underwriting, Premium  Audit and Reinsurance a plus.  Demonstrates a sense of urgency  Demonstrates diplomacy in dealing with people across the organization  Demonstrates the ability to evaluate results and resolve problems. Communicates results  to applicable individuals in a clear and comprehensive manner to aid in quick resolution.  Considers a variety of alternative to arrive at a timely, practical solution  Sompo International offers a competitive compensation and benefits package commensurate with  experience. The minimum salary for this position: $59,538. For consideration; please e-mail your  resume along with your Minimum Salary Expectations as well as your Minimum Total Compensation  Expectations to: ********************.  Sompo International is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. M/F/D/V Visit our website at ****************** ================================= PDF DESCRIPTION ENDS ================================

Name: Marketing Technology Data Analyst
Description: Job Description: Position Summary  Bank of America is seeking a marketing technology data analyst to support the design and support of the data and reporting environment. This will require the individual to gain a full understanding of the data captured in our environment including cross-channel campaign data based on 1st and 3rd party data, real-time signals and events to customize the user experience/messaging across multiple touchpoints and the tools/analytic methods (predictive analytics) used within our big data environments. This individual will become a subject matter expert in the data captured and will be a key contributor to how we measure the effectiveness of the programs.  The Marketing Technology Data Analyst must be able to work equally well in both technical and non-technical environments and effectively communicate technical information in a common, non-technical manner. This individual must work well in a fast paced, demanding environment; the ability to efficiently organize and prioritize projects and assignments to meet deadlines is essential to success. Responsibilities include producing regular reports as well as one-off reports for a variety of individuals and groups within the bank as well as writing clear, concise, and accurate SQL for other groups to execute. This individual will be key contributor to all discussions utilizing and/or impacting the data captured. Additionally, this role will require regular education to other business and technical teams regarding the systems and the data supported as part of the requirements gathering phase.  Key Responsibilities and Required Skills include: Good listening and problem solving skillsCommunicate results in a clear and accurate mannerKnowledge of SQL for use on internal SQL-based systems to import, process, and clean data in various formats to support the business needsAbility to keep up with multiple independent projects/tasksWork closely with client-facing team requires good oral and written communicationRequires excellent QA skills to closely review post processed data to ensure data accuracy and integrityMS ExcelSupport Functional & Technical Requirements gatheringMay support multiple projects with competing deadlinesAbility to work in a matrix environment Required Skills: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science highly preferredExperience working with data and databases (SQL, Oracle, DB2, etc)Experience with and basic understanding of relational database system as well as non-relational data environmentsExcellent communication skillsStrong aptitude towards learning new technologiesMultitasking abilityCan be entry level, but needs proven educational experience with the above.Prefer 1-2 years of work experienceShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Location 500 7th Ave. New York, NY or101 S. Tryon St. Charlotte, NC.About AlphaPoint: AlphaPoint is a financial technology company helping make illiquid assets liquid. It enables customers to launch new products and services by providing institutions enterprise-grade blockchain solutions to digitize assets, launch markets, and reduce operational costs. AlphaPoint has customers across 5 continents with offices in New York, Charlotte, Philadelphia, and San Francisco. Position Profile: The Business Analyst within the Product Management department will have primary responsibilities including translating business needs into requirements, workflows, and designs that can be utilized by development and QA staff to achieve product, business and customer goals. The Business Analyst is required to have an in-depth understanding and knowledge of our products, in how they are installed, structured, and function. Job Responsibilities:Elicit business requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, business scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Work independently with customers, users, external and internal resources, both functional and technical, to define concepts and solutions.Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal resources to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements, Business Requirements, Use Cases, UI Screen design / workflow requirements and technical Interface designs, through appropriate assessment and functional specification documents.Present proposed solutions to Product Managers for review and approval prior to providing to customers.Along with reviewing and assessing customer feedback, refine and represent functional and technical designs as requirements, cost and time restrictions change.Work with QA to develop test scenarios, performing functional testing, and/or oversee testing prior to delivery to customerSuccessfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development teams through which requirements flow.Conduct requirements knowledge transfer sessions with the technical and support teams in the organization.Required Skills and Experience:Bachelors or masters degree in computer science, business, or related field (1-5 year of equivalent experience will also qualify)Able to demonstrate working knowledge of agile software development Name: Business Analyst
Description: JAARS mission is to make Bible translation and language development possible, especially in the most remote and difficult places on earth. We do that by enabling locally appropriate and sustainable solutions in transportation, technology, media, and training. We partner closely with SIL International, the organizations of the Wycliffe Global Alliance, and with other organizations locally and globally. JAARS has a 70-year history of innovation and excellence in supporting Bible translation around the world.  We (www.jaars.org) are a 501(c) (3) non-profit Christian ministry headquartered on a beautiful 500+ acre campus just south of Charlotte, NC. Our campus includes extensive training facilities, an airfield, office and commercial facilities, guest housing, food services, recreational areas, clinic, on-site childcare, and youth and family ministry support for staff and partners. We are pleased to have more than five hundred people serving on our campus with JAARS and several partner organizations.  The ministry is experiencing tremendous growth opportunities globally. We recognize that to realize our full potential we need to evaluate our current systems and enhance them for the future. Our leadership team is looking for people with the skills and experience to make this happen.  As JAARS responds to strategic opportunities locally and globally, we are seeking a Business Analyst to bea team leader supporting the JAARS Customer Relationships Management (CRM), and Human Resources environments by establishing and maintaining a close relationship with our business staff, designing and improving business processes, leveraging system functionality for greater effectiveness, coaching and training end-users, and overall operations. The Technology Business Analyst is a member of the Technology & Business Solutions department. This position is a full-time position requiring 40 hours per week. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Snapshot Employee Type: Contractor Location: Huntersville, NC Job Type: Information Technology Experience: Not Specified Date Posted:11/6/2018Job Description JOB DESCRIPTION for the Business Analyst  Seeking a Senior Business Analyst to be an intermediary between business partner stakeholders and IT technology teams to ensure the delivery of solutions that meet our company's business needs. This position will assimilate and document business requirements, and translate them into functional and non-functional requirements that the IT development and Infrastructure staff will use to deliver a high quality solution.  The Business Analyst is responsible for identifying business requirements, assessing the impact of system or process changes, eliciting and documenting business process flows and requirements, and providing insight to ensure requirements are traceable to and translated into workable solutions. This role is also responsible for facilitating the definition and execution of user-acceptance testing and providing post implementation support to business stakeholders and end-users to ensure solutions meet the prescribed business requirements. In order to be successful, this Business Analyst must have a thorough understanding of the business processes and functionality of business applications, including our web portal and associated applications. This position must be able to facilitate road-mapping and requirements gathering conversations with business partners. He/she will then support solution design by providing insight at design sessions with IT teams to help translate requirements into business solutions.  Qualified candidates will possess 6+ years of equivalent experience and have a strong understanding of the BA role and associated methodologies. He/she will also have the ability to juggle competing priorities in a fast paced environment. This is an opportunity in an organization transitioning from start-up to mature.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS of the Business Analyst  Elicit and document business process flows, functional and non-functional requirements for business applications.  Facilitate conversations with application developers and ensure they understand requirements and can translate them into a technical design.  Provide traceability between requirements and design.  Define user acceptance criteria for a solution; facilitate UAT execution.  Assist the business in defining change management activities associated with new or changing processes and solutions.  Utilize and understand BA methodologies and tools.  Contribute to improving and maturing the BA practice.  Contribute to the adoption of maturing project methodologies.  Contribute to the initiative intake process.  Contribute to risk and issue lifecycle management.  Prepare and present project information and task details to project team members.  Proactively resolve conflict among team members and functional teams.  Develop and maintain positive working relationships across the company.  Develop and maintain a culture of continuous improvement.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILL SET & QUALIFICATIONS of the Business Analyst  Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, CIS or related field and 6 years of experience in business analysis or a related field OR 8 years of comparable experience without a degree  Minimum of 6 years of Business Analyst experience.  Able to write Business Rules Documents and Requirements  Able to write Tests Cases  Able to lead testing scenario planning and manage test execution  Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and Visio  Experience with Wire Frames  Experience with Flow Charting  Experience in utilizing various methodologies and SDLCs, including waterfall and agile.  Must be able to manage time, work under pressure and deliver on tight deadlines.  The ability to work collaboratively across several IT and business functions.  Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.  Demonstrated success in working within a matrix organization.  PREFERRED SKILLS for the Business Analyst  Six-Sigma green or black belt  Certified Agile SCRUM leader  Job Requirements  Digital Intelligence Systems, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because they inquired about, discussed, or disclosed compensation. Email recruitinghelp @ ********* to contact us if you are an individual with a disability and require accommodation in the application process.Digital Intelligence Systems, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because they inquired about, discussed, or disclosed compensation. Email recruitinghelp @ ********* to contact us if you are an individual with a disability and require accommodation in the application process.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Company Description CapTech is an award-winning national management technology-consulting firm with an enterprising, entrepreneurial environment. We have achieved four straight years ranked in the Top 10 of Consulting Magazine's Best Firms to Work For, including a #5 ranking overall in 2015. Additionally, we placed 28th within the Vault Consulting 50 for the second year in a row, including a #5 ranking in work/life balance.  At CapTech you'll experience a flat organizational structure with access to constant learning -- where your career path isn't set in stone, and you have unlimited potential for growth. CapTech is based upon a culture of mutual respect. We look for, and hire the best. The creatively innovative, the technically insightful, the driven, the self-managed, the value conscious, the caring, and the gracious person these are all qualities that we look for along with a love and a passion for the work that we do. Job Description Business Analysts (BA) at CapTech work side-by-side with key business and technical stakeholders to elicit solution requirements, drive the solution design, and ensure the finished product meets the needs of the business. Our BAs work on a variety of projects from mobile and content management systems, to large integration efforts spanning multiple lines of business. CapTech BAs are called upon to provide leadership through experience and help shape the strategy of our clients.  Specific responsibilities for the Business Analyst position include: Quickly become familiar with client business challenges and technologies in order to act as a SME and trusted advisor to client stakeholders.Act as key player in a team environment through all phases of the system delivery lifecycle.Provide connection between technical and business views to ensure that high quality and impactful solutions are delivered for our clients.Perform gap analysis to identify capability gaps within the organization, and propose and evaluate alternative solutions that will fulfill the business needs.Work with client stakeholders to understand high level business needs and elicit detailed requirements using various methods.Qualifications Specific qualifications for the Business Analyst position include: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience.Demonstrated progression and growth as a Business Systems Analyst through past career experiences with a minimum of 3 years of experience on IT-related projects.Familiarity with multi-system integration and common issues that can arise when integrating enterprise technologies.Excellent written and verbal communication skills leveraged to interface with senior business leadership and technical resources.Ability to write and perform basic SQL queries preferred.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite as well as change control and defect tracking software.Prior consulting experience preferred.Additional Information We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.  At CapTech we offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to: Competitive salary with performance based bonus opportunitiesSingle and Family Health Insurance plans, including Dental coverageShort-Term and Long-Term disabilityMatching 401(k)Competitive Paid Time OffTraining and Certification opportunities eligible for expense reimbursementTeam building and social activitiesMentor program to help you develop your career At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.  Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly (we are not open to contract or "corp to corp" agreements).  CapTech is an equal opportunity employer.  CapTech is a Drug-Free work place.  Candidates must have the ability to work at CapTech's client locations.  All positions include the possibility of travel.  CapTech has not contracted/does not contract with any outside vendors in its recruitment process. If you are interested in this position, please apply to CapTech directly.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Excellent Benefits Package!!!Location: Gastonia, Elkin or Hickory Projected Hiring Range: $48,355 – $50,900 Closing Date:12/13/2018 by 4 PMPrimary Purpose of Position: This position performs complex professional work in business requirements analysis, project management, technical consultation, and in the design and preparation of system integrations. This position will assist with the development of creative and highly technical solutions within specified time frames. In addition, this position serves as a liaison between the IT Department and other departments or individuals to understand and evaluate workflows, structure and operations of the organization so that recommendations can be made on possible solutions to assist with the agency achieving its goals. Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Covia is a leading supplier of minerals and material solutions to the industrial and energy markets. Our ability to deliver the right product, to the right place, at the right time, is unmatched. Just as strong is our commitment to building partnerships that help our customers succeed.  Quality and innovation are at the foundation of Covia; but our real strength is our people. Covia employs a diverse and highly-skilled team of professionals to convert natural minerals into engineered solutions for our customers. Every member of our team has a valuable opportunity to help shape our future and make a positive impact on the world around us through our commitment to the locations where we live and work.  Covia Corporation is looking for a dynamic Business Process Analyst who will have a positive impact on the Operations team. As a Business Process Analyst, you will provide support to include complex analysis, troubleshooting, configuration, and process changes for the supported application. Our compelling culture supports inclusion, individuality and respect within the workplace. We are committed to providing employment opportunities to the most qualified candidate based on work-related factors and without regard to non-work-related factors including race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or veteran status.  The organization offers competitive salaries, advancement opportunities, and a full range of benefits.  An Equal Opportunity EmployerRequired Skills Required Experience Job Location  Charlotte, US-NC

Description: Job Title: Business Systems Analyst 143308 Duration: 18 Month Contract with chance for extension (W2 USC/Greencard/H4 EAD ONLY - no C2C allowed) Location: Charlotte, NC - Must sit on-site Pay: 42-44/hr To apply: Please email your resume in Word Format to Erica Johnson at and reference Job Order: 143308 or Click the Apply Button.  Strategic Staffing Solutions (S3) seeks a Business Systems Analyst for a long term contract at one of the nation's top financial corporations. This position requires that the selected candidate be located in Charlotte, NC. 5+ years of technology delivery and relationship management experience with a client organization demonstrating excellent planning, project coordination and management, leadership and time management skills5+ years of business systems analysis or design experienceService Level Management and System interface agreement development and tracking.Highly efficient at managing large numbers of activities/tasksAbility to learn new concepts and adapt to environments / situations that are not always clearly defined or ambiguousExcellent communication and presentation skills with an ability to articulate technical solutions to both technical and business audience across large, matrixed teams.3+ years of change management experience in an ITIL/ITSM environment3+ years of PAC2000/ServiceNow experience3+ years of business continuity planning (BCP) experienceAbility to manage complex data collection and analysis activities including conducting extensive source-to-target mapping exercisesRelationship management experience delivering technology services between one or more internal technology organizations and medium to large internal lines of businessKnowledge and understanding of service level agreement process$$ WE OFFER A REFERRAL FEE FOR ANYONE REFERRED & HIRED WITH S3! $$ Strategic Staffing Solutions (S3), based in Detroit, Michigan, prides itself on being an international, woman-owned, $260 million IT and Business Services Corporation. We are ranked 16th among the largest staffing firms in the US by Staffing Industry Report and are one of five companies nationally certified as a Charter Partner with Staffing Industry Analysts. S3 provides IT consulting, customized project solutions, vendor management programs and executive search services to financial institutions, insurance, energy, oil/gas, telecommunication, government, retail and health care industries worldwide. We have more than 2,700 consultants and 31 offices in the US and Europe.S3 is also proud to be nationally recognized as both a Military Friendly and Military Spouse Friendly Employer. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Req ID: 31677     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst to join our team in Charlotte, North Carolina (US-NC), United States (US).        POSITION SUMMARY  The Business Analyst uses business and technology knowledge to serve as a liaison between business initiatives and IT in order to determine the correct course of action to achieve desired results. This person collaborates with business and technical resources to determine business information and application needs and assists clients in the analysis of a proposed idea and performs the review, determines the systems potential, conducts documentation, testing (as needed) and follow through.     RESPONSIBILITIES  Analysis and Solution Definition Documents client organization's direction, structure, business processes and requirements.Liaison between the business and development teams throughout the project.Analyzes business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how the application can best function to fulfill those needs.Provides input to buy vs. build decision based on input received from the business and other functions within Technology.Identifies cross impact to other systems.Proposes solutions to problems and considers timeliness, effectiveness, and practicality in addressing client needs. Communication & TeamworkListens to others and accepts input from team members.Clearly articulates ideas and thoughts verbally.Accurately prepares written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective and professional.Demonstrates flexibility in day-to-day work.Establishes harmonious working relationships with team members; appreciates each team member's contributions and values each individual member.Values internal and external clients and responds to their needs as they arise.Establishes effective working relationship with clients; uses good judgment in what and how to communicate with clients. BASIC QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree in business or related field3-5 years of experience as business analystUnderstands basic Internet and client/server architecturesPossesses basic knowledge of HTMLProficient in Microsoft Office suiteExperience in systems implementation, business analysis, and/or project managementAdvanced communication and time management skillsExperience in working with development teams preferredKnowledge of data structures, databases or query tools preferredRapidly adapts and responds to changes in environment and prioritiesExcellent communication, interpersonal, problem solving and analytical skills       This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: TECHNOLOGY Sr. Business Analyst  Charlotte, NC, USA Apply Job DescriptionDuties: Gather and analyze business requirements for banking and financial domain using Calypso practices; establish specifications for the design and development of regulatory reporting solutions addressing current and anticipated business needs; map conceptual business and financial elements to practical system capabilities in line with industry standards; engage in JAD and brainstorming sessions with business stake holders and develop work/process flow diagrams, sequence/activity diagrams, etc. to be used by the technical development team; and lead business documentation, testing and deployment as a part of a wider project team on the overall process using Calypso, Java, XML, Weblogic and Tibco skills on Oracle and Linux platforms.  This position qualifies under our incentive-based employee referral program. RequirementsEducation and Experience: Master’s degree in Business Administration. Alternatively, Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration plus five (5) years’ experience as Business Analyst, Systems Analyst, Management Analyst or closely related position. Foreign educational equivalent accepted. Skills required: Calypso, Java, XML, WebLogic, Tibco, Oracle and Linux. Worksite: 11 Times Square, Suite 3301, New York, NY 10036. Must be willing to relocate to unanticipated worksites throughout the United States. No travel and/or telecommuting.

Name: Jr. Business Analyst
Description: Role: Junior Business AnalystJob Summary One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. Helps implement customer-centric solutions (web, mobile and call center applications) in a cost-effective way by learning and comprehending business process, eliciting and documenting requirements, and communicating clearly to business and technology. This role requires a level of energy and assertiveness to drive work with multiple groups in a complex, busy environment. The successful candidate will possess experience with full life-cycle application development along with exposure to evaluating, coordinating and creating deliverables; meeting with customers and resolving issues. The role works across functional boundaries to connect-the-dots between IT department products and services. Responsibilities:Support the design and development of both custom and core product features.Understand the business need & gather requirements from clients.Analyze requirements and prepare different use cases and user stories.Develop one or more solution alternativesReview of solution(s) with stakeholders.Prepare Requirement & Solution DocumentExplain requirements to technical teamAssist in UAT.Travel to work at client sites.Skills Required:This person should have technical experience / Knowledge in API Mapping and Design.Knowledge/experience with Confluence, JIRA, technical writing, diagramming, SQL, and XML.Strong communication skills, must be able to communicate with technical and non-technical parties.Ability to work independently as well as collaborate with others.Strong project and time management skills.Ability to analyze current systems/requirements and develop strategies for systems development.Can assist in defining projects, effort and staff requirements.Technical Skills:Experience using Axure Pro/ MS Visio/ Pencil to prepare Wireframes.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.Basic Requirement:Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams

Name: Senior CRM Business Analyst
Description: Logistics done differently.At XPO Logistics, our employees are our greatest asset. As a Senior CRM Business Analyst, you will lead the functional definition of complex, multi-disciplinary projects related to the CRM platform in partnership with Global Business Process Owners. You will also lead business stakeholders through detailed process discussions to gather requirements for both process and systems changes needed. In addition to building strong relationships with Division level subject matter experts, stakeholders, and the IT technical development team, your strong presentation, problem solving, and relationship building skills will be paramount. Our projects, like our users, span the globe and require you to keep the big picture in focus. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work, and the resources to build a career you can be proud of. Pay, benefits and more.We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.What you’ll do on a typical day:Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders, key users and Business Process Leads to analyze business problems and capture detailed requirements that are based upon business needs rather than user preferences; reconcile conflictsFacilitate process meetings/workshops that involve eliciting process requirements and liaising with business stakeholdersDevelop detailed user stories, work plans, deliverables, definitions of overall approaches, and mobilization efforts for CRM initiativesWork closely with IT teams to validate and ensure proposed solutions meet business requirements; participate in initial validation and testing and facilitate UATPartner with program and training/communication teams to ensure business readiness for organizational change and timing for impacted processes/systems changes; assist in creating training documentation and delivery of train-the-trainer sessionsProvide leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to Key Users/SME’s as neededWhat you need to succeed at XPO:At a minimum, you’ll need:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience3 years of experience in an analyst role deploying and supporting a Salesforce.com implementationIt’d be great if you also have:Certificate in any of the following: Salesforce.com, Business Analysis, Systems Analysis, or Business Requirements gatheringAbility to communicate technical concepts and plans at all levelsExcellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to quickly understand the system, process, and culture during periods of ambiguity and rapid changeBe part of something big. #LI-AS1XPO provides cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies, including Disney, Pepsi, L'Oréal, Toyota and many others. We’re the fastest-growing transportation company on the Fortune 500 list and we’re just getting started.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran, or other protected status.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

This person participates in the analysis and development of logical data base designs, data models and relational data base definitions across multiple computing environments.     Responsibilities:  * Assist in data management deliverables such as business need analysis, data source identification and analysis and data modeling techniques. Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: Job Title:  Agile Business Analyst Location:  Charlotte NC  Industry:  Financial Services  Terms:  Contract  Agile Business Analyst Job Summary  : Develops, enhances, debugs, supports, maintains and tests software applications that support business units or supporting functions operations. These application program solutions may involve diverse development platforms, software, hardware, technologies and tools. Participates in the design, development and implementation of complex applications, often using new technologies. May collaborate with external programmers to coordinate delivery of software application. Works under minimal supervision, with general guidance from more seasoned consultants. Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Who you are:Self-motivated and self-managed with a demonstrated analytical ability and curiosityTakes creative approaches to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolutionWorks independently and within a team settingStrong oral and written communication skillsFluent in EnglishLive in or willing to move to Armonk NY, Austin TX, Littleton MA, or Raleigh NC to work collaboratively in the officeHow well help you grow:This role will give you executive visibility and the chance to show that you can drive impactful change.Offer an opportunity to be a part of a hardworking team in a collaborative, borderless organization in an inspiring, empowered environmentProvide a place where youre proud to work and where you are motivated to produce the best results possible No remote opportunities exist  Must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorshipRequired Technical and Professional Expertise 10+ years of experience with IBM support or development processAbility to work with both the business and technical resources to understand and define functional/technical requirements Ability to use Agile collaboration tools (e.g. Mural, Slack, RTC, Trello)Working familiarity with Agile development conceptsMust have excellent communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Subject matter expert in Salesforce Service CloudFamiliarity with IBM brand and business structure EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
