Name: Cloud Business Analyst (BSC5)
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members.  As a Cloud Business Analyst (Business Systems Consultant 5) with the Cloud Foundry Engineering organization, you will be integral in efforts focused on driving internal adoption of the Pivotal Cloud Foundry platform offering. As a member of the team, you are responsible for assisting in defining and executing a product roadmap that expands and matures our platform solution by enabling more business units to deploy applications to the cloud.  This role is inherently cross-functional: you will work closely with the Technical Product Manager/Business Analyst; as well as the engineering, operations, application development, finance, and executive teams to set strategy, launch features, and grow business opportunities for Wells Fargo. This role is a member of a highly visible team that requires you to partner with a variety of leaders and teams across Wells Fargo and engage with leadership at customer organizations and third-party vendors.  The Cloud Business Analyst (Business Systems Consultant 5) is expected to: Perform business analysis/business systems consultant responsibilities while learning technical product management and project management responsibilities for Cloud Foundry Engineering; participating in the Agile functions for the PaaS teamsBuild relationships and collaborate with highly skilled Engineers (Cloud, Systems, Security), as well as with the Technical Product Owner/Business Analyst and business partners to ensure planning, strategy and execution of solutions align with requirements, compliance and bank standards.Partner in execution of the product strategy for driving PCF adoption within key verticals and use cases, including defining and delivering new features and services.Develop crisp, detailed business requirements, documentation, and other project deliverables that can be used to create development specifications and architecture for platforms and applications.Possess the ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage tradeoffs, and evaluate new ideas and opportunities with internal and external partners.Partner with Wells Fargos solution architecture, security, and application development organizations to define and drive go-to-market activities.Proactively identify and resolve issues that may impair the teams ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals.Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions.High attention to detail, including precise and effective customer communications and a proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously. Successful candidates are strong technical leaders who have demonstrated: Technical breadth and depth with platforms, including experience working with IaaS/PaaS, web services, or back-end application infrastructure.Experience driving focus and quality within strong, talented, cross-functional teams to deliver technical products and projects in a fast-paced environment.Strong track record of Name: HR Technology Analyst (Business Analyst)
Description: Job DescriptionJOB SUMMARY The HR Technology Analyst position will be a key role in the implementation activities for Client's new onboarding system, IBM Kenexa Onboard. This position includes gathering and documenting requirements, conducting analysis and assisting with configuring the new system. The Analyst is also responsible for creating test scripts, executing testing, and working with the development team to troubleshoot issues. This position will engage directly with IBM's project resources and internal key stakeholders. The HRT Analyst will report to the HR Technology Recruiting Systems manager. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES " Review and understand existing current state documentation  " Work with the stakeholders to document future state processes and requirements  " Review and consult on functional and technical requirements for accuracy and completeness  " Identify, document and escalate project issues as needed  " Create standard functional specifications and acts as a testing lead  " Assist with test script creation for execution during unit testing and system integration testing that are based on the functional specifications  " Attend all required project meetings  " Perform other related duties as assigned by management REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Skills/Abilities and Knowledge  " Experience with IBM Kenexa BrassRing or similar applicant tracking system, e.g. Taleo, PeopleSoft eRecruit, etc.  " Experience with IBM Kenexa Onboard or similar onboarding system, e.g. SilkRoad.  " Familiarity with prehire activities, e.g. background checks, I-9 processing, etc.  " Ability to adhere to established processing timeframes and make decisions independently.  " Experience in data reporting, validation and analysis  " Experience in continuous process improvement, including technology upgrades and implementation  " Strong analytical capacity and communication skills  " Ability to effectively interact and partner with staff in various levels of the organization  " Strong organizational skills and orientation to detail  " Strong customer service orientation  " Strategic thinking skills with demonstrated experience developing and implementing solutions to issues  " Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, Visio, SharePoint and PowerPoint  " Understanding and demonstrated application of SDLC and project methodology  " Ability to read, write, speak and understand English EDUCATION Bachelor's degree required or equivalent related work experience RELATED WORK EXPERIENCE 5 years of experience working in a HR technology or Recruiting analyst role WORKING CONDITIONS Office environment

Name: Software Business Analyst
Description: Summary / Objective of Position:Investor Management Services (IMS), the leading Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company targeting the commercial real estate industry, is looking for a talented, organized, and energetic individual to fill the role of Software / Business Analyst. In this role on the IMS product team, you will report to the VP of Product and work closely with scrum masters, the development team, the UI/UX team, and the customer success team. Your primary role is to help the VP of Product execute on the IMS product roadmap. To do this, we expect you to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate business/user requirements and translate those requirements into functional specifications that describe what the system, process, or product/service must do to fulfill the end-user/business need. You should have a solid grasp on data analytics, strategy, and Agile methodologies in order to deliver a high-quality product to increase company revenue.IMS is a well-funded startup that is growing fast with a team that has a history of building successful companies. We need to continue to build out new features and ensure customers are on-boarded smoothly, all while seamlessly scaling to support our growth.Our platform enables commercial real estate investment sponsors to proactively manage their investors, investments, and properties. It is a game changer for their businesses! The platform has both a heavy front end (investor dashboards, CRM, etc.) and back end (complex financial calculations and data models). Though our software is complex, you thrive in simplifying complexity. If you have the technical chops and are ready to build a successful software startup that does things the right way, keep reading.Responsibilities* Consult with VP of Product to understand the product vision/roadmap and feature set* Research and develop expertise in key Agile processes* Create strong process flows and diagrams relative to business requirements* Elicit and document functional requirements, ensuring requirements are concise, complete, and prioritized and that they are aligned to the goals of the project and the business* Create and prioritize user stories that developers and testers can develop against and manage the backlog to ensure a successful release that delivers to expectation* Support the development teams to ensure the success of the software solution* Work iteratively with stakeholders to validate/refine requirements, define acceptance tests, and validate results* Facilitate UAT planning and testing* Assist the VP of Product in identifying risks, issues, and dependencies* Provide assistance in identifying, developing, and evaluating systems and procedures* Work within the Agile framework* Serve as a liaison to the other teams in planning, coordinating, developing, and deploying multi-team enhancementsSkills* Strategic Thinking: Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals; Understands organization's strengths & weaknesses; Identifies external threats and opportunities; Adapts strategy to changing conditions* Analytical: Undertakes complex tasks and breaks them down into manageable parts in a systematic way, thinks of multiple possible causes and anticipates consequences of situations, thinks of possible alternatives for a situation* Problem Solving: Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics* Team Work: Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed* Communication: Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings; Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar* Adaptability: Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events* Quality Management: Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughnessExperience, Education, & Qualifications* Experience documenting user stories and requirements* Ability to gather information, consult those who need to be involved, and drive decisions* Experience writing requirements and driving requirements through the full SDLC (Includes business requirements, functional design, conceptual mockups, use cases, test plans, and implementation plans and can review and understand technical design)* Degree in business administration or computer science / information systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or experience* 1-3 years experience as a business or software analyst preferred* Demonstrated ability to communicate a vision, build relationships, and obtain buy-in* Ability to adapt as business needs change* Data analysis and problem-solving skills* Demonstrated organization and planning skills* Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environmentLocation: This role is located in Charlotte, North Carolina.AAP/EEO Statement: Investor Management Services, LLC is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Marketing Technology Data Analyst
Description: Job Description: Position Summary  Bank of America is seeking a marketing technology data analyst to support the design and support of the data and reporting environment. This will require the individual to gain a full understanding of the data captured in our environment including cross-channel campaign data based on 1st and 3rd party data, real-time signals and events to customize the user experience/messaging across multiple touchpoints and the tools/analytic methods (predictive analytics) used within our big data environments. This individual will become a subject matter expert in the data captured and will be a key contributor to how we measure the effectiveness of the programs.  The Marketing Technology Data Analyst must be able to work equally well in both technical and non-technical environments and effectively communicate technical information in a common, non-technical manner. This individual must work well in a fast paced, demanding environment; the ability to efficiently organize and prioritize projects and assignments to meet deadlines is essential to success. Responsibilities include producing regular reports as well as one-off reports for a variety of individuals and groups within the bank as well as writing clear, concise, and accurate SQL for other groups to execute. This individual will be key contributor to all discussions utilizing and/or impacting the data captured. Additionally, this role will require regular education to other business and technical teams regarding the systems and the data supported as part of the requirements gathering phase.  Key Responsibilities and Required Skills include: Good listening and problem solving skillsCommunicate results in a clear and accurate mannerKnowledge of SQL for use on internal SQL-based systems to import, process, and clean data in various formats to support the business needsAbility to keep up with multiple independent projects/tasksWork closely with client-facing team requires good oral and written communicationRequires excellent QA skills to closely review post processed data to ensure data accuracy and integrityMS ExcelSupport Functional & Technical Requirements gatheringMay support multiple projects with competing deadlinesAbility to work in a matrix environment Required Skills: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science highly preferredExperience working with data and databases (SQL, Oracle, DB2, etc)Experience with and basic understanding of relational database system as well as non-relational data environmentsExcellent communication skillsStrong aptitude towards learning new technologiesMultitasking abilityCan be entry level, but needs proven educational experience with the above.Prefer 1-2 years of work experienceShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Recruiter Duke Energy  Location Charlotte, North Carolina  Salary Competitive  Posted 18 Nov 2018  Closes 18 Dec 2018  Ref R6505  Sector Power and Nuclear  Category Business and Commercial, Skilled Trades  Contract Type Permanent  Hours Full Time  You need to sign in or create an account to save  More than a career - a chance to make a difference in people's lives.  Build an exciting, rewarding career with us - help us make a difference for millions of people every day. Consider joining the Duke Energy team, where you'll find a friendly work environment, opportunities for growth and development, recognition for your work, and competitive pay and benefits. Position Summary Responsible for all IT business consulting activities for a business group or function serving as the primary interface between business groups and IT. Incumbent responsible for understanding the work processes of the assigned business group and evaluating and integrating IT products and services into the business area to meet business needs or business process improvements. Provides technical knowledge to ensure efficient design, development, implementation, and support of systems and interfaces with programmers to explain solutions. Responsible for overall customer satisfaction, customer communications, problem resolution consultation or oversight, and development and adherence to service level agreements. Responsible for IT representation on assigned business areas steering teams, quality improvement teams, and continuous improvement teams, project implementation teams and working groups. May also participate in the testing and evaluation of new IT solutions. Employees at this level participate in project implementations to understand impacts to their assigned business groups.  Responsible for working with assigned business areas to do annual and long range IT investment planning. Coordinates the Application Portfolio Management (APM) Process for the assigned business department to systematically review the functional and technical health of all business applications on an annual basis (entire portfolio is assessed over a 3 year rolling cycle). Outputs of the APM Process are feeders to the short and long term planning process. Responsibilities Create test strategy for features and convert them to detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases  Responsible for driving work planning and execution for QA team offshore and onsite.  Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.  Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities.  Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools.  Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs.  Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved.  Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet business needs.  Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and project sponsors) to identify system requirements.  Monitor debugging process results.  Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions.  Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts.  Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies.  All other duties as assigned.  Basic/Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline  Years of prior equivalent work related experience in lieu of a degree: 4  3 years of related experience in business and/or information technology systems analysis or support. Desired Qualifications Experience analyzing and creating test cases and scripts  Experience testing Web Applications  Tosca Test Automation experience  Experience with HP Quality Center  Experience with Agile testing and JIRA  Travel Requirements 15-25% Relocation Assistance Provided (as applicable)  No  Represented/Union Position  No  Visa Sponsored Position  No  Posting Expiration Date  Friday, November 23, 2018  All job postings expire at 12:01 AM on the posting expiration date.  Please note that in order to be considered for this position, you must possess all of the basic/required qualifications.

Name: Finance Business Process Analyst
Description: Job Description: Within the CFO organization, Team Accelerated Solutions & Automated Processes (Team ASAP) is focused on driving efficiency and productivity across Finance. To this end, Team ASAP combines process reengineering and, in partnership with GT&O, the introduction of new and emerging technologies. Linked to Enterprise initiatives such as Operational Excellence and Enterprise Cost Management, Team ASAPs goal is to reduce manual efforts and errors, improve productivity, and streamline existing functions.  Team ASAP has an open position for a Finance Business Process Analyst. This is an excellent opportunity to learn about new technologies, driving change, and improving the organization to support Responsible Growth.  Focused primarily on process reengineering, qualities and skills of a successful candidate include the following: Analyze business problems and provide recommendations around people resources, process, and technology enhancementsAssists with documentation of business requirementsBuild credibility and trust with business partners to unveil complexities and nuances of the business and its processesDemonstrate an eagerness to leverage technology, old and new, identify and solve problems, improve processes, and re-align resourcesIntegrate best practices with process design to ensure continuous process improvementSupport building business cases and (if needed) gain consensus for rapid decision making On a daily basis, tasks and responsibilities may include:  - Coordinates gathering input/feedback from business SMEs  - Supports delivery of tasks and milestones on projects and understands dependencies and calendar  - Assist in establishment of success criteria of projects  - Partners with the CFO business and/or process owners to: Understand and help document (if needed) current stateAnalyze business processes impacted to ensure processes are designed efficiently and effectively (operational excellence) and determine readiness for technology driven solutionIdentify improvement opportunities and riskArticulate business requirements and provide insight into potential solutionsProduces pilot and rollout plans for new functionality or processes, including support of business training expansion and adoption activitiesLeverages common reusable templates and ensures consistency in deliverables across program Enterprise Role Overview  Manages diverse administrative functions usually for a very large, complex department or business unit. Functions managed may include: financial control/budgeting and consolidation, personnel processes, audit/compliance, premises, and coordination of certain projects, associate training, service quality, process improvement, business continuity, or communication. May consult with senior management to define and manage projects that encompass and impact many associates. Requires a thorough knowledge of the department or business unit's functional area or products. Working knowledge of general bank policies, programs and procedures and financial/accounting practices. May have full management responsibility over a team or may manage one level of managers. Required Skills and Experience:Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience5+ years experience around process improvement/re-engineering within a financial institutionStrong relationship/business partnering skills a mustExcellent communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate complex and/or technical information as well as lead/facilitate discussions across various levels of stakeholders/support partners.Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skillsOrganized, result-driven, and able to work on multiples tasks with limited supervisionEnjoys working in a fast paced environment with rapidly changing demands and priorities; willingness to take on new initiativesShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Financial Business Analyst
Description: Job Description More than a career - a chance to make a difference in people's lives.  Build an exciting, rewarding career with us - help us make a difference for millions of people every day. Consider joining the Duke Energy team, where you'll find a friendly work environment, opportunities for growth and development, recognition for your work, and competitive pay and benefits.  The preferred location for this role is Charlotte, NC but we will consider other locations if we find the ideal candidate.Position Summary  This a newly created position on the Energy Services Business Support team within Duke Energy's Market Solutions & Innovation (MSI) expanding portfolio of customer programs and services. These programs and services target Duke's regulated and non-regulated commercial, industrial and institutional customers, both inside and outside the Duke, regulated service territory, and enable customers to stay focused on their core business by managing their energy and facility systems.  The Business Support team collaborates across the Energy Services and Commercial Solutions teams and partners with other areas of MSI, as well as Finance, Supply Chain, and other corporate departments at all levels. Responsibilities include strategic planning, budgeting, forecasting, P & L analysis and reporting, portfolio management, compliance, Business Intelligence (BI) analysis and reporting, complex customer contract management and governance, expense code block governance, and internal/external data analysis and management reporting. Strong financial and analytical acumen are necessary to succeed in this role, and prior experience working with a business development and/or project implementation function will also be beneficial. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: About the RoleAs a business intelligence analyst at Passport, you will be looked to for providing the source of truth on key business metrics across the company. You'll partner with stakeholders in different parts of the organization in order to establish and deliver consistent quantitative measures of business performance, including regular reports, business dashboards, and ad-hoc queries as necessary. You will serve as the go-to resource for business insights that can be derived from data that lives in a number of repositories across the company, and you'll champion analyzing that data to help us drive our ambitious growth goals. Responsibilities include:Effectively prioritize, manage, and deliver on a roster of projects driven by multiple stakeholders across the organization.Assess the data necessary to answer key business questions and define requirements that may be necessary to fill in any gaps identified.Be resourceful in identifying sources of data that can be useful to generating new insights to drive better decision making and growth for our business.Assist in creating the right data aggregation strategies for massive data repositories in order to facilitate efficient queries and reporting.Occasionally evaluate our business intelligence toolset and explore additional opportunities to enhance our capabilities.Keep up with the latest best practices in the field of business intelligence, raising those that may be relevant to Passport's business to the team for discussion.Collaborate with and encourage Passport managers and leaders to become better at incorporating data into decision making.Maintain and develop of our organizational dashboards and deeper level tools for self-service insights.Highlight stand-out insights and notable anomalies spotted in the course of delivering these views to stakeholders.Cooperate with infrastructure and devops to deploy updates and make sure B.I. tools remain functional through other system changes.Make sure data governance and compliance requirements are met in delivery of business intelligence insights.Field ad-hoc requests for deriving new insights from our data resources.Advise on data requirements related to new product development and enhancements.Qualifications:At least 3 years of professional experience in business analyticsBachelor's degree in business, analytics or a related field. MBA, a plus.Solid SQL skills and a general understanding of database systems. You should be comfortable exploring the contents and relationships among hundreds of very large tables in order to track down data that will help you answer business questions.Ability to translate data into meaningful business insights for decision makingExperience turning data into effective visualizationsWorking knowledge of statistical methodsTrack record of successfully delivering projects on timeStrong communication skills, especially at being able to communicate complex information clearly to multiple partiesStrong relationship building and interpersonal skills with the ability to instill confidenceAbility to manage project deliverables across several projects at a timeDesired skills:Experience using cloud-based B.I. or dashboarding tools such as PeriscopeInterest or experience in mobile technology and consumer behaviorExperience incorporating geolocation data into analysisTrack record of successfully contributing value through data analyticsExperience using R or Python, especially with dashboarding and/or visualization librariesAbout YouYou obsess over the details. You blend technical ability with business acumen. While you are not necessarily a developer, you may have tinkered and are familiar with development methodologies. You are effective at connecting long-term vision to near-term objectives.  You are incredibly organized. Nothing slips through the cracks when you're running a project. You measure everything. You are inquisitive, and you know how to listen and incorporate new knowledge into your projects. You have a knack for connecting the dots across multiple things and ensuring they are consistent. You know how to work collaboratively across teams in order to produce the strongest outputs. Above all else, you are an excellent communicator, both written and verbal, and you understand how to effectively convey ideas to various stakeholders across the organization.  You will have the opportunity to wear several hats, and you should be comfortable learning new things and taking on new responsibilities. You'll spearhead strategic initiatives. You won't hesitate to roll up your sleeves and do the dirty work to turn your concepts into reality. You'll team up with sales and marketing one day, dig through spreadsheets and analytics tools another day, and deep dive with product and engineering the next. You're comfortable working in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment.  You read the books, you've followed the blogs, and as someone committed to continual improvement, you're excited to improve the overall practice of business intelligence at Passport.  Willingness to travel up to 5%.About UsPassport transforms the way cities manage their operations. The fintech company's mobile-first platform has been adopted by more than 450 cities, universities, and private operators around the world in cities including Chicago, Toronto, London, and Miami, across more than 5,000 locations. Passport's product lines parking, transit and tolling payments, parking enforcement, and permit management enable organizations in the public and private sectors to streamline their operations, enhance customer service, and make data-driven decisions. Consistently recognized as one of the fastest growing companies and Best Places to Work in Charlotte, North Carolina, Passport has an ingrained practice of putting People First a guiding principle in its culture.  Passport is backed by a group of investors, including Bain Capital Ventures, Grotech Ventures, MK Capital and Relevance Media.  Passport provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

Name: Supply Chain Business Analyst
Description: The Transportation & Warehousing (Supply Chain) Business Analyst position has the overall responsibility and accountability for managing month-end close activities, communicating trends, forecasting, annual planning, business analysis, control and reporting as it relates transportation & warehousing activities. In addition, the Business Analyst plays a key role by business partnering and supporting execution of set objectives by Supply Chain business partners.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Prepare supply chain cost analysis/standard reporting on a daily/weekly/monthly basis to highlight key performance metrics.Prepare monthly forecast using valid and accurate assumptions and obtain consensus from business partners.Develop the annual plan by collaborating with all necessary stakeholders to reflect all headwinds/tailwinds needed for budget preparation.Provide support, reporting, and validation for month end close process.Work closely with the Accounting Department on month-end journal entry data requirements and audit requests.Validate with the Accounting partners all reserve balances pertaining to supply chain, and make appropriate adjustments, if necessary.Identify cost trends and make recommendations for cost out/process improvements and track results.Lead initiatives to enhance/automate reporting capabilities, both from financial and operational perspective.Resolve and follow-up on all supply chain related financial requests and inquiries by internal/external stakeholders.Provide analytical support to business partners in terms of collecting, analyzing, and reporting cost trends and any other ad hoc project requests.Prepare investment requests as needed to support business initiatives related to capital spending.Work closely with Commercial Business Analysts and Product Line Analysts to provide leading indicators related to supply chain cost components.Provide cost reporting to Sales and Product Line Managers by product line, channel, platform and at a SKU level. Minimum Qualification BS Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related fieldsMinimum 3 - 5 years’ experience with data analysis or measurement reportingStrong analytical skills with strong cost modeling experienceAdvanced skills in Microsoft Excel for data mining, analysis and reporting. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and MS QueryPreferred System utilization: JD Edwards, SAP.Must be able to apply analytical and decision making skills without direct supervision.Capable of setting priorities, meeting pre-determined deadlines and multi-taskingPossess excellent verbal and written communication skillsAble to work effectively with cross functional teams and at all levels of management.Prior knowledge of working with transportation modes, load utilization, load distance to calculate volume/mix impact, preferredPrior experience working with line haul, fuel and accessorial freight cost components, preferred.Ability to respond quickly and positively to change as well as acting as a change catalystUnquestionable business ethics and integrityStrong analytical, planning and organizational skills

Name: Mid Level Business Analyst with SQL

The ideal candidate will 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst as well as 2+ years of experience writing SQL statements and queries. Job Description: The Business Analyst will analyze and translate the business needs and assess the feasibility for enhancements to existing applications or building new applications. Highly organized and motivated to deliver results with minimal direction Creative and proactive problem solver ability to understand what the team needs and offer suggestions above and beyond what they desire Naturally curious individual with the ability to quickly become the authority in the various data and systems used by the team Strong communication skills, interpersonal skill are must. Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and Visio should have excellent documentation skills Any experience in Capital Markets and/or Regulatory Compliance areas is a huge plus Any experience in Salesforce design is a huge plus.

Name: Business Analyst, Risk Advisory
Description: OverviewDHG is a certified public accounting and advisory firm offering assurance, tax and advisory services. With a growing international presence and ranking amongst the top 20 accounting firms in the nation, the firm combine’s deep industry experience with a strong commitment to personal service. DHG understands the complexities and challenges of delivering both regulatory and strategic change initiatives by offering a fresh perspective and innovative solutions to complex risk, compliance, and regulatory concerns. The firm’s consulting and advisory clients include Fortune 500 companies across a variety of industries in all 50 states and internationally.ResponsibilitiesDHG Risk Advisory Services (RAS) is currently seeking a Business Analyst that will be responsible for maintaining and advancing the tools that will report, analyze, and forecast the results of our practice. These tools will support monthly, annual, and special project goals for all professionals across its rapidly-growing global consulting practice. Primary consumers of these tools and the actionable intelligence they provide will be leveraged by all RAS professionals. In addition to business analysis responsibilities, this position will include the review of various compliance requirements and assist with various resource management/scheduling priorities. The position is located in Charlotte, North Carolina.  Responsibilities of the position will include:  • Work in collaboration with the Scheduling Coordinator and Financial Analyst to document, train, and implement new finance and operational processes across DHG RAS• Track general operating performance and monitor specific service line results • Compile and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasts and subsequent results • Analyze engagement performance and proactive work with billing partners and managers to ensure engagements perform as planned • Assist in the creation of scheduling forecasts, strategic business plans, and models • Monitor compliance activity requirements for large and complex professional services contracts / programs. • Ensure conformity and consistency in application of legal and business policies and practices across all RAS markets. • Assist in the preparation of financial and business performance schedules for routine meetings and presentations• Assist in maintaining scheduling tool to ensure reporting accuracy• Respond to scheduling updates and ad-hoc requests sent to a centralized Scheduling mailbox• Develop trend analysis of staff utilization to be used for workforce planning• Demonstrated communication skills to include written, verbal, and effective listening skills • Demonstrated problem solving as well as continuous process improvement skills • Consistent track record of on time work product delivery and attention to detail • Ability to handle confidential information • Demonstrated analytical and organizational proficiency • Ability to prioritize and multi-task while maintaining accuracyQualifications• BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance or related discipline preferred• 1 - 2 years of related experience (full time or internships) required • Experience in professional services preferred • Advanced Excel competency, Microsoft BI, and database proficiency preferred

Name: Business Analyst - Insurance
Description: Title: Business Analyst - InsuranceDuration: 6+ MonthsLocation: Charlotte, NCJob description: We are seeking a Business Analyst, Insurance to join our Information Technology team in our Charlotte, NC office as a contractor. Main areas of responsibility: • Lead requirements definition for complex projects and multi-year strategic initiatives. Identify and translate business needs into clearly defined requirements, and create documentation inclusive of business use cases, process flows, data flows, traceability matrices and report mock-ups.  • Plan, facilitate, and conduct requirements gathering sessions, meetings, and presentations.  • Lead review sessions for completed business/functional requirements with key business users focused on gaining consensus and final business approval.  • Build strong relationships within the business units and support functions to understand the business needs.  • Collaborate with development and testing teams to provide subject matter expertise, ensure that out of the box functionality is leveraged and assist in troubleshooting and resolving issues.  • Ensure that proposed solutions are focused on improving efficiency and effectiveness of the business processes, and are consistent across products where possible.  • Participate in the development and planning of the User Acceptance Testing activities, including test plans and scripts, based on requirements.  • Facilitate UAT execution phase and work with business lead and project manager to obtain user acceptance test signoff.  • Provide direction and leadership to one or more IT Business Analysts.  • Travel as required, approximately 10%. Qualifications, Skills and Experience: • 7+ years of business analysis or underwriting experience in Commercial Property & Casualty insurance, including General Liability, Inland Marine, Property, Auto, and Workers Compensation.  • Strong experience with policy administration solutions. Experience with Guidewire PolicyCenter preferred.  • Expert understanding of Commercial Lines products (e.g. WC, GL, Commerical Auto, Property) and underwriting processes, including risk selection, pricing, exposure recognition, application of controls, hazard group identification, and frequency and severity management.  • Exposure to insurance functions, including Claims, Premium Audit, and Loss Control  • Experienced preferred with Agile SCRUM methodology and business analysis methodologies; working knowledge of both SDLC & PMLC processes.  • Experience with business process analysis and improvement is helpful, but not required.  • Hands-on experience writing High-level Business requirements documents and user stories is preferred.  • Knowledge and experience leveraging both IT solutions and business process improvements.  • Experience operating and interfacing with business management, including negotiation and presentation skills.  • Proven track record of creating clear, concise deliverables that reflect a deep understanding of business needs and the out of the box software functionality.  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Understands communication channels and escalates appropriately.  • Proficiency with process modeling tools (e.g., Visio) and other visualization tools is beneficial.  • Experience supervising small teams.  • Strong initiative; able to self-manage. Comfortable with ambiguity and able to work through it to get the right things done.  • Must be able to see tasks through to completion without significant guidance.  • Personal time management skills and ability to meet individual and team deadlines.  • Experience using standard project and business tools including, Microsoft Project, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, SharePoint.  • Team player who works well with technical and business resources. Thanks and Regards,Rishabh ShuklaTechnical LeadStellar Consulting Solutions, LLC.http://www.stellarconsulting.comPhone: 678-935-7711E-Mail: rishabh@stellarconsulting.comLinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/rishabh-shukla-39119853- provided by Dice  Commercial Property & Casualty insurance, MS Visio, MS Office

Name: Senior Financial Business Analyst - Cold Product Line
Description: Electrolux North America, Inc., a $5 billion manufacturing and sales subsidiary of AB Electrolux, is seeking a Product Line Senior Business Analyst. This position has overall responsibility and accountability for understanding and communicating the Food Preservation Product Line’s financial position.  It is also responsible for providing financial support to the Product Line Team by creating and maintaining periodic reports that analyze and communicate actual performance and the implications of ongoing business decisions as well as forecasting future performance. The Senior Business Analyst position is a critical link between the sales and marketing, operations and product line groups, and provides valuable insight on a daily basis to the financial performance through its analysis and reporting. The Senior Business Analyst position will take day-to-day direction from the Product Line Team and Finance Manager for the Food Preservation Product Line, and will funnel information through the various departments in the finance organization as needed, ensuring one consistent approach/method is used across the Sector.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Support the finance manager in monitoring and managing the financial activities of the Cold Product Line, including both the P&L and balance sheet. Includes understanding and providing financial analysis (trends, etc.) to the Finance manager, VP, and other forward-looking insightsSupport the Cost Initiatives with analysis and providing direction as requiredFinance support on Product Line Projects and Product Development activitiesFinance support capital investments related to the product line, including providing financial review and guidance, where necessaryWork cross-functionally with Pricing, Sales Channel and Operations Finance Teams to drive connectivity within the financial team and communications are consistentAssist in the monthly reporting requirements including statutory reports and management analysis related to the manufacturing operations. Have a thorough understanding of the business drivers of the operations and the accounting treatment of transactions.Participate in ongoing business management with plant managers, senior operations leaders and other business managers relating to plant cost controls and improvement activities. Communicate effectively with senior management and influence decisionsManage and execute special projects as assign by the Chief Financial Officer or VPProvide annual projections, periodic forecasts, and business architecture (profitability per channel/platform/market) analyses as requiredInvestment request analysis“Closing the Gap” activities regarding the business financial targets – exploring all alternatives  Understanding Electrolux accounting policies and procedures and making informed business decisions according to policy is an underlying responsibility of all Electrolux financial personnel. Minimum Qualification Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in Accounting or FinanceRobust business understandingMinimum 5 years of finance experience with financial analysis including sales trends analysiscustomer and consumer marketing analysisresource allocation analysiscapital investment analysis KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skillsManufacturing experience preferredSolid understanding of accounting and financial conceptsExperience working with and advising senior management of financial and business strategiesHighly motivated / Driven / Proactive approach to business needsStrong interpersonal skills with the ability to thrive in a ‘matrix’ organizationAbility to adjust/react quickly to changes and changing prioritiesAbility to drive changeUnquestionable business ethics and integrityStructured, operative, pragmatic attitude and approach to tasksProficiency in Microsoft Office, SAP preferred, Qlikview and JD Edwards knowledge a plus

Name: Operations Business Process Analyst
Description: The Operations Business Process Analyst acts as a liaison between the global Operations team, the IT department, and other adjacent global teams such as Finance, Customer Care, and Technical Services. Ability to define business requirements to determine appropriate solutions.Advanced knowledge of MRP software; SAP, Oracle, Sage MAS, etc.Advanced understanding of SQL, knowledge of Power BI a plus.Advanced understanding of BOM structures, routings, and MRP tools.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Ability to create macros, VLOOKUPS, and Pivot Tables required.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Detail oriented with exceptional time management and multi-tasking ability.Proven ability to develop reports and analyze data to initiate problem solving. Must be analytical and data driven in decision making process.Excellent interpersonal, writing, speaking, coordinating and organizational skills.Must be a team player with ability to handle multiple simultaneous tasks and follow-up on requests.Be part of something scent-sational...Competitive payMedical, dental, vision, and life insuranceCompany matched 401kFun, team-focused work environmentEmployee driven community outreach program

Name: Analyst, Client Reports
Description: TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.  TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. If you’re passionate about innovation and making an impact on the large SMB market, come join us as we power our clients’ business success with extraordinary HR.JOB SUMMARY/OVERVIEW The Client Reports Analyst is responsible for the creation of custom reports for TriNet customers and supports the associated business services processes. The analyst helps TriNet customers maximize the service value they receive through the development of accurate and timely custom report creation. Provides training, coaching, and mentoring for staff that serves as the primary method for the creation and maintenance of custom client reports and training of TriNet Clients. Also acts as a liaison between internal TriNet departments and TriNet customers regarding custom client reports. Resolves escalated report-related issues by working with the assigned Client Services account team. ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIESBuild client loyalty and minimizes controllable client attrition through the effective management of custom client report creation and maintenance.Drive coordination between client-facing and internal TriNet groups for the delivery of dependable, accurate, timely and easy to use reports.Provide guidance, coaching, and mentoring to the Client Service teams on all available reporting features.Drives new process development and training for TriNet Reports to all colleagues, as appropriate.Ensure the quality and availability of TriNet Passport Training to all customersServe as the main escalation point for clients and internal TriNet departments.Work closely with Client leadership and other internal departments to continuously improve processes and preclude or prevent recurrence of report-related problems.Responsible for customer service delivery disciplines when working directly with customers.Drive the resolution of complex and escalated report-related complaints and issues.Provide on-going education and information to appropriate Client Services teams on TriNet reporting-relates systems and capabilities.Demonstrates flexibility in examining new approaches in problem solving in response to changing organizational objectives.Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the Manager/Director’s discretion.JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS Education: Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Advance knowledge of and experience in custom client report creation, including the development of highly complex GL reports. Training Requirements (licenses, programs, or certificates):Experience:Minimum two years of customer service experience.Minimum five years of experience in custom report creation in a high volume, fast paced environment.Proven ability to manage client escalations to timely resolution resulting in increased client satisfaction and retention.Experience with, knowledge of, and ability to apply excellent customer service practicesOther Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Excellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to communicate with employees and customers at all levels of the organizationStrong knowledge and understanding of system capabilities and requirements in relation to custom client report creation and management.Excellent interpersonal skills.Excellent presentation and facilitation skills.A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplaceAbility to adapt to a fast paced continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.Ability to apply basic mathematical operations and perform cost and variance analysis.Ability to use software to create reports, presentations and spreadsheets involving complex databases and information. Must have a high level of proficiency with Microsoft Office applications and email. Experience in using intranets, extranets, and internet for business applications desired.Must be highly organized, able to effectively prioritize work, be oriented to detail, and have excellent follow through.Ability to build and skilled at building effective business relationships and positively influencing others.Ability to train, mentor, and coach others.Knowledge of PEO products, services, and markets, as well as operations, cross-functional workflows, and interaction between the various company units, processes, and systems, a plus.Ability to coordinate action and provide leadership to others to facilitate customer service excellence.Ability to communicate ideas and information clearly, accurately, and tactfully verbally and in writing.Ability to organize, prioritize work, and ensure timely deliverables and services that are effective, efficient, and economicalWORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.)Limited travel requiredWork in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office settingThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear.The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Please Note: TriNet reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Position functions and qualifications may vary depending on business necessity. Highly organized and motivated to deliver results with minimal direction Creative and proactive problem solver ability to understand what the team needs and offer suggestions above and beyond what they desire Naturally curious individual with the ability to quickly become the authority in the various data and systems used by the team Strong communication skills, interpersonal skill are must. Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and Visio should have excellent documentation skills Any experience in Capital Markets and/or Regulatory Compliance areas is a huge plus Any experience in Salesforce design is a huge plus.

Name: Sr. Systems Analyst/ Business systems Analyst
Description: Duration: 10 monthsJob Description: Looking for a Senior Systems Analyst to join a Production Support team for supporting our institutional retirement application portfolio. The Analyst is expected to scale up quickly and join an existing production support team in supporting critical applications. Primary focus will be to drive diagnostics of critical applications including real time incidents. This will also include software and infrastructure assessment to determine underlying issues with critical applications both in file processing mode and invocation of the application through online access. Understanding of online access to applications, web services and associated infrastructure components is paramount.Previous use of diagnostic tools such as Tealeaf, CAs Wily, dynaTrace are an advantage in addition to experience reading application logs and other sources of diagnostic information. The scope of support is growing fast and the candidate will need to be able to work independently as well as interface with multiple teams across functions in day to day work. The ideal candidate will be highly organized with good communication skills so as to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and to be able to respond to and manage unplanned priorities.  Responsibilities:  1) Work on Production issues and defects to provide timely diagnostics, recommendations and resolution both for real time events and as follow up to open incidents.  2) Support software Release testing and provide production support sign off for new versions and to assist in software release activities including post deployment validation and incident management  3) Assist in the on boarding of new clients to the institutional retirement application suite including readiness and transition to steady state  4) Work with critical development, test and software vendor(s) on issues that need diagnostics including triage and data gathering, configuration, data changes, workarounds and/or code fix(-es)  5) Interface with other downstream application and business operations teams on issues and problems to manage business workflows, processing requirements and sequencing and recovery as needed.  6) Identify areas of improvement in processing files, implementing automation and monitoring, use of tools and diagnostic techniques, inspection of outputs including resulting data and generated client correspondence.  7) Help with supervising contingent workers and their daily tasks including onshore and offshore staff  8) Demonstrate core values with clients, business partners and team members Required Skills:7 plus years of experience with Online web applications with understanding of Web services and multi-tier applications and database. Expert at diagnostics of distributed platform application issues including understanding of Web service issues, performance and response time optimization across the tiers including database interaction.Knowledge and awareness of multi-tier concepts, protocols and infrastructure including but not limited to Big-IP, F5 devices, implementations of an Enterprise Service Bus (with or without hardware appliances including DataPower), CA-SSO, SAML3 plus years of experience with tools like CAs Wily or Compuwares dynaTrace for application and multi-tier analysis.6 plus years of hands on Oracle experience. Adept at complex data models and writing complex SQLs.4 plus years of hands on Unix experience. Ability to scan thru logs and troubleshoot issues.Experience with tools like Filezilla, SQL Developer, Putty4 plus years or hands on experience in Java environments including fluency with Object Oriented concepts.Extensive experience with J2EE platform and Java application development lifecycle and understanding (multi-threading, JVM, concurrency etc)Ability to write application build scripts, understanding of WebLogic, WebSphere or other similar domains and clustering.Strong understanding of SOA and layered architectures.At least 4 years of experience working in application Production Support environmentMicrosoft ExcelExperience with handling flat files, comparing and making changes to them.Experience working in Financial services industry and some Retirement industry domain knowledge.Excellent communication skills and ability to work with a large teamAcumen to understand business logic and product offerings.  Job Type: Contract  Salary: $55.00 to $61.00 /hour  Experience:Systems Analysis: 3 years (Required)Production Support: 1 year (Required)Oracle: 1 year (Required)web applications: 1 year (Required) Location: Charlotte, NC (Required)

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, Ally Invest
Description: Position Description  This position is on the Ally Invest business development and growth team, reporting to the director of business development. This person will be responsible for aspects of tactical execution of strategic priorities. Reporting and analysis of results, strategic scenario planning, and other business analysis will be required. Strong quantitative acumen with the ability to influence others and manage initiatives will be required as well.  Job Responsibilities Manage and improve the process and reporting for various client programs at Ally InvestDevelop new or enhanced models to support changing business needsProactively identify areas of improvement in current processes and help drive automationPartner with business leaders/budget owners in the bottoms-up development of key assumptions and financial performance metricsInterpret operational data and effectively illustrate/communicate links to business performanceSelf-starter with the ability to collaborate with teams or work alone to solve a problemCreate and update management review presentation materialsData analysis and reporting on various facets of business planCustomer and vendor facing outbound relationship interaction proficientBe willing and able to think "outside of the box" for ideation and critical thinkingDrive audit compliance within the areas for which you are responsibleContribute to ad hoc analytical projects as necessary both within and beyond your primary area of focusWork collaboratively with Marketing, Finance, Risk, Service, Operations and other partners to ensure team objectives are metQualificationsBA/BBA degree required with major in Finance or Economics preferredAdvanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills requiredProven track record of driving for results while remaining agile enough to change course regularlyProven track record of influencing decisions with great analyticsMinimum 3-5 years previous work experience in Finance, Marketing or Broker Dealer related field requiredFinancial services and or broker dealer experience preferredAdvanced degree or MBA or CFA (or working toward) preferredAbility to manage competing priorities and work effectively in a matrix environmentAbility to communicate effectively, both written and verbalEnergetic and inquisitive, quick learner, takes initiative Ally Overview  Ally Financial Inc. (NYSE: ALLY) is a leading digital financial services company and a top 25 U.S. financial holding company offering financial products for consumers, businesses, automotive dealers and corporate clients. Ally's legacy dates back to 1919, and the company was redesigned in 2009 with a distinctive brand, innovative approach and relentless focus on its customers. Ally has an award-winning online bank (member FDIC), one of the largest full service auto finance operations in the country, a complementary auto-focused insurance business, a growing digital wealth management and online brokerage platform, and a trusted corporate finance business offering capital for equity sponsors and middle-market companies.  Business Unit/Enterprise Function  Ally Invest, launched in May 2017, is the brokerage and wealth management offering from Ally. The offerings consist of a trading platform for self-directed investors, as well as a suite of automatically managed investment portfolios. The Ally Invest team is responsible for ensuring the technology and service of the platform with a focus on award winning customer service and outstanding user experience.  Total Rewards Information  Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and bonus pay potential based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid time-off program with an emphasis on work-life balance.  Ally offers a variety of benefits to protect your health and well-being, provide financial security and balance your work-life needs including: Industry-leading 401K Retirement Savings Plan including Matching and Company ContributionsComprehensive wellness program with financial incentives designed to help you achieve your best healthFlexible health insurance options including dental and visionPre-tax Health Savings Account with generous employer contributionsPre-tax dependent care and commuter benefitsOther work-life integration benefits including Paid Parental & Caregiver Leave, Adoption Assistance, Back-up Child & Adult/Elder Care, Child Care Discounts, Tuition Reimbursement, LifeMatters Employee Assistance Program, Weight Watchers and other employee discount programs Ally is an Equal Opportunity Employer  We extend equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law. 3F Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/DisabledSDL2017

Name: Business Analyst -LIBOR
Description: Job Description: London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR) is the term often used to refer to one of a series of benchmark interest rates of varying tenors and currencies that underpin more than $350 trillion of financial contracts including derivatives, home mortgages, corporate loans, student loans and securitizations. While significant improvements have been made to LIBOR since April 2013, the absence of active underlying markets raises questions about the sustainability of the LIBOR benchmarks that are theoretically based upon these markets. In light of these challenges the Federal Reserve, in cooperation with the Treasury Department and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, convened the Alternative Reference Rates Committee (ARRC) to work with market participants to identify options for replacing US Dollar LIBOR. Similar committees exist or are being formed worldwide to address non-US Dollar LIBORs. Last summer the UKs Financial Conduct Authority emphasized the urgency and importance of the efforts and implored industry participants to work in earnest on the transition to alternative reference rates that are based firmly on transactions.  As one of the largest LIBOR lenders in the world, the transition from LIBORs to a new series of benchmark rates will be a significant undertaking for Bank of America as it will impact almost every line of business and nearly all of our customers. LIBOR Transition Program will be charged with developing and executing a coordinated strategy to transition the numerous LIBOR-based products and processes across the enterprise.  Corporate Treasury Program Management is seeking a highly motivated individual to join the LIBOR Transition Project Management team, with a focus on providing support in executing a coordinated strategy to transition the numerous LIBOR-based products and processes across the enterprise.  In support of this enterprise objective, this position will be responsible for providing support of facilitating cross-team coordination and ultimately help to develop credible enterprise LIBOR transition plans. Given the broad focus, the candidate will gain broad knowledge of and exposure to a wide range of the enterprise business units and control functions. The candidate will be required to work closely with leadership, Global Technology and Operations (GT&O) and the various lines of business. This role will require the individual to facilitate, track and deliver key program priorities. Develop and maintain plans to meet the program objectives with a focus on collaboration and efficiency. Coordinate with stakeholders to define and document business requirements. Identify, monitor and resolve issues and risks related to the transition effort. Help establish and support leading program routines. Ensure program is in compliance with the Enterprise Change Management policy.  Enterprise Role Overview  Manages projects limited in scope to LOB products, processes or functions although some may have cross-functional or inter-departmental implications. Serves as secondary contact to senior department managers for critical change initiatives and provides assistance to staff. Partners with the business to develop and transition plans, including ongoing success measures, to sustain the change. Accountable for initiatives limited in scope to department products, processes or functions although some may have cross-functional or inter-departmental implications. Accountable for analyzing present-state, developing alternative future-state approaches and facilitating implementation. Plans, organizes, monitors and controls projects using appropriate tools and techniques to ensure efficient and effective project completion. Develop and socialize potential risk mitigation strategies. Effectively communicates with managers, peers and business partners on deliverables, timelines and support needed. Partners with the business to develop and transition plans, including ongoing success measures, to sustain the change. Responsible for Clarity and PCM updates and project documents. Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines. Typically 3+ plus years of project management support experience.  Provide business analyst engagement for program and support the management of end to end delivery of Program initiatives:  • Establish and lead initiative routines  • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple bodies of work simultaneously  • Partner with FLUs and control functions to ensure collaborative progression through the delivery lifecycle  • Build and develop expertise to support ongoing and evolving enterprise activities of the program  • Identify, track and resolve issues and risks related to the program  • Monitor Issue milestones to ensure issues and milestones stay green, escalating new and emerging issues as appropriate  • Monitor project plans to ensure projects will deliver high-quality and efficient work  • Effectively communicates with managers, peers and business partners on deliverables, timelines and support needed from them Required Skills and Experience:Experience working in the BAC CFO organization, with understanding of organization framework and business areas1-2 years business analyst or project management experience within the CFO organizationStrong organizational skills and experience managing multiple tasks simultaneously, strong prioritization and time managementExperience developing and facilitating concise and effective presentations, including the ability to explain results of complex analysis at a level that resonates across many different audiencesStrong analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to lead/facilitate discussions across various levels of stakeholders/support partnersSolid work ethic and willingness to take on new initiativesAbility to effective communicate complex and/or technical informationExcellent computer skills, particularly Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, WordEnjoy working in a fast paced environmentBachelor's Degree or equivalent experienceShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Description: Logistics done differently.You know the future holds endless possibilities, so you like to plan, strategize, and dream big. At XPO Logistics, we need people like you to help us find ways to improve, enhance, grow, and adapt to an ever-changing marketplace. As the Senior Business Planning and Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting leadership in the planning, implementation, and operations of the XPO O2C (Order-to-Cash) Global Strategy. We’re the fastest-growing transportation company on the Fortune 500 list and we’re just getting started.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran, or other protected status.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. Name: Strategic Business Analyst
Description: What's the role? Strategic Business Analysts typically focus on Search Analysis, Customer Experience or Operations, though there are always new opportunities arising, such as driving our international expansion or joining our machine-learning team. We'll work to find the specific role that best suits your background and skills and no matter what you do, you won't just analyze the data you'll own your work; from ideation and strategy to implementation. As an Analyst, you'll support one or more of our businesses in industries ranging from insurance and telecom to energy and consumer services.You'll conduct thorough analyses of revenue, sales conversion and yield data to drive greater profitability as well as efficiency and effectiveness for the business. At Red Ventures you'll do more than just consult you'll immerse yourself in one of our businesses.You'll also develop and manage new tools for measuring and understanding the health of our business operations.The Opportunity: Gain exposure to all aspects of our high growth business In this role you'll gain hands on experience in operations, digital marketing, finance, partnership relationship management and several other key areas of Red Venture's business. Best of all, you can feel your impact on the organization. Whether you're presenting a new break through to our Sr. Leadership Team in our monthly business review sessions or implementing a new operational strategy through testing and analysis, your results are measurable.This position is a great way to learn our business and have a high-visibility, immediate and profound impact. It offers responsibilities and career growth opportunities that are not available in similar roles in larger companies. Many of our Analysts hired in to this role now lead major parts of our business.What We're Looking For: A strong analytical prowess and entrepreneurial mindset 1-3 years of work experience in a highly quantitative and analytical role. Statistics, management consulting, investment banking, private equity and digital marketing experience are all more relevant to this role than traditional marketing or market research analysis.To succeed in this role, you must be comfortable measuring, interpreting, and making real-time decisions based on large volumes of sales and marketing performance data.A Bachelor's degree in an analytically oriented discipline (e.g. business, economics, statistics, mathematics, etc.) or technology oriented discipline (e.g. computer science, MIS, etc.)Experience building complex operational and financial models, conducting ROI analysis, synthesizing recommendations, and presenting them to senior executives.Experience with SQL, SSAS or other database/analysis packages is helpful, but not required.The ideal candidate is proactive, has a positive attitude, is well organized, and is adept at managing competing deadlines and priorities.Eagerness to break records, create opportunities, and take risks; we love a competitive spirit.Comfort in a fast-paced and often changing environment, with an inclination to solve new problems and learn new skills in order to succeed.Our employees behave like entrepreneurs. They are incredibly driven, agile, goal oriented, and are always up for a challenge.A sense of humor!About Red Ventures: Red Ventures is a leading digital consumer choice platform. Through deeply integrated brand partnerships and consumer-facing assets, Red Ventures connects online customers with products and services in the home services, financial services, and healthcare industries. We use advanced analytics, data science, and integrated technology to cultivate and customize digital connections between brands and customers. We marry the speed of a start-up, the DNA of a digital agency, the strategic thinking of a consultancy, and the analytical skills of a big data company. Red Ventures is headquartered in Charlotte, NC and has more than 3,500 employees in offices across the US as well as in Brazil and London.
