Name: Project Business Analyst - Media
Description: Spectrum Reach (www.spectrumreach.com) is the advertising sales division of Charter Communications, Inc. The company offers custom solutions for the modern media landscape utilizing national cable networks, internet advertising and promotional events supported by marketing, research and award-winning creative services. Spectrum Reach applies insightful research to understand consumer behavior and build targeted, multi-screen media plans personalized for each customer.  With offices in 41 states and 147 markets, Spectrum Reach covers over 27 million households throughout the country. From traditional commercial advertising to exciting new possibilities in interactive media and multi-screen solutions, Spectrum Reachs consultative team brings advertisers effective, efficient ways to turn our audiences into their customers. SUMMARY Looking for a Business Analyst with Project Management Skills. Must be collaborative, forward thinking, technologically savvy, and enjoy project work. The Business Analyst will run multiple analysis projects for multiple clients. The position will be responsible for defining, analyzing and documenting user requirements, processes, and problems. The role will lead joint efforts to offer new solutions, automate processing, and/or improve existing business processes and associated information systems for clients. RESPONSIBILITIESSolicit client requirements through interviews, workshops and/or existing systems documentation or procedures.Evaluate business requirements for new/modified applications, systems, and/or integration solutions.Conduct reviews of and analyze business and information technology processes and prepare essential groundwork for the development of systems.Develop test schedules, review test plans, track and document development of systems/enhancements/integrations.Alert project team and business of risks and important issues.Ensure requirements are understood, agreed to and signed off by the appropriate roles and at the appropriate stages in a project.Provide analysis of processes and workflows with suggestions for improvement. Identify areas where technology can lead to increased efficiency and productivity.Understand functions provided by the current systems. Understand and accommodate the requirement constraints imposed by current systems.Provide detailed analysis and document results in clear and concise business requirements.Provide user documentation for the system. Create curriculum for user training.Act as project manager, if necessary.QUALIFICATIONSMedia industry experience (Knowledge of Advertising Sales Inventory Management, Sales and Finance a strong plus)3+ years of business analysis experience with previous project management experience a strong plusDemonstrated track record of defining business requirements that lead to increased efficiency and productivity through the use of technology and/or enhanced processesBasic understanding of various technologies ; able to grasp complex conceptsExperience with Agile Development process a strong plusExcellent meeting facilitation and organizational skillsStrong leadership and collaboration skills; a team playerStrong business acumenAbility to bridge gap between business users and technology departmentsExcellent analytical and communication (both verbal and written) skillsPMP certification a plus

Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Identify, assess, and report to leadership patterns of inefficiency and irregular call handling behaviors. Recommend process improvements as it relates to contact center efficiencies, service level, and key performance indicators. Assume responsibility to improve service efficiency and quality of work. partnerships in and outside the department for the purpose of sharing best practices   Analyzes time tracking and employee log in/out data to assist managers with team efficiency   Compares and analyzes all results associated with performance and efficiency to identify outliers in an effort to assist leaders with strategic improvements   Monitors call management software and other workflow tools to identify staffing requirements to meet required service level agreements   Monitors inbound call activity and assists with efficient resource allocation   Assists leadership in workflow home inspections at specified intervals   Identifies potential scheduling/staffing problems and recommend possible changes   Gathers and analyzes data to support enterprise wide initiatives   Prior call center experience   Working knowledge of professional regulatory and technical standards   Project Management skills   Excellent organizational skills and timely follow-up   Advanced verbal and written communication skills   Advanced knowledge of Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, and Business Objects   Advanced knowledge of core technologies   Ability to teach local leadership on available core technology to enhance performance on multiple levels   Demonstrates good training practices   Acts as a mentor to team members   Ability to exercise discretion in the handling of confidential informationThe candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen. Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.  Learn more about life at Allstate. Name: Regulatory Business Analyst
Description: Job Description: The Access Management Operations (AMO) function within Global Information Security is responsible for enabling simplification of our access processes, standardizing solutions and risk reduction across the enterprise, as well as collaborating with internal partners to encourage adoption of the banks cybersecurity standards by external stakeholders.  Candidate will be responsible for partnering with the GIS Governance & Policy team to drive alignment of application Laws, Rules and Regulations via GIS policies to access controls and processes while working to ensure long term sustainability. Position requires a proficient understanding of standards, baselines, security procedures and policies. Position is among the Access Management Operations space within the Global Information Security organization. A risk oriented perspective is required, along with the ability to understand and help document BAU processes. Self-starter and highly analytical thinker required. Ability to work well in teams as well as with business partners. Utilizes technical and business knowledge to support secure, risk-based practices, exercising judgment within broadly defined practices and policies. Results oriented, business focused, and successful at interfacing across multiple organizational units, at various levels. Self-starter who is comfortable working as part of a highly-leveraged team across geographic locations. Demonstrated record of strong leadership capability in a matrixed, multi-layered organization.  Specific Skillsets Desired:  • Background in regulatory compliance and business intelligence in large-scale environments  • A broad knowledge of information security principles (e.g. access control)  • Impeccable communication skills  • Able to translate data into visualizations  • Crafting of presentations for executive management  • Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual thinking  • Ability to work with Technical and Non-Technical business owners  • Assist with internal efficiencies projects and development  • Strong Project Management skills  • Extremely well organized; ensures projects stay on target, escalating and identifying roadblocks  • Must be able to identify, analyze and address problems to resolve issues whenever possible in way that minimizes negative impact and risk to the organization  • Ability to work independently on initiatives with little oversight. Motivated and willing to learn.  • Must be comfortable in delivering messages across a wide spectrum of individuals having varying degrees of technical understanding  • Must have strong leadership skills and qualities which enable you to work with peers and various levels of management  • Ability to matrix manage people, assignment of tasks Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Healthcare Business Analyst Senior
Description: The employee’s Number One job responsibility is to deliver the most remarkable patient experience, in every dimension, every time, and understand how he or she contributes to the health system’s vision of achieving that commitment to patients and families.  A healthcare business analyst job involves creating and implementing both reports and analysis that help maximize the effectiveness of health management initiatives and strategies. This position requires in-depth healthcare/clinical business knowledge. A healthcare business analyst manages healthcare/clinical outcome projects and acts as liaison between the business, clinicians, technology and the company to meet healthcare and clinical expectations and requirements. The healthcare business analyst guides and advises less experienced healthcare/clinical business analysts. The position is competent to work at the highest level of most phases of systems analysis.  Education: Bachelor's Degree Required  Experience: Minimum five years of clinical experience in a Payor, Acute, or Ambulatory careenvironment e.g.: Nursing, Pharmacy, Public Health  Required  Analysis: Clinical data underwriting, preparing reports, performing clinical data analysis and data  validation, producing clinical data requirement, gathering and writing clinically focused functional  specifications. Must have the clinical, analytical and technical familiarity necessary to independently  execute each phase of an analysis, including information gathering through oral and written  communication, methodological design, the ability to learn quickly and translate clinical data into clear  and actionable results, and strong organizational skills. Analyze and interpret statistics to point out  significant differences in relationships among sources of information and prepare conclusions and  forecasts based on data summaries. Applies sophisticated analytical techniques, statistical sampling  methods, database integration and the use of forecasting models. Requires an advanced understanding  of clinical/nonclinical relational databases and large clinical/nonclinical data structures.  Evaluation: Evaluates the reliability of source information, adjusts and weighs raw data, and  organizes results into a form compatible with analysis by software (business intelligence tools. The  healthcare/clinical analyst is able to describe sources of information and limitations on reliability and  usability.  Communication: Act as a liaison between the clinician, customer and the technical team, and provide  clinical business unit data support. Functions as an internal consultant providing analytical problem  solving and statistical and methodological consultation. Present sophisticated numerical information as  graphs, charts, tables, written reports, or other methods for publication and consumption by clinicians,  customers and clinical business units.

Name: Business Analyst -JIRA Administrator - Remote- Charlotte or Atlanta
Description: Every day, we deliver innovative solutions at the forefront of fintech that help businesses better serve their customers, expand their business, protect themselves from fraud, and reimagine commerce. Formed in 2009 by powerhouse brands Bank of America and First Data, we’ve grown to process more than 16 billion transactions at approximately 529,000 merchant locations in 2017 alone. We’re a leader with deep expertise and momentum. Bank of America Merchant Services is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Females, Minorities, Veterans and Disabled.PurposeThe Business Analyst - JIRA Administrator supports Bank of America Merchant Services’ ongoing JIRA and Confluence needs, from user management, to issue triage, to workflow design and implementation. This role fields incoming requests by users and provides timely support and guidance on all Atlassian issues. The Business Analyst - JIRA Administrator will be responsible for creating and managing JIRA components including project workflows, screen schemes, permission schemes, and notification schemes. Furthermore, this role will ensure systems are stable, discover opportunities to improve the workflow of daily tasks and lead efforts to drive improvements. He or she will work closely with the project management, development, business analysts, QA, and product management teams to help define solutions and drive execution of best practices and standards within the Atlassian tool or any other related tools that BAMS will utilize for issue tracking and team collaboration needs.Essential Functions· Perform overall maintenance of Atlassian tools such as JIRA and Confluence· Administer and maintain multiple JIRA and Confluence instances· Manage user permissions and project roles for JIRA, Confluence and other tools· Perform administrative tasks for the Atlassian products upgrades, patching, backup, and recovery· Manage and administer built-in customization and third party add-ons and integrations as needed· Troubleshoot, identify and resolve JIRA or Confluence issues reported by end-users· Document standards, guidelines, and standard operating procedures for admins/users of the system· Develop processes and improvements around tools administration· Develop metrics, dashboards, reports and advanced filters to provide end-users and business leadership with meaningful operational/performance metrics and status reports· Provide training and support of tools to development and project teams as needed· Design and maintain custom projects, workflows, schemes, screens and field configurations· Work directly with cross-functional agile teams to understand their specific issue tracking and team collaboration needs and provide guidance and solutions· Perform routine audits of access lists and perform security tests to ensure restrictions are in place· Drive improvements to Confluence by reorganizing and archiving spaces and pagesExperience· Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or related field from a four-year college or university or equivalent combination of education and experience.· JIRA certification required· At least 1-3 years’ experience and knowledge in installing, integrating and managing Atlassian tools (specifically JIRA and Confluence)· Experience working in a Scrum/Agile environmentSkills· Excellent organizational, problem solving, written and oral communication skills· Excellent understanding of JIRA workflows, permission schemes, notification schemes, screens schemes, etc.· Excellent knowledge of SDLC and experience working with Agile teams· Experience creating, configuring and maintaining a JIRA server strongly preferred· Ability to analyze, review and document current functionality to determine potential areas of improvement· Ability to create and edit documentation to a standard· Ability to learn new software systems, concepts, and practices relatively quickly· Ability to build collaborative relationships across the organization· Atlassian Name: Business Analyst Consultant
Description: Senior Business Analyst A senior BA to lead the decommissioning, gap analysis and the gathering of business requirements processes.  Knowledge of OTC confirmations is good to have but not essential.  Experience in work such as systems decommissions, preparation of gap analysis, identification of business requirements.  Hands-on work such as writing BRDs, FRDs, UAT test plans.  Experience working with operations & technology group. Also with external vendors.  Ability to lead a program of work reporting into a WFS project/program lead.  Must have Domain knowledge of securities processing experience and Confirms knowledge would be good.  Founded in 2000, eClerx is listed on the National Stock Exchange (NSE, Ticker: ECLERX) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE, Ticker: ECLERX). The majority of eClerx s employees (currently ~8,000) are strategically located across four delivery centers in Mumbai, Pune and Chandigarh, India.  eClerx is a specialist Knowledge and Business Process Outsourcing (KPO / BPO) company providing operational support, data management, and analytics solutions to over 50 Global Fortune 1000 clients, including many of the worlds leading High Tech, and Industrial Manufacturing, Financial Services, E-commerce, Retail and Distribution, Broadband, Cable & Telco, Interactive Media and Entertainment, Travel and Leisure, and Software Vendor companies.  Working at eClerx  Driving every global company are countless processes in finance, operations, sales, and marketing. Their growth and profitability depend on to a large degree on how intelligently these processes are designed and how efficiently these processes are run. This is exactly what we do for our clients at eClerx. At eClerx, we specialize in process execution allowing our customers to focus on increased efficiency, time savings, and driving their business forward.  eClerx is known for being customer focused. There is an urgency to compress delivery and turnaround times. Theres an equally fierce drive to continually improve the quality of our product and services. Responsiveness and continual process improvement make eClerx unique in the Knowledge Process Outsourcing and Business Process Outsourcing industries.  eClerx is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.  Job Type: Contract  Education: Bachelor's (Preferred)

Name: Sr. BI Business Analyst
Description: Spotlight Your Business Analysis Talent as You Review Complex Data & Interact with Leaders at a Growing Global Organization  If you're a proven business analyst with a strong background in BI and the analytical and creative savvy to think beyond the data/numbers and ask, Why?, the role of Senior Business Intelligence Analyst offers a compelling mix of challenge and opportunity. Consider: This is a newly added role, specifically created to take on an exciting and robust new project. You can make a ground-floor impact!You will enjoy exposure to the C-Suite and globally as you work on this key project.This position offers a complexity that will allow you to stretch your skills and further develop your talents. Initially, you'll focus on the business and sales processes, as related to your assigned project, but in time you'll move onto Operations and other areas.We have an outstanding, family-like culture where we enjoy team building and other activities including BBQs, ice cream socials, field days where we play games, and more. We also have a bistro for breakfast and lunch and an onsite gym!We believe in work/life balance. While you will flex your time, coming in a little early or staying as needed to meet project deadlines, we do our best to keep hours reasonable.In addition to work/life balance, you'll enjoy seasonal time off like a half day off every Friday between Memorial Day and Labor Day and the week off between Christmas Eve and January 2nd, in addition to the PTO you'll earn as part of your benefits.In addition to a competitive salary and bonus opportunity, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. This role could be a good fit whether your background is in business, sales & account planning, IT, finance or manufacturing. It will be based in our North American Corporate HQ in Charlotte. Relocation assistance may be available to an outstanding candidate.  Based in Charlotte, North Carolina, SPX FLOW, Inc. (NYSE: FLOW) innovates with customers to help feed and enhance the world by designing, delivering and servicing high-value solutions at the heart of growing and sustaining our diverse communities. The company's product offering is concentrated in rotating, actuating and hydraulic technologies, as well as automated process systems, into food and beverage, industrial and power and energy markets. SPX FLOW has approximately $2 billion in annual revenues with operations in more than 30 countries and sales in more than 150 countries. To learn more about SPX FLOW, please visit SPXFlow.com. Clicking on this link will open a new browser window, but be sure to come back to submit your resume.  The Requirements  To meet the basic qualification for this role, you will have legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship. In addition, to be a good fit for the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst opportunity, you will have: Bachelor's degree required, ideally in Business, IT, Finance or another directly related field; relevant certifications are a plus5+ years of relevant industry experience in data analysis, business analytics, business intelligence or a comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technologyKnowledge of SQL to write complex, highly-optimized queries across large volumes of dataProven track record demonstrating an aptitude to analyze trends, compile data into comprehensive reports, and making recommendations based off of findingsAbility to present and explain complicated or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiences, including leadershipCuriosity and passion for data and data visualizationCreativity to determine the best solution for a real-world problem with quantitative dataWillingness to question the validity and accuracy of dataExcellent verbal and written communication skills and comfort interacting with employees ranging from entry-level to senior leadersThe ability and desire to collaborate with others in a team environmentAbility to handle multiple demands with a sense of urgency, drive and energyAbility and willingness to travel up to 10%, including internationally Preferred, but not required, 2+ years of project management experiencePrevious experience working with the following: Sales, Finance, HR, and e-commerce/web, ManufacturingExposure to ERP's, ideally including SAPKnowledge of ETL and data warehouse processesKnowledge of Power BI or similar data visualization toolsKnowledge of big data platforms like Hadoop The Role  The Mission  At SPX Flow we are committed to attracting, hiring, developing and deploying the best and brightest individuals into critical capability areas across the company, and providing them a platform to build a career. We're expanding our team to meet growing business needs that will provide you the opportunity to be involved on the ground floor of an important project, the details of which will be shared when you are fully qualified.  As Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work initially on the newly emerging project -- a project that is sales and product focused. We will be building the foundation from scratch. A good deal of focus will be placed on creating and agreeing on enterprise KPIs between the customer's requirements, business needs and IT capabilities. You will work with other analysts on the team, seated in Charlotte, France and Sweden, but take point on the project, serving as a bridge between the business and IT. You'll be the face of IT to the business and of the business to IT, so you'll need to be able to communicate in both technical and non-technical terms. Success will require that you take an intellectual approach, thinking beyond the data as you create if/then scenarios and develop optimal solutions.  You may participate in another major project underway, and in time could interact and collaborate with stakeholders throughout the organization including Finance, Product Management, Sales, Engineering, Manufacturing Operations, and Supply Chain groups.  Role Details  Reporting to the Director of Global IT Applications & Business Intelligence, you will be responsible for translating BI needs into requirements by holding requirements gathering interviews/sessions with key stakeholders across the organization. You will initially work with local Finance and Sales team leaders and begin with sales processes. From there we'll build the global vision. Additionally, you will: Gather, analyze, and identify opportunities for enhancementsWork closely with business and technology partners to seek and provide effective resolution to business issuesDefine the engagement success criteria with business users; track and monitor progress during engagements and ensure deliverables are metSupport the analytics needs inclusive of data cleaning, exploratory analysis and deck building in PowerPoint Identify and implement solutions to enhance the existing BI infrastructure process and technology, and to potentially move to newer BI infrastructure technologies to support the long-term roadmap Create documentation to assist business users and IT members in designing & effectively using the solutions developedDeliver against the data strategy to support the development and deployment of executive dashboards, operational dashboards, standard reports, ad hoc reports, discovery & analysis, and predictive analyticsCommunicate and report project progress related to schedule and work performance to the necessary stakeholders Note: this description is intended to give you a general overview of the position and is not an exhaustive listing of duties and responsibilities.  More Good Reasons  Global reach  Over time, you'll work with our AMER, APAC and EMEA teams with locations all over the world. You'll have exposure to different cultures and teams. You'll also have global opportunities, should that interest you.  Professional development  While you'll use the breadth of your skills, there is a lot to learn. We are dedicated to providing our employees with the training and the tools they need to succeed.  Training and support  Your supervisor maintains an open door policy and can serve as a strong mentor to your success. We have regular team meetings and alternate one-on-one meetings in between. You can feel secure knowing that you'll have plenty of support to help you get started.  Build a career home  We search for those with the talent and ambition to build a long-term career with SPX Flow. If you're looking for a career home with ample opportunity, we want to hear from you.  Engaging environment  You'll find strong entrepreneurial spirit here, along with a work hard/play hard attitude. In addition to offering flexible work arrangements, such as the 1/2 day summer Fridays, we are proactive about recognizing and rewarding strong performance.  Excellent compensation  In addition to competitive base and bonus opportunity, you'll enjoy a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical and dental choices with costs shared by the employee and SPX FLOW; an employee-paid vision plan; a retirement savings plan with company match; paid time off; and more. Benefits begin day one.  Total Rewards  At SPX FLOW, what's in it for employees goes well beyond market-competitive compensation and benefits. Our Total Rewards program includes a comprehensive offering that combines a challenging work environment with opportunities for personal development, career growth and recognition. The program gives employees a financial stake in their own success and the ongoing success of the organization and includes: Opportunities to be recognized and rewarded for hard work and a job well done.A platform to spotlight personal talent and achieve exceptional results.A chance to display the values and leadership practices we, as a company, embrace. Keys to Success  To excel in this role you will have the ability to see the big picture both from a business and systems viewpoint. In addition to being able to connect the dots between multiple data sources, you should have a knack for seeing solutions. You will be challenged by the complexity of the data, so a creative mind and attention to detail will be important.  Just as important as your business analysis skills and knowledge of BI tools and data warehousing, will be your interpersonal and communication skills. You'll work with people at various levels, and you should develop an understanding of which information is important to which people and where they merge. Similarly, when presenting information, you'll need to translate technical information into clear and concise terms that suggest action. This is a high-visibility project, so comfort presenting to leaders will be essential.  To thrive here you will share our entrepreneurial spirit and have a positive, upbeat attitude. You'll join a collaborative and supportive team of people who readily engage and help one another, but are also driven to achieve goals independently.  About Us  SPX FLOW is a global supplier of highly specialized, engineered solutions with operations in over 35 countries and sales in over 150 countries around the world. Our innovative solutions play a critical role in helping meet the rising global demand in the end markets we serve. Our total revenue in 2017 was $1.95 billion, with approximately 30 percent from sales into emerging markets.  We serve the food and beverage, power and energy and industrial markets. Our product portfolio of pumps, valves, mixers, filters, air dryers, hydraulic tools, homogenizers, separators and heat exchangers, along with the related aftermarket parts and services, supports global industries, including food and beverage, oil and gas, power generation (including nuclear and conventional), chemical processing, compressed air and mining.  Our core strengths include product breadth, global capabilities and the ability to create custom-engineered solutions for diverse flow processes. Over the past several years, we have strategically expanded our scale, relevance to customers, and global capabilities in these markets. We believe there are attractive organic and acquisition opportunities to continue to expand our business.  We focus on a number of operating initiatives, including innovation and new product development, continuous improvement driven by lean methodologies, supply chain management, expansion in emerging markets, and organizational and talent development. These initiatives are designed to, among other things, capture synergies within our businesses to ultimately drive revenue, profit margin and cash flow growth. We believe our businesses are well-positioned for long-term growth based on our operating initiatives, the potential within the current markets served and the potential for expansion into additional markets.SDL2017

Name: Business Control Analyst
Description: Republic Finance is seeking a business control analyst. This role will report directly to the Head of Centralized Operations and provide risk and control support to Centralized Operations. In this capacity, the individual will play an integral role in the development of risk and control monitoring and testing programs for Centralized Operations. The ideal candidate will work with centralized operations management to identify risks, define key controls, and develop control monitoring and testing programs to evaluate control effectiveness. Oversight responsibilities include adherence to regulations, company policies, and testing programs. You will work closely with operations, compliance, audit, legal, and other key partners who may be both internal and external to the organization. As a key member of the Centralized Operations team that is growing rapidly, you have an opportunity to grow professionally in this role. Key responsibilities are as follows: Partner in the development of an internal control framework for centralized operations.Partner with stakeholders to ensure business objectives are achieved.Perform risk and control monitoring and testing.Engages compliance team when appropriate; Solicits clarification and interpretations of new and existing regulations that affect the organizations current and future processes.Ensure departmental processes are adhered to while maintaining updated process, procedure, and testing programs.Prepare impact analysis identifying how change will impact policies, procedures, people and systems.Responsibility for ensuring department standards and goals are achieved.Effectively collaborate with the appropriate business heads to support critical business projects.Monitor and manage work flow to ensure highest levels of efficiencies.Provide feedback to the operation teams on results and work with them on corrective actions and future reviews.Minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience in a risk and control or compliance environment.Experience reviewing business processes and identifying key risks and developing mitigating controls.Experience conducting business monitoring and performing control effectiveness testing.Strong leadership skills and people management.Experience in a multi skill call center environment a plus.Experience in financial services a plus.Bachelor degree in business or related concentration.Strong communication and writing skills.An individual who takes a lead by example approach in working with team members.Operates at the highest level of integrity and takes a transparent approach to managing.Strong financial and analytical skills.Continuous and effective team leadership skills with demonstrated track record.Ability to teach and effectively motivate others We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including: Health/Dental/VisionPaid Vacation401 (K) and employer matchCompany provided Life Insurance & Long Term Disability Additional benefits with Republic include: Regular drawings for sports ticketsEmployee of the Month ProgramPhilanthropic support for charities such as Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation and the American Cancer SocietyRepublic Finance, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age disability or veteran status in employment opportunities and benefits. Name: Sr. Business Analyst-D2B
Description: Sealed Air Corporation is a knowledge-based company focused on packaging solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals in the face of today’s biggest social and environmental challenges. Our portfolio of widely recognized brands, including Cryovac® brand food packaging solutions and Bubble Wrap® brand cushioning, enable a safer and less wasteful food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.5 billion in sales in 2017 and has approximately 15,000 employees who serve customers in 122 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com.Job Description  The IT organization of Sealed Air Corporation is responsible for the life cycle planning of business applications through selection, operation, refresh, migration, optimization, retirement and disposal.  The Sr. Business Analyst builds/configures, maintains/enhances, and eventually decommissions relevant Demand to Build applications through that life cycle. Manufacturing (with a focus on MES/Smart Factory), Scheduling, Plant Maintenance and Inventory Management. This position requires a deep technical and comprehensive business process understanding of manufacturing environments with a focus on Manufacturing Execution Systems and Smart Factory innovations related to scanning, printing, data collection and predictive analysis.  This position will also have responsibility for R&D applications and associated contracts. A background in engineering or related R&D role preferred but not mandatory. Experience with PLM applications and implementations a plus.  The position reports directly to the Executive Director of Supply Chain and will be based at our headquarters in Charlotte, NC.  Job Description Cont. Work with Executive Director of Supply Chain and other IT leaders to understand and support the IT and Business strategies and offer innovative suggestions to improve processes.Form a strong bond with the Global Supply Chain Business and R&D Partnership groups within IT and with the supply chain and R&D business leaders and key users in order to facilitate idea generation and delivery of solutions.Develop and enhance methodologies and practices for the application lifecycle management in line with best practice and practical experience of continuous improvement.Ensure that applications processes (including those of external service providers) are conducted in line with corporate social responsibility, environmental and technical policies and applicable standards and legislation.Partner with our managed services provider to insure their employees are properly trained in order to support our business. Be responsible for making sure that proper documentation exists to support our business processes.Oversee the successful delivery of key projects, such as the multi-year initiative to deploy Smart Factory functionality in 60+ manufacturing facilities. Qualifications REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:8+ years’ in-depth experience in Demand to Build (D2B) domain including but not limited to functions such as discrete and repetitive manufacturing, production planning, scheduling, plant maintenance, Quality Management, etc. with SAP as the platform.Experience with supporting Inventory Management with Warehouse Management being a plus.Additional experience with Labeling or Finite Scheduling (whether SAP or otherwise) looked upon favorable.Experience with Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) a plusStrong verbal and written communication skills.University educated (at least BA/ BS) or 15 year of experience in diverse professional roles.Can work effectively with remote teamsWilling to travel 15% time.ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: Able to understand complex issues & can clearly articulate complex ideasExcellent project management, organization, attention to detail, follow-upStrong analytical abilities to identify issues & self-start programs to addressAbility to communicate & liaise broadly across functions & the global organizationDeadline & detail orientedDemonstrated ability to champion change, influence & drive results in a complex organizationA mind toward innovation in an organization that allows IT to innovate, drive change, and bring revenue to the organization.Requisition id: 26203 Relocation: [[filter4]]  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. Sealed Air participates in the E-Verify Program (US sites only). Job Segment: Business Analyst, ERP, Engineer, Quality Manager, Warehouse, Finance, Technology, Engineering, Quality, Manufacturing

Name: Financial Business Analyst
Description: Financial Business Analyst  Job Description:Financial Business Analyst Summary: Signature Consultants is seeking a Financial Business Analyst for an opportunity in Charlotte, NC. The primary function of the Financial Business Analyst is to support Liquidity Risk Management workstreams involving Basel III, Net Stable Funding Ratio (NSFR) and Liquidity Coverage Ratio (LCR), CRD-IV, Additional Monitoring Metrics (AMM), Stress Testing and the Fed 5G. He or she will build and manage relationship with data providers to increase data quality and usability, as well as work with business and data architects, and application managers to deliver technology solutions. At XPO Logistics, we know that cutting-edge technology drives our success. As the Business Systems Analyst III, you will work closely with Accounting, Procurement, and Business Line Group staff in the support of Oracle applications; specifically, Oracle General Ledger, Receivables, Payables, Purchasing, Inventory, and Assets modules. You will be responsible for performing highly complex analysis, testing, and documentation on application projects, application support, and enhancement requests. This role is critical in positioning XPO for long-term success. Pay, benefits and more. We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability, and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan. What you’ll do on a typical day:Participate in the complex review and analysis of business requirements and the configuration, mapping, and management of processesDocument highly complex system specifications and solutions to satisfy project requirementsDevelop and perform testing as needed; ensure tasks conform to specifications/processes and standardized best practicesLead the development team in the deployment/implementation of IT solutionsProvide system and customer support to users including escalated issue resolution; accurately repair and document changes to the system, as assignedDevelop and maintain application training manuals and system documentationMonitor system and application performance; troubleshoot and resolve escalated issuesWhat you need to succeed at XPO: At a minimum, you’ll need: Bachelor’s degree in a technical field7 years of experience in IT solutions development with 5 or more years of direct experience in Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS)Strong knowledge of the Procure-to-Pay and Order-to-Cash processesWorking knowledge of query tools (PL/SQL, Toad, SQL Plus)Demonstrated knowledge of the IT software development life cycle methodologies and processesDemonstrated ability to apply understanding of functionality of multiple transportation-related systemsAvailability for periodic 24/7 on-call support as required by team’s rotation schedule It’d be great if you also have: Lean/Six Sigma certificationDemonstrated working knowledge of Lean conceptsBe part of something big.#LI-CM2 XPO provides cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies, including Disney, Pepsi, L'Oréal, Toyota and many others. We’re the fastest-growing transportation company on the Fortune 500 list and we’re just getting started.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran, or other protected status. Description: The Role Our Health and Benefits business helps large and mid-size clients control health and welfare plan costs, improve health outcomes and promote employee engagement through broad-based, state-of-the-art interventions. Name: Product Analyst
Description: As a Product Analyst, you will serve as an integral part in educating our customers on what our software does, how it does it, and how we can enrich the lives of their customers. Product analysts work closely with our R&D, sales, and marketing teams as an integral part of our product team. Candidates must possess strong communication skills and be deeply passionate about solving hard problems.  In this role, you will conduct market research, understand our products, and assist with design related needs on the product and collateral front, crafting high-quality materials and presentations that resonate well the target audience and that speak strongly to customer needs.  If you get excited about enriching millions of people’s lives with technology and like any of the above challenges, we’d love to talk with you. This is a Systems Administrator role that manages and monitors all Ariba maintenance, integration and core system processes. Ariba expertise and knowledge of Ariba P2P, Contracts, Sourcing, Supplier Performance Mgt functions and supporting processes preferredKey skills must include troubleshooting, issues/resolution and data analysisKnowledge of all phases of software development including design, coding, testing, debugging, implementation and supportPrior experience with Financial systems and integration a mustExcellent problem solving, written and verbal communication skillsExperience with an OnDemand/ASP model a plusUnderstands the core functions of Procurement and Supply Chain processes Ally Overview  Ally Financial Inc. (NYSE: ALLY) is a leading digital financial services company and a top 25 U.S. financial holding company offering financial products for consumers, businesses, automotive dealers and corporate clients. Ally's legacy dates back to 1919, and the company was redesigned in 2009 with a distinctive brand, innovative approach and relentless focus on its customers. Ally has an award-winning online bank (member FDIC), one of the largest full service auto finance operations in the country, a complementary auto-focused insurance business, a growing digital wealth management and online brokerage platform, and a trusted corporate finance business offering capital for equity sponsors and middle-market companies. IT is also responsible for the administration and execution of information protection, disaster recovery and IT risk management.  Total Rewards Information  Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid-time-off program including time off for volunteer opportunities. Name: Business Analyst -JIRA Administrator - Remote
Description: Ever wonder what it takes for a business to process credit card payments? Interested in helping small business owners do more with their point-of-sale systems? At Bank of America Merchant Services , we ll help you become a payments expert. We ll show you the intricacies of payment processing, eCommerce and security solutions so that you can become a trusted partner for a variety of small businesses. Every day, we deliver innovative solutions that help small business owners across the U.S. better serve customers, manage operations, accept digital payments and ultimately grow their businesses. Formed in 2009 by powerhouse brands Bank of America and First Data, we ve grown to process more than 16 billion transactions at approximately 529,000 merchant locations in 2017 alone. We re a leader with deep expertise and momentum. Bank of America Merchant Services is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Females, Minorities, Veterans and Disabled. Purpose The Business Analyst - JIRA Administrator supports Bank of America Merchant Services ongoing JIRA and Confluence needs, from user management, to issue triage, to workflow design and implementation. This role fields incoming requests by users and provides timely support and guidance on all Atlassian issues. The Business Analyst - JIRA Administrator will be responsible for creating and managing JIRA components including project workflows, screen schemes, permission schemes, and notification schemes. Furthermore, this role will ensure systems are stable, discover opportunities to improve the workflow of daily tasks and lead efforts to drive improvements. He or she will work closely with the project management, development, business analysts, QA, and product management teams to help define solutions and drive execution of best practices and standards within the Atlassian tool or any other related tools that BAMS will utilize for issue tracking and team collaboration needs. Essential Functions Perform overall maintenance of Atlassian tools such as JIRA and Confluence Administer and maintain multiple JIRA and Confluence instances Manage user permissions and project roles for JIRA, Confluence and other tools Perform administrative tasks for the Atlassian products upgrades, patching, backup, and recovery Manage and administer built-in customization and third party add-ons and integrations as needed Troubleshoot, identify and resolve JIRA or Confluence issues reported by end-users Document standards, guidelines, and standard operating procedures for admins/users of the system Develop processes and improvements around tools administration Develop metrics, dashboards, reports and advanced filters to provide end-users and business leadership with meaningful operational/performance metrics and status reports Provide training and support of tools to development and project teams as needed Design and maintain custom projects, workflows, schemes, screens and field configurations Work directly with cross-functional agile teams to understand their specific issue tracking and team collaboration needs and provide guidance and solutions Perform routine audits of access lists and perform security tests to ensure restrictions are in place Drive improvements to Confluence by reorganizing and archiving spaces and pages Experience Bachelor s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or related field from a four-year college or university or equivalent combination of education and experience. JIRA certification required At least 1-3 years experience and knowledge in installing, integrating and managing Atlassian tools (specifically JIRA and Confluence) Experience working in a Scrum/Agile environment Skills Excellent organizational, problem solving, written and oral communication skills Excellent understanding of JIRA workflows, permission schemes, notification schemes, screens schemes, etc. Excellent knowledge of SDLC and experience working with Agile teams Experience creating, configuring and maintaining a JIRA server strongly preferred Ability to analyze, review and document current functionality to determine potential areas of improvement Ability to create and edit documentation to a standard Ability to learn new software systems, concepts, and practices relatively quickly Ability to build collaborative relationships across the organization Atlassian JIRA/Confluence plugin development experience a big plus Tools Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite products Experience in Atlassian products such as JIRA and Confluence Other issue tracking and collaboration tools such as Salesforce, HP Quality, SharePoint Physical Requirements and Working Conditions Standard office environment: work typically involves close visual acuity on a computer to access view, read, prepare and analyze data and other written communications. Travel Approximately 5% travel may be required to attend trainings and meetings. Name: Capacity Planning Business Analyst
Description: Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures. Name: Senior IT Business Operations Analyst
Description: Career Area: Information Technology Experience Level: Experienced Available Work Locations: North Carolina (Charlotte) Ally Requisition #:18-6360 Job Description:Position Description The IT Sustain Business Analyst will have a number of responsibilities supporting Ally's Finance and Accounting systems and business customers. This individual will be member of a team whose responsibilities include the maintenance and development of key financial accounting and reporting systems. Responsibilities of this position will span application monitoring; incident resolution; requirements analysis and definition; application configuration; implementation and deployment; communications and change management; effective and timely resolution of all issues in compliance with the Service Level requirements defined in the client contract and based on established company objectives.  Ally seeks a candidate with broad experience or aptitude to learn business processes; gather and analyze data; and functional configuration of internal systems. Candidates need to be able to gain a good grasp of the technical side of the process which also involves understanding the accounting outcomes and be able to converse with our business users in order to gather and understand their business requirements. Job ResponsibilitiesPerform/Manage daily/monthly and quarterly data for accounting and reporting on investments and derivativesSharing opportunities to ensure optimal productivity levels are achieved by all technical resources each week.Proactively monitor financial processes in the development and production environments.Support development and production configuration and assist in functional change requests.Collaborates with Finance organization to ensure organizational readiness (including business process changes people changes, change management and communication) is addressed.Creates and communicate training, process guidance and instructions to user environment.Investigate and troubleshoot user reported incidentsMonitor application business, batch and system processes.Respond to user requirements, problem resolution, develop designs, and process modeling. .Ensure common configuration across business units where appropriate.Defining maintenance and other improvements as needed.Ensuring adherence to methodology, change control, and compliance requirements.Create plans and lead QA/test activities for configuration/development activities.Administer user support documentation and provide training and coaching to end users.Participates in the planning, organization, development and deployment of reporting and analysis projectsQualificationsBachelor's degree in Accounting or Information Technology and 5 + years or equivalent of related experience. Strong understanding of Accounting policies/processes experience preferredStrong written and verbal communication skills, excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Ability to communicate effectively with individual contributors up to Director level personnel.Proven experience in successfully working with business partners and projects as well as team coordination/cooperationAbility to communicate effectively with business partners, executives, management and internal personnel.Possess strong project management skillsAlly Overview Ally Financial Inc. (NYSE: ALLY) is a leading digital financial services company and a top 25 U.S. financial holding company offering financial products for consumers, businesses, automotive dealers and corporate clients. Ally's legacy dates back to 1919, and the company was redesigned in 2009 with a distinctive brand, innovative approach and relentless focus on its customers. Ally has an award-winning online bank (member FDIC), one of the largest full service auto finance operations in the country, a complementary auto-focused insurance business, a growing digital wealth management and online brokerage platform, and a trusted corporate finance business offering capital for equity sponsors and middle-market companies. Business Unit/Enterprise Function Ally's Information Technology (IT) organization is focused on supporting and improving the position of our industry-leading business franchises through cost effective, innovative IT solutions, as well as overseeing critical functions that enable the day-to-day operations of the entire Ally Financial enterprise. IT is also responsible for the administration and execution of information protection, disaster recovery and IT risk management. Total Rewards Information Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid-time-off program including time off for volunteer opportunities. Ally's Total Rewards Program is designed to enrich your life at work -- and outside of it and includes: Industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributionsWellness program encouraging healthy living with financial rewardsFlexible health insurance options including dental and visionPre-tax Health Savings Account with generous employer contributionsPre-tax commuter benefitsOther work-life integration benefits including parental and caregiver leave, adoption assistance, backup child and adult/elder day care program, child care discounts, tuition reimbursement, LifeMatters® Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programsAlly is an Equal Opportunity Employer We extend equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law.

Name: AI (Artificial Intelligence) Business Analyst w/ Conversational Design
Description: Job DescriptionWe are looking for a business analyst who is passionate about working with our clients to solve their business problems with virtual assistant technology.  This role demands meticulous attention to detail, outstanding communication skills, and outside of the box thinking, always with the end user in mind.  You will assist in writing user stories, conversational flow, testing materials, and help our product lead in product delivery and project management. The role will work with our clients closely, where you will be required to analyze user behavior and suggest continuous improvements to our virtual assistants. It will also involve troubleshooting and researching problems, evaluating the feasibility of product features and making them happen.  Responsibilities: · Work with developers and clients to develop the user story and conversational flow of the virtual assistants· Assist in planning, management, and coordination of the projects· Assist in product development, including define functionality priorities, develop product specification for development after internal discussion, timeline control, progress follow through, prototype testing and user-testing· Engage with business users and developers to ensuring the business objectives being met· Organize marketing and thought leadership events both online and offline· Research best practices and implement as needed· Ensuring requirements get done.· Negotiates with stakeholders to resolve logistical or other obstacles.· Prioritize requirements Looking for candidates who are: · Curious about latest technologies and are motivated by real world application of virtual assistant technology.· Passionate about building new products and continuously making them better based on user’s feedbacks· Detail-oriented and eager to work with complex business workflows· Proven experience with Virtual Assistant/Chatbot technologies· Experience with visual analytic based tools is a plus Company DescriptionThe Norman Group is recruiting these full time positions for one of our clients, a software technology provider to banks.  The Norman Group is a management consulting firm providing project staffing and management consulting to banks and the financial services industry. The Norman Group was established in 1997 in Charlotte, NC. We offer management, project, and IT consulting, across specific domains; including treasury, payments, foreign exchange, factoring, risk & compliance and trade finance.  Normans clients have access to an entire project team including analysts, developers, QA specialists, and project/ program managers. The Norman Group employs a talented group of consultants and though their backgrounds are diverse, they share common characteristics in their analytical abilities, ethics, and commitment to teamwork.

Name: Software Configuration Senior Analyst
Description: Job descriptionMortgage Cadence, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Accenture, has been partnering with mortgage lenders since 1999, offering the industry’s only true one-stop shop mortgage technology solutions designed for point-of-sale through post-closing. In a time when efficiency, speed and the customer experience are paramount to the success of lenders, Mortgage Cadence offers the most reliable software and dedicated people, supporting lenders every step of the way. Each of our products has revolutionized the mortgage lending process in some way, changing the way lenders lend and borrowers finance. As a software company, we think like a start-up, with every employee empowered and encouraged to be visionary. Teamwork and innovation define what we do as we take our customers into the future by providing the last lending solution they will ever need.Job Description:Looking for an individual with approximately 3 or more years of work experience who is eager to learn software and  systems analysis in a software development environment. This role is responsible for loan origination system  configuration, business requirement interpretation, database mapping efforts utilizing SQL Management Studio, and  knowledge of process documentation workflow. This position requires hands on configuration of software and  systems and the coordination and problem solving processes to ensure that the business standards and requirements  are met. It would be considered a plus if this individual has experience in VB or C or Mortgage software  experience, but is not required. + Basic qualificationsMinimum of 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Management Studio Minimum of 1 experience in workflow process designMinimum of 1 year experience writing business rules decision logic within a rules engine.Minimum of 1 year experience in writing testing business and functional requirements.Professional skills:Process focused mindset.Results oriented attitude.- Self starter requiring little direction  Desire to make a difference.Proven multi tasking capabilities.Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to prioritize and coordinate multiple projects simultaneously.Creative, outgoing and professional demeanor.Excellent communication skills, both oral and written.Proactive and a team player.- Knowledge of Visual Basic VB , C , LOS Loan Origination System , and Mortgage processing  Experience with Microsoft SQL ServerAll of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You'll also have opportunities -to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status). Name: BWT SAG Analyst
Description: Job Description: Special Assets Group manages the high risk/criticized or distressed commercial loan portfolio for the Small Business segment of Bank of America. This position focuses primarily on the workout, collection and rehabilitation of commercial loans up to $1MM originated by the Small Business line of business. A SAG Analyst is responsible for the management, workout, collection, and asset quality of a criticized loan portfolio with particular emphasis on the smaller sized, less complex relationships in a higher volume environment. Typically has prior workout/commercial loan experience or educational and other accomplishments that are indicative of a highly motivated individual with strong advancement potential. Requirements:BS or BA in finance, accounting, economics or managementTypically has 1 year+ of commercial workout experience in a high paced environmentMay have commercial bank underwriting experienceThe candidate must have an understanding of workout strategies, lending, commercial credit analysis, using strategic and creative thinking.The role requires excellent written and oral communication skills.Should have good negotiation skillsThe candidate will be required to manage several tasks at once and work efficiently and effectively as an individual.Some characteristics required for the job would include attention to detail, accuracy and timeliness, ability to think broadly and recommend in-depth workout solutions, with good problem solving skills and flexibility.Working knowledge of loan structuring on A/R, inventory, equipment, other commercial transactions, SBA guarantees and real estate secured loans.Loans managed are usually less complex credits.Experience should include knowledge of bankruptcy lawMust exhibit all of Bank of America core valuesProficient in Word and ExcelShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

It all begins with you.  Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSouth Charlotte, privately-held company is looking for a Financial Analyst to join their growing team! This company offers an excellent culture, a full benefits & bonus plan, and most importantly, opportunities for training and growth! Summary: The Financial Analyst is responsible for finance activities including, month-end close, monthly KPIs and cost savings initiatives tracking, variance reporting, monthly forecast process, interfacing with Operations leads to assist in explaining variance drivers, assisting in creating annual budget, participating in various ad-hoc reporting as required, etc. Responsibilities:Prepare management reports emphasizing historical results, budgets, forecasts and trendsProduce variance reports with variance explanationsSupport in preparation of monthly forecastPerform analysis and reports in support of finance and sales and marketing organizationPrepare presentations using charts/graphs/tables for Board of Directors and Senior Leadership TeamUtilize Business Intelligence system for various ongoing and ad-hoc reportingPerform business plan case review for financial viability as neededMaintain industry competitive landscape analysis available from industry resourcesPerform ad-hoc analysis as neededKnowledge, Skills and Abilities:Expert in Microsoft ExcelFP&A experience, Operations Finance experience is a plusExperienced and proficient with Microsoft PowerPointDetailed knowledge of financial statements and financial reportingExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills; strong attention to detailStrong communication and interpersonal skills; comfort working with senior executivesSelf-driven, motivated and matureEducation/ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics from a strong, competitive academic institutionExperience with Transportation industry is a plus1+ years of experience is preferred. Name: Sr Business Analyst --- Customer Ops
Description: Date posted 11/05/2018  Requisition Number: ******BR  Location: United States - North Carolina - Charlotte  Zip Code: 28277  Area of Interest: Information Technology Services, Operations/General, Telecommunications  Position Type: Full Time JOB SUMMARY The Customer Operations Call Center Technology - Desktop Tools team is currently seeking a Sr. Business Analysts. This position would be responsible for supporting business applications used by agents within Customer Operations contact centers and ensuring consistency of these applications across the enterprise with regard to business requirements, configuration and administration, implementation, and adoption. The position will also require the hired individual to coordinate with various stakeholder teams across the company to align these applications with current and future business needs.  Under general supervision, the Sr. Business Analysts serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization and/or vendors in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. This role provides complex analysis services, translates user needs into detailed business requirement, supports the business solution implementation journey, performs business rules configuration activities within the applications, and participates in the implementation and support of operations processes that support Customer Operations Desktop Tools. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.  Analyze business partner's operations to understand strengths and weaknesses in order to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions.  Gather, refine and validate complex business requirements, interdependencies and potential risks or issues.  Facilitate communication and encourage commitment between business units to align solutions with business strategies.  Assist in the documentation and application configuration changes as needed for new and existing technology.  Translate high-level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and/or vendors. Manage changes to such specifications.  Negotiate agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT and/or vendors from initial requirements to final implementation.  Work with business partners within a business function to align technology solutions within business strategies.  Analyze business processes, functions, and procedures to determine most effective business systems software to meet the needs of the organization.  Assist Project Managers in development of project plans and use associated project planning tools as needed.  Conduct feasibility studies to assess cost/benefit, efficiency and technical viability of solutions to business problems.  Serve as project team member for multiple projects as needed.  Establish specifications and objectives based on business requirements and cost effectiveness; provide recommendations to management personnel.  Coordinates technical pilot deployment activities of business applications across teams in Customer Operations organization.  Provide appropriate reports and updates to appropriate stakeholders on a timely basis  Perform analysis and follow up of data relating to Customer Operation applications performance and adoption.  Collaborate with management in systems development and design.  Develop test plans and coordinate software testing.  Perform other duties as assigned. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Skills/Abilities and Knowledge  Ability to read, write, speak and understand English  Strong analytic, organizational, and problem solving skills with a willingness to get into detail  Ability to work well under pressure, handle multiple priorities, and make deadlines  Demonstrated leadership abilities  Working knowledge of cable television operations, processes and billing systems  Excellent presentation skills with small- to medium-sized groups  Ability to work independently  Ability to use personal computer & software applications (i.e. Word, Excel, Visio, etc.) Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience  Related Work Experience  Procedural documentation and implementation background PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Skills/Abilities and Knowledge  Ability to analyze and interpret data  Ability to quickly identify business problems/opportunities  Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner  Ability to communicate with all levels of management and company personnel  Ability to define key performance indicators / metrics  Ability to document, prepare and present data-driven presentations  Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure  Ability to manage multiple projects at one time  Ability to prioritize and organize effectively  Ability to show judgment and initiative and to accomplish job duties  Ability to supervise and motivate others  Ability to make configuration changes in an application; document, test, and deploy changes  Knowledge of process and project management  Knowledge of general accounting and billing procedures Education Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field or equivalent experience  Related Work Experience  5+ years of business analysis experience  5+ years of project management experience WORKING CONDITIONS Normal office conditions  The Spectrum brands (including Spectrum Networks, Spectrum Enterprise and Spectrum Reach) are powered and innovated by Charter Communications. Charter Communications reaffirms its commitment to providing equal opportunities for employment and advancement to qualified employees and applicants. Individuals will be considered for positions for which they meet the minimum qualifications and are able to perform without regard to race, color, gender, age, religion, disability, national origin, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.  Business Unit: Customer Operations

Name: Business Initiatives Consultant 2
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Wholesale Banking provides financial solutions to businesses across the United States and globally, with annual sales generally in excess of $5 million. Our 10 major business lines include Business Banking, Middle Market Banking, Government and Institutional Banking, Corporate Banking, Commercial Real Estate, Financial Institutions Group, Wells Fargo Commercial Capital, Wells Fargo Insurance, Wells Fargo Securities, and Principal Investments. We also have groups in credit risk, group risk, finance, marketing, human relations, and the Wholesale Chief Operating Office that support our businesses.  The Wholesale Control (WC) organization serves as the front line risk management organization within the Wholesale Banking group of Wells Fargo supporting the Wholesale businesses with risk strategy, implementation, and execution. The Wholesale Control team is accountable to assess and effectively manage risks across all risk types and Wholesale businesses delivering an integrated view of risks, producing a sustainable control environment, and instilling a culture of strong risk management. The team is responsible to identify and assess risks, design and implement controls, and execute and monitor the controls to ensure they are working effectively to manage risk across Wholesale. Wholesale Control interfaces with Independent Risk Management and Audit to drive comprehensive and consistent implementation of regulatory and corporate risk policies and programs across Wholesale.  The Role Supporting Infrastructure (SI) Control Strategy & Transformation SI Data & Reporting AnalystIndividual ResponsibilitiesAct as a data and reporting lead for key Wholesale Control SI strategic initiatives.Support the sourcing, acquisition, loading, and conformance of new risk data.Help design new data models to enable new risk reporting.Help lead rapid development of prototypes and interim solutions to address key problem areas while longer term solutions are being designed and built.Develop new BI dashboards as needed.Support existing SI databases and Tableau Dashboards. Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.Required Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: project management, implementation, or strategic planningDesired Qualifications3+ years of financial services industry experienceTableau experienceAbility to initiate action, make difficult decisions, and generate creative solutionsAbility to work effectively in a team environment and across all organizational levels, where flexibility, collaboration, and adaptability are importantAdvanced Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) skillsExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsInternational or wholesale banking operations exposure; preferably within Wells FargoStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyStrong organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skillsInternational or wholesale banking exposure; preferably within Wells FargoStrong, clear and concise written and oral communication skillsOther Desired Qualifications3+ years in Technology, Data Analytics & Data Modeling3+ years Data Analytics & Data ModelingStrong Experienced in BI Tools especially TableauStrong Experienced in DBMS Platforms specifically Teradata, Oracle, Microsoft SQL ServerStrong familiarity with WFs Wholesale BSA / AML Program especially in the area of customer refresh / Periodic Review work and staffing adequacy analysisDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
