Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data AnalystPandera prides itself in being a leader in the analytics field, creating an artful blend of analytics and product expertise to create beautiful, data-driven products and platforms. Our mission is to remain the leader in existing and emerging advanced analytics utilizing modern and traditional analytical toolkits. We accomplish this by promoting your continuous development, both personally and professionally.As a Data Analyst at Pandera, you are someone who can do a analyze data and communicate effectively with others by partnering with cross-functional teams focused on product improvements. You love wrangling messy data into an elegant solution, and working with a wide range of data to identify opportunities or unknown risks and articulate recommend solutions and strategies. You will contribute to data team initiatives focused on ensuring fast, reliable, and comprehensive data and serve as a trusted consultant and promote data literacy across the company. This role is a chance to have a huge impact on how millions of users collaborate.Responsibilities:Analyze data in a business settingCollaborate with non-technical consumers of dataSelf-motivated and thrive when working autonomouslyTo be curious, innovative, diligent and not afraid to fail fastTo keep current with emerging technologies and advanced analytic methodologiesCollaborate with other technical teams to integrate analytical solutions in Enterprise applicationsQualifications:Running and Testing ReportsExperience with large Data SetsProficient when it comes to writing SQL QueriesExperience with Data Analysis and/or Data Visualization tool such as (MicroStrategy)Critical ThinkingAbility to test that the Data from A matches B and if not diagnose the problemExperience with Netezza or Oracle DB is a plusWhat do you get out of this? You’re a hot commodity and having you on the team would be an honor to us! Here’s some of the ways we pay it forward to recognize your contribution to our vision!Be RewardedA competitive salary and instant vesting on 401k are only a few of the rewards for a job well done.Be HealthyHealth, dental, and vision offered through top tier providers and unlimited sick leave to keep you feeling at the top of your game.Be InspiredCollaborative workspace and unlimited vacation to keep your mind fresh and ready to take on the next new idea.Be SupportedA large network of industry experts, internal training platform, and external learning opportunities to grow your skills and experience.Be a TeamTeam outings, happy hours, passion presentations, volunteer opportunities, meetups, etc. we are creating a community to continuously share and grow as a team.

Name: EB Ancillary Analysts I
Description: General Description: This position is responsible for analyzing information and creating financial and marketing deliverables for current clients with ancillary lines of coverage (Dental, Vision, Life AD&D, Disability and Worksite). Deliverables include financial and contractual analysis, claims utilization analysis and modeling, and premium rate analysis and modeling. Required to perform essential functions and meet service standards and Best Practices developed by USI.  Responsibilities: Set priorities and manage analytical work flow to ensure efficient, timely and accurate creation of deliverables and other responsibilities.Prepare standard analyses based on USI templates in accordance with client service calendar financial meetings (e.g. Post-renewal, mid-year, pre-renewal, renewal). Analyses may include but are not limited to: Market review analysisRenewal rate and benefit illustrationsAnalysis of claims utilization with guidance from Team Lead or mentorDrive USI's Cornerstone carrier strategy and process alongside ancillary team leaderServe as primary contact with insurance carriers on new business quotes and renewals to include related activities such as: requesting quotes, evaluating options, spreading results.Acts as an ancillary product knowledgeable resource to develop strategic plans and solutions for clients.Perform technical analysis of group insurance contracts and financial arrangements.Participate in the peer review process both as a participant as well as a reviewer.Collaborate with other team members to share best practices and processes.Other miscellaneous duties as assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 1-2 years' experience in Employee Benefits related field preferred, specifically with ancillary related insurance products (Dental, Vision, Life, Disability).High School Graduate. College degree preferred, but not required.Ability to work in a fast paced environment with minimal instruction and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.Ability to manage and negotiate multiple priorities and deadlines.Maintain a cordial and effective relationship with clients, co-workers, carriers, vendors and other business contacts. Ability to work in a team environment.Keep informed regarding industry information, new product information, legislation, coverage and technology to continuously improve knowledge and performance.Interact with others effectively by utilizing good communication skills, cooperating purposefully and providing information and guidance, as needed, to achieve the business goals of the company.Must hold state Life & Disability insurance license or willing to obtain one within an agreed upon timeframe.Strong written, oral and interpersonal communication skills.Strong functional knowledge of Excel specific to creating, formatting and evaluating formulas and working within templates. Must be proficient in Excel, Word and other MS Office products.Strong problem solving and critical thinking skillsOther:Must be willing to work in one of the following offices: New England - Meriden, CTNortheast - New York CityMidAtlantic - Hunt Valley, MDSoutheast -- Tampa, FLSouthwest - HoustonMountain - DenverWest - Seattle

Name: Senior Financial Analyst- Business Support
Description: Job Description:This is a Business Finance Officer (BFO) / Business Support role on the Consumer Client Services (CCS) Finance team which is part of the overall Consumer / GWIM CFO organization. The primary focus of this team is to provide financial and strategic support to our CCS business partners that lead the consumer call centers including nearly 12,000 agents and 30+ locations. The role will deliver on normal finance activities including month end close, financial reporting, forecasting, stress testing, and ad-hoc analysis. The teammate in this role will partner with line of business leaders, resource planning, and Finance to serve as the primary contact for business case development and initiative tracking.The teammate will develop business partner relationships with business leaders, resource planning, and other Consumer Finance teams through regular interactions with key contacts and working directly with teammates. Throughout the tenure of the role, the teammate should gain exposure and acumen across the Consumer Bank, including a deeper understanding of Consumer Strategy changes that affect Consumer Products and other Consumer Channels which ultimately impact CCS. Additionally, the teammate will develop and improve the following skills: Essbase, financial reporting, problem solving and analytical abilities, and communication. The ideal candidate should be a quick learner, organized, independently motivated, and demonstrate intellectual curiosity.Required Skills:Bachelor's degree (accounting or finance strongly preferred)Strong communication, organization, presentation, analytical, and business partnering skillsAdvanced Excel, modeling, and data manipulationStrong Business AcumenAttention to detailComfortable functioning in a highly dynamic, ever changing environment, manages multiple responsibilities simultaneously, easily adaptable to changing priorities, and has the ability to work independently or in teamsSeeks to understand end to end processes and develop simplified, repeatable processes to streamline existing workComfortable taking ownership of highly impactful processes and business partner relationshipsAbility to interact with multiple levels within an organizationDesired Skills:Critical Thinking / Problem SolvingeLedger / EPM / BeX / Smartview KnowledgeShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week: 40

Name: Lead IT Applications Analyst - webMethods
Description: More than a career - a chance to make a difference in people's lives.Build an exciting, rewarding career with us – help us make a difference for millions of people every day. Consider joining the Duke Energy team, where you'll find a friendly work environment, opportunities for growth and development, recognition for your work, and competitive pay and benefits.Position SummaryThe Lead IT Applications Analyst will be a member of Customer Connect Integration Team, and will be responsible for leading portions of design, build and test of integrations to and from our SAP Customer Billing & Engagement Platform. The candidate is an highly experienced and skilled webMethods lead who will work closely with the webMethods Infrastructure team to facilitate project specific configuration of UM and IS environements. Responsible for coaching, guiding and mentoring junior members in the team. Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review. The candidate will have strong technical experience and experience interfacing with business partners as well as internal and external technical teams. Applicant should also be versed in integration best practices and have experience in creation and management of enterprise web services, messaging, and data movement to support ERP implementations in a highly complex environment..  Customer Connect is a multi-release/multi-year program that will implement the SAP product suite including: Hybris Cloud for Customer (C4C), Hybris Marketing, Hybris Commerce, Hybris Billing, HANA Analytics and SAP ISU on S4HANA. Ultimately the program’s goal is to consolidate four legacy customer billing systems into one customer service platform to deliver the universal engagement experience customers expect. Internally, this multi-year program will positively impact our business by driving efficiencies, consistencies and insights. The program is using a hybrid waterfall / agile methodology. Name: Secondary Analyst Team - Analyst
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities.  Business Unit:Applications/Investment SystemsJob Summary Barings’ Structured Credit Investment team is seeking a motivated individual with strong analytical skills and attention to detail to join our Secondary Analyst Team. This individual will be responsible for conducting surveillance of a wide range of investment related data, helping to manage, improve & create sustainable, scalable operational workflows surrounding the investment management process. This individual will be tasked with working to ensure our proprietary in-house & other 3rd-party applications are well positioned to enhance the ability of the group’s investment process. This position reports to a Director on the Structured Credit Investment Team & is located in Charlotte, NC.  The Structured Credit Investment Team conducts analysis, monitoring and valuation of investments in structured credit securities, with a heavy focus on Collateralized Loan Obligations (CLO’s). The team tracks collateral manager risk, style and performance. The team uses proprietary analytical platforms to analyze and track the performance of each CLO including detailed analysis of the credit quality and risk imbedded in the underlying portfolio.  The Secondary Analyst Team’s primary mission is to ensure the timely and accurate flow of information from external data providers, allowing our portfolio managers and analysts to focus on the current and potential risks in each CLO and collateral manager platform. The team also works very closely with the Development Team which is focused on the continued application improvement and support of the proprietary in-house and 3rd-party applications used by the Structured Credit. Primary ResponsibilitiesWork together with other members of the secondary analysts to provide direct support to the Structured Credit Investment Team members in the underwriting, analysis and monitoring of CLO’s.Manage the daily flow and quality of data from 3rd party vendors; ensuring timeliness, completeness & accuracyProduce and support client reporting in cooperation with other team’s across Barings, especially for initial trade data and on-going investment monitoringSupport CLO Analysts in the CLO underwriting process with initial deal step upAssist other team members; secondary analysts, portfolio managers & investment team analysts, with various time sensitive ad-hoc tasks as needed.Work with Development Team with the testing an implementation of system enhancements The ideal candidate for this role will: have a desire to learn the CLO asset class, be able to troubleshoot & problem-solve quickly with a strong sense of urgency & attention to detail, communicate well with other members of the firm in different areas of operation. The candidate must be able to understand business requirements, investment data and concepts. This person should be a self-starter, able to work both independently and cooperatively as required.  Barings Structured Credit is a fast paced, challenging environment and the team often manages multiple time sensitive assignments and initiatives simultaneously.  Prior experience with structured finance products such as CLO’s or related systems/data at another asset manager or financial services company would be a plus but is not required. QualificationsTechnology Skill Sets:Strong computer skills & familiarity with Microsoft’s suite of Office products especially Microsoft ExcelMicrosoft SQL desiredBloomberg desiredQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or related discipline preferred0-3 years’ experience in financial services, investment management or related fieldWillingness to learn and take on challengesStrong analytical and problem solving skillsStrong time management, organizational & collaboration skillsSelf-motivated with a strong work ethicAbility to communicate clearly and effectively Barings is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; Minority/Female/Age/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply.

Name: Manager, Business Intelligence
Description: Client Reference Code: 230909 JOB TITLE: Mobile BI Analytics ManagerJOB SUMMARY Responsible for partnering with Mobile BI leadership to manage a portfolio of high-value, business-critical information delivery. This position will work closely with key business planners to ensure business needs and goals are realized through discovery, analysis, and reporting on Charters information assets. This role oversees a complete delivery team including analysts and ETL/Report developers dedicated to assisting Mobile BI efficiently and effectively organize and deliver high-quality BI products that align with current business needs. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop expert level understanding in Employer Mobile data flows (understanding which systems are the source for various types of data required for reporting); additionally, this individual will be responsible for analyzing and defining the reporting impact of source system and business process changesLeverage strong business acumen to respond to executive reporting asks by developing a hypothesis, identifying specific data points, querying the data, and summarizing the findings into a presentation for the executive audience; manage a team of Analysts to intake and deliver ad hoc BI requests from stakeholdersLead reporting requirements gathering workshops with business leaders for upstream mobile projects and synthesize to determine BI scope for executionServe as the product owner for existing Mobile BI reporting products and functionality; evaluate new requirements or new business features, this candidate will be expected to have an opinion on how existing reporting products should be enhanced or what new reporting capabilities need to be deliveredContribute to data model and reporting solution design sessions with BI architectsLead issue and defect triage and resolution by leveraging strong a understanding of the BI reporting data model, upstream source system and business processes, and reporting logic to guide development and quality assurance resource in the investigation and resolution of issuesManage BI reporting backlogs by stakeholder groups; responsible for aligning with stakeholders on the priority for new requirements and enhancements and representing those priorities at internal BI delivery planning meetingsDevelop an advanced understanding of key Mobile industry metrics and a perspective on KPI benchmarks; consult with internal reporting stakeholders on Employer Mobile's performance against these industry benchmarks with the objective of supporting processing improvements through insightful reportingQUALIFICATIONSRequired advanced-level understanding of the end-to-end delivery of reporting delivery lifecycle, including requirements definition, functional and technical design, source data identification, ETL and report development, and testingPreferred background in Mobile industry reporting, metrics, and KPIsRequired experience serving as the primary contact for executive-level reporting stakeholdersAdvanced ability to write SQL to profile and analyze dataExperience working with MicroStrategy or a similar enterprise reporting application strongly preferredEDUCATION Bachelors or Masters degree in Information Systems, Business Analytics or related engineering field RELATED WORK EXPERIENCE5 years relevant business work experience3 years supervisory experience and project managementExperience with Mobile Wireless, Cable TV and / or Internet products & services or other related industry experience preferredWORKING CONDITIONS Office environment Job Code : BBL500 Mgr, Business Intelligence Exempt 230909BR

Name: SAP Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSAP Business Analyst Stabilus is a global leader in the production of gas springs and dampers on five continents. Our products can be used in a wide variety of industries, such as the automotive and office chair manufacturing industries, furniture technology, solar industry, medical technology, and many other industrial applications. This position will be located in our U.S. Headquarters in Gastonia, NC. Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced SAP Logistics Functional/Business Analyst to support manufacturing, logistic processes, operations and to further SAP customer specific applications. The SAP Business Analyst supports Stabilus Global IT Business Solution Team by studying business processes and recommending system solutions to support best practice methods. This position requires strong analytical, organizational, decision making and presentation skills. Essential Job Functions: · Ensure and develop organization for a high level data integrity.  · Provide functional support in all areas of SAP Production Planning and Logistic Processes (Master Data, MRP, Demand Management, Material/Warehouse Management, Production Execution, Sales and Distribution).  · Recommend and develop process improvements and enhancements.  · Identify training needs; create training materials and business process standards to deliver training as needed.  · Help identify, train and mentor super-users to provide level 1 support to the business.  · Facilitate organization knowledge sharing at all levels of the company.  · Reports and coordinate the requirements, projects, business changes to the IT Headquarters. Education, Training, Certifications: · Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems or a comparable combination of education/certification and work experience required. Experience: · 5+ years hands on experience in SAP logistic modules PP/MM/SD. The ideal candidate will have experience with ALL of these modules.  · Strong understanding of business processes in discrete manufacturing.  · Background in end user manual preparation and training.  · Experience with business process improvement techniques and methodologies.  · Customer service orientation and experience in business-related interactions.  · Passport required.  · Ability and willingness to travel nationally and internationally when required. Job Knowledge and Skills: · Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.  · Effective team player and/or mentor/coach.  · Fluent speaking and writing skills in English are required.  · Good communication skills.  · Willingness and ability to work in an international team.  · Attention to detail and excellent analytical skills.  · Well-organized and able to work on own initiative.Company DescriptionWith a comprehensive application spectrum, a broad and unique product offer and decades of experience we are the world market leader for gas springs and dampers. Stabilus has been a pioneer and market leader with the state of the art technology in the segment. Stabilus has a global footprint and a broad range of vibration, motion and noise control products.

Name: Sr Business Control Specialist – Risk Analyst–
Description: Job Description: Provide analytical support in executing internal control discipline and operational excellence within a LOB/ECF. Gather and organize data in order to monitor and test the effectiveness of key controls and status of mitigation and action plans. Prepare documentation for the tracking, monitoring, and escalation of risk related issues to management. Acts as an ambassador of the risk culture. Incumbents typically have over 5+ years of risk management and/or LOB/ECF experience. May manage staff.  Summary:  The Risk and Finance Technology Risk and Control Team is responsible for advocating a strong risk management culture and discipline to ensure capabilities are in place to drive execution of the firms operational risk management framework. Uses Enterprise and/or CIO specific processes and tools in order to ensure adherence to Enterprise policies and standards for the Risk and Finance Technology teams. This includes monitor and testing of key controls across high risk functions, Issue management, and Audit, Regulatory and SOX exam coordination and support.  Responsibilities: Provides risk management support across various business units within a Technology portfolio.Develops and maintain team documentation and reportingManage relationships and communications with business and control partners at various levels of the organization, as well as other Enterprise Control Functions (ECFs)Support Bank of America’s Risk Framework and enable strong operational risk management – identify, escalate and debate risksDocument, debate, and manage the performance of issues and risks within the portfolioRespond to Audits, Exams, and Inquiries, including SOX control assessmentsAssist business and process owners with assessing compliance to control requirements and their performance.Inspect evidence of control design and operation.Participate in the Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) process as requiredConsult and guide application teams and partners on the usage of Risk tools, processes and deliverables.Identify opportunities for streamlining or improving risk management processes; ability to partner across multiple divisions to execute. Required Skills: Minimum 3 years Technology or Information Security experience required, with strong Application Management policy acumenMinimum 5 years technology risk and control experience requiredStrong communication skills, both verbal and writtenOrganized with strong attention to detailSkilled in handling multiple priorities with tight deadlines in a fast-paced environmentWork within a team but also has the ability to work for extended period in standalone roles to meet targets and deadlinesAbility to analyze details and shape results into conclusions and recommendations for managementMust be able to collaborate and influence across a matrix environmentStrong Excel and PowerPoint skills Desired Skills: Experience with SOX IT General Controls

Name: Senior Apptio Business Systems Consulant (Business Systems Consultant 5)
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members.  Wells Fargos Financial Systems and Technology Group (FST) within Enterprise Information Technology (EIT) is seeking a Senior Business Analyst responsible for providing support for Wells Fargos Apptio implementation and system operation activities. This individual will be a key member of the project implementation, including planning, design, building, testing, deployment and support. It is important for this individual to quickly understand existing business/system processes and its inherent inter-dependencies for immediate contributions. The individual will ensure that the Apptio data flows and feeds are completed successfully and on-going reference data tables are maintained.  Job Description: Provide business analyst support for all phases of the Apptio project implementation.Responsible for documenting the integration requirements between Apptio and other applications across Wells FargoPartner with vendor and technical system owners to understand integration points, design, and document current vs future process and identify gapsManage overall testing process and expected outcomes; create test plan, test cases, and tracks defect logs and provide reporting on progressManage the operational aspect of Apptio, including the scheduled data feeds, updates to mapping tables and access governance.Partner with stakeholders to capture short-term and long-term roadmap items.Maintain internal reports and recommend reporting improvements to meet the needs of the Senior Business/IT leadership.Identify, create, and refine Cost allocation models and documentation.Partner with project team to review and prepare corporate and management reporting from Apptio.Work directly with internal clients to identify process and system improvements. Note: The work locations for this position are Chandler-AZ, Charlotte-NC (Preferred), and Minneapolis-MNRequired Qualifications7+ years of business systems analysis experience, business systems design experience, or a combination of both7+ years of financial analysis or accounting experience7+ years of financial industry experience5+ years of testing or quality assurance experience5 + years of experience with System Integration Testing (SIT)3+ years of business process experience3+ years of experience supporting finance or accounting functionsDesired QualificationsExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsApptio experienceKnowledge of planning management tools such as ApptioAbility to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environmentAbility to work independentlyAbility to work effectively in a team environmentA BS/BA degree or higher in accounting, finance, or economicsA BS/BA degree or higher in information technologyOther Desired QualificationsStrong technical and financial acumen, data analytics and report development.Proven success implementing, integrating and supporting financial management applications in a highly complex global architecture of multiple solutions.Prior experience developing requirements for the integration between financial systemsAttentive to details, thoroughness and self-motivatedDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst - Direct Hire/Colleague
Description: Job DescriptionSUMMARY: The Business Intelligence Analyst independently produces insightful market and business analytics. This includes external economic/global business trends, client specific analytics and overall program key performance indicators (KPI’s) and service level agreements (SLA’s). Ensures all requests are completed with a high level of customer satisfaction and accuracy. Acts as a project manager for all analytic deliverables coordinating with Pontoon executives, corporate partners and developers to ensure an on time and high-quality product is delivered. Communicates and documents insightful account of analytic trends to internal and external customers. Develops, maintains and summarizes KPI’s, ensuring metrics provide a clear picture of performance against contractual service level agreements (SLA). Utilizes strong technical skills coupled with business intelligence and a deep understanding of customers’ needs to deliver valuable reports on each recruitment engagement.  Evaluates all requests while considering best practices and Pontoon Standards to ensure solution tools are utilized whenever possible, preventing the number of manual workarounds. Evaluates all requests for first level approval and if escalation is necessary, gathers all relevant information and presents to Business Intelligence Consultant. Designs data specifications for analytic requests/initiatives and collaborates with MSP Reporting Analysts for execution. Ensures data delivered by MSP Reporting Analysts have a high level of integrity and consistently applies standard validation procedures to all deliverables. Creates and updates procedures for all requests delivered on a schedule. As assigned, develops statistically derived analytics such as projections, forecasts or predictive regression models. Partners with the Data Warehousing and Development team to ensure products and data are delivered accurately completing validation as needed. Works to deliver analytics to make programs more efficient, deliver faster, and leaner. Serves as a thought leader in the area of reporting and analytics to program teams. GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:Responsible for research & development of statistical projections/forecasts and mathematically derived correlation analysis.Provides written explanation of results/trends to Pontoon Executives and independently is proactive taking the initiative to modify presentation of results based on knowledge of business trends. This data may contain cross-client analytics, cross-client data, macro-economic data, and/or client data.Utilizes software and numerous reporting technologies to define metrics, develop actionable recommendations, and identify process improvement opportunities.Works with Pontoon leadership, Business Intelligence Consultant, and clients to develop in-depth and insightful analytics while ensuring optimal design for development and written analysis.Acts as project manager for new client implementations and existing analytic deliverables coordinating with leadership, implementation, corporate partners and Reporting Analysts to ensure reporting design is optimal following the Pontoon standard while capturing all MSA reporting requirements, delivery is on time and a high quality, insightful and accurate product is delivered.Performs quality assurance testing of Reporting Analysts’ deliverables, provides feedback and clear expectation of responsibility.Owns production of analytic documents until design is finalized and identifies supporting tasks to delegate to the Reporting Analysts.Collaborates with Reporting Analysts to create detailed procedures; to include validation and quality assurance steps.Develops presentation of data trends that are scalable for reproduction and provides business insight. Communicates design and interpretation best practices to internal and external customers.Works to leverage existing functionality and standardize scope of reporting products aligning to the Pontoon Standard.Follows established protocols and approval process; creates customized analysis only as necessary and reviewed with Business Intelligence Consultant.Utilizes case management system to manage, monitor, and track all reporting requests from internal and external clients.Executes all reporting analytic requests per standard reporting guidelines. Effectively delivers analytic requirements by following production schedule.Communicates status and communicates per the escalation matrix.Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.EDUCATION & JOB REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor’s Degree preferably in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Finance, or BusinessTwo (2) to five (5) years’ experience in business analytics, project management and/or statistical modelingExperience in the staffing industry, strongly desired but not requiredExperience with VMS tools, such as Fieldglass, IQNavigator, Provade or Beeline, and/OR ATS tools, such as BrassRing, PeopleFluent, Avature, Taleo, or SuccessFactors, strongly desired but not requiredExperience with business intelligence tools such as Spotfire, Business Object, Domo, Tableau, Cognos, or equivalent, strongly desired but not requiredExperience with statistical software, IE, SAS, Statistica, R, or SPSS, strongly desired but not requiredKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:Skilled in communicating effectively verbally and in writingAbility to establish and maintain effective working relationshipsAbility to perform accurately in a detailed environment while being able to effectively prioritize, organize and perform multiple work assignments simultaneouslyProficient with Microsoft Office products, including advanced formula writing within ExcelStrong attention to detail and problem solving skills Company DescriptionPontoon is a global HR outsourcing company specializing in improving an organization’s talent. We manage the contingent workforce and statement of work resources on behalf of our clients, as well as source and recruit direct hires. A division of Adecco with operations in nearly 100 countries and with more than 1,500 colleagues worldwide, the Jacksonville, the Florida-based organization delivers solutions to more than 150 industry-leading companies. Name: Syndicate Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Title: Syndicate AnalystCompany: Banking/Financial ServicesLocation: Charlotte, NCTerms: 6 month contract, extendable to 24 months and eligible for conversion to FTE This is a position on the Syndicate Operations Team which is responsible for the settlement and Syndicate accounting of new issue securities.  • As a team member you will be responsible for providing support to the various syndicate trading desks and investment banking teams.  • Functions will include obtaining eligibility for securities, funding issuers on settlement date, reconciling deal related revenue, paying deal related expenses, creating deal profit and loss statements, distributing revenue and statement of accounts to outside Syndicate members, maintaining extensive documentation of the Syndicate process and booking general ledger entries.  • Position requires superb organizational and problem solving skills, knowledge of investment bank back office processes, understanding of basic accounting principles and the ability to partner effectively with various interested parties including Traders, Bankers, Bond Counsel, Trustees, Finance and Compliance departments.  • This role is ideally suited to a candidate which excels in a fast paced environment, managing conflicting priorities and has a desire to continuously enhance a process.  • This position requires excellent communications and interpersonal skills, exceptional attention to detail; ability to work independently and multi-task; strong technical and problem-solving skills.Company DescriptionAbout us  Digital Intelligence Systems, LLC (DISYS) is a global staffing and IT consulting services company with core capabilities in: Staff Augmentation ServicesApplication Development ServicesBusiness Intelligence ServicesCloud Enablement ServicesEnterprise Resource PlanningInfrastructure Support ServicesTesting Services Our vision is to be a global business partner, delivering highest quality and most consistent services at the best value to clients worldwide.  Incorporated in 1994 as a certified Minority Business Enterprise, DISYS is one of the largest IT staffing firms in the US according to a report by Staffing Industry Analysts. DISYS is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with offices and delivery locations worldwide in North and South America, Europe, and the Asia Pacific region.

Description: Job Description: The Collateral Trading Optimization (CTO) Business Finance & Controls (BF&C) team is part of GBAM Finance and is responsible for coverage of the Collateral Trading Optimization business. The CTO desk is a desk within the Counterparty Portfolio Management business. The CTO desks mandate is to manage funding and capital costs of the GBAM derivative portfolio across all legal entities and business units in collaboration with other CPM desks.  The Finance team supports the desk in a Business Finance Officer (BFO) capacity, ensuring proper reporting of the balance sheet and financial results. Core responsibilities will include helping with daily, weekly and monthly risk and P&L reporting, explains, and commentary, quarterly accounting disclosures if needed, daily and monthly P&L and account reconciliations, balance sheet reviews, coordinating with audit (internal & external, SOX), month end close, reserve calculations, pricing adjustments and planning/forecasting.  As part of the responsibilities of the role, the teammate will also develop business partner relationships with the Front Office, various businesses, controller groups and other support partners. Throughout the tenure of the role, the teammate should gain exposure and acumen in collateral, systems used for collateral, FTP, and several other areas of the organization. The candidate will develop or improve the following skills: Business Partnering, Management Reporting Focus, Process Control, and Capital Management.  This is a well- rounded role in which candidates have the opportunity to partner with the CTO desk (Front Office), Risk and other senior finance managers. Candidate will be exposed with how to deconstruct balance sheet and P&L to provide analytical support to the desk and other business partners. Required SkillsBS / BA Degree Required - (Accounting, Finance, or Economics Preferred)5 - 7 years accounting or finance experienceUnderstanding of accounting (debits / credits), reconciliation, balancingUnderstanding of ledger, and sub ledger systems (SAP/eLedger, Oracle, Finman, etc)Advanced in Microsoft Office suite of products with emphasis on strong Excel (macros, pivot tables, etc) as well as various Bank specific reporting tools (EPM, FMA, etc)Understand the business strategy, products and inherent risks.Oversight on the official daily P&L explain and its provision for VaR backtesting.Regulatory capital disclosures, Price Testing, Sector analysis, Stress Test and Forecasting.Must be able to work across the organization to research and resolve issuesMonthly Independent Price verification on Derivatives and securities positions.Calculation of the Valuation adjustment - Validation of appropriate application and use of models for books & records.Substantiation & analysis of daily Balance Sheet and P&L with analytics and commentary on Line of Business performance.Preparation of monthly & quarterly revenue commentary to senior manager and regulators.Maintaining/updating valuation adjustment & IPV Desk Level Procedures (DLP)Responsible for being audit compliant and meet the regulatory requirements.Highly organized, detail oriented, proactive, and able to multitask in a deadline driven environmentIndependent learner and thinker, Initiative, Insight, leadership skillsDemonstrated financial acumen with analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to communicate, partner and influence across a matrix organizationDesired SkillsMBA / CPA / CFAExperience with CollateralExperience with Carbon, Musketeer, Vienna, EBAR, Impact, Intrader, Martini, BookmapFASB / SEC ExposureExperience around regulatory reporting, Sarbanes Oxley, capital reporting and metricsShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Performance Analyst - Cons Prod Strategy Analyst II/III

Utilizes portfolio trends to propose policy/procedural changes within segmentation structure to produce optimal results. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Build relationships with external agencies. Provides analytical support on various strategies to ensure company goals are met. Coordinates the production of performance reports and updates for senior management. Role will routinely involve quantifying impacts and building compelling business cases to drive change. Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: RadixBay is looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst to support our clients that utilize Salesforce. Candidate should have a desire to work in the Information Technology field. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn and grow within the role and RadixBay. This role will be a contract opportunity for a candidate that lives in or near Charlotte, NC. Candidate will also assist with consulting with current and future clients. The Salesforce Business Analyst responsibilities may include any of the following:Consistently achieve or exceed monthly target(s).The Business Analyst will work with RadixBays customers to understand their unique needs and then customize various technologies to meet business requirementsCreate custom objects, record types, fields, and field dependencies with SalesforceCreate and customize page layouts within SalesforceCreate, configure and maintain custom reports and dashboards with SalesforceDevelop and maintain training materials as they relate to SalesforceThe Salesforce Business Analyst will assist with configuration and implementation of Salesforce.Keep abreast of new features and functionality in order to provide recommendations for process improvements to RadixBays clientsEducation and Skills for the Salesforce Business Analyst:Highly motivated and disciplined self-starter with excellent communication and customer or client support skillsA degree in technology is required.Knowledge of basic SQL based system principlesWorking proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)High attention to detail RadixBay delivers world-class Business IT Consulting and Solutions using a new approach that breaks the outdated and stale IT delivery model. Name: Analytic Consultant 5 - Business Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Data Management and Insights (DMI) is transforming the way that Wells Fargo uses and manages data. Our work enables Wells Fargo to empower and inform our team members, deliver exceptional experiences for our customers, and meet the elevated expectations of our regulators. The team is responsible for designing the future data environment, defining data governance and oversight, and partnering with technology to operate the data infrastructure for the company. This team also provides next generation analytic insights to drive business strategies and help meet our commitment to satisfy our customers financial needs.  The Wholesale Data Office team delivers trusted, reliable data which drives strategic decisions, enables business growth, and facilitates a strong risk discipline. We enable usage of common data that is complete, trusted, understood, and aligned with our financial reporting.  This position will be supporting our iHub service with the Business Data services team. ihub is an authorized provision point which standardizes common foundational data and distributes to downstream applications and reporting services. The position will support a number iHub workstreams tied to risk, regulatory and internal business line initiatives primarily focusing on loan and leasing data supporting our eOne initiatives. The eONE initiative seeks to build a 'one number' instrument data foundation that is complete, reliable, and aligned to the general ledger. The initiative will also establish the authoritative data source for common data elements between Corporate Finance and Corporate Risk management to support in scope risk and regulatory reporting. eONE will create a federated, coordinated set of applications and databases to support risk and finance, which will allow for agile and accurate risk and regulatory reporting and analytics that complies with BCBS 239, G&O and the Wells Fargo Enterprise Data Governance Policies and Standards.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE: • The applicant should have a strong data management, Wholesale business background, and experience leading project workstreams. You will be expected to perform complex analysis of datasets, build data mapping, and conduct data validation.You will have the opportunity to interact with business and technology partners across Wholesale such as Risk, Finance, Lines of Business, and Systems of Record owners.Required Qualifications8+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling3+ years of experience with SAS or SQL, or other data management, reporting and query tools4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: data management, metrics & business intelligence, data warehouse3+ years of Asset Backed Lending (ABL) experience including loan and invoice financing and factoring1+ year of leadership experience including coaching, training, and mentoringDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to work and influence successfully within a matrix environment and build effective business partnerships with all levels of team membersKnowledge and understanding of data governance challenges and approaches: metadata, data quality, and data stewardshipAbility to articulate complex concepts in a clear mannerOther Desired Qualifications Proven experience working with data problems to solve and come up with innovative ideas and make things happen without management direction Knowledge and understanding of wholesale banking: products, platforms, policies, processes, and procedures Experience with database platforms such as Oracle, Hadoop, or Teradata Techno-functional skills with exposure to various banking products Logical thinker and problem solver. Takes analytical, creative approach to problem solving Positive, people oriented, and energetic attitude Strong communication skills to effectively work with Finance, Risk, Regulatory, and remote team members Ability to manipulate data from non-normalized or disparate data sources Clear understanding of data warehousing principles, dimensional data and data modeling Preferably experience with Oracle Financial Services Data Foundation(FSDF) implementationDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Enterprise Risk Analyst II
Description: *Position Description** The Risk Analyst will be a critical member of the Enterprise Risk Management team responsible for owning Ally's Enterprise-level risk governance process that focuses on the development of new products and new businesses, including the timely completion of recurring reporting, meetings with business partners across the organization, and ensuring accurate, consistent reporting is provided to leadership. This role is a part of a team which will act as an independent review and challenge body to ensure risk is appropriately assessed, managed, and reported, and that the new initiatives are consistent with Ally's strategy and risk appetite. The position will also support and potentially lead additional risk processes and projects. *Job Responsibilities** + Collaborate with business partners on strategic initiatives to collect, analyze, and articulate New Product reporting provided to upper level executives and committees  + Manage multiple processes under stringent deadlines to complete periodic reporting requirements  + Partner with management to assess areas of risk, alerting management to critical deficiencies, violations of policies, procedures, or regulations, and recommend appropriate areas for remediation.  + Enhance current reporting using MS Excel, MS Access, MS PowerPoint, MS SharePoint, or other tools  + Maintain updated governance documents and templates used by business partners to execute key processes  + Review, analyze, and enhance the control processes to ensure accuracy and formatting of reporting is sufficient for executive scrutiny  + Maintain a strong knowledge of corporate policies and procedures including applicable federal regulations related to risk management  + Work closely in a team environment to complete objectives *Qualifications** + Bachelor's degree  + 1 to 4 years of prior experience with meeting strict project and reporting deadlines, working as a team, and process improvement  + Strong written and verbal communication skills; excellent presentation skills  + Experience building and maintaining relationships with multiple business partners  + Prior exposure to project management and team building  + Background in diversified financial services company is desirable, including exposure to insurance, auto finance, consumer and corporate banking  + Skilled in building reports and automation through MS SharePoint, MS Access, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel  + Experience in building new business processes and re-inventing existing ones to exceed business needs and eliminate redundancies and inefficiencies  + Ability to focus on several projects and balance competing priorities and timelines  + Strong work ethic, excellent time management skills, persistence and determination in problem solving  + Openness and desire to learn and implement new technology for report visualization  + Self-motivated and a self-starter  + Ability to work collaboratively on a team and in a fast-paced changing environment  + Ability to comprehend, summarize, and explain complex concepts and detailed findings efficiently *Ally Overview** Ally Financial Inc. (NYSE: ALLY) is a leading digital financial services company and a top 25 U.S. financial holding company offering financial products for consumers, businesses, automotive dealers and corporate clients. Ally's legacy dates back to 1919, and the company was redesigned in 2009 with a distinctive brand, innovative approach and relentless focus on its customers. Ally has an award-winning online bank (member FDIC), one of the largest full service auto finance operations in the country, a complementary auto-focused insurance business, a growing digital wealth management and online brokerage platform, and a trusted corporate finance business offering capital for equity sponsors and middle-market companies. *Business Unit/Enterprise Function** Ally Risk function manages and analyzes our exposure to internal and external risk factors. The group strives to achieve an appropriate balance between risk and return, to limit unnecessary risk, and to protect the company's financial returns. *Total Rewards Information** Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and bonus pay potential based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid time-off program with an emphasis on work-life balance.  Ally offers a variety of benefits to protect your health and well-being, provide financial security and balance your work-life needs including:  + Industry-leading 401K Retirement Savings Plan including Matching and Company Contributions  + Comprehensive wellness program with financial incentives designed to help you achieve your best health  + Flexible health insurance options including dental and vision  + Pre-tax Health Savings Account with generous employer contributions  + Pre-tax dependent care and commuter benefits  + Other work-life integration benefits including Paid Parental & Caregiver Leave, Adoption Assistance, Back-up Child & Adult/Elder Care, Child Care Discounts, Tuition Reimbursement, LifeMatters Employee Assistance Program, Weight Watchers and other employee discount programs *Ally is an Equal Opportunity Employer** We extend equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law. *Job Title:** Enterprise Risk Analyst II*Company:** Ally Financial Inc.*Category:** Risk*BU Function:** Risk*Requisition ID:** 18-6871

Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: Are you a problem solver? Do you love data and reporting? Are you passionate about innovative solutions and have a focus on how to make things, Better, Faster and Simpler? If so, this may be the perfect job for you.  CTE is seeking a dynamic and career-minded individual that can manage the HRIS function for a fast-growing and progressive company. We offer a strong family-oriented culture where individuals and teams are rewarded for strong performance. This individual will interface with all business units and will enable our Company to be more efficient and data-driven.  The primary focus of this position is the support and maintenance of the Human Resource Management System (HRMS) in addition to other systems supported by the Human Resources team. This individual serves as a technical point-of-contact for assigned functional areas and assists with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. The HRIS Analyst also supports HRMS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Manage the review, testing, and implementation of HRMS system upgrades or patches independently or with technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade/fix.Maintain data integrity in HRMS systems by running queries and analyzing data.Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions or alternate methods with HRMS systems, policy changes and/or major variations from established policy that must be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementation. Serve as a key liaison with third parties and other stakeholders (e.g. payroll).Write, maintain, and support a variety of reports utilizing appropriate reporting tools and assist in development of standard reports for ongoing customer needs.Develop HR Dashboard reporting to visually review data, trends and areas of opportunity.Develop user procedures, guidelines, and documentation. Train clients and new system users on new processes/functionality.Maintain awareness of trends in HRMS with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support through classes, reading, CBTs or other mechanisms. Participate in user group meetings/conferences.Leads projects and initiatives aimed at improving operational efficiency, productivity and HR compliance. Identifies creative ways to redesign business processes and/or implement HR technology required to successfully solve business challenges. Provides input on, reviews and approves functional requirements. Ensures business group needs are evaluated and addressed as projects are implemented.Other duties may be assigned on an as needed basis. Education and/or Experience Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field preferredPHR/SPHR certification preferred.3 - 5 years of HRIS or HR generalist or specialist experience system (Ultimate software experience preferred); systems implementation experience.Cognos reporting experience highly preferred.1 - 2 years of project management experience preferred.Effective organizational and interpersonal skills including written and verbal communication skillsDetailed, organized and deadline oriented is a must!Advanced skills of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint), Human Resource Information System (HRIS)Ultimate Software knowledge preferred, strong understanding of HRMS database design, structure, functions, process, and reporting.Job Location: Charlotte, North CarolinaSDL2017

Name: Shared Services Database Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members.  We are looking for a highly competent and motivated individual to fill a Mid - Senior level DBA role in the Enterprise Data Technology Shared Services DBA organization to manage and support highly complex Teradata data warehouses. This is a database management and support role to service all of the Teradata databases within the data technology area. The role is involved in the planning, analysis, implementation, maintenance, and control of the organization's server-class databases. Consults with and make recommendations to management and multiple application DBA/support teams on high impact data, queries or database management issues. Handles and leads various large-scale or highly complex data/database management and deployment activities including one or more of the following: Monitor the shared services mailbox for any work requests, work orders and problem tickets and address them in a timely mannerReview code and deploy database code/objects for new projects and enhancementsCollaborate with production support and Application DBA teams to address any data backfill/load failures during production issuesShare on-call rotation duties and troubleshoot and resolve user and database issues to ensure the service level requirements.Collaborate with Infrastructure DBA & Application DBA teams and external vendors in support of database installations, patches, upgrades and migrationsProvide necessary support in space management, access management and other manual intervention tasks required in productionSupport data copy to lower environments and assist with backup and restore activities when requiredMonitor database performance and provide query recommendation to the usersProvide guidance to less experienced database analysts, managed resources and other team members where applicable, including guidance for troubleshooting escalated issues and support regular/emergency requests during production issues.Required Qualifications7+ years of database design and administration experience4+ years of Teradata experienceDesired QualificationsStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills2+ years of performance tuning experience4+ years of SQL experienceOther Desired QualificationsAbility to work and influence successfully within a matrix environment and build relationshipsAbility to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple prioritiesThe job involves on-call duties once in 4-6 weeks for implementation and support activities. Flexible schedules for the on-call week can be arranged.DisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members. The ITM APP Application team is responsible for driving the design and development of the new ITM APP in collaboration and alignment with the Enterprise Data Blueprint architecture. The intention of the ITM APP is to provide increased consistency, quality, and insight in the information available to manage the business of IT. Through the Enterprise Blueprint architecture, the ITM APP is implementing leading tools and principles in data warehousing to deliver an effective and efficient solution that simplifies the data environment. The ITM APP Application team is part of IT for IT Data Services team which is responsible for driving both near-term data to satisfy regulatory requirements while strategically creating the ITM APP.  This position will play a key business systems leadership role and responsible for analyzing, designing, and implementing solutions specific to IT data. Will work directly with Enterprise Core Services (ECS) Data Technology - IT Data Solutions Architecture, Enterprise Information Technology (EIT) Systems Architects, and IT business partners to understand the requirements and partner with the development team to implement high performant database solutions of IT data within the Wells Fargo enterprise. of MS SQL server experience5+ years of SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) experience5+ years of SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) experience3+ years of Tableau experienceDesired As the Senior Business Analyst, you will offer expertise in problem-solving and analysis, process mapping, and reengineering to ensure that best practices are being achieved in process, technology, and organizational design. We will equip you with the best tools in the industry to grow and develop to a level that will exceed your expectations and help you reach the goals you set for yourself, your colleagues, your career, and your customers. Pay, benefits and more. We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan. What you’ll do on a typical day:Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders to elicit detailed business requirements using a variety of techniques to include interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process workflows, value stream mapping, prototypes, storyboards, and user case scenariosDevelop work plans, completion of deliverables, definition of overall approaches, and mobilization efforts for each initiativeProvide subject matter expertise to support business requirement definition, process design, implementation of processes, organizational change, and timing for impacted processes across all work teamsEvaluate business requirements, decompose high-level information into functional requirements, validate that requirements are based on business needs rather than user preferences, reconcile conflicts, and then document the functional requirementsCollaborate with counterparts in Information Technology to define and implement solutions and troubleshoot production issuesWhat you need to succeed at XPO: At a minimum, you’ll need: Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or a related field4 years of applicable work experienceExperience in operation support for Accounting and Financial Shared Service departmentsHands-on experience in implementing or supporting one or more of the following Oracle applications in vR12: General Ledger, Receivables, Payables, Fixed Assets, Oracle Business Intelligence – Financial Analytics, HyperionExperience in Oracle system administration functions, Oracle BI/XML Publisher It’d be great if you also have: Strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to translate business needs into actionable application and operations requirementsAbility to work with a diverse group of work partnersBe part of something big. XPO provides cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies, including Disney, Pepsi, L'Oréal, Toyota and many others. We’re the fastest-growing transportation company on the Fortune 500 list and we’re just getting started.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Our culture fosters trust and partnerships through appreciation, acknowledgement, and inclusion. Here at Berry we are continuously improving to support our mission and exemplify our values of partnerships, excellence, growth and safety. Develop constructive and cooperative working relations with others in a business setting.*Team Work** - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Recognizes accomplishments of other associates. Offers constructive feedback and advice to fellow associates in a tactful manner. Accepts and considers feedback and advice to enhance probability of desired outcomes. Demonstrates group presentation skills; Presents information, ideas, conclusions and abstract concepts effectively.*Problem Solving** - Gathers and analyzes information skillfully and efficiently. Name: Data Analyst
Description: ATR International, Inc. is an IT staffing leader and places a wide range of technical professionals at many of the most innovative companies. Position Information: Requisition#: ATR****** Position title: Data Analyst Location : Charlotte, NC Contact Information : Lisa Lombard : ************** Job Description Provides the highest technical expertise for the planning, analysis, design, implementation, maintenance, and control of the organization's server-class databases. Handles and leads the most complex or critical data/ database management initiatives that typically involve multiple disciplines and multiple business groups, including responsibility for database architecture, design, integration, and/or data modeling. Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: RadixBay is looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst to support our clients that utilize Salesforce. Candidate should have a desire to work in the Information Technology field. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn and grow within the role and RadixBay. This role will be a contract opportunity for a candidate that lives in or near Charlotte, NC. Summary for the Salesforce Business Analyst: The Salesforce Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting client needs as it relates to Salesforce. Candidate will also assist with consulting with current and future clients. The Salesforce Business Analyst responsibilities may include any of the following:Consistently achieve or exceed monthly target(s).The Business Analyst will work with RadixBays customers to understand their unique needs and then customize various technologies to meet business requirementsCreate custom objects, record types, fields, and field dependencies with SalesforceCreate and customize page layouts within SalesforceCreate, configure and maintain custom reports and dashboards with SalesforceDevelop and maintain training materials as they relate to SalesforceThe Salesforce Business Analyst will assist with configuration and implementation of Salesforce.Keep abreast of new features and functionality in order to provide recommendations for process improvements to RadixBays clientsEducation and Skills for the Salesforce Business Analyst:Highly motivated and disciplined self-starter with excellent communication and customer or client support skillsA degree in technology is required.Knowledge of basic SQL based system principlesWorking proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)High attention to detail RadixBay delivers world-class Business IT Consulting and Solutions using a new approach that breaks the outdated and stale IT delivery model. This approach delivers high-touch, high-speed results and is aligned with our goal of creating jobs in rural North Carolina.  The RadixBay team has a proven track record of developing advanced technologies, process innovations, and business transformation programs across a wide range of Fortune 500 clients, high-growth companies, and government entities.  As an Oracle, Microsoft, and Salesforce Partner, RadixBay provides specialized services and solutions for enterprise software products. The company is headquartered in Charlotte, with operations in rural North Carolina.  Job Type: Contract  Salary: $60.00 to $65.00 /hour

Name: Financial Business Analyst
Description: The Sector Controlling Financial Business Analyst has overall responsibility and accountability for using data to inform business and product decisions across the company. Using technical skills, business acumen and creativity, this position is responsible for building tools to automate reporting and generate insight that will allow functions to quickly and accurately see how our key products and customers are performing. This role is involved in projects from inception to delivery, ensuring that the team's financial reporting delivers high-quality and relevant data to intelligently grow our business, and combines business acumen, technology, and innovation to organize data, enable insights and create a more data-driven and efficient finance organization. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with the ability to thrive in environments with multiple cross-functional stakeholders and fast-changing market conditions. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESPartner with finance leadership and their teams to understand needs, ensuring that our data solutions are an excellent fit to their evolving needs.Automate currently manual processes, provide data-rich visualizations to promote accurate decision making throughout the businessWork to identify relevant trends, perform analysis to advise leadership on profitable opportunities throughout the organizationManage and deliver multiple data work streams on an ongoing and ad-hoc basis.Utilize business intelligence tools (SQL, QlikView, Power BI) to automate and standardize financial reporting across the team and broader finance community.Participate in month-end, financial forecasting, and annual operating plans specifically in areas supported by business intelligence analysis and tools such as item level profitability analysisAid and participate in on-going technology implementations and decisions, such as ERP systems, business intelligence tools and databasesWork closely with product line teams to ensure investments and decisions throughout the organization are data-driven. Provide ad-hoc analysis as needed.Contribute to the development of the team's tools, skills, culture, and impact. Minimum Qualification BS Degree in Finance, IT or related field of study required3+ years of relevant work experience in finance, data analysis or associated areaExperience working with database languages/tools (e.g. SQL, Tableau, QlikView, Looker)KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIESSolid understanding of financial reporting, accounting, planning and economics concepts.Ability to manage multiple data sets and translate into financial and/or business insightsExcellent communication skills (both verbal and written)"Can do" spirit with proactive mindsetAbility to adapt and respond quickly to changing market and organizational conditionsStrong analytical, planning, and organizational skillsHighly motivated / Driven / Proactive approach to business needsStrong interpersonal skills with the ability to thrive in a 'matrix' organization with multiple cross-functional stakeholdersUnquestionable business ethics and integrityStructured, operative, pragmatic attitude and approach to tasksSDL2017

In a time when efficiency, speed and the customer experience are paramount to the success of lenders, Mortgage Cadence offers the most reliable software and dedicated people, supporting lenders every step of the way. Each of our products has revolutionized the mortgage lending process in some way, changing the way lenders lend and borrowers finance. As a software company, we think like a start-up, with every employee empowered and encouraged to be visionary. You'll also have opportunities -to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career. Name: Sr Business Control Specialist Risk Analyst
Description: Job Description: Provide analytical support in executing internal control discipline and operational excellence within a LOB/ECF. Gather and organize data in order to monitor and test the effectiveness of key controls and status of mitigation and action plans. Prepare documentation for the tracking, monitoring, and escalation of risk related issues to management. Acts as an ambassador of the risk culture. Incumbents typically have over 5+ years of risk management and/or LOB/ECF experience. May manage staff.  Summary:  The Risk and Finance Technology Risk and Control Team is responsible for advocating a strong risk management culture and discipline to ensure capabilities are in place to drive execution of the firms operational risk management framework. Uses Enterprise and/or CIO specific processes and tools in order to ensure adherence to Enterprise policies and standards for the Risk and Finance Technology teams. This includes monitor and testing of key controls across high risk functions, Issue management, and Audit, Regulatory and SOX exam coordination and support.
