Name: Loan Agency Administration - Analyst
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities.  Business Unit:Portfolio ServicesJob Summary Barings is seeking a seasoned Bank Loan Services professional to work in our Loan Administration and Specialty Operations team. This position will be located in our Charlotte, NC office and reports to the Director of US Data Management. Primary Responsibilities This position is responsible for administration and servicing of managed assets (primarily bank loans and similar products), including but not limited to: Support and monitoring of cash and collateral accounts for which Barings serves as Administrative AgentCoordination of information flow between internal Barings processes and third-party service providers.Pro-active management of client and lender notifications, insuring accurate and timely delivery of informationPreparation, processing and distribution of invoices for fees and receivablesAccurate reconciliation of accounts to insure movement and availability of funds in an acceptable time-frameSupport the set-up and processing of distressed debt restructure transactionsComfortable reviewing and interpreting bank loan related legal documentation to insure proper set-up and maintenance of serviced assetsExperience with rating agency terminologyQualifications4 years’ experience in loan administration and servicing, preferably in Agency ServicesMinimum of Bachelor’s Degree requiredAbility to multi-task and handle shifting prioritiesExcellent attention to detailStrong verbal and written communication skillsCan-do attitude; resilient with the ability to remain calm when under pressureTakes ownership and responsibility for tasksHighly organizedDemonstrated initiative in solving internal and external customer problems Barings is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; Minority/Female/Age/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply.

Name: Investment Reconciliation Analysts
Description: Private Wealth Systems is seeking a highly motivated and detail oriented Investment Analyst to join our growing operations team. The operations team is responsible for completing daily transaction-level and account-level reconciliation across multiple custodians and multiple asset classes on behalf of our clients. You will be part of the team that is reinventing and redefining investment reporting for the 13.7 million high net worth individuals and their advisors who manage $52.6 trillion in private wealth. You will help bring transparency to an opaque industry and enable smarter, more engaged communications and interactions between sophisticated investors and their advisors so they can manage their wealth with greater personalized purpose. Make no mistake, what you do matters, which is why we want and need the best and brightest individuals who want to make a difference. Come join the best team in financial technology!RequirementsAssociates Degree in a finance, accounting or related field; BA/BS/MS preferredAt least 2 years of experience in Finance or Back Office Operations functions (preferably securities services or securities/trade reconciliation)Familiar with investment terminology, financial instruments, market practices and reporting of financial dataAbility to communicate professionally and effectively with clients, vendors, team members and managementAbility to comprehend business processes and workflowsStrong understanding of Microsoft Office applicationsAbility to work both collaboratively and independentlyStrong problem-solving skillsRigorous attention to detailStrong adherence to project goals, tasks and timelinesAbility to take ownership of a task and see it through from inception to completionHighly self-motivated and able to work under pressureAbility to maintain strict confidentiality of critical Company, Client and Employee informationDemonstrated knowledge of and support for company mission, vision, value statements,standards, policies and procedures, operating instructions, confidentiality standards, the employee handbook and code of conduct, including required ethical behavior.ResponsibilitiesCompleting daily transaction level reconciliation of client accountsProcessing daily activity files received from data providers and managing exceptionsTrouble-shooting complex exceptions and working with team lead to resolveManually updating transactional data inputs for automated processingAssessing data input against requirements and taking appropriate action to augment when requiredIdentifying process and technology improvement opportunitiesThe ideal candidate will have an interest in both technology, investment accounting, and investment reporting as well as a desire to work in a fast-paced exciting environment.Private Wealth Systems is the industry defining financial technology company that is revolutionizing the way private wealth is analyzed, reported, and managed by the 13.7 million high net worth investors, and their advisors, who control $52.6 trillion in global private wealth. Founded by pioneers of the consolidated investment reporting industry, Private Wealth Systems provides a total wealth dashboard with transaction-level-transparency so investors and their advisors have instant access and understanding of the drivers of risk and return across all of their investments, regardless of complexity, asset class, or entity structure. The company’s multi-asset, multi-custodial, multi-currency performance reporting platform provides account aggregation, data normalization, performance calculation, and client reporting that transcends all levels of wealth. Unlike any investment reporting system today Private Wealth Systems is purpose built to support the highest levels of financial complexity – supporting all asset classes, all custodians, all managers and sub-managers, all currencies, and all complex ownership structures – but scale to transcend all levels of wealth – providing the precision of a family office solution with the performance of an enterprise banking platform. A simple touch on your mobile device and you have absolute control and oversight over your entire wealth with reporting that is as personalized as you are. Experience the power of reporting precision. ONE TOUCH > TOTAL CONTROL

Name: Senior System Analyst
Description: We seek Senior System Analyst to work under limited supervision, applying strong technical skills and experience to implement, support, and improve mortgage technology. This role is for Ally Bank Mortgage Technology team who has strong exposure to Mortgage Applications, Production Support & Mortgage Business Processes. This Technology role will be critical for Ally to unfold and expand Allys Mortgage Technology portfolio capabilities to support Ally 2.0 roadmap which is a major initiative in 2017  Job Responsibilities  Alan Kings SBO2000 application support:  Upgrade, enhance and automate the features of SBO2000 application.  Deploy and maintain SBO2000 application code updates.  Develop and maintain the Oracle Packages/Procedures/Functions.  Develop SSIS packages to enhance SBO2000 application functions.  Create Windows Visual Basic and Unix batch scripts.  Demonstrate proficiency in creating and maintaining Control M Jobs.  Perform administration functions in SBO2000 application.  Create & Maintain SBO 2000 custom programs, codes, menu Items, import/export of files.  Creating custom business reports using SBO2000 knowledge & SSIS.  Proficient at SBO2000, Oracle, and SSIS triaging including work-around identification.  Full understanding of Star and Snowflake database schema.  SAP Business Objects (BO):  Develop SAP Business Objects Intelligence Platform.  Develop business objects in accordance to clients needs and requirements.  Develop report prototypes, review and fine tune report deliverables with business.  Creating Universe from various databases using Star and Snowflake database schemas.  Creating freehand-SQL and Queries over the BO Universe.  Creating Complex reports, dashboards providing a consolidated view for mortgage business.  Experience working on BO context, derived tables, and drills.  Proficient in BO trap handling, (Chasm Trap, Fan Trap).  Experience with BO Web Intelligence Rich Client, Universe Design Tool, and Information Design Tool.  SharePoint:  Demonstrated ability to adopt existing SharePoint application and implementing enhancements such as user interface, automation, and workflows.  Create new SharePoint sites using SharePoint Designer.  Create new SharePoint forms using InfoPath.  Create workflow and custom actions to automate processes based on business needs.  Demonstrate proficiency in SharePoint administrative tasks.  Salesforce:  Support and troubleshoot applications in Salesforce.  Perform administrative tasks and security maintenance.  Understanding account, contact, lead, opportunities, complaints, APEX, SOQL, validations, and workflow objects.  Creating reports and dashboards based on the business needs.  Visionet:  Experience with Visionet Loan Review configuration including, OCR (optical character recognition), workflows, business rules, templates, document and field mapping, text fields, and event viewers.  Perform administration tasks.  Demonstrated proficiency in creating complex business rules and workflows.  Data Analysis:  Triage complex data issues with multiple data sources in a variety of data formats.  Perform Root cause analysis of complex data issues, providing workarounds, and assisting the business and development teams to determine long term solution.  Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.  Work on data quality initiatives to help reduce data errors encountered and work with development to enhance data validation rules.  Ensure mortgage loan images and data are stored correctly in the mortgage image & data repositories.  Create and enhance data mapping documents for mortgage applications.  Create various reports for business partners to determine the health and quality of the data by using enhanced, complex database queries.  Automate operationalized data reports using the SSIS and SSRS and SAP BO.  Create the monthly operations report and dashboard for business to see the data and issues reported.  Support:  Proficient with in disaster recovery planning and execution.  Proficient with automated monitoring using UNIX Batch Script & Visual Basic script.  Proficient in change and incident management and leading triage meetings. ServiceNow tool is a plus.  Monitoring / Automation skills a plus (Splunk, AppDynamics, ScienceLogic, TeaLeaf, UFT, Selenium).  Exposure to practice of application scans, tracking vulnerabilities, security issues and reporting the updates with appropriate risks highlighted.  Experience in managing 24/7 support functions and teams working in an Onshore / Offshore model.  General:  Demonstrated experience in working both development and maintenance environment.  Exhibit excellent verbal and written communications in all aspects of the production support role.  Have good experience in building strong relationship with the business partners and other application partners.  Work independently and may supervise the work of lower level personnel.  Experience in preparing weekly reports and presentations highlighting daily, weekly, and monthly operational progress to CIOs and other leaders in the organization.  Flexibility to stretch work hours to meet business & technology needs and expectations.  Proactive and analytical thinker who can optimize or enhance the current process model to introduce more efficiencies.  Qualifications  Minimum of 10 years in a technical IT specialty, preferably in the financial services industry  Expertise in SBO2000 application deployment and building the internal tools to support SBO2000 application.  Expertise in developing Dashboards, Reports in SAP Business Objects.  Expertise in complex Web Intelligence/universe reporting including multiple data providers, merging of data providers, row level security, derived tables etc.  Ability to create Web Intelligence reports with universes and directly against databases.  Strong hands-on experience with BO 4.1x and more, 4.2x preferred  Expertise in developing SharePoint Sites, Lists, Workflows.  Experience with SharePoint Designer, InfoPath, Web Parts, SharePoint add-ins and workflow creation.  Experience in supporting and troubleshooting applications in salesforce.  Experience working with OCR technology. Visionet is a plus.  Extensive experience working in SSIS, SSRS, .Net, Batch Script, Java Script, UNIX.  Expert knowledge of Oracle database.  Should have extensive experience working with Schedulers like Control M, Autosys  Should have extensive experience working in Loan Origination, Servicing and BULK channels.  Should have extensive knowledge on HMDA, CRA, OFAC, 14M regulator reporting.  Should have expert knowledge on Excel, Access.  Knowledge of Snowflake and Star Schemas.  Knowledge on Java, SPLUNK, TEALEAF is a plus.  Expertise in Data Quality control  Experience working as Business Analyst, Developer and Support.  Experience as Business Analyst.  Ability to thoroughly understand the business issues surrounding each Mortgage Application  Ability to utilize extensive trouble shooting skills for addressing Production issue and to act as primary liaison who will be the primary interface between IT, Business, Vendors and other partner teams  Ability to lead onshore and offshore team  Experience managing financial applications from both Technology & Business aspects to meet Mortgage Application needs  Bachelor Degree or the equivalent combination of education.  Should have 8+ years of experience in data analysis, data mapping  Excellent communication skills  Good relationship management skills  Flexibility and adaptability in the face of changing priorities  Ability to evaluate and manage risk  Ability to manage several unrelated efforts simultaneously  Teamwork oriented  Demonstrated perspective and good judgment  Willingness to assume responsibility and ownership; accountability  Personal initiative and strong personal work ethic  Ability to work independently  Professional poise and presence  Occasional after hours and weekend work required

Name: Vulnerability Analyst
Description: Where good people build rewarding careers.  Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.  Job Summary  The Vulnerability Management Analyst will ensure continuous vulnerability lifecycle management within the Allstate environment including monitoring, collection, reporting, and assessment of impact for vulnerability related data from vendors and internal sources. This candidate must form strong partnerships with technical teams and provide strategy and prioritization to control vulnerabilities in the environment in a timely and effective manner.  Job Responsibilities Perform as a vulnerability management SME in one or more of the following areas: Microsoft platform (Server, workstation, applications), Open Systems platforms (Linux, UNIX, VM Ware ESX), Java, Adobe, Web Application, Java web app virtualization platforms (e.g. WebSphere), Networking, Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, IMS), and others.Have the ability to understand and develop enterprise policy and technical standards with specific regard to vulnerability management and secure configuration.Be able to successfully partner with other security and IT professionals to assess potential impact from vulnerabilities specific to Allstate's environment, and determine and implement mitigating controls.Identify and recommend appropriate measures to manage and remediate vulnerabilities and reduce potential impacts on information resources to a level acceptable to the senior management of the company.Build strong partnerships with technical teams to promote best practices for managing vulnerabilities in an agile manner and within cloud solutions.Ability to fully understand business requirements and work with them to define appropriate solutions security objectives while meeting the business need.Be a champion for vulnerability management and information security including broadening awareness and use of the team's services, education of security best practices and integration with other business areas.Providing mentorship and support to teammates with regard to vulnerability assessment, communication/rapport with other divisions and various levels of leadership, technical expertise, and career development.Develop and improve KPIs, metrics, and trending for vulnerability management functions.Participate and lead new projects as needed.Other duties as assigned. Job Qualifications Bachelors and/or Masters Degree or equivalent experience in Information Security, Engineering, Computers Science, or related field3-5+ years experience in either vulnerability management or related information security fieldFamiliar with industry standard security best practices and vulnerability management processes including compliance reportingAdvanced experience with vulnerability scanning tools (Qualys preferred) and other vulnerability management tools.Demonstrate knowledge of IT security best practices including operating systems(Windows, Unix, Linux), end-user application, and network securityDemonstrate knowledge of networking concepts and devices (Firewalls, Routers, Switches, Load Balancers, etc)Excellent analytical and problem solving skillsDemonstrated ability to participate in cross functional teams, including offsite, remote and offshore resourcesExperience working in very large enterprise environment with diverse teams.Effective written, verbal communication skills. Ability to tailor communication style to audience at handAbility to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical resourcesStrong organizational skillsSelf-directed, works with minimal guidance, and recognizes when guidance neededDemonstrated ability to stay abreast securing evolving technology such as cloud and mobile computing.Knowledge of PCI, HIPAA, ISO, NIST, and IT ControlsCISSP, GCIH, GPEN, or other industry certification or expected completion of certification within 1 year of hire. The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.  Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands.  As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary - but that's just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you'll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.  Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.  Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.  Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component.  For jobs in San Francisco, please click 'here' for information regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  For jobs in Los Angeles, please click 'here' for information regarding the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.  It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.  Apply on Company Website  Job ID: US*1743_******  For your privacy and protection, when applying to a job online, never give your social security number to a prospective employer, provide credit card or bank account information, or perform any sort of monetary transaction. Learn more.  Allstate Insurance Company  The Allstate Corporation is the largest publicly held personal lines property and casualty insurer in America, serving more than 16 million households nationwide. Founded in 1931, Allstate has been dedicated to protecting our customers from life's uncertainties and preparing them for the future for more than 85 years. Allstate became a publicly traded company in 1993, and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the trading symbol ALL. As of year-end 2015, Allstate had nearly $104.7 billion in total assets. Name: Sr. Business Analyst 1
Description: Requisition id: 18182  Additional Location(s): None  Sealed Air Corporation is a knowledge-based company focused on packaging solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals in the face of today's biggest social and environmental challenges. Our portfolio of widely recognized brands, including Cryovac® brand food packaging solutions and Bubble Wrap® brand cushioning, enable a safer and less wasteful food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.5 billion in sales in 2017 and has approximately 15,000 employees who serve customers in 122 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com. Job Description The IT organization of Sealed Air Corporation is responsible for the life cycle planning of business applications through selection, operation, refresh, migration, optimization, retirement and disposal.  The Sr. Business Analyst builds/configures, maintains/enhances, and eventually decommissions relevant Procure to Pay applications through that life cycle. This position will mainly focus on SAP MM, including Purchasing and Inventory Management. This position requires a deep technical and comprehensive business process understanding of manufacturing environments. The position reports directly to the Executive Director of Supply Chain and will be based at our headquarters in Charlotte, NC.  Job Description Cont. Work with Executive Director of Supply Chain and other IT leaders to understand and support the IT and Business strategies and offer innovative suggestions to improve processes.Form a strong bond with the Global Supply Chain Business Partner group within IT and with the supply chain business leaders and key users in order to facilitate idea generation and delivery of solutions.Develop and enhance methodologies and practices for the application lifecycle management in line with best practice and practical experience of continuous improvement.Ensure that applications processes (including those of external service providers) are conducted in line with corporate social responsibility, environmental and technical policies and applicable standards and legislation.Partner with our managed services provider to insure their employees are properly trained in order to support our business. Be responsible for making sure that proper documentation exists to support our business processes.Oversee the successful delivery of key projects, with an Agile mentality.QualificationsDeep experience in SAP MM in areas such as Purchasing, Inventory Management and MRP.Solid multi-year experience in integrations to Accounts Payable. Experience with systems such as Readsoft and Perceptive a plus.Experience APO, especially in Demand Planning but preferably also Supply Network Planning, PPDS and/or Integrated Business Planning is a nice to have.Additional experience with Production Planning, Plant Maintenance, QM and/or MES Systems looked upon favorably.Strong verbal and written communication skills.University educated (at least BA/ BS) or 15 year of experience in diverse professional roles.Can work effectively with remote teamsWilling to travel 20% time.ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:Able to understand complex issues & can clearly articulate complex ideasExcellent project management, organization, attention to detail, follow-up, with certification a plusStrong analytical abilities to identify issues & self-start programs to addressAbility to communicate & liaise broadly across functions & the global organizationDeadline & detail orientedDemonstrated ability to champion change, influence & drive results in a complex organizationA mind toward innovation in an organization that allows IT to innovate, drive change, and bring revenue to the organization. Requisition id: 18182  Additional Location(s): None  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Senior Systems Analyst - Dashboard Reporting to join our team in Charlotte, North Carolina (US-NC), United States (US).(To qualify must be a US Citizen, Permanent Resident, and located in Waltham, MA)Responsibilities:* Supports the Project/Program Manager in development of plans and high level schedule* Adapts quickly to moving targets and changes in requirements* Provide consultation, recommendations and assistance to stakeholder on data matters.* Investigate, evaluate and support prioritization of client requests for new or existing solutionsQuality Management:* Plans testing tasks and creates test plans and test cases following the methodology defined and using prescribed testing tools* Conducts Integration Testing and ensures testing is compliant with the approved integration test plan and expected results* Monitors overall test execution and manage contingency planning for test plan variances * Responsible for defect reporting and tracking; including collaboration on defect resolutions with developers/partners and identification of retest requirements * Participates in Code Reviews to ensures code is compliant with recommended practicesSystems/Data Analysis and Design:* Analyze/interpret data requirements and perform current/target/gap/impact analyses* Collaborates with other technology and development staff to provide solution alternatives that ensure key deliverables are achieved * Prepare documents such as expected benefits, gap analysis, use cases, models, current and proposes process, workflows, data flows, implementation plans and end user guides in accordance with standards and methodologies* Documents the technical requirements, design, and testing information to ensure quality output that meets stated and implied business needs * Interacts with various development groups within and outside the dashboard team to understand system dependencies and recommend solution alternatives that ensure key deliverables are achieved* Assist in driving digital metrics delivery for the Digital OrganizationDesired Skills:* 5-10 years of systems analysis, data analysis, data visualization, agile project management* Knowledge of various software development methodologies and the corresponding processes, activities, decisions and deliverables (iterative/adaptive; agile/xp/scrum; waterfall, etc.)* Advanced understanding of the software development process including analysis, design, coding, system and user testing, problem resolution and planning.* Experience with data aggregation, data visualization, business intelligence and data analytics a plus. Name: Accessibility Analyst
Description: Accessibility Analyst Summary: Signature Consultants is seeking an Accessibility Analyst for an opportunity in Charlotte, NC. The Accessibility Analyst is responsible for the implementation of initiatives that ensure products and services are accessible to people with disabilities for Digital Client platforms. He or she will be responsible for working with product teams to help identify and scope accessibility features. This role will work directly with the Accessibility team to maintain support standards for accessibility and digital content compliance. Responsibilities: Oversee accessibility review of web content, mobile apps and digital assets Implement accessibility process controls to ensure compliance Work closely with multiple development and product management teams to ensure accessibility is part of the entire development cycle Requirements: 3-5+ years of accessibility experience, prefer in a corporate environment Must have WCAG 2.0, and/or Section 508 experience Experience as a Senior hands on member of the team Knowledge of ARIA, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript Will need to understand coding 3 plus years of experience in quality research or analytical field, software and product testing, process improvement, business of financial analysis 3 plus years of experience in a primary role related to accessibility compliance, leading accessibility testing and validation efforts Strong communication skills, verbal and written Significant experience performing accessibility audits on web applications, iOS apps, Android apps AND providing solutions to developers Significant experience with various Assistive Technologies including JAWS, VoiceOver, TalkBack, automated code checking tools like WAVE, AMP, or Axe, and low vision settings Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience Preferred Skills: Passion for making websites and applications accessible to all users This position will be a busy one. Self-drive and a desire to work hard, cranking through a backlog and keeping up with multiple fast-paced teams is required Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills Thorough, methodical, problem solver and creative with extreme attention to detail Expert at time management as well as working & finding answers to questions independently About Signature Consultants, LLC Headquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Signature Consultants was established in 1997 with a singular focus: to provide clients and consultants with superior staffing solutions. For the eighth consecutive year, Signature was voted as one of the "Best Staffing Firms to Work For" and is now the 14th largest IT staffing firm in the United States (source: Staffing Industry Analysts). With 26 locations throughout North America, Signature annually deploys thousands of consultants to support, run, and manage their clients' technology needs. Signature offers IT staffing, consulting, managed solutions, and direct placement services. For more information on the company, please visit www.sigconsult.com. - provided by DiceAccessibility Analyst

Name: Sr. Business Analyst--D2B
Description: Requisition id: 18181  Additional Location(s): None  Sealed Air Corporation is a knowledge-based company focused on packaging solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals in the face of today's biggest social and environmental challenges. Our portfolio of widely recognized brands, including Cryovac® brand food packaging solutions and Bubble Wrap® brand cushioning, enable a safer and less wasteful food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.5 billion in sales in 2017 and has approximately 15,000 employees who serve customers in 122 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com. Job Description The IT organization of Sealed Air Corporation is responsible for the life cycle planning of business applications through selection, operation, refresh, migration, optimization, retirement and disposal.  The Sr. Business Analyst builds/configures, maintains/enhances, and eventually decommissions relevant Demand to Build applications through that life cycle. Manufacturing (with a focus on MES/Smart Factory), Scheduling, Plant Maintenance and Inventory Management. This position requires a deep technical and comprehensive business process understanding of manufacturing environments with a focus on Manufacturing Execution Systems and Smart Factory innovations related to scanning, printing, data collection and predictive analysis.  This position will also have responsibility for R&D applications and associated contracts. A background in engineering or related R&D role preferred but not mandatory. Experience with PLM applications and implementations a plus.  The position reports directly to the Executive Director of Supply Chain and will be based at our headquarters in Charlotte, NC.  Job Description Cont. Work with Executive Director of Supply Chain and other IT leaders to understand and support the IT and Business strategies and offer innovative suggestions to improve processes.Form a strong bond with the Global Supply Chain Business and R&D Partnership groups within IT and with the supply chain and R&D business leaders and key users in order to facilitate idea generation and delivery of solutions.Develop and enhance methodologies and practices for the application lifecycle management in line with best practice and practical experience of continuous improvement.Ensure that applications processes (including those of external service providers) are conducted in line with corporate social responsibility, environmental and technical policies and applicable standards and legislation.Partner with our managed services provider to insure their employees are properly trained in order to support our business. Be responsible for making sure that proper documentation exists to support our business processes.Oversee the successful delivery of key projects, such as the multi-year initiative to deploy Smart Factory functionality in 60+ manufacturing facilities.QualificationsREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Work with Executive Director of Supply Chain and other IT leaders to understand and support the IT and Business strategies and offer innovative suggestions to improve processes.Form a strong bond with the Global Supply Chain Business and R&D Partnership groups within IT and with the supply chain and R&D business leaders and key users in order to facilitate idea generation and delivery of solutions.Develop and enhance methodologies and practices for the application lifecycle management in line with best practice and practical experience of continuous improvement.Ensure that applications processes (including those of external service providers) are conducted in line with corporate social responsibility, environmental and technical policies and applicable standards and legislation.Partner with our managed services provider to insure their employees are properly trained in order to support our business. Be responsible for making sure that proper documentation exists to support our business processes.Oversee the successful delivery of key projects, such as the multi-year initiative to deploy Smart Factory functionality in 60+ manufacturing facilities.ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:Able to understand complex issues & can clearly articulate complex ideasExcellent project management, organization, attention to detail, follow-upStrong analytical abilities to identify issues & self-start programs to addressAbility to communicate & liaise broadly across functions & the global organizationDeadline & detail orientedDemonstrated ability to champion change, influence & drive results in a complex organizationA mind toward innovation in an organization that allows IT to innovate, drive change, and bring revenue to the organization. Requisition id: 18181  Additional Location(s): None  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. Sealed Air participates in the E-Verify Program (US sites only). Name: Test Analyst III
Description: Job Title: Test Analyst 143199 Duration: 12 Month Contract with chance for extension (W2 USC/Greencard/EAD ONLY - no C2C allowed) Location: Charlotte, NC - Must sit on-site Pay: Negotiable To apply: Please email your resume in Word Format to Erica Johnson at and reference Job Order: 143199 or Click the Apply Button.  Strategic Staffing Solutions (S3) seeks a Test Analyst for a long term contract at one of the nation's top energy corporations. This position requires that the selected candidate be located in Charlotte, NC. Review requirements and identify areas to be tested. Develop test scenarios, test cases, and test scripts.Define, collect, and document data for testing. Identify, log and review defects.Maintain and retire test cases and test scripts at the end of the work effort.Maintain traceability between test cases/scripts and requirements.Ensure that all testing results are easily accessible.Ensure that the team follows the testing standards, guidelines, and testing methodology as specified in the testing approach.Review test, validation, and pilot results with Test Lead to ensure that they meet the entry and exit criteria.Create framework components and reusable functions for automation and performance testing.Build user documents and script maintenance instructions for automation and performance testing scripts.5-10 years of experience$$ WE OFFER A REFERRAL FEE FOR ANYONE REFERRED & HIRED WITH S3! $$ Strategic Staffing Solutions (S3), based in Detroit, Michigan, prides itself on being an international, woman-owned, $260 million IT and Business Services Corporation. We are ranked 16th among the largest staffing firms in the US by Staffing Industry Report and are one of five companies nationally certified as a Charter Partner with Staffing Industry Analysts. S3 provides IT consulting, customized project solutions, vendor management programs and executive search services to financial institutions, insurance, energy, oil/gas, telecommunication, government, retail and health care industries worldwide. We have more than 2,700 consultants and 31 offices in the US and Europe.S3 is also proud to be nationally recognized as both a Military Friendly and Military Spouse Friendly Employer.  As an S3 employee, you're eligible for a full benefits package which may include: Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, 401(k) Plan, Vacation Package, Life & Disability Insurance Plans, Flexible Spending Accounts, and Tuition Reimbursement.  The global mission of S3 is to build trusting relationships and deliver solutions that positively impact our customers, our consultants, and our communities. The four pillars of our company are to: Set the bar high for what a company should do, Create jobs, Offer people an opportunity to succeed and change their station in life, and improve the communities where we live and work through volunteering and charitable giving. CA-EJ

Name: Red Classic - Business Systems Analyst III
Description: Red Classic - Business Systems AnalystOVERVIEW: Red Classic is a subsidiary of Coca-Cola Bottling Co. Consolidated—one of the most recognized brands in history—our objective is to deliver the finest service available in truck load and less than truckload transportation, dedicated contract carriage, transportation management, freight brokerage and maintenance services nationwide.  The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) is the technical subject matter expert (SME) that assists the business to achieve maximum utilization of the applications’ capabilities WORK EXPERIENCE:Coordinates and/or participates in application implementations and upgrades.BSA 3 - Leads highly complex projects as assigned.Identifies user requirements and works with the business to translate them into functional specifications supporting overall business strategies with an emphasis on leveraging delivered functionality with little to no customization. Guides design to meet standards and controls while ensuring ease of use. Helps design and configure systems to ensure smooth and accurate flow of data.Develops test plans and scripts in cooperation with the business. Performs integration and system testing to ensure application requirements are successfully met. Assists with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and logging and resolving testing issues.Develops user documentation in cooperation with the business which includes workflows and procedures. Provides training to business “super users”.Provides functional/technical support to the business identifying, evaluating, researching, resolving, and/or escalating user issues. Assists in the prioritization of business requests and ensures timely resolution of assigned service tickets.Other duties as assigned.RESPONSIBILITIES:BSA 3 – 5+ years of functional/technical experience supporting applicationsRelevant experience in the transportation industry preferredStrong experience in systems development life cycle (SDLC) specifically testing and project managementAbility to manage multiple tasks and priorities concurrently and meet deadlinesStrong written and verbal communicationsPractical application ability with Microsoft Office, Project, and VisioRed Classic is an equal employment opportunity employer.

Name: Organizational Risk Analyst
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities. Business Unit: Enterprise/Operational Risk  Job Summary  Barings and its subsidiaries serve institutional investors around the globe and have over $305+ billion. Through proprietary research, analysis and a focus on investment fundamentals, the firm develops products and strategies that leverage its broad expertise in global fixed income, equities, alternatives, structured products, debt financing for corporations and debt and equity financing for commercial real estate. The firm maintains a strong global footprint with operations on four continents, and with major offices in Charlotte, Springfield, Boston, New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, London, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Sydney and Melbourne. Barings is a member of the MassMutual Financial Group.  Barings Organizational Risk Management Department is seeking an Analyst to work with associates across the firm to develop and produce operational risk assessments and help facilitate the successful execution of audit-related activities. The assessments involve analyzing risks and controls and recommending process and control improvements to strengthen and harmonize Barings' control structure environment. The Analyst will support the oversight of ongoing firm-wide audits while promoting effective relationships with both external and internal key stakeholders.  This position will be located in the Charlotte, NC office. Name: Cloud Business Analyst (BSC5)
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members.  As a Cloud Business Analyst (Business Systems Consultant 5) with the Cloud Foundry Engineering organization, you will be integral in efforts focused on driving internal adoption of the Pivotal Cloud Foundry platform offering. As a member of the team, you are responsible for assisting in defining and executing a product roadmap that expands and matures our platform solution by enabling more business units to deploy applications to the cloud.  This role is inherently cross-functional: you will work closely with the Technical Product Manager/Business Analyst; as well as the engineering, operations, application development, finance, and executive teams to set strategy, launch features, and grow business opportunities for Wells Fargo. This role is a member of a highly visible team that requires you to partner with a variety of leaders and teams across Wells Fargo and engage with leadership at customer organizations and third-party vendors.  The Cloud Business Analyst (Business Systems Consultant 5) is expected to: Perform business analysis/business systems consultant responsibilities while learning technical product management and project management responsibilities for Cloud Foundry Engineering; participating in the Agile functions for the PaaS teamsBuild relationships and collaborate with highly skilled Engineers (Cloud, Systems, Security), as well as with the Technical Product Owner/Business Analyst and business partners to ensure planning, strategy and execution of solutions align with requirements, compliance and bank standards.Partner in execution of the product strategy for driving PCF adoption within key verticals and use cases, including defining and delivering new features and services.Develop crisp, detailed business requirements, documentation, and other project deliverables that can be used to create development specifications and architecture for platforms and applications.Possess the ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage tradeoffs, and evaluate new ideas and opportunities with internal and external partners.Partner with Wells Fargos solution architecture, security, and application development organizations to define and drive go-to-market activities.Proactively identify and resolve issues that may impair the teams ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals.Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions.High attention to detail, including precise and effective customer communications and a proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously. Successful candidates are strong technical leaders who have demonstrated: Technical breadth and depth with platforms, including experience working with IaaS/PaaS, web services, or back-end application infrastructure.Experience driving focus and quality within strong, talented, cross-functional teams to deliver technical products and projects in a fast-paced environment.Strong track record of defining multi-year product strategies, executing on associated roadmaps, and consistent delivery of results.Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage tradeoffs, and evaluate new ideas and opportunities with internal and external partners.Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions.High attention to detail, including precise and effective customer communications and a proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.Required Qualifications7+ years of business systems analysis experience, business systems design experience, or a combination of both2+ years of data analysis experience2+ years of Agile experience7+ years of experience capturing and documenting complex business and functional requirements1+ years of experience with Cloud technologies5+ years of relationship management experience with business and technology partnersDesired QualificationsExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to articulate complex concepts in a clear mannerAbility to negotiate, influence, and collaborate to build successful relationshipsIntermediate Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint) skillsStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyOther Desired Qualifications3+ years of knowledge and understanding and/or experience with IT concepts including any of the following: Cloud services and platforms (Pivotal Cloud Foundry, AWS, GCP, Azure), VMware, PaaS, IaaS, SaaS, Security IT principles1+ years of relationship management experience within Cloud servicesAbility and desire to learn new concepts and skillsDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Sr Finance Analyst- Deposit Finance Analytics and Reporting
Description: Job Description: Sr. Finance Analyst (SFA) role within the Consumer Deposits team under the broader Consumer/GWIM Finance organization. This role involves providing business case support involving various deposit products and supporting the debit card product.  Key responsibilities for this role include: Planning & Forecasting (Debit Card Product); Business partnering; Providing business case support; Ad hoc analysis and Initiative tracking. Successful candidates will have an opportunity to develop the following skills: Financial acumen, attention to detail, communicating with impact (written & verbal),  In regards to business case support, this will consist of partnering with the line of business, providing financial sizing and clearly communicating the economic impacts. Strong analytical skills and partnership skills will be needed to build out the business cases. This will lead to developing a broad knowledge of deposit products and developing relationships across finance/business.  This role will also be focused on forecasting, stress test modeling and analysis of the debit card product. This includes understanding the drivers/metrics behind the debit card product and developing knowledge of debit interchange rules. Responsibilities include forecasting and stress test modeling, which will involve understanding the various macroeconomic impacts of the debit card product. Required SkillsBachelor's degree (accounting or finance strongly preferred)5+ years of accounting or financial analysis work experienceStrong communication, organization, presentation, analytical and leadership skillsAnalytical Abilities / Financial Acumen - Systematic application of a combination of inductive and deductive reasoning to examine information, interpret results and arrive at well-founded logical conclusions.Builds Partnerships - Builds broad-based business relationships across the organization. Skillfully influences peers and colleagues to promote and sell ideas. Proactively surfaces and resolves conflict with minimal noise.Advanced excel skillsStrong business acumenShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: Are you a problem solver? Do you love data and reporting? Are you passionate about innovative solutions and have a focus on how to make things, Better, Faster and Simpler? If so, this may be the perfect job for you.  CTE is seeking a dynamic and career-minded individual that can manage the HRIS function for a fast-growing and progressive company. We offer a strong family-oriented culture where individuals and teams are rewarded for strong performance. This individual will interface with all business units and will enable our Company to be more efficient and data-driven.  The primary focus of this position is the support and maintenance of the Human Resource Management System (HRMS) in addition to other systems supported by the Human Resources team. This individual serves as a technical point-of-contact for assigned functional areas and assists with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. The HRIS Analyst also supports HRMS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Manage the review, testing, and implementation of HRMS system upgrades or patches independently or with technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade/fix.Maintain data integrity in HRMS systems by running queries and analyzing data.Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions or alternate methods with HRMS systems, policy changes and/or major variations from established policy that must be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementation. Serve as a key liaison with third parties and other stakeholders (e.g. payroll).Write, maintain, and support a variety of reports utilizing appropriate reporting tools and assist in development of standard reports for ongoing customer needs.Develop HR Dashboard reporting to visually review data, trends and areas of opportunity.Develop user procedures, guidelines, and documentation. Train clients and new system users on new processes/functionality.Maintain awareness of trends in HRMS with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support through classes, reading, CBTs or other mechanisms. Participate in user group meetings/conferences.Leads projects and initiatives aimed at improving operational efficiency, productivity and HR compliance. Identifies creative ways to redesign business processes and/or implement HR technology required to successfully solve business challenges. Provides input on, reviews and approves functional requirements. Ensures business group needs are evaluated and addressed as projects are implemented.Other duties may be assigned on an as needed basis. Education and/or Experience Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field preferredPHR/SPHR certification preferred.3 - 5 years of HRIS or HR generalist or specialist experience system (Ultimate software experience preferred); systems implementation experience.Cognos reporting experience highly preferred.1 - 2 years of project management experience preferred.Effective organizational and interpersonal skills including written and verbal communication skillsDetailed, organized and deadline oriented is a must!Advanced skills of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint), Human Resource Information System (HRIS)Ultimate Software knowledge preferred, strong understanding of HRMS database design, structure, functions, process, and reporting.Job Location: Charlotte, North CarolinaSDL2017

Name: CCAR Model Validation Analyst
Description: Job Description: As part of the Enterprise Scenario Planning and Execution (ESPE) Qualitative Methodology Review team, the candidate will be responsible for the execution of key activities (defined as part of the independent review and challenge framework) relating to the assessment of qualitative forecasting models used to support enterprise scenario analysis.  Key responsibilities for the team include: Working with Lines of Business, Risk Management and Finance to collate a complete inventory of qualitative forecasting approaches employedConducting independent assessments and/or reviews of the modelsDocumenting a clear and detailed review and analysis of assessments - including completion of risk classifications, materiality evaluation and any recommendations / requirements to be incorporated.Completion of periodic reviews across qualitative models used, in order to ensure they remain current to changing market conditions and incorporate any methodology changes required.Effectively engaging with key stakeholders to agree on action plans and follow-up reviews, as required, to facilitate executive approvals.Driving the development of infrastructure, process and procedures to ensure alignment to the independent review and challenge requirements.Identifying areas for improvement and continued enhancement, and implementing solutionsPosition Description: The candidate will be responsible for managing the independent assessment for a portfolio of qualitative models.As part of the assessment process, the candidate will be required to review, interpret and critically assesses the qualitative models and documentation, in order to evidence suitability and compliance with framework requirements.  The position requires interaction within the Lines of Business, Risk Management and Finance to address inquiries related to qualitative model identification, approach and calibration.In addition to validation activities, ongoing interaction with the model owners and developers will further be conducted in order to understand ongoing performance, assess environmental changes and ensure continued suitability for use.The candidate will also support the execution of key group-wide ESPE deliverables, in order to ensure full alignment and extension of processes across enterprise scenario analysis. Required Skills:2-5 years of relevant work experience in banking, finance or public accounting3-5 years of prior stress testing and/or financial analysis experienceBachelors degreeDetail oriented with excellent quantitative analytical skillsStrong interpersonal, written communication and presentation skillsAbility to effectively work under pressure and successfully manage multiple activitiesSelf starter and ability to work high degree of independenceStrong organization and planning abilityDesired Skills:Understanding of BASEL III capital rules, CECL/IFRS 9 and cash-flow modeling experience a plusDegree in in economics, finance or accounting is a plusMBA a plus Enterprise Role Overview:  Responsible for building, consolidating and reporting stress testing results for EST management. Performs complex analysis related to earnings, balance sheet, capital and liquidity as well as associated risk exposures. Provides analytical support for explaining business/forecast strategies in the context of baseline and stress forecasts. Reviews and analyzes trends in stress results to best understand implications both internal and externally. Understands complex interactions between economic and operational factors and their resulting impact to product, business line and financial results & position of the company. Challenges assumptions and results and is comfortable communicating and influencing business partners based on these results. Can quickly build credibility with partners. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion and independent judgment. Requires strong analytical, , influencing and communication skills. Comfortable with a dynamic, fluid work environment with tight deadlines. Experience with risk management, finance and/or accounting preferred. Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Software Configuration Senior Analyst
Description: Job descriptionMortgage Cadence, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Accenture, has been partnering with mortgage lenders since 1999, offering the industry’s only true one-stop shop mortgage technology solutions designed for point-of-sale through post-closing. In a time when efficiency, speed and the customer experience are paramount to the success of lenders, Mortgage Cadence offers the most reliable software and dedicated people, supporting lenders every step of the way. Each of our products has revolutionized the mortgage lending process in some way, changing the way lenders lend and borrowers finance. As a software company, we think like a start-up, with every employee empowered and encouraged to be visionary. Teamwork and innovation define what we do as we take our customers into the future by providing the last lending solution they will ever need.Job Description:Looking for an individual with approximately 3 or more years of work experience who is eager to learn software and  systems analysis in a software development environment. This role is responsible for loan origination system  configuration, business requirement interpretation, database mapping efforts utilizing SQL Management Studio, and  knowledge of process documentation workflow. This position requires hands on configuration of software and  systems and the coordination and problem solving processes to ensure that the business standards and requirements  are met. It would be considered a plus if this individual has experience in VB or C or Mortgage software  experience, but is not required. + Basic qualificationsMinimum of 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Management Studio Minimum of 1 experience in workflow process designMinimum of 1 year experience writing business rules decision logic within a rules engine.Minimum of 1 year experience in writing testing business and functional requirements.Professional skills:Process focused mindset.Results oriented attitude.- Self starter requiring little direction  Desire to make a difference.Proven multi tasking capabilities.Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to prioritize and coordinate multiple projects simultaneously.Creative, outgoing and professional demeanor.Excellent communication skills, both oral and written.Proactive and a team player.- Knowledge of Visual Basic VB , C , LOS Loan Origination System , and Mortgage processing  Experience with Microsoft SQL ServerAll of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You'll also have opportunities -to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is a Federal Contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. Name: Marketing Operations Data Analyst
Description: About Nicus Software Nicus Software is a rapidly-growing software company that provides IT Financial Management (ITFM) solutions to large enterprises and state and local governments, helping world-class IT organizations make informed investment decisions and CIOs tell their IT value story.  Nicus customers include Visa, First Republic Bank, Target, Staples, Choice Hotels, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Louisiana, the State of Colorado, and Fidelity Investments. Position Overview Nicus Software is looking for an experienced data analyst to compile, analyze, report, and interpret data to support key marketing objectives. The Marketing Operations Data Analyst will be responsible for developing, coordinating, executing and tracking marketing and sales performance and KPIs at a functional, channel program, and tactical level. Programs will include webinars, conferences, inbound marketing and website maintenance, email and other programs necessary to support marketing and sales objectives. This position reports to the Director of Marketing. Duties and Responsibilities Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Monitor and maintain data quality within the marketing database, including list creationEvaluate new technologies and add-on applications to improve and optimize marketing team performance and measurementProvide support to Sales team through administration of sales quotes, proposals and reports, general process administration, and carrying out various sales operations functionsUse Hubspot and Salesforce.com to assist with managing leads, accounts, quotes, customers, and processesCompile, analyze, report, and interpret data to support key sales data metricsEngage in data cleansing activities to ensure that sales data is consistent and accurate for management reportingEstablish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices in campaign and lead management reportingCreate and maintain metrics reports on marketing and sales activities and effectiveness and business impactAnalyze marketing and sales data to develop insights and make recommendations on areas for optimization.Qualifications Qualifications include: Bachelors degree or equivalent experience requiredExcellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skillsSalesforce/CRM experience requiredMarketing Automation (i.e. HubSpot) experience requiredAbility to organize, multitask, work independently on several projects and meet deadlines while producing accurate workSkill in defining problems, collecting data and interpreting informationEager to learn new technologies2+ years of experience in marketing operations functionsKnowledge of and passion for marketing concepts, methods and techniquesData-driven, analytical mindsetWorking knowledge and understanding of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, and particularly Excel)This is a Telecommute/Work from Home position. Nicus offers a competitive base salary, bonus, and benefits, including medical, vision and dental as well as a matching retirement plan.

Name: Senior Risk Analyst, Mortgage
Description: As the Sr. Risk Analyst, your data-driven analyses will support strategic business decisions for Allys mortgage origination business and held-for-investment portfolio. You will leverage your experience, knowledge, and expertise to identify emerging risk trends and produce portfolio performance metric. As part of the team, you have a unique perspective on the risks associated with Ally Mortgages product development and offerings. Allys mortgage business is growing, giving you plenty of opportunities to drive strategic/big picture insights with your understanding of consumer trends and risk drivers.  Job Responsibilities  Deliver routine reports and dashboards that present a point-in-time view of the risk profile of Allys consumer mortgage business.  Perform ad-hoc reporting and analytical deep-dives to support a fast-paced, growing mortgage business.  Use data-driven analytics to identify emerging and developing risk trends in the market and Allys portfolio and provide recommendations on risk mitigation strategies.  Partner with Mortgage Technology and Data Governance groups to ensure data issues are documented and appropriately pursued.  Provide support across business lines and functional areas to ensure requests for mortgage risk reporting and analytics are satisfied.  Qualifications  Bachelors degree required, advanced degree in Finance or related field preferred.  5+ years of experience, preferably in Financial Services/Risk Management/Reporting and Analytics.  Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Effective written and verbal communication skills.  Experience in SQL or SAS coding across relational DB environments (e.g., Oracle, MS SQL Server, etc.).  Intermediate to advanced proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel, Word, and Powerpoint applications.  Experience with Business Intelligence reporting tools such as PowerPivot, Tableau, etc.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst-D2B (QM or PM)
Description: Sealed Air Corporation is a knowledge-based company focused on packaging solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals in the face of today’s biggest social and environmental challenges. Our portfolio of widely recognized brands, including Cryovac® brand food packaging solutions and Bubble Wrap® brand cushioning, enable a safer and less wasteful food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.5 billion in sales in 2017 and has approximately 15,000 employees who serve customers in 122 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com.Job Description  The IT organization of Sealed Air Corporation is responsible for the life cycle planning of business applications through selection, operation, refresh, migration, optimization, retirement and disposal.  The Sr. Business Analyst builds/configures, maintains/enhances, and eventually decommissions relevant Demand to Build applications through that life cycle. Manufacturing, Scheduling, Plant Maintenance and Inventory Management. This position requires a deep technical and comprehensive business process understanding of manufacturing environments with a focus on Production Planning and either Quality Management or Plant Maintenance.  The position reports directly to the Executive Director of Supply Chain and will be based at our headquarters in Charlotte, NC or Epernon, France.  Job Description Cont. Work with Executive Director of Supply Chain and other IT leaders to understand and support the IT and Business strategies and offer innovative suggestions to improve processes.Form a strong bond with the Global Supply Chain Business Partnership group within IT and with the supply chain business leaders and key users in order to facilitate idea generation and delivery of solutions.Develop and enhance methodologies and practices for the application lifecycle management in line with best practice and practical experience of continuous improvement.Ensure that applications processes (including those of external service providers) are conducted in line with corporate social responsibility, environmental and technical policies and applicable standards and legislation.Partner with our managed services provider to insure their employees are properly trained in order to support our business. Be responsible for making sure that proper documentation exists to support our business processes.Oversee the successful delivery of key projects, such as the global ERP rollouts. Qualifications REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:8+ years’ in-depth experience in Demand to Build (D2B) domain including but not limited to functions such as discrete and repetitive manufacturing, production planning, scheduling, plant maintenance, Quality Management, etc. with SAP as the platform.Core experience in PP with either QM or PM in order to be responsible for one or the other in our environment.Experience with supporting Inventory Management a plus.Additional experience with Labeling or Finite Scheduling (whether SAP or otherwise) looked upon favorable.Experience with Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) a plusStrong verbal and written communication skills.University educated (at least BA/ BS) or 15 year of experience in diverse professional roles.Can work effectively with remote teamsWilling to travel 15% time.ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: Able to understand complex issues & can clearly articulate complex ideasExcellent project management, organization, attention to detail, follow-upStrong analytical abilities to identify issues & self-start programs to addressAbility to communicate & liaise broadly across functions & the global organizationDeadline & detail orientedDemonstrated ability to champion change, influence & drive results in a complex organizationA mind toward innovation in an organization that allows IT to innovate, drive change, and bring revenue to the organization.Requisition id: 26210 Relocation: [[filter4]]  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. Sealed Air participates in the E-Verify Program (US sites only). Job Segment: Business Analyst, ERP, Quality Manager, Supply, SAP, Finance, Technology, Quality, Operations

Name: Sr. SF Employee Central Business Analyst
Description: Sealed Air Corporation is a knowledge-based company focused on packaging solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals in the face of today’s biggest social and environmental challenges. Our portfolio of widely recognized brands, including Cryovac® brand food packaging solutions and Bubble Wrap® brand cushioning, enable a safer and less wasteful food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.5 billion in sales in 2017 and has approximately 15,000 employees who serve customers in 122 countries. The Hire to Retire (H2R) tower has the specific responsibility for building or configuring, maintaining and enhancing Human Resource, Payroll, and other employee-facing applications through that life cycle.  The candidate will collaborate closely with other team members to provide the full set of functional services and technical services required to implement and support the company’s global Hire to Retire systems. Enterprise technology experience specifically in the areas of SAP SuccessFactors is required. Job Description Cont.
