Name: Analyst I Corporate Finance
Description: Description Citizens Capital Markets is seeking current college seniors to join the teams Corporate Finance & Sponsor Coverage Group. Analysts will work closely with the teams junior and senior professionals in originating and executing debt capital market and M&A transactions primarily for U.S. middle market clients.  Analysts' responsibilities include transaction support (idea generation, financial analysis, industry analysis, client communication), from origination through transaction closing, for multiple concurrent transactions. The Analyst within the Corporate Finance & Sponsor Coverage Group will play a critical role in originating opportunities and coordinating projects interacting directly with senior management, other groups within Citizens, client management teams, private equity firms, and legal counsel. The Analyst will support industry aligned client coverage efforts and working closely with other Analysts and senior professionals in Debt Capital Markets, Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage, and M&A teams to originate and successfully execute a wide variety of transactions, including loan syndications, acquisition finance, high yield bonds, convertibles, and M&A. Key Tasks and Responsibilities of the role include, but are not limited to:Supporting junior and senior team members within the Debt Capital Markets, Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage, and M&A teams to develop and pitch new ideas to help corporate clients and financial sponsors achieve their financial and strategic objectivesPerforming extensive financial modeling and valuation analysis leveraging diligence findings to develop additional modeling scenarios, and present findings for internal approval teamsConducting comprehensive company and industry research, and developing and maintaining thorough industry thought pieces and analyses for presentation to clientsAnalyzing financial model output and client information to prioritize data and present conclusions for discussion purposesPreparing pitch materials for client meetingsParticipating in accounting, business and legal due diligence for both credit approval and underwriting approval processesPreparing detailed transaction marketing materials and management presentations This position offers an excellent opportunity to join a high performing, rapidly growing, and entrepreneurial team within one of the largest regional banks in the country. Citizens Bank has market leading positions in middle market corporate and Sponsor-backed transactions. Analysts will gain insight into the issues and considerations for management teams, Sponsors, and shareholders at growing middle market companies; as well as gain exposure to strategic financial decision making at the highest management levels. Analysts will also develop direct working relationships with current and prospective clients, investment professionals at credit funds, professionals at other banks, and private equity firms. This position is for a two year analyst role, with the option for a third year, as well as assistance with placement for alternative positions within Citizens Bank, private equity firms, or other desired industry positions.  This opportunity carries a competitive salary and a discretionary annual bonus based on individual and firm achievement. QualificationsAbility to function as part of a flat organization, manage several projects at once and work effectively as an individual and as part of multiple teamsExcellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to express ideas in a persuasive, organized, and articulate mannerAbility to follow-up independently and consistently and play the critical role as the project manager on assignmentsDemonstrated aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis with a solid understanding of financial statements, financial modeling and company or industry analysisSelf-starting team player who can think strategically and excel in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, challenging work environmentHigh degree of maturity and integrity with a positive and hardworking attitudeExcellent attention to detailBackground qualifications include:Please note that U.S. Immigration sponsorship or work visa is not available for this position and candidates must have permanent authorization to work in the U.S.Undergraduate candidates with a strong academic record from a leading university and expected graduation date between December 2018 and June 2019. All concentrations considered.Must have a minimum GPA of 3.5 preferredPrior financial services internship experience preferred, but not requiredExperience with related financial services software including S&P Capital IQ, S&P Leveraged Commentary, Advantage Data, Bloomberg, , Thomson Loan Connector, FactSet, etc. a plusHours and Work ScheduleHours per Week: 40+Work Schedule: Monday - FridayWhy Work for UsAt Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.Equal Employment OpportunityIt is the policy of Citizens Bank to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/VeteranCitizens Bank is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective subsidiaries, and Citizens Bank of Pennsylvania.

Name: Investment Specialist - Analyst
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities.  Business Unit:Product Management & DevelopmentJob Summary Barings’ Product Management & Development Team is seeking an Investment Specialist – Analyst to be based in the Charlotte, NC office. The position will support the Barings Funds & Co-Investments team, a platform responsible for constructing, executing and overseeing customized private market portfolios for its clients. Primary ResponsibilitiesBecome involved and support all aspects of Funds & Co-Investments Product Management.Support product managers and investment teams in the development, tracking and closing of opportunities generated by Business Development and Product ManagementReview industry publications for news regarding clients and potential clients as a means to analyze potential market opportunities.Assist in the research of prospects, clients, consultants, competitors and competitive strategies and fundsModel pricing scenarios, return expectations and fee waterfall structures to support product development and negotiationsCoordinate and support the creation of slide decks and materials for roadshows, strategy specific meetings and educational events held by senior leadership, investment personnel, business development team members and product managersMaintain organized and updated files for all past presentations, so that information can be retrieved with easeMaintain and upload to shared website (Seismic) marketing materials for use by leadership, investment personnel, business development team members and product managersAssist in the completion of request for proposals and requests for information generated by prospects, consultants, and clientsFoster strong working relationships with all business disciplines within organization (Business Development, Portfolio Management, Research, Finance, Accounting, Compliance, Legal, etc.)Coordinate with other members of the firm to retrieve quarterly updates for routine aspects of presentation and marketing material templatesSupport the compiling of materials for the weekly product management and senior leadership discussionParticipate in projects as needed under tight time constraintsConduct ad hoc reports and analysis as neededQualifications3 - 5 years’ experience as an investment specialist with an emphasis on product management, private equity industry experience is a plusBachelor’s degree required; a major in finance, accounting or economics is desiredProficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and a strong working knowledge of other Microsoft Office products including WordExperience building and maintaining quantitative models that add scale and efficiency to the businessFoundational knowledge of various private market strategies, including private equity, real assets, real estate and/or private credit is desiredExperience with client relationship management system is required and experience with Salesforce.com is desiredMust be able to work in a collaborative environment with respect to raising and retaining capitalMust possess a high standard of professionalism and integrityHighly organized and able to multi-task in an environment of changeAbility to prioritize, and meet tight timelinesHigh degree of independence, initiative, responsibility and accountabilityMust have excellent oral and written communication, including presentation skillsAbility to work as an integral part of a team that includes other company departments; must be able to work with multiple internal groups at all levelsAbility and willingness to travelMust have strong client service focusAbility to develop strong and effective relationships both internally and externallyWillingness to remain flexible in work schedule Barings is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; Minority/Female/Age/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply.

Name: Time and Attendance Systems Analyst - REMOTE
Description: Job Description When the global aerospace community looks for ideas and solutions to its biggest challenges, they turn to the people of UTC Aerospace Systems. We design, invent and deliver the most advanced and diverse range of aerospace systems on the market. We are inventors. We are manufacturers. We work in space exploration, commercial air travel, defense and rescue applications. Always learning and pushing the boundaries, we are an undisputed industry leader that continually sets the bar higher and higher. Come soar with us.  Do you want to be part of a new, exciting initiative to combine foundational IT with new digital technologies? Our IT team is leading UTC Aerospace Systems to "empower digITal". With this initiative, the team is leveraging technology to make our internal work environment more efficient, productive and seamless. For our customers, we're working to make aircraft more electric, intelligent and integrated. If you're an agile thinker who enjoys utilizing modern technology to make big improvements, then you're a perfect fit for this team. Join UTC Aerospace Systems and help us to empower digITal today!  The Business Analyst position will be part of the Financial Applications team in Digital Technology at UTC Aerospace Systems. You will be responsible for designing and implementing time, attendance and labor tracking solutions across the global organization. You will need to demonstrate a deep knowledge in time, attendance and labor collection processes as well as some software development expertise. You will work with cross-functional teams to ensure government and corporate policies are met and to enable the business to derive meaningful information through labor reporting as it relates to resource allocation and product costing. Principal Responsibilities:Support large projects including implementations, mergers, acquisitions and divestituresWork with cross-functional groups to design solutions and advise project teamsIdentify and deliver system operation improvementsDesign interfaces (improve processes, share data)Report Generation (build and modify reports using either sql or Crystal Reports)Support Information Technology audits focused on business, SOX and Government complianceManage, prioritize and resolve trouble tickets and user requestsAnalyze and troubleshoot software and interface issuesSupport month-end / year-end activity (load holiday calendars/banks, adjust processes based on payroll schedules)Other duties as assigned This position can be 100% REMOTE with some travel.  Employment Type  Full time

Name: Commercial Renewables Contract Analyst
Description: Recruiter Duke Energy  Location Charlotte, North Carolina  Salary Competitive  Posted 12 Nov 2018  Closes 12 Dec 2018  Ref R6541  Sector Power and Nuclear  Category Business and Commercial, Skilled Trades, Sustainability  Contract Type Permanent  Hours Full Time  You need to sign in or create an account to save  More than a career - a chance to make a difference in people's lives.  Build an exciting, rewarding career with us - help us make a difference for millions of people every day. Consider joining the Duke Energy team, where you'll find a friendly work environment, opportunities for growth and development, recognition for your work, and competitive pay and benefits. Position Summary The Commercial Renewables Contract Analyst is responsible for the management and analysis of executed contracts relating to commercial renewables real estate. Such contracts include Leases, Easements, Memoranda, Releases and Assignments. The Contract Analyst will support the Commercial Renewables Development Group regarding landowner leases, review and analyze contracts, draft various real estate related documents, perform contract research for development efforts, work with landowners to research and resolve issues, and work within Landworks, the software tool used for lease contracts. The Commercial Renewables Contract Analysts are also responsible for the tracking and payment of landowner leases and easements as well as the recording of Leases, Easements, Releases and related documents for Commercial Renewables Developers. Responsibilities Contract Management and Analysis(40%) - Facilitates the execution and recording of landowner real estate documents as well as reviews and analyzes executed real estate related contracts/agreements such as Leases, Easements, Releases and Assignments. Manages the set-up of landowners in the CAPS system. Inputs agreement details and moderate/complex payment information into Landworks. Ensures lease terms are met and responds to ad hoc inquiries in regards to executed contracts. Monitors status of contracts and payments for ongoing management of agreement development terms. Manages executed contracts for compliance with development terms and rent adjustments. Researches, validates, and processes Transfer of Ownership requests for existing executed contracts. Supports development efforts for existing contracts. Manages and processes landowner complaints and requests.  Rent Payments (25%) - Ensures development payment dates and amounts are calculated properly and processes all development payments in a timely manner.  Reporting(15%) - Tracks development contracts through the execution and recording phases and provides timely reports to internal stakeholders during meetings and upon request. Provides timely notice of development period expiration dates.  Project Management Support(10%) - Provides ad hoc support on requests from Developers, Legal and others related to executed contracts, agreements and leases. Manages the contract amendment process for development sites that require mass changes to agreements.  Miscellaneous(10%) - Maintains necessary paper files. Performs various administrative duties, as requested. Assists with the documentation of processes and standards related to all development departmental policies and procedures. Assists other team members as needed. Manages special assignments related to development agreements, as needed. Develops strong relationships with landowners and provides excellent customer service in response to inquiries.  Basic/Required Qualifications  Bachelors Degree with 2 years of experience in legal, contract management or accounting OR Associate's degree and 2 years of experience in legal, contract management or the energy industry. Desired Qualifications Excellent written and oral communication skills as well as good organizational skills  Strong attention to detail  Team player; customer service oriented  Problem solving skills  Proficient in Microsoft Office products  Computer skills and experience with Landworks, and CAPS Online or similar  Ability to manage multiple assignments and meet deadlines on a timely basis with a high degree of accuracy  Experience researching and recording of real estate documents  Paralegal  Travel Requirements 5-15% Relocation Assistance Provided (as applicable)  No  Represented/Union Position  No  Visa Sponsored Position  No  Posting Expiration Date  Friday, November 23, 2018  All job postings expire at 12:01 AM on the posting expiration date.  Please note that in order to be considered for this position, you must possess all of the basic/required qualifications.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Become a subject matter expert on securities in terms of how they are listed and traded on various global stock exchanges. Name: Operational Excellence Support Analyst
Description: Job Description:Scope: Support GBAM Tech in the strategic development and execution of the Operational Excellence program. Operational Excellence defines how we manage the company and describes our mindset of continuous improvement to provide a deeper understanding of our work. The Operational Excellence team is looking to assess horizontal processes that impact multiple groups across the enterprise. Role Overview: Operational Excellence Support Analyst has end to end accountability of managing Operational Excellence for GBAM Tech and management of supporting projects including Simplify and Improve. The candidate must be able to delegate effectively in a highly collaborative manner, have a detailed understanding of Operational Excellence standards and requirements, and the ability to bring multiple submissions from parallel teams together to assess current state and drive consensus/decisions about target state. Some key accountabilities are: Assist in setting and communicating the strategic approach to Operational Excellence workstreams for GBAMTCreate metrics and executive reporting to support program goalsSupport executives, process owners and SMEs by facilitating operational excellence deliverables within a collaborative team environment and delivering results.Assist in the creating of draft communications outlining operational excellence success stories and showcase how process improvement produces high performing teams and programs.Skills & CompetenciesMust have a strong background in process design and ARIS mappingExceptional ability to think systemically within the Operational Excellence frameworkExecution driven, highly collaborative and works well in the details. Proven track record within a BAC Project Management or Business Management function required.Ability to crisply communicate concepts and tailor messaging to audiences appropriatelyWorking knowledge of general bank policies, programs and procedures with specific fluency in Operational ExcellenceStrong relationship management skills to navigate the complexities of explaining deliverables, tracking work stream progress and collecting and creating executive updates.Strong written and verbal communication that supports work stream execution in delivering on Operation Excellent milestones while and other business management servicesAbility to establish and grow strong relationships while managing work flow across the Operational Excellence partnersAbility to learn and adapt quickly in making sound decisions while facilitating process working sessions

Name: 2-Year Analyst Program - Alternative Investments Analytics and Research
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities. Business Unit: Alternative Investments  Barings Alternative Investments (BAI), the private equity and real estate division of Barings, is seeking a two-year analyst for the Analytics and Research team. The team combines mathematical model development with market research to forecast investment performance, construct portfolios, and design customized product solutions that are tailored to our clients' individual needs. In addition, the position will help in building and maintaining Barings' financial data inventory and data management system. The goal of the 2-Year Analyst Program is to train junior professionals such that they are able to provide leverage to senior professionals while utilizing them in a manner such that high performers will want to remain with the firm in roles of increased responsibility.  Primary Responsibilities Market researchData collection and organizationDatabase managementQuantitative model developmentStatistical methodology researchProgrammingQualificationsGraduation date of May 2019Passion for the markets and quantitative analyticsSTEM or quantitative finance/economics backgroundProficient in Microsoft Office Suite; advance Excel skillsBasic programming skills, preferably: VBA, SQL, Python, and/or C++/C#Ability to manage large data setsStatistical analysisKnowledge about financial modelingStrong communication abilities to convey complex and quantitative concepts across teamsExpectations of an analyst:Strong communication skillsExceptional work ethicAttention to detailEffective time managementResponsivenessIntellectual curiosity and desire to learnReliabilityProfessionalismTeam-oriented Barings is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; Minority/Female/Age/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply.SDL2017

Name: Reporting & Governance Senior Analyst - Global Markets Risk, Global Portfolio Analysis

Name: Equity Analyst - Solutions Consultant
Description: Summary/Objective of Position:Investor Management Services, a leading commercial real estate software as a service (SaaS) company, is looking for a talented individual to fill the role of Equity Analyst - Solutions Consultant. The Analyst will work with prospective clients to understand the commercial real estate (CRE) equity structure needed to run waterfall calculations for operating and sale/refi distributions.The Sales – Equity Analyst (Solutions Consultant) will manage multiple prospective client CRE equity waterfall reviews, completing troubleshooting and financial analysis tasks related to setup of those prospective clients’ distribution calculations / waterfalls in the IMS Platform. The Sales – Equity Analyst (Solutions Consultant) will also be responsible for demonstration/presentation of waterfall distribution calculations in the IMS Platform using prospective clients’ data, providing proof of concept, and facilitating the close of the sale. When fully ramped, the Analyst (Solutions Engineer) will manage 5-10 prospective client waterfalls at a time through the demonstration stage. This requires a highly organized person who can understand ownership structures, operating agreements, and distribution calculations. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and knowledge of the following items is also required: preferred rate of return, capital balance(s), compounding periods, day count conventions, IRR, and XIRR.Additional responsibilities include process improvement and interfacing with internal team members in various departments, including development, product management, sales, and marketing. Rapid customer adoption of our break-through commercial real estate technology platform means career advancement opportunities for a motivated, hard-working, and capable professional who consistently drives for results.Competencies for Success in This Role:Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of informationAttention to detail is critical for client confidence and efficiencyExperience working with advanced financial calculationsSelf-starter with strong work ethic, common sense, and a positive attitudeExtremely customer service focusedAbility to adapt plans to changing circumstancesAbility to allocate time for specific tasks and prioritize requests and demandsAbility to prioritize a list of projects and focus on higher value tasks with more immediate deadlinesAbility to set realistic standards for qualityAbility to provide accurate, valid, and complete information using correct methods/toolsCapable of handling client complaints, providing appropriate solutions and alternatives within time constraints, and following up with clients to ensure resolution was satisfactoryExcellent focus, with the ability to multi-task and prioritize in a very fast-paced environmentFollow, and continually strive to improve, communication procedures, guidelines, and policiesDesire to learn commercial real estate terms and conceptsRequired Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree required. Prefer finance/math/economics/business degrees.Experience with Microsoft products, including: Excel (expert level), Outlook, Word and PowerPointPreferred Education and Experience:2+ year prior experience as an analyst or as a CRE brokerCommercial real estate (CRE) knowledge and financial experienceExperience working in a financial technology firmLocation: This role is located in Charlotte, North Carolina.

Name: Business Control Manager-AML (Anti-Money Laundering) Enterprise and Country Standards Customer Due Diligence Desktop Tools Analyst
Description: Job Description:Line of Business Job Overview As part of GT&O, the Enterprise Process Oversight (EPO) teams directly impact the firm’s ability to achieve and sustain operating and regulatory excellence. The EPO teams oversee the execution of significant processes across the enterprise by partnering with Legal, Compliance and the Front Line Units (FLUs)/Control Functions (CFs). EPOs perform standard functions to identify and mitigate risks, achieve operating targets and consistently comply with applicable laws, rules and regulations. Role Overview:  The AML EPO Customer Due Diligence (CDD) Desktop Tools Analyst is responsible for supporting the development, implementation, and support of a set of tools to provide clarity to GBAM Front Line Units (FLUs) and Operations teams with the Customer Due Diligence Standards. Job Description:Supports the development, implementation, support, and updates to the Enterprise CDD Desktop Tools and regional CDD Desktop ToolsResponsible for working with the regional AML EPO Policy/Standard leads and GFCC for updating CDD Desktop Tools based on regulatory requirements, changes to regulatory requirements and standards and working with FLUs to implement changes.Responsible for working with GFCC (Global Financial Crimes Compliance), FLUs, Operations and teammates to provide training, support, and ongoing maintenance.Support key Stakeholder routines for CDD Desktop Tools and appropriate governance forumsMonitor and respond to requests for change or exception to the CDD Desktop Tools from the FLUs and ensure they are submitted through the established governance routines, including ensuring adequate business justification, assessment of risk and mitigating controlsProficient in Financial Crimes policy and standard requirements and provides guidance to FLU/Operations team to clarify with Compliance where unclearWork horizontally across enterprise standards, country standards, and desktop procedures to identify areas for improving and simplification of CDD processesEnterprise Role Description Assist in the execution of internal control discipline and operational excellence within a LOB or ECF. Execute LOB/ECF specific processes and tools to drive adherence to enterprise-wide Standards. Support the implementation of QA/QC processes within the LOB/ECF through ongoing monitoring and testing of controls. Identify issues and/or control improvements for remediation, whilst assisting in building out actions plans and milestones. Acts as an ambassador of the risk culture. Develop and direct staff. Incumbents typically have over 8+ years of risk management and LOB/ECF experience. Required Skills:2 – 4 years’ experience in AML CDD (Customer Due Diligence)/KYC (Know Your Customer) with US and international regulatory environment and experience in regulatory change management and GBAM a preferred.Strong understanding of AML CDD regulatory requirements and processes performed by FLU and OperationsKnowledgeable with Global Banking and Markets client onboarding and AML CDD operational processes that include onboard and refreshExperienced in understanding policy/standard requirements, clearly and clearly writing reference procedures and/or QRG’s (quick reference guides) for FLUsExperienced in policy writing, operationalizing the policy and provide advisory on policy/regulatory requirements to help in development of desktop proceduresDetail-oriented to ensure quality and accurate work productAbility to facilitate and drive consensus that includes effectively demonstrating influence with business partners and teammatesExperience working in high visibility, high pressure environmentsProactively builds trusted relationships with key partnersMotivated self-starter who takes ownership and can produce high quality resultsStrong time management skills and adaptability to address shifting priorities and tight deadlinesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong proficiency with MS Office - Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and SharePointUndergraduate College Degree preferred

Name: Senior Billing Analyst
Description: Senior Billing AnalystJob Type: Full-Time Location: Charlotte, NC Department: Finance Operations The Company RingCentral, Inc. (NYSE:RNG) is a leading provider of global enterprise cloud communications and collaboration solutions. More flexible and cost-effective than legacy on-premises systems, RingCentral empowers today’s mobile and distributed workforce to communicate, collaborate, and connect from anywhere, on any device. RingCentral unifies voice, video, team messaging and collaboration, conferencing, online meetings, and integrated contact center solutions. RingCentral’s open platform integrates with leading business apps and enables customers to easily customize business workflows. RingCentral is headquartered in Belmont, California, and has offices around the world.  Traditionally, business communications comprised a series of inflexible, expensive, and disparate systems: on-premises hardware–based private branch exchanges, or PBX systems, which are still prevalent in businesses today. The emergence of the cloud and SaaS business models, combined with the proliferation of smartphones and tablets, as well as the corresponding new paradigms in user experiences, has revolutionized how people communicate. RingCentral is leading the charge in cloud-based communications.  RingCentral is the largest and fastest-growing pure-play provider in this space, with a market capitalization of over $6 billion. With +$600 million run rate, RingCentral is projected to reach $1 billion by 2020. Examples of Wall Street analyst quotes post Q3 earnings: Craig Hallum: “Predictably Exceptional Results – We’ve Come To Expect Nothing Less.”Deutsche Bank: “Executing like a Well-Oiled Machine.”Jeffries: “Firing On All Cylinders.”Northland: “As UCaaS Market Evolves, RNG Excels”Responsibilities:Responsible for all aspects of processing Billing and AR transactionsAssist with the deal desk review of sales opportunities, contracts and non-­ standard transactionsReview and approve sales orders. Work closely with the sales team and provide guidance on entering sales orders consistently with company policiesReview Invoices and Customer account. Name: Senior Consultant - Energy - Scheduling Analyst - Remote
Description: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant?s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant?s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  With over 600 consultants, Navigant?s global Energy practice is the largest energy management consulting team in the industry. We collaborate with utilities, government and NGOs, industries and large corporations, product manufacturers, and investors to help them thrive in a rapidly changing energy environment. Our clients include the world?s 50 largest electric, water, and gas utilities; the 20 largest independent power generators; and the 20 largest gas distribution and pipeline companies. Navigant?s seasoned professionals and highly skilled specialists form exceptional teams to help clients transform their businesses, manage complexity and accelerate operational performance, meet compliance requirements, and transform systems and governance to address upcoming changes as the energy transformation takes hold.  Navigant was awarded the contract by the Government of Puerto Rico through the Central Office of Recovery, Reconstruction, and Resilience (COR3). Bringing reliable and affordable power to Puerto Rico is critical to the island?s economy and the well-being of its residents. With Navigant?s expertise across power systems generation, T&D, distributed energy resources, and grid modernization, Navigant is uniquely positioned to deliver on key objectives for a more resilient, customer-centric, and sustainable energy system for the people of Puerto Rico.  The Scheduling Analyst will assist the Master Scheduler in the development and implementation of schedules to support client projects. Perform Program Planning and Scheduling tasks for the organization. The Scheduling Analyst will support a diverse group of Program Managers, Project Managers, and Technical Leads in the development of program plans and schedules. Responsibilities: + Facilitate project planning: prioritize tasks, set deadlines and manage deliverables  + Analyze schedule information with the project teams and stakeholders on a weekly basis  + Generate program plans & schedules from the earliest stages of program development through program execution  + Develop solutions to complex problems and support the development and deployment of new techniques and tools  + Prepare and coordinate plans and schedules for new and/or existing projects.  + Analyze effects of projects on engineering, facilities, and construction and determine efficient methods to solve conflicts.  + Minimum 2 years related experience in MS Project or Primavera  + Good organizational skills and ability to effectively coordinate multiple activities.  + Solid knowledge of MS Project; scheduling theory, techniques and methodologies; project management principles.  + Working knowledge of critical path and other schedule risk/opportunity analysis techniques.  + Good presentation, communication, and analytical skills  + BS in Engineering or Construction Management, with a solid academic performance.  + PMP Certification preferred  + 2 plus years? experience in scheduling, with emphasis in project controls.  + Highly motivated, driven, and dynamic attitude towards work and career.  + Creative problem-solving ability and a collaborative, consultancy mindset.  + Strong oral and written communication skills in English and Spanish is a plus.  + Ability to multi-task and effectively prioritize tasks.  + Must demonstrate a working knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint.  + Experience with Primavera scheduling tools. MS Project and Critical Path Method (CPM) scheduling techniques.  + Solid skills in analysis and reasoning, good interpersonal, communication and time management skills.  + Travel is required  + Frequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectively  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Flexibility and responsiveness in managing multiple projects in sometimes high-pressure situations simultaneously  + Travel Required  + Usually remains stationary for the majority of the day  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Navigant and Navigant will not be obligated to pay a placement fee._***Navigant** is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation. Navigant will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

Name: Organizational Risk Analyst
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities. Business Unit: Enterprise/Operational Risk  Job Summary  Barings and its subsidiaries serve institutional investors around the globe and have over $305+ billion. Through proprietary research, analysis and a focus on investment fundamentals, the firm develops products and strategies that leverage its broad expertise in global fixed income, equities, alternatives, structured products, debt financing for corporations and debt and equity financing for commercial real estate. The firm maintains a strong global footprint with operations on four continents, and with major offices in Charlotte, Springfield, Boston, New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, London, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Sydney and Melbourne. Barings is a member of the MassMutual Financial Group.  Barings Organizational Risk Management Department is seeking an Analyst to work with associates across the firm to develop and produce operational risk assessments and help facilitate the successful execution of audit-related activities. The assessments involve analyzing risks and controls and recommending process and control improvements to strengthen and harmonize Barings' control structure environment. The Analyst will support the oversight of ongoing firm-wide audits while promoting effective relationships with both external and internal key stakeholders.  This position will be located in the Charlotte, NC office.  Primary Responsibilities Track, coordinate and report audit deliverables from key stakeholders within the firmInteract with business partners to help ensure the information flow from the business to the audit team is timely, complete and efficientExecute operational risk assessments designed to strengthen and harmonize existing control structures and promote operational consistency and integrity on a global basisCollate and monitor key Organizational risk metrics and provide updates to management in a timely mannerAnalyze and interpret data, processes, metrics and other relevant information associated with assessing and evaluating the control environment in order to make recommendations on controls improvementsManage and drive remediation or corrective action plans associated with operational risksEngage with management and business partners to leverage operational risk data and trends and implement lessons learned from significant eventsSupport the development and ongoing production of risk management reporting/presentations for meetings with senior members of the firm and relevant risk committeesQualificationsDegree in finance or accounting preferredFive plus years of experience performing internal or external audits within the financial services industryWorking knowledge and experience with auditing tools such as Archer, Audit Control Language, and proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and VisioSound knowledge and experience in Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, Sarbanes-Oxley, and Statement on Standards for Attestation NO. 18 ("SSAE 18")Applied working knowledge of U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and accounting proceduresExceptional interpersonal, presentation and communication skills, both written and verbalStrategic and creative thinker with the ability to drive to results, and transform the current stateStrong project and resource management skillsAbility to communicate issues and recommendations persuasively to key stakeholders across levels and business units, including leadershipAbility to effectively influence key stakeholders in multiple geographic locationsManage initiatives to aggressive timeframes and ensure high quality results are delivered on timeSignificant research and analytical skills including the ability to coalesce disparate informationProcess mapping and problem solving skillsComfortable in rapidly changing, high sense of urgency type environments Barings is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; Minority/Female/Age/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply.SDL2017

Name: Derivatives Analyst
Description: Derivatives Analyst Job Description: Derivatives Analyst Summary:Signature Consultants has an opportunity for a Derivatives Analyst to work on-site in Charlotte, NC. The candidate will assist in the day-to-day maintenance, build-out and development of Derivatives and Collateral Liquidity Risk infrastructure to support Global Liquidity Risk Management and Regulatory Reporting. The primary responsibilities of the group include the following: data validation and controls across multiple products, data attribution and explanation of daily variances, reconcile production data to independent sources to ensure data completeness and accuracy, develop and enhance existing processes to address evolving regulatory requirements, test and build-out new reporting database and reporting platform for Global Liquidity Risk Regulatory Reporting.Responsibilities:Perform daily attribution recons for derivatives and collateral positions across multiple platforms and productsWork with internal business lines to research and explain daily variancesPrepare reporting to Reporting Risk Team and provide commentary as neededTest new data populations as they are added to the reporting databaseEnhance existing controls to address changes to data populationsQualifications:5-8 years of Middle Office, finance or product control experienceIn-depth product knowledge of financial instruments, preferably derivatives (Listed and OTC)Strong quantitative and analytic skillsDegree in economics, business or financePreferred Skills:5-8 years of experience analyzing and reporting financial data relating to fixed income and derivatives productsIdeal candidate should have a general comprehension of the collateral process and products usedMust have strong analytic skills and have experience working across multiple applicationsAbility to work independently and take lead on addressing issuesStrong technology skills including advanced Excel skillsDemonstrate history of working with SQL, Python or other programming languageAbout Signature Consultants, LLCHeadquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Signature Consultants was established in 1997 with a singular focus: to provide clients and consultants with superior staffing solutions. For the sixth consecutive year, Signature was voted as one of the “Best Staffing Firms to Work For” and is now the 15th largest IT staffing firm in the United States (source: Staffing Industry Analysts). With 25 locations throughout North America, Signature annually deploys thousands of consultants to support, run, and manage their clients’ technology needs. Signature offers IT staffing, consulting, managed solutions, and direct placement services. For more information on the company, please visit www.sigconsult.com.

Works on small to large, complex projects that require increased skill in one or more technologies. Possesses knowledge in a specific business area. Works on one or more projects as a team member or occasionally as a project lead. Works under general supervision with latitude for independent judgment. May consult with senior peers on certain projects. Typically requires four or more years of demonstrated business systems analysis/consulting experience and demonstrated technical capabilities.

Name: Fraud Operations Reporting Analyst
Description: Specific information related to the position is outlined below. To apply, click on the button above. You will be required to create an account (or sign in with an existing account). Your account will provide you access to your application information.Should you have a disability and need assistance with the application process, please request a reasonable accommodation by emailing or by calling 866-362-6451. This email inbox is monitored for reasonable accommodation requests only. Any other correspondence will not receive a response. Regular or Temporary:RegularLanguage Fluency: English (Required) Work Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Please review the following job description: The Fraud Operations Reporting Analyst will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and producing reporting to support Fraud Detection Operations and Fraud Resolution Operations. This will include daily and monthly reporting to measure operational, system, and associate effectiveness. The primary tools to be used will be Tableau, SQL, Altreryx, and Microsoft Excel. The analyst will responsible for working with other fraud teams to develop reporting requirements, identify data needs, work with the Fraud Tools and Data team to source the data, create the reporting, establish report distribution, and ensure the reported information is accurate. Position is open to Wilson or Charlotte, NC.Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.  ** Perform data mining and aggregating, querying multiple data sources (Flat Files, Excel, Access, SQL Server, DB2, etc.). Data validation to ensure accuracy, quality and integrity. Analyze data and provide results to other analysts or management.  ** Utilize PC and/or internal systems/software. Perform analysis, compile and prepare reports, graphs and charts of data developed for business need or risk mitigation analysis. Document and maintain statistics, records and reports that support various processes, parameter and risk mitigation decisions or refine quality control standards. May include the creation of financial and/or loss reports.  ** Utilize, consult on, and occasionally design and create database structures to efficiently store critical business historical data.  1. Conduct and facilitate work efforts and projects in the areas of problem identification and resolution, performance and productivity improvement and quality enhancements.  2. Lead Liability Risk Management (LRM) systems implementation testing and any training that becomes necessary as a result of conclusions reached in project-related activities of systems implementation or policy change.  3. Utilize PC and/or mainframe based systems and software, detection systems and claims management system to perform fraud trend, root cause or other defined analyses with results delivered through professionally constructed management reports that may require graphs, tables and other tools with supporting commentary.  4. Gather documents, perform analysis, maintain statistics, create records and reports that highlight trends, help establish policies, procedures and quality control standards.  5. Provide input and support in the planning and prioritization for business systems related processes and policies by maintaining and communicating knowledge of industry trends and technologies. Recommend strategies to mitigate losses.  6. Assist other lines of business (LOBs) supported by LRM in managing their controllable fraud risk by providing data on the impact of fraud losses and loss avoidance by channel, product, geography or as otherwise defined.  7. Manage, control and periodically validate source data used for key performance measurements and other statistical information used to manage the operations.  8. Assist with developing and maintaining a professional relationship with vendors supporting assigned systems, coordinate system upgrades and communicate to team members when systems are upgraded.  9. Assist in the planning, development and documentation for effective business recovery strategies and participate in testing and deployment, if needed. Required Skills and Competencies: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  1. Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and related training.  2. Two years of experience using Tableau, SQL, and other reporting tools. Experience with Tableau server desired.  3. Ability to work independently in a detailed and deadline-oriented environment.  4. Experience with integrated data capture and database structure design.  5. Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications such as Microsoft Office software products.  6. Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate (verbal and written) clearly to internal clients.  7. Possess a strong sense of urgency, strong independent reasoning and analytical, organizational and operational skills. Ability to analyze, process, and communicate information timely and accurately. Desired Skills: 1. Familiarity with Six Sigma or Process Master Performance measurement methods (control charts, Pareto charts, diagrams).  2. Knowledge of fraud detection the resolution operations processes. BB&T is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants regardless of race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other classification protected by law. EEO is the Law Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

Name: Cybersecurity Intrusion Detection Analyst
Description: Job Description: Are you passionate about working with the best information security team in the world? Bank of America is hiring top talent to join our team.  The Cyber Security Defense (CSD) function within Global Information Security is responsible for all aspects of threat intelligence and monitoring, application and network security, and insider threat. In addition, the CSD team drives out the enterprise-wide cyber exercise program.  Will function as a member of an Enterprise Network Intrusion Detection and Prevention Response team. The Security Analyst will use our security tools and events to find targeted attacks against the banks internal and external network. The analyst will also use new intelligence to update existing controls to detect new threats. Additional Tasks include:Daily analysis of security eventsBuilding and enhancing automated controls to detect security eventsWork with vendor to maintain our security controlsDevelops and implements processes or controls in support of audit and risk requirementsWill partner with senior leaders from lines of business organizations to triage security events and report on impacting security initiatives.Responsible for mentoring and developing the skill sets of less experienced team members.On call and after hour work can be expected.  Previous network security experience required. Strong attention to detail, analytical skills, ability to operate in a high stress environment, and ability to work both independently as well as part of a larger technology team are also required. Must be able to plan, execute and document initiatives following established processes and procedures. Five to seven years of experience in network security required. Required Skills:Strong Intrusion Analysis backgroundExperience with packet captures and interpreting network trafficFamiliarity with web application attacks including SQL injection, cross-site scripting,Strong Splunk skill setAbility to work independently on initiatives with little oversight.Ability to work with Technical and Non-Technical business ownersMotivated and willing to learn.Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual thinking.Must be comfortable in delivering messages across a wide spectrum of individuals having varying degrees of technical understanding. Desired Skills:Unix/Linux system administration experienceApplication development experienceFirewall administration experienceNetwork penetration testing experience Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Bank Funding Analyst
Description: Job Description:Role Overview This role is on the Strategic Asset and Liability Management (SALM) team within Treasury; specifically the US Bank and Parent Company Team. The role has responsibility for Position Management including the daily cash position, short-term liquidity forecasts, coordination with tactical and strategic funding efforts, internal funding execution, and ongoing analytics to optimize deployment and funding actions. Job Description SALM employees interact daily with internal and external constituents including business lines, other Treasury functions such as Balance Sheet Management (BSM), Finance, Capital Management and Global Liquidity Management, internal control partners, regulators, market participants and investors. SALM strives to utilize its global presence to provide efficient funding strategies across the enterprise in the most cost effective manner, while managing the risks associated with those strategies. The US Bank and Parent Team are tasked to forecast the sources and uses of funds across the US Bank and Parent (Holdco) taking into account business input and projected market conditions in order to manage effectively the Corporations key cash and liquidity positions. Implementation of our funding and hedging strategies necessitates flawlessly executing transactions with internal and external counterparties in accordance with liquidity constraints, internal guidelines, legal limitations and regulatory directives.  This role requires critical thinking about the many challenges facing our company and industry with an emphasis on attention to detail, teamwork and strong communication skills. The Treasury group provides an opportunity to gain broad knowledge about the company and its many businesses as well as the global markets in which we transact. Your day to day experience will be varied and challenging, and will allow you to extend your skills within various disciplines, such as market analysis, short term money markets & real time liquidity risk management. Key Responsibilities:Participate in BANA cash and liquidity forecasting routines to identify risks and ensure compliance with relevant liquidity risk metricsEngage with business partners including BSM, GLM, and CFO Risk to analyze balance sheet changes, identify subsequent risks to the liquidity and cash positionExecute intercompany funding transactions, supporting USD funding needs of non-US branches and subsidiariesParticipate and drive Technology initiatives to integrate SALM capabilities (including integration across Treasury groups) and to further enhance tools to manage liquidity risk globallyDevelop thorough understanding of Federal Reserve monetary policy. Analyze impacts to short-term money market rates and liquidity resulting from changes in Fed policyPerform extensive ad-hoc financial analysis related to funding risks and opportunitiesAssist in coordination and completion of both internal and external audits and regulatory related examsEnsure that a robust control environment is maintained through compliance with all policies, procedures and directives Enterprise Role Overview  Accountable for a specific trading activity. Understanding of liquidity management, bank funding strategy, money markets, economic indicators and Federal Reserve programs. Works closely with the Senior Trader and Bank Funding Managers to make optimal trading decisions to execute the funding strategy set forth. Ability to appropriately balance; liquidity, price, risk and other key factors within established guidelines. Ability to make quick market decisions independently. Contribute knowledge and expertise regarding funding and liquidity to day to day Funding Desk responsibilities. Responsible for pricing, executing and recording trades, ensuring operational cohesiveness and performing investor and dealer analysis. Evaluate funding opportunities with partners across the companies and provide recommendations based on thorough analysis to senior management. Execute funding transactions across international entities. Required Skills and Experience:Undergraduate degree with quantitative focus / prefer finance, accounting or engineering majorMinimum two years treasury (asset liability management), finance (bond math, analytics, balance sheet, cash flows) or trading (traded or monitored/reported on trading strategies) experienceStrong analytical, investigative problem-solving, and decision making skillsAdvanced Excel skillsExperience streamlining/improving processesAbility to thrive in a fast paced, demanding environment, adapt to changing priorities and demonstrate initiativeInquisitive, willing to challenge the status quo and strive to improve processesAbility to work independently, with a team, with minimal supervision and efficiently prioritize tasksAbility to communicate effectively across a broad range of constituents in verbal, written and presentation formsAbility to build and maintain strong relationships across the EnterpriseComfortable leading an initiative as well as playing a support role on a broader teamDesired Skills and Experience:Familiarity with financial regulatory environmentBloomberg and other market sourcesSQL and/or other advanced data manipulation skillsCFAShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Private Investment Risk Analyst
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities. Business Unit: Enterprise/Operational Risk  Job Summary  Barings Risk Management Department is seeking a Private Investment Risk Analyst to provide ongoing development and support of the firm's Investment Risk Management framework with respect to credit-oriented private/illiquid asset strategies. These private/illiquid asset strategies predominantly span globally-issued investment grade private placement bonds and infrastructure/project finance debt, private high yield loans and junior capital securities, and commercial mortgage loans and structured real estate securities. The Analyst will work with associates from the relevant investment teams within Barings to develop, produce and monitor investment risk assessments of private/illiquid asset portfolios. Additional responsibilities for this position include providing credit analysis and monitoring for certain financial counterparties and third party vendors and also helping to review and validate periodic analysis of impaired/stressed assets. A successful candidate will have formal credit training and experience with private credit underwriting, credit reviews and/or portfolio management. In addition, they must be able to effectively build relationships with the key stakeholders in business and support areas, ensure high quality results are delivered on time and be comfortable in rapidly changing, high sense of urgency type environment.  This position will report to Barings Global Head of Investment Risk and will be located in the Charlotte, NC office. Occasional travel to other Baring's office locations may be required.  Primary Responsibilities Assist the Investment Risk Management function with the development, implementation and ongoing oversight of a private/illiquid asset risk assessment framework.Conduct periodic risk reviews with relevant investment teams to monitor the credit quality and exposure trends of private/illiquid portfolios and the ongoing integrity of credit underwriting standards against defined risk limits/thresholds.Work with internal business and IT partners to develop and support risk report creation and assist with ongoing governance committee and/or fund board risk reporting as required.Provide credit analysis and monitoring for certain financial counterparties and key third party vendors.QualificationsBachelor degree (preferably science or engineering) with background and understanding of private/illiquid credit-oriented assets. FRM/CFA preferred.5-10 years of experience in the financial services industry, preferably in a credit risk functionFormal bank credit training and experience with insurance company investment accounting, capital requirements and asset impairment analysis/coordination strongly preferred.MS SQL Server querying experience (preferred).Experience with report development and data visualization/business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Sportfire, Power BI).Ability to rapidly learn our infrastructure and proprietary tools and handle detailed reporting and presentation requirements a must.Proven analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to gather, analyze, organize and report information, results and recommendations.Ability to establish and maintain relationships at all levels in the organization.Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Barings is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; Minority/Female/Age/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply.SDL2017

business analysis.Si vous êtes prêts à optimiser votre potentiel, c’est le temps de commencer votre carrière à la Manuvie/John Hancock.À propos de ManuvieLa Société Financière Manuvie, groupe mondial et chef de file des services financiers, aide les gens à réaliser leurs rêves et leurs aspirations en priorisant leurs besoins et en leur fournissant de bonnes solutions et recommandations. Elle exerce ses activités sous les noms John Hancock aux États-Unis et Manuvie ailleurs dans le monde. Elle propose des conseils financiers ainsi que des solutions d’assurance, de gestion de patrimoine et de gestion des actifs à des particuliers, à des groupes et à des institutions. À la fin de 2016, elle comptait environ 35 000 employés, 70 000 agents et des milliers de partenaires de distribution au service de plus de 22 millions de clients. À la fin de 2016, son actif géré et administré se chiffrait à 977 milliards de dollars canadiens (728 milliards de dollars américains) et, au cours des 12 mois précédents, elle avait versé à ses clients près de 26 milliards de dollars. Elle exerce ses activités principalement en Asie, au Canada et aux États-Unis, où elle est présente depuis plus de 100 ans. Son siège social mondial se situe à Toronto, au Canada, et elle est inscrite aux bourses à la bourse de Toronto, de New York et des Philippines sous le symbole « MFC », ainsi qu’à la Bourse de Hong Kong sous le symbole « 945 ».Manuvie est résolue à favoriser une culture de diversité et d’accessibilité dans l’ensemble de l’entreprise. Aussi s’est-elle donné comme priorité d’éliminer les obstacles à l’accès égalitaire à l’emploi. Un représentant des Ressources humaines communiquera avec les postulants invités à participer à l’une ou l’autre des étapes du processus de recrutement et demandant des mesures d’adaptation. Les renseignements reçus relativement aux besoins d’adaptation des postulants sont traités en toute confidentialité.

Name: Derivatives Analyst
Description: Derivatives Analyst Job Description: Derivatives Analyst Summary:Signature Consultants has an opportunity for a Derivatives Analyst to work on-site in Charlotte, NC. The candidate will assist in the day-to-day maintenance, build-out and development of Derivatives and Collateral Liquidity Risk infrastructure to support Global Liquidity Risk Management and Regulatory Reporting. The primary responsibilities of the group include the following: data validation and controls across multiple products, data attribution and explanation of daily variances, reconcile production data to independent sources to ensure data completeness and accuracy, develop and enhance existing processes to address evolving regulatory requirements, test and build-out new reporting database and reporting platform for Global Liquidity Risk Regulatory Reporting.Responsibilities:Perform daily attribution recons for derivatives and collateral positions across multiple platforms and productsWork with internal business lines to research and explain daily variancesPrepare reporting to Reporting Risk Team and provide commentary as neededTest new data populations as they are added to the reporting databaseEnhance existing controls to address changes to data populationsQualifications:5-8 years of Middle Office, finance or product control experienceIn-depth product knowledge of financial instruments, preferably derivatives (Listed and OTC)Strong quantitative and analytic skillsDegree in economics, business or financePreferred Skills:5-8 years of experience analyzing and reporting financial data relating to fixed income and derivatives productsIdeal candidate should have a general comprehension of the collateral process and products usedMust have strong analytic skills and have experience working across multiple applicationsAbility to work independently and take lead on addressing issuesStrong technology skills including advanced Excel skillsDemonstrate history of working with SQL, Python or other programming languageAbout Signature Consultants, LLCHeadquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Signature Consultants was established in 1997 with a singular focus: to provide clients and consultants with superior staffing solutions. For the sixth consecutive year, Signature was voted as one of the “Best Staffing Firms to Work For” and is now the 15th largest IT staffing firm in the United States (source: Staffing Industry Analysts). With 25 locations throughout North America, Signature annually deploys thousands of consultants to support, run, and manage their clients’ technology needs. Signature offers IT staffing, consulting, managed solutions, and direct placement services. For more information on the company, please visit www.sigconsult.com.

Name: CCAR Governance Analyst
Description: Job Description: As part of the Enterprise Scenario Planning and Execution (ESPE) Qualitative Methodology Review team, the candidate will be responsible for the co-ordination and management of governance related activities (defined as part of the independent review and challenge framework) relating to the assessment of qualitative forecasting methodologies used to support enterprise scenario analysis.  Key responsibilities for the team include: Working with Lines of Business, Risk Management and Finance to collate a complete inventory of qualitative forecasting approaches employedConducting independent assessments and/or reviews of the methodologies appliedDocumenting a clear and detailed review and analysis of assessments - including completion of risk classifications, materiality evaluation and any recommendations / requirements to be incorporated.Completion of periodic reviews across qualitative methodologies used, in order to ensure they remain current to changing market conditions and incorporate any methodology changes required.Effectively engaging with key stakeholders to agree on action plans and follow-up reviews, as required, to facilitate executive approvals.Driving the development of infrastructure, process and procedures to ensure alignment to the independent review and challenge requirements.Identifying areas for improvement and continued enhancement, and implementing solutionsPosition Description: The candidate will be responsible for managing the governance related activities to support the team - including pipeline management, capacity planning, management reporting and process validation / re-design.As part of the role, the candidate will be required to develop a strong working relationship with key partners (incl. Model Risk Management, methodology Stakeholders) in order to ensure effective co-ordination of deliverables and integration into management reporting routines.Responsibilities also include supporting the Enterprise Scenario Planning and Execution Executive to develop fully transparent reporting and obtaining required executive management and senior governing body approvals, as required.  The position requires interaction within the Lines of Business, Risk Management and Finance to address inquiries related to qualitative model / methodology identification, approach and calibration.The candidate will also support the execution of key group-wide ESPE deliverables, in order to ensure full alignment and extension of processes across enterprise scenario analysis.
