Name: Data Analyst-Quality Advisor
Description: Data Analyst-Quality Advisor . Premier, Inc. is searching for a Data Analyst to support our most popular tool, QaulityAdvisor. The data analyst will process member data from data receipt to entrance into the QualityAdvisor data warehouse error-free and effectively support members once the data is in the system. The analyst will be expected to communicate with members on a regular basis via email and phone calls answering basic member questions regarding data, processing or reporting issues. Provide written communication regarding deadlines, decisions, explanations of issues, etc.  This level will start out supporting 1-2 members the first few months and then grow workload to minimum of 10 members in 6 months.  This position works in collaboration with customers; QualityAdvisor Operations including the clinical staff, mentors, Supervisors, and the Solution Center to respond to client issues and questions; and Data Warehouse Services, Data Quality and Development teams to resolve data integrity or application issues; and other Premier stakeholders to ensure issues are resolved and required deliverables are met.  Major Accountabilities Preparing the data for loading into Premier's data acquisition tools to support Clinical products; review and understand data files prior to loading; perform initial reconciliation of data to ensure data imported aligns with member's general ledger; import member data into Data acquisition tools; ensure data is validated and corrected prior to publishing to Clinical productsSecure approval from the supervisor to send data to the data warehouseWork closely with QualityAdvisor Operations (clinical) team regarding QA issues, mapping member charge codes; send inpatient data to clinical staff to perform a resource consumption clinical quality assurance test (QA).Analyze clinical and financial data; review reports; send error reports to memberResearch member issues and/or financial charges against coded data; perform validation and manual audit of data; reconcile data ensuring that patient data ties back to member's financials. Ability to identify and research issues, may or may not be able to resolve them.Communicate with members on a regular basis via email and phone calls answering basic member questions regarding data, processing or reporting issue.Provide written communication regarding deadlines, decisions, explanations of issues, etc.Working with member to correct validations identifiedWork closely with IT Data Warehouse Services, Development, Data Quality, Solution Center, and Data Management teams to make data corrections; support member questions, secure alternatives for application errors; or resolve data integrity issues in QualityAdvisor and Quality Measures ReporterDeveloping understanding of how members use the productsPrepare documentation and manuals for member kick-off and training meetingsParticipate in internal training of new products or releases; update training documentation materials; transfer knowledge to other consultants Education & Experience Bachelor's degree required2 or more years of experience utilizing analytical and technical abilitiesPractical hospital or healthcare related experience preferredStrong communication skills and excel skills are preferred#LI-AD1 #Charlotte  Premier is looking for smart, agile individuals like you to help us transform the healthcare industry. Here you will find critical thinkers who have the freedom to make an impact. Colleagues who share your thirst to learn more and do things better. Teammates committed to improving the health of a nation. See why incredible challenges require incredible people. Name: Index Analyst
Description: Index Review AnalystRole Profile The Index Analyst role sits within the Chief Data Office’s organisation which is part of the Information Services Division.  The Index Review team are ultimately responsible for the review, rebalance, and reconstitution of the FTSE Russell index / product portfolio. It is a global group, with teams in Hong Kong, London, New York and Seattle. The group operates a “follow the sun model” with work as a single team across the different time-zones. Key Responsibilities As a member of the Index Review team, the individual will be responsible for the support/assisting of the periodic Index reviews and rebalances of the FTSE Russell indices. Key areas of responsibility will include: Conduct the periodic rebalance process of indices and/or the associated implementation of any changes, in accordance with review schedule.Conduct eligibility checks on stocks potentially entering FTSE Russell indices, such as liquidity and free float.Conduct comprehensive data analysis on the results of index rebalances to ensure the accuracy and quality of the changes of the review.Demonstrate the ability to communicate and articulate the effects and impact of the index rebalance/reviews on end clients.Escalate to line manager any issues/concerns and report exceptions in a timely manner.Timely investigation and resolution of any client queries relevant to your role and areas of expertise.Highlight and recommend to your line manager any process improvements or efficiencies that will improve the levels of quality, productivity & client service.Participate as and when required in any projects or initiatives, supporting the on-boarding of new business into the team.Ensure that all of your tasks have been completed in accordance with your procedures.Strive to constantly improve your skills through any training & development that is available.Support your line manager in any functions as and when required.Actively contribute and lead training of other team members.Promote a good teamwork ethic across the teams (including other offices), actively encouraging interaction and providing assistance to others where required.Candidate Profile / Key SkillsIt is expected that with limited supervision the individual will deliver each of the key objectives of the role identified above, working to strict deadlines and to the highest degree of accuracy. It is therefore expected that the individual will have:A degree in finance, economics, or equivalent experience required.Understanding of the investment management and portfolio construction across asset classes.Knowledge of performance measurement and portfolio analysis concepts.Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with the ability to prioritize effectively, handle multiple projects under tight deadlines, identify/ flag/resolve potential issues early onA proven track record for achievement in delivering a high quality service.Demonstrated proficiency with Excel as well as a structured programming language such as VBA or SQL.MS or MBA in finance, financial engineering, economics, statistics, or other quantitative fields a plus.CFA, CAIA designations (or participation in the programs) viewed very favorably.Type of PersonEnthusiastic and responsive to change.Ability to work to tight deadlines and under pressure.Logical and structured approach.Ability to pay meticulous attention to detail.Effective written and spoken communication and presentation skillsGeneralComfortable with flexible hoursTeam playerHighly motivatedSelf-starter People are at the heart of what we do and drive the success of our business. Our colleagues thrive personally and professionally through our shared values of Integrity, Partnership, Innovation and Excellence are at the core of our culture. We embrace diversity and actively seek to attract people with unique backgrounds and perspectives. We are always looking at ways to become more agile so we meet the needs of our teams and customers. We believe that an inclusive collaborative workplace is pivotal to our success and supports the potential and growth of all colleagues at LSEG.  A career with London Stock Exchange Group offers you the opportunity to be at the centre of the financial community. As well as competitive salaries and a range of attractive benefits, we maximise each employee’s potential through personal development plans, training, coaching and mentoring. Name: Client Valuations Analyst
Description: Job Description: This role is within the Derivatives section of the Client Valuations Group who are responsible for managing the distribution of MTM valuations for Interest Rate Derivatives, Credit Derivatives, Equity Derivatives, FX, Commodities & fixed income bonds.  The Client Valuations Group is a centralized team responsible for the production and dissemination of mark to market (MTM) valuations for the Bank’s institutional clients, ensuring full compliance with the Global Client Valuation Policy and Operational Risk. Client Valuations is a growing area, which has increased focus within Global Markets. The Group is one of the few ‘cross product’ areas in Operations and offers exposure to a number of products as well as the opportunity to build a substantial cross department/business network with Sales, Trading, Financial Control, Compliance and Technology, and offers excellent training opportunities to continuously learn and develop across all the products.  Responsibilities: Liaise with the client as well as Salesperson/Marketer to establish valuation requirementsIdentify product type and suitable source for the MTM'sAdminister access for clients to the self-serve valuations portal and monitor/update user preferences where necessaryManage manual exception processes for the valuations that cannot currently be supported via the portal; and distribute accurate valuation statements in a timely mannerInvestigate valuation queries across the different product groups by extracting data from various systems & liaising with Middle OfficeLiaise with Legal and Compliance ensuring new products are accurately disclaimedEnhance the control framework of the team, working with the Front Office and Middle Office groups to establish robust threshold checks and exception tracking processes for each product the group supportsProvide subject matter expertise for technology deliverables, performing testing, and contributing to post-implementation reviewsProvide top class customer service as it relates to client’s valuation statement, responding to client needs & queries in an efficient manner; participate in customer services initiativesActively participate in a number of ad hoc tasks associated with MIS reporting, process improvement initiatives, testing, & on the job/in house training & job shadowing Requirements: Strong client service skills: The unit is extremely ""client service focused"" and has a great deal of interaction with clients, Sales and Trading and Middle Office globally, thus requiring a confident and professional telephone mannerTime management/organization skills: The group has peak periods where volumes are high — during these periods it is imperative that all individuals are able to manage their workload effectively and prioritize as necessaryOTC Product Knowledge: Understanding of broad range of financial products (e.g. Interest Rates Derivatives, Credit Derivatives, Equity Derivatives, FX & Commodities) and any embedded components to value various trade structures & Fixed Income BondsTeamwork: The group has to work efficiently as a team to function. It is essential that each individual member shares information with the rest of the team and can communicate and maintain strong working relationshipsTechnical Skills: The group is very dependent on Microsoft Excel. Knowledge of these is required. Various Pricing tools are also used within the group for MTM generation. A Client Tracking tool and Client Portal will be integral systems as part of the Analyst’s day to day activitiesAbility to prioritize, organize workload and react promptly under pressure at peak periodsStrong negotiation, communication and influenceClient awareness/focus Desired Skills: 2+ years of client services and/or valuations/pricing experience preferableStrong aptitude for numbers, accuracy and customer serviceComprehensive knowledge of operational risk principles and proceduresStrong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to interpret large amounts of information and its impact in operational areasDemonstrated communication skillsAbility to transform large amounts of data and information into short and concise presentations with sound business conclusions and recommendations

Name: Manager, Business Development and Analytics
Description: When the global aerospace community looks for ideas and solutions to its biggest challenges, they turn to the people of UTC Aerospace Systems. We design, invent and deliver the most advanced and diverse range of aerospace systems on the market. We are inventors. We are manufacturers. We work in space exploration, commercial air travel, defense and rescue applications. Always learning and pushing the boundaries, we are an undisputed industry leader that continually sets the bar higher and higher. Come soar with us.  Responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting data for decision making by the business development team, including customer account management and strategy. Includes customer, competitor, and industry data.  Role supports development of long-range business objectives and strategic plans by identifying internal and external strategic issues that could affect growth and profitability of several groups including Landing Systems, Actuation Systems, Propeller Systems, Cargo, and Hoist & Winch. Also supports improvement of key customer relationships and performance through creation of a customer engagement plan and monitoring progress to resolving customer performance issues.  Requires analysis of environment for business opportunities and surveillance of the market. Monitors and highlights public information sources for market opportunities, competitive intelligence, and due diligence to position the business for growth.  Responsible for development and review of business processes to support execution of strategies and customer relationships and performance. Identifies opportunities to streamline data collection, reporting, and analysis and works with the UTAS Digital Strategy team to implement improvements to the process.  Coach and develop analysts from cross functional teams at Landing Systems, Actuation Systems, Propeller Systems, Cargo, and Hoist & Winch sites to embed the strategic planning and customer performance skill set across the organization.Qualification:Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, ability to operate at both strategic and tactical levels.Strong business acumen to approach business issues from multiple functional and or operational perspectives.Strong problem solving ability to identify innovative solutions to achieve strategic objectives.Superior interpersonal, facilitation and communication skills, ability to effectively present ideas to senior leadership and influence key decision makers.Ability to effectively interact with employees at all levels.Excellent research skills utilizing both public information sources and commissioned reports to form data backed business perspectives.Ability to work under pressure, handle ambiguity and change.Strong bias for action with ability to product results. Strong teamwork, collaboration skills.Superior skillset in the use of analytical and digital tools for data acquisition, analysis, and reportingEducation:Bachelors degree with 5+ years of experience.Masters degree with 3+ years of experience. Name: Capital Management - Sr Financial Analyst
Description: Job Description: The Capital Adequacy and US Legal Entity Capital Management Team is responsible for leading integrated capital management strategy, which includes both Enterprise-level and US legal entity-level capital planning and optimization. This team is responsible for the Capital Plan under CCAR, for the capital components of the Recovery and Resolution plans, and capital strategy for US bank and brokerdealer entities. The team is responsible for compiling the capital forecast and assessing capital adequacy for the internal capital adequacy assessment process (ICAAP). The team also manages the firms capital allocation (TAC) strategy for allocating capital to the LOBs, aligning with Business risk appetite and strategy.  The candidate will join a dynamic environment that offers numerous opportunities to learn, grow, impact and drive changes for the Company. In particular, the candidate will: Support the capital planning process across multiple legal entities by preparing capital forecasts for the purposes of capital adequacy assessments, recovery planning, resolution/recovery planning, etc.Support weekly integrated financial outlook production process for the Parent CompanySupport the assessment of the capital position of BAC and certain of its subsidiaries for the purposes of the Company's Resolution PlanSupport enhancement of the capital management process, including better connectivity across business areas and legal entitiesDevelop business partnering skills and cross-functional knowledge through interactions with other capital management teams as well as Risk teams, Balance Sheet Management, Corporate Strategy; Global Liquidity Management, Global Stress Testing and Global Recovery & Resolution PlanningGain knowledge on various capital reporting regimes and their implications for the Company Enterprise Role Overview  Responsible for more complex finance activities around capital calculation, reporting and/or analysis to support the Bank's Capital Initiatives. Understanding of Basel III is a plus. Can work independently. May provide supervision to a small staff. Supports achievement of business goals by working on more complex activities or projects within the unit and with partners. Required Skills & Experience:BS/BA in Finance/Accounting2+ years' experience in the financial industry in a financial analyst roleStrong communication and business partnering skillsAttention to detail is a mustHighly motivated and enjoys taking initiativeEmbraces challenges and changeAdvanced proficiency in MS office tools in particular Excel and PowerPointAbility to work well in a team environmentDesired Skills & Experience:Familiarity with Basel III rules/regulation is a plus but not requiredKnowledge/understanding of CCAR requirements and processes is helpfulExcel VBA skills with specific application to process automation is a plusPrevious experience with financial forecasting, regulatory capital, capital and/or resolution planningShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: BI Analyst
Description: As a BI Analyst, you will be charged with providing web analytics reporting and data-driven strategic insights, trends and perspectives. The ideal candidate will develop and maintain relevant data capture, reporting and perform critical data analysis necessary to monitor and improve revenue-related business goals for Red Ventures. This role requires a proactive personality, extremely analytical mindset, attention to detail, and excellent time management and communication skills. ResponsibilitiesManage web analytics measurement strategy to standardize tracking taxonomy across multiple websites and business verticals.Execute on web analytics and marketing tools implementation using Google Analytics 360, Google tag manager and in-house analytics solutions.Conduct a variety of deep-dive data analyses to gather web behavioral data insights to make decisions on new products, optimization tests and enhancements.Collaborate closely with all areas of the business (Product, SEO, Performance Marketing, Business Development, Social, Email, Sales, Marketing, Finance, Display/AdOps) to provide analysis, reporting and tool-building capabilities that inform our key stakeholders.Run ad-hoc reports and develop dashboards on web behavioral data for internal stakeholders.Required SkillsExperience with Google Analytics or other web analytics tools. Through bespoke technology, integrated digital commerce and sales, distinguished partnerships, data science, and original content from the company's proprietary brands and marketplaces, Red Ventures provides better end-to-end consumer experiences throughout the buying cycle. Headquartered in the Charlotte metro area, Red Ventures has more than 3,600 employees globally in offices across the US, UK, and Brazil.

Name: Intern opportunities for undergraduate students: Finance Analyst Intern
Description: Are you looking forward to a career in finance? Microsoft's undergraduate finance internship opportunity has the training you need to get your career in finance underway. This program has a 15-year track record of producing some of Microsoft's top full-time finance professionals. For 12 weeks, you'll put classroom theory to the test by working on real business issues embedded on one of our top finance teams at the world's leading software company.  Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.? Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!??  Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available finance intern roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered for an internship position, you need to be enrolled as a student with at least one semester/quarter remaining after the internship.  As a Financial analyst intern, you'll learn how to perform financial analysis from full-time professionals at Microsoft. This unique opportunity will get you involved in the dynamic high-tech space solving problems using best-in-class financial tools. You'll also be able to explore one of many areas of Microsoft Finance: Financial Planning and Analysis, Treasury, Capital Markets, Sales and Marketing, Finance, Accounting, or any one of the many product groups such as Office, Xbox or many others.  Interns will interact?directly with Finance rotation program Analysts, who serve as dedicated?coaches for Finance interns. Coaches ensure you have the resources and encouragement needed to succeed in your internship and they take care to?explain your future career opportunities if you return full time. You will participate?in social events held by the Microsoft internship and Finance Rotation programs. These events allow you to socialize with interns from across the company as well as those who are in similar internships. Past events have included hikes at Mount Rainier, sailing along Lake Washington, and Mariners baseball games. *Responsibilities** You will become a valued and integral member within your finance area. You will work on a variety of projects that directly impact the business, such as building?models, forecasting, market research, or creating internal tools or databases. Your manager will work with you to make sure your projects are?meaningful and relevant based on your interests and development needs. Additionally, you will receive finance-specific training and have access to all company-wide training resources to help you succeed in your role. *Qualifications** + Pursuing a bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or business with a graduation date between Nov. 2019 and July 2020.  + One or years of classroom or work experience in financial risk analysis preferred.  + Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: About BDP International:   BDP International is a privately held, family-owned non-asset based global logistics provider with annual sales exceeding $2.1 billion USD. Founded in 1966 by Richard Bolte Sr. and based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, BDP has grown to be one of the largest logistics providers in the world. BDP employs more than 4,000 people worldwide, and operates freight logistics centers in 270 cities across the world through a global network of wholly owned offices, joint ventures and affiliates in 135 countries.  The company serves more than 4,000 customers worldwide. Clients include Bayer, Dow, DuPont, Heineken USA, Honeywell, Johnson & Johnson, Revlon, Trek Bicycle, Wacker, and others.     Job Summary:Provides analysis, definition and recommendations to support Ocean Export, Air Export and Import Services improvements, efficiencies and business development. Provides analysis for projects, ad hoc studies, pricing and costing decisions, productivity assessment, process improvement, transition management and corporation training.Essential Functions:  Perform business and process analysis using the data and information provided by internal systems and outside sources. Analysis offered includes more than just the numbers. It contains observations and ideas. Participate on process improvement teams to determine ways to improve business processes. Ideally taking a lead role for some projects at the appropriate time.Provide ad hoc analytical services to assist in problem solving and in times of crisis.Produce reports and graphics for internal and external customers.Offer ideas with substance that add create value and anticipate questions and concerns.Build effective relationships and credibility with external customers and within BDP operations and other company functional groupsIntroduce new ways of thinking.Ensure that all decision making for carrier selection and other related activities take into account the utmost safety in respect to the quality of the Environment, and health of employees and contractors in which BDP interacts with on a daily basis. Performs other job-related duties and functions as required.That all decision making for carrier selection and other related activities take into account the utmost safety in respect to the quality of the Environment , and health of employees and contractors in which BDP interacts with on a daily basis. Exemption Type Exempt (Salaried) Job RequirementsThe ideal candidate must have at least three (3) to four (4) years of operational experience.Understanding of supply chain and logistics is a plus.APICS CSCP Certification is a plus.A college degree is preferred but not required.Must be able to work in a fast paced environment. Good communication and organization skills and a strong attention to detail are required.The ability to work on a team and leadership experience is strongly desired. Candidate should have the ability to learn various computer programs.    Please note: There is no relocation or immigration assistance associated with this opening.  Compensation based on experience. We offer a very competitive salary, full benefits, matching 401(k), tuition reimbursement, and casual dress environment.       Please visit our website: www.bdpinternational.com ** This is a great opportunity to advance your career! Come join our growing BDP team!*** BDP International - The Employer of Choice Follow BDP International Career Pages!

Name: Data Analytics Specialist, Analyst Relations
Description: Job Description IBM is looking for a Data Analytics Specialist in San Francisco, Boston or New York to work to handle an analytical workload which would primarily entail the management of a custom database that weighs influence as well as tracks interactions and mentions. This database gives the global analyst relations team a road map of the most important influencers globally. It is necessary to take raw data and transform it into creative graphs and PowerPoints with insights to help set strategic direction.  Analyst Relations is an old function inside of IBM. Some say IBM created the function in the 1960s. It has been an integral part of how we work and create success for our business units, clients and society.  IBM has been innovating for 107 years. In 2017, we broke the record as the top US patent generator for the 25th consecutive year. Our patent leadership has changed the way the world works with advancements critical to the modern era of computing. Nearly half of our patents are pioneering advancements in AI, cloud computing, cybersecurity, blockchain and quantum computing and all are aimed at helping the world and our clients.  Analyst Relations is at the nexus of IBM sales and strategy. It plays a critical, cross-functional role by working with experts at many different levels of the organization across product management, engineering, communications, sales and marketing teams, while leveraging important technology analysts and key global influencer community. Analyst Relations is considered a strategic function at IBM, as it drives revenue and influences strategy.  Candidate should have; Strong ability in data analytics, including database construction and analytics tools.Ability to develop and continuously measure Key Performance Metrics (KPIs) for different roles.Strong content and proficient story writing skills.Ability to take unstructured data, and crystalize them into poignant compelling visuals.Ability to glean insights from data, communicate it to peers, and create executive-level talking points.Ability to leverage data to craft unique solutions to elevate the Analyst Relations efforts.Ability to present orally and written to broad audiences (executive to functional).Effectively project manage such that you can handle multiple projects, from beginning to end.Ability to teach concepts to other teammates, such that they can replicate your analyses.An eagerness to work with highly influential individuals both in and outside of the company.Candidate must have the tenacity, determination and patience to be able to challenge conventional thinking and processes. Also, key to the role are the following traits; analytical, entrepreneurial, persistent, collaborative, open and expressive. Must like to laugh.Exceptional skills with: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and other analytics tools as well as, Tableau, SQL, Slack, Zoom, Box and Architect. Candidate will report to Manager of Strategy & Operations Team in Analyst Relations, based in Boston, MA.  This role requires the ability to work on multiple fast paced projects at the same time, strong analytical skills, and experience evaluating qualitative and quantitative research in the tech sector. This candidate must also enjoy building relationships with industry influencers and internal stakeholders. Candidate will be a delicate blend of technical and business.  The candidate will interact with colleagues across IBMs global offices. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop, manage and create content for the Analyst Relations department.The content you generate educates IBM executives, the most influential technical analysts, hybrid analysts, bloggers, marketers, etc., who work with existing or prospective IBM customers, key global media and financial markets.Work closely with and for Vice President, department colleagues and BUs to influence strategy while improving analyst/influencer perceptions and relationships.Collaborate with colleagues in Analyst Relations, Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Communications, Finance and BU leadership to ensure that IBM is receiving the best representation with the analyst/influencer community.Develop and broaden Analyst Relations key performance metrics to elevate efforts to key BU leadership and stakeholders.Analyze analyst inputs, such as social media, blogs, reports, and other forms of influence. Leverage data to guide Analyst Relations leads to maximize amplification of IBM messages.Develop a keen understanding of how to build credible and impactful relationships with key influencers and leading industry analysts. Honesty, tenacity and consistency.Grow a deep technical interest in the spaces that IBM plays in.Be a person who thinks about bettering the world through your work in the technology sector. Applicants must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorship.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Bachelors Degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, Applied Math, EconomicsProven proficiency in analysis and visualization tools such as SQL, Tableau, and Excel.Expertise in writing and creating compelling data-based content and graphics, and presenting them in Word and PowerPoint.Experience with collaboration software tools such as Box, Zoom, Slack and Architect.Experience in social media analysis.Experience working in the tech sector and/or a passion for technology.Polish and presence to work with senior management.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Unwavering attention to detail and excellence.Compassion and respect for fellow colleagues and clients.Entrepreneurial mindset, being able to operate in a highly visible and accountable role. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Advanced Degree in the Engineering/Sciences, Math, Computer Science and/or MBA Strategy or JD.5+ years of work technology flavored experience in: Data Analytics, Market Research, Performance Marketing, Management Consulting, Strategy, Product Management, Communications, PR, or Graphic Design.Existing relationships with leading industry analysts/influencers in emerging technologies space. EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: IT Security Analyst 1
Description: Are you inspired by "what's next"? So are we.  When you join the Albemarle team, you contribute to a better tomorrow. You will play a role in powering many of the world's largest and most critical industries, from energy and communications to transportation and electronics. We are putting innovation to work to improve people's lives and we want YOU to be a part of it. Job DescriptionJob Description The Information Security Analyst assists in the implementation and maintenance of the Information Security Program. This program protects the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of IT assets, networking resources, and intellectual property throughout the corporate environment. The Security Analyst must be able to effectively identify and mitigate internal and external threats to Albemarle's information landscape. The Information Security Analyst should have a combination of both technical and business skills and be capable of balancing business demands against technical capabilities, project budgets, and implementation schedules. From a technical perspective, the Security Analyst should be well versed in security technologies including Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Vulnerability Management, Anti-Virus, Web Filtering, and Firewalls / Intrusion Prevent Systems (IPS). Additionally, the ability to evaluate and prioritize new solutions, both technical and procedural, to remediate risks is a core component of the job. From a business standpoint, the Security Analyst should have experience working with leaders and influencers from non-IT groups, be able to understand business problems, align technical solutions to them, and manage projects to implement them.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Responsible for basic forensics to include deadbox, livebox, memory,Conduct legal holds and journaling.Monitor computer and networks for security issues.Analysis and mitigation of security events.Work with security team to perform tests and uncover network vulnerabilities.Fix detected vulnerabilities to maintain a high-security standard.Stay up-to-date on information technology trends and security standards.Responsible for the technologies, processes, and service providers that deliver Albemarle's Information Security programPromote the brand, vision, and message of Information Security within business units and functional groupsDevelop and support standard operating procedures to simplify and streamline IT processesBe aware of and stay current with emerging threats and security trends Direct experience managing security technologies, specifically in some of the following areas: Forensics softwareThreat IntelligenceSecurity Information and Event Management (SIEM)Data Loss Prevention (DLP)Vulnerability ManagementAnti-VirusWeb FilteringFirewalls / Intrusion Prevent Systems (IPS)Proficient English language skillsAbility to travel Education Requirements Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field or comparable experience with certifications (i.e. CEH, Sec+, Network+, GCIH, GCFA).Experience in information security or related field.Experience with computer network penetration testing and techniques.Understanding of firewalls, proxies, SIEM, antivirus, and IDPS concepts.Ability to identify and mitigate network vulnerabilities and explain how to avoid them.Understanding of patch management with the ability to deploy patches in a timely manner while understanding business impact. Choose to unlock your full POTENTIAL. Apply today. Responsibilities:Experience:Education: Language:SDL2017

Name: Fixed Income P&L Analyst
Description: Job Description: We provide daily, risk-based P&L to the Chief Investments Office (CIO), responsible for managing the Bank's interest rate risk and net interest income. This is done by producing a variety of reports spanning several investment programs and provision of accurate regulatory metrics. We interact real-time with the trading desk and business management to fulfill ad-hoc data requests, process hedges and ensure a controlled reporting environment.  As a member of the CIO Product Control team, the candidate will be responsible for reporting of income and gains of the group's primary portfolios and validating data inputs thereto. The majority of our reports are produced daily, with additional analysis and reporting required around MBS settlement dates and the first ten calendar days of the month. The business operates in both fixed-income and equities markets.  Daily reports are produced in the morning and in the evening, with project work and ad-hoc requests occupying the afternoon. The front office rely on these reports for timely, informed decision making.  We also review Comprehensive P&L and Aging metrics regularly, culminating in month-end routines designed to engage senior management in the Volcker cycle.  Enterprise Role Overview  Responsible for more complex control processes. Maintains and enhances processes, manages daily accounting control project ownership and acts as a system / process subject matter expert. Advanced understanding of more complex structured transactions and strong understanding of the operational risks around the end to end product lifecycle. Requires product experience & knowledge of financial instruments accounting relevant to the area supported. BA preferred or substantially equivalent experience. Typically 3-5 years of applicable experience. To be used for employees in Global Markets only. Required Skills & Experience:Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field2-4 years experience in financial servicesExpert Excel skills/data manipulationProficient in VBA codingDesired Skills & ExperienceDirect support of trading desk and/or P&L preferredPython coding highly desiredSQLShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

This role will also be assigned as a team “Liaison” to two or more of the 7 Government Banking teams to administer preparation of sales proposals, presentation templates, BDR/call plans, division financial and portfolio reporting data analytics, and custom support and project management. Responsibilities: Assist Relationship Managers with various client and portfolio analysis and research projects, call plan development, GovWin/Onvia contract data mining, BDR preparation, proposal and presentation preparation, conference preparation, and provide other sales support as requested  Pull division financial, sales, opportunity and relationship profitability reports, and provide requested data sensitivity, trend and financial analysis. Attend monthly database management calls, submit change requests as authorized by management, and provide pertinent system update or change notification emails to division. Maintain all aspects of the Government Banking Division intranet, loading monthly reports, changing organizational charts, news, etc.  Provide support for various custom and complex customer processes. Provide support for various aspects of legal contracting, KYC, AML and other compliance requirements.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications Bachelors degree, or equivalent work experienceEight to ten years of experience in project management activities  Preferred Skills/ExperienceConsiderable knowledge of Government BankingStrong multi tasking and organizational skillsWillingness and ability to be adaptable and flexibleExcellent independent research, problem solving and communication skillsAbility to meet deadlinesThorough knowledge of project management and data analysisDemonstrated leadership skills

Name: Strategy Analyst (careC2)
Description: Job Description: Leidos makes the world safer, healthier and more efficient through information technology, engineering and science. careC2™, a Leidos Health Products and Services business, is delivering on this mission with a next generation care coordination software solution that enables the healthcare enterprise to effectively and efficiently manage the delivery of care. This single, consolidated environment for managing episodes of care with a real-time, common view for all care providers - including patients, families, clinicians and other care givers or coordinators - reduces variation and potential issues as it follows the patient through each phase of their medical care treatment, measuring how well the care providers are performing against and expected outcome. We are re-imagining how we provide visibility, oversight and management of patients across the entire care continuum that is based on consolidated views of the patient's priorities and holistic, actionable insights aimed at improving productivity and enhancing the patient experience.  We need motivated individuals who want to run fast and shape a new product-line business that is well supported by a large, well-established and aggressively growing organization .  The careC2 Strategy Analyst supports the careC2 Strategy and Business development team. This position reports to the careC2 Director of Strategy and Business Development. The candidate will be responsible for market research and analysis and the development of marketing and strategy collateral. The strategy analyst will work independently to achieve day-to-day objectives with significant impact on operational results or project deliverables and must have excellent communication skills. Duties and Responsibilities:Identify, aggregate, and analyze data to communicate market and resource trends related to careC2 strategic objectives.Research competitive landscape, assess competitors, and develop insights on market requirements for current and future careC2 products.Analyze commercial market conditions to determine the potential sale of products or services and identify business needs, challenges, and opportunities. Duties may include research related to careC2's business environment and decision support analytics (e.g., business intelligence, alternative scenarios, bid/no bid analysis, risk identification, market size, and/or market penetration).Develop complete understanding of careC2's product lines/services to help drive sales and strategy with the ability to analyze complex problems and develop recommendations and solutions.Work with internal and external stakeholders to develop strategy/marketing materials, including detailed descriptions of careC2 products and services.Maintain clear and complete knowledge of business operations and procedures.Monitor and update careC2 sales opportunity pipeline, develop proficiency in opportunity/pipeline software.Mission oriented - High integrity, character, reliability.Qualifications:Requires a BA degree, preferably in business or related field.2-3 years of Experience, Healthcare strategy experience preferred.Superior ability to present data with effective communication and presentation skillsStrong project management skills and experience to support process standardizationProficiency in Microsoft Office suite

Name: Financial Analyst - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Job Summary:Provides financial planning and analysis. Responsibilities Designs, implements and provides products, programs, projects, processes and policies in support of the Financial Planning and Analysis function.  Provides financial services and consulting at the corporate, business unit and/or market level; performs analysis and interpretation of financial and other data; directly supports the CFO and Director of Finance team.  Forecasts, analyzes, and evaluates financial plans and budgets; develops recommendations to achieve financial objectives.  Participates in expense forecasting and actuals process, including research and communication of variances, quarterly earnings, press release support, and competitor analysis.  Analyzes and reports on results of various requests for proposals (RFPs) and programs to include total cost modeling, and prepares cost benefit analysis (CBA) recommendations.  Prepares forecast results commentary; compiles consolidated expense actual and forecast reports for distribution to appropriate leadership.  Analyzes trends, researches issues and responds to inquiries.  Contributes to the development of best practices for company.  Participates in and leads financial variances for forecast, budget and monthly close packages.  Acts as point of contact for programming, responsible for understanding detailed financials, key variances and identifying risks/opportunities to the business  Builds process improvements that identify and track key operating metrics that can be leveraged to develop planning tools.  Creates financial models to support P&L forecasting, annual budgeting process, and evaluation of strategic business decisions.  Interfaces with business, finance & sales leads, accounting partners and IT to ensure accurate data and information gathering.  Performs analysis/deep dives on profitability, revenue trends and other periodic ad-hoc analytical projects.  Performs ad hoc research as necessary; prepares and presents comprehensive evaluations, proposals and recommendations to appropriate leadership.  May assist with annual update of long range forecasts.  May manage budgeting process including preparation of templates, coordination of budget meetings, entering budget information into appropriate systems and preparation of presentation materials.  May develop spend profiles and any performance to business requirements.  May be responsible for training and/or acting as the lead for lower level positions in the group. Name: Data Analyst / Scientist - Audit Manager
Description: Job Description:Delivers data driven value-add analysis, insights, and solutions while guiding and executing assigned areas of audit work. Applies advanced data analytics concepts within the audit framework in order to evaluate risks and controls to assess the effectiveness of various business operating environments. Defines, drives, and executes against an overall strategy to incorporate data analytics across areas of assigned audit coverage. Will contribute to a broader strategy to automate audit testing.  Typically acts as Auditor-in-Charge (AIC) and leads matrix teams to deliver audit projects across multiple Lines of Business. Requires an entrepreneurial sprit and demonstrates strategic thinking in areas of data analytics, automation, and audit concepts. Oversees audit testing to ensure timely execution within quality standards and conformance to audit policies and procedures. Assesses issues for impact to business processes, controls and strategies, recommends severity ratings and escalation of broad themes or trends.  Manages business partner relationships when conducting specific audits; primary engagement is with line management. Exercises critical thinking and judgment to effectively influence management to improve the control environment. When leading an audit engagement, is responsible for day to day coaching, mentoring, and performance feedback. Fosters an inclusive work environment.  This role will have exposure to data related to all Lines of Business (Consumer, Global Markets, etc) and Control Functions (Risk, Compliance, etc).  Ideal candidate will be intellectually curious and have background in data analysis and experience with internal audit methodology. Experience with internal audit and banking products is strongly preferred. Candidate will have the ability to operate in a fast paced environment with multiple concurrent priorities. Minimum Qualifications: College degree required.5 -7+ years of relevant experience.Advanced knowledge and experience with SQL, SaS, R, Python, or similar languagesDemonstrated experience working with large data sets Desired Qualifications: Audit experience at large financial services institutionsSolid knowledge and understanding of audit methodologies and tools that support audit processesAbility to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple prioritiesExperience with automation, machine learning, or artificial intelligenceWorking knowledge of regulatory landscapeWorking knowledge of core Banking concepts and productsStrong written and verbal communications at all levels of managementShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
Description: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer  Job Description:Business Intelligence (BI) Developer Summary: Signature Consultants is seeking an experienced BI developer who will lead a team of approximately five report developers to execute the strategic BI plan developed by the BI architect. This opportunity is in Charlotte, NC. This role will not have responsibility for installation or system administrative setup. These activities will be handled by our Enterprise COE. The ideal candidate will have extensive BI background in developing reporting systems not exclusively isolated report development with solid understanding and exposure to Tableau. Responsibilities:Designing of a reporting system that supports rapid, reusable reporting components with row, column, dimension, and report level security controls.Must be able to lead teams in an AGILE environment and work with Product Owners and SCRUM masters to manage and execute on the backlog.Extensive BI background in non-Tableau tools with a lesser degree of Tableau experience is acceptable when paired with the ability to translate that BI experience to the Tableau system.About Signature Consultants, LLCHeadquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, Signature Consultants was established in 1997 with a singular focus: to provide clients and consultants with superior staffing solutions. Signature offers IT staffing, consulting, managed solutions, and direct placement services. For more information on the company, please visit www.sigconsult.com.

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst - Consumer Allowance
Description: Job Description:Job Description:Job Responsibilities/Additional Information:  The Data Analytics and Reporting role in Allowance team is responsible for the analysis and development of data structures and reports to support the allowance for loan losses and related forecasting and stress testing scenarios. The candidate will work with large sets of data to analyze, understand drivers and prepare summaries for reporting. They will work on dashboard development and effort contributing to report automation. Additional projects and analysis may focus on specific end-to-end loss forecasting and allowance related processes or functions. The position will provide a well-rounded, balanced role with opportunities for interaction with Management, auditors and regulators. The role also provides opportunities to present to a broader group and cross functional management of deliverables. Strong analytical, communication, presentation, time management skills are required. Detailed responsibilities include:  - Working with large data sets, analyze and understand drivers of loss forecast and allowance results  - Dashboard development and visualization of data; explore scope of reports well suited for automation  - Quickly understand the current state and proactively identify opportunities with the transformation as we head in to adopting CECL Standards.  - Aggregates and analyzes allowance and provision for quarter end as well as forecast and stress testing  - Assist in completion of quarterly processes supporting enterprise stress test scenarios each quarter ensuring sufficient reserves and appropriate allowance adequacy  - Assist with SOX compliance and audits requirements.  - Respond to management and business partner requests, providing necessary analytical, allowance and reporting support Required Skills and Experience • Proficient using SQL or SAS, on large datasets for data analysis  * 2- 3 years of experience  * Bachelor's Degree  • Strong Communicator - Clearly conveys information and ideas through a variety of channels to individuals or groups in a way that engages and impacts the audience. Transcends silos to achieve greater enterprise results. Proactively establishes relationships and routines to convey critical business information.  • Analytical Abilities / Financial Acumen - Systematic application of a combination of inductive and deductive reasoning to examine information, interpret results and arrive at well-founded logical conclusions. Understanding of accounting (debits / credits)  • Organization / Time Management - Maintains an organized approach to managing daily activities; is able to simultaneously juggle multiple demands to achieve optimal efficiency and productivity while ensuring the team meets business deadlines and requirements.  • Resourceful - Systematically acquires relevant information to support key decisions; is particularly resourceful in securing hard-to-get information from a variety of sources.  • Results Oriented - Exhibits strong drive for results and success; conveys a sense of urgency to achieve outcomes and exceed expectations; persists despite obstacles, setbacks and competing influences.  • Teamwork - Fosters collaboration among team members and business partners throughout the enterprise; shows skill and ease at working in groups and senior leadership; contributes ideas, opinions and skills toward the achievement of a common goal; views each success as a win for the organization. Desired Skills and Experience: - Understanding of different environments like Hadoop, Teradata, Exadata etc  - Experience with Tableau and/or Microstrategy  - Proven business partnering  - Strong Business Acumen  - eLedger experience  - Exposure to a Finance or Risk Function Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Sr Financial Analyst - Capital Management
Description: Job Description: This role resides within Enterprise Capital Management. The position involves the calculation, reporting and analysis of regulatory and economic capital and risk-weighted assets (RWA) for debt and equity securities. The team member will ensure calculations appropriately handle the positions in the portfolio including new transactions/products; identify alternatives/assumptions within the Basel rules that can tangibly improve the banks capital position; work with support partners to supervise the implementation of models and enhancements to calculations; design and produce reports of capital and RWA; assist in the banks explanation of capital and RWA to the lines of business and senior management; assist in securities capital variance commentary on various regulatory reports, and perform other analyses, such as measuring the effect of changes to rules or to the portfolio.  Enterprise Role Overview  Responsible for more complex finance activities around capital calculation, reporting and/or analysis to support the Bank's Capital Initiatives. Must have a thorough understanding of Basel III. Can work independently. May provide supervision to a small staff. Supports achievement of business goals by working on more complex activities or projects within the unit and with partners. Required Skills and Experience:Finance or quantitative related undergraduate degree or equivalent experience2+ years working in financial services as a financial analystAnalytical ability and problem-solving skills with desire for continual learning including impact of potential new or changing regulationsStrong attention to detail with ability to simplify the complex and drive key initiativesAbility to work collaboratively with teams and interface credibly across various LOBs and support partners at both junior and senior levelsProactive, resourceful and takes initiativeDesired Skills and Experience:Experience with debt securities productsExperience with SQL or other programming languageKnowledge of Basel 3 regulatory rulesAbility to interact and influence analytical teams and model developersSelf-starter with ability to work independentlyResults oriented with the ability to remain flexible in the face of changing prioritiesShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Sr Talent Management Systems Analyst - HRIS
Description: Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Sr. Talent Management Systems Analyst at our facility located in Charlotte , NC . HYG designs, engineers, manufactures, sells and services a comprehensive line of lift trucks and aftermarket parts marketed globally under the Hyster and Yale brand names. We are one of the global leaders in the Material Handling industry and have been building relationships and partnering with our customers, suppliers, dealers and employees for over 80 years. HYG is looking for an energetic, passionate Sr. Talent Management Systems Analyst. This position contributes at an expert level with systems, data management, process improvement, quantitative analysis, project management, issue remediation, operational system support and global consistency (as applicable) to the Global and US Talent Management Systems in support of Learning, Development, Performance, Succession, Recruitment Management and Onboarding. The successful Sr. Talent Management Systems Analyst will have the following Key Accountabilities: Act as the primary technology interface to research and resolve issues and manage day-to-day operations to ensure full functionality of the multiple TM Systems environment for all users. Provide the data necessary to drive learning and performance analytics. Create, review, and maintain system configurations and integrations. Develop and apply acceptance test plans for accuracy and completeness. Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate and implement upgrades, enhancements or patches in test and production systems. Maintain TM system tables and ensure data integrity. Define and develop Governance Plans that include Business Continuity, Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Incident Management. Standardize and document TM system administration and processes. Ensure compliance with Data Privacy Regulations (global) and SaaS Complementary End User Controls. Establish security controls and compliance to meet internal audit standards. Recommends plans for continued process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, policy changes and/or major variations from established policy. Lead and work on a broad range of concurrent projects, independently and with the HR leadership/team. Identifies requirements, gathers workflow data and basic system and reporting specifications for projects and enhancements. Translates business and functional requirements to create functional and technical specifications using system level appropriate modeling and documentation techniques within defined application architectures. Leads the creation and monitoring of development activities according to project plans, defining risks, and anticipating delays and resolving issues. Recommends alternatives to address or mitigate risk. Develop, maintain, and support HR’s reporting capabilities providing a suite of reports to system users as well as management, for use in strategic decision-making. Enable automation for reporting whenever possible. Develop dashboards to answer relevant business questions and communicate report data in a concise and easy to understand format. Review data and identifies trends that ensure HYG maintains state and federal compliance (as applicable). Assists with organizational change management during and post implementation to include communication, training and feedback collection. The successful Sr. Talent Management Systems Analyst will have the following Minimum Qualifications: Minimum of 5-7 years HRIS/Talent Management System Experience. Systems implementation and full system life cycle experience. Experience with systems such as IBM Kenexa BrassRing, SAP SuccessFactors, SkillSoft, ADP and/or Workday preferred. Three years project management experience preferred. IBM Kenexa Workbench Certified preferred. SAP SuccessFactors SFX Accreditation preferred. 10 years of system experience in lieu of degree. Strong understanding of HR processes and data, including eligibility and enrollment rules, and procedures in order to ensure correct implementation. Strong understanding of TMS database design, structure, functions and processes, and experience with databases tools. Thorough knowledge of MS Excel, Word, Visio and PowerPoint. Effective organizational and interpersonal skills including written and verbal communication skills. Project and Vendor Management Experience. Experience managing technical resources, vendors, and projects. Perks: Competitive Healthcare Benefits – medical, vision, dental Profit Sharing + 401K with company matching PTO + Vacation + Paid Holidays Education Assistance Life Insurance Employee Assistance Program On-site Health Clinic On site cafeteria We are an equal opportunity employer with an excellent benefit package including medical, dental and life insurance, 401(k) and profit sharing. EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled - provided by DiceHRIS, Talent Management Systems, SaaD, IBM Kenexa BrassRing, SAP SuccessFactors, SkillSoft, ADP, Workday

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: The Supply Chain Analyst position will be responsible for providing analytical support for Supply Chain/Omnichannel initiatives, Distribution Centers/Logistics KPI improvement, support in developing budgets and forecasts for Supply Chain, develop education material for the broader Belk organization and support key stakeholders in preparation for peak period. An enthusiastic self-starter with a strong drive to improve existing processes & systems is highly desired. The Analyst will be responsible for driving analysis, creation of operational and financial reporting, executive dashboards. Additionally, the Analyst will provide recommendations with an innate focus on key performance metrics and cost drivers related to Supply Chain initiatives that would enabling informed and effective business decisions.Essential FunctionsIdentify & analyze Distribution Centers/Logistics data/trends to drive both strategic and tactical opportunitiesSupport the development of departmental budgets & forecast variances to budget & LYSupport the develop informational material to educate the broader Belk organization on Supply Chain KPIsWork closely with cross-functional teams to support peak period planning and overall Supply Chain initiativesUnder minimum supervision, design, analyze and create management reports/presentations and dashboards.Propose alternative strategic and operational tactics to further improve overall results and efficiencyProvide financial, statistical & operational analyses in support of key initiativesProactively communicate with multiple teams to gather required data needed to validate accuracy of analysisDevelop presentations highlighting key assumptions, business drivers and recommendations to leadershipPerform analysis to reconcile data to source reports to resolve discrepanciesIdentify opportunities for innovation, productivity improvement and savingsRequired Experience and Skills2 to 3 years work experience in Supply Chain, Logistics, Industrial/Operations Engineering, Fulfillment Operations or Finance.1 to 2 years of experience in a quantitative analytical field with in-depth analysis, advanced Excel and large volume data management skills required.1 to 2 years of experience in budgeting and forecasting of expensesRequires sufficient experience to immediately proceed with the responsibilities of the position with minimal assistance.Strong communication and presentation skills; able to communicate effectively in various levels of the organization, i.e. large meeting facilitation, written and electronic communications.Ability to manage tight deadlines.Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and influences, motivates people with no direct authorityProven ability to understand degree of implemented changes and forecast upstream and downstream effects across the supply chain, organization, and end consumer.Advanced computer skills. Experience with: Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Access, Word, Project, Outlook, Visio, Visual Basic, and PowerPoint), Microstrategy, Hyperion/Essbase,Tableau, SQL, and Minitab (or other statistical software) preferred.Required Education & CompetenciesBachelors of Science degree from accredited university in Computer Science, Finance, Industrial Engineering, MIS, Supply Chain, Logistics Management and/or equivalent work experience.Experience in analytical field, building regression models, correlations, etc.Ability to work well under pressure & deal effectively with competing initiativesStrong understanding of and ability to create productivity metrics, related to both efficiency and throughput of systems.Strong financial modeling and financial acumen, related to cost-benefit analysis & proven ability to accurately forecast real-world impact of changes as it relates to retail distribution environmentHighly self-motivated with a passion for driving results and achieving successDesired Education or CompetenciesCSCP (Certified Supply Chain Professional), CPSM (Certified Professional in Supply Management) or PMP (Project Management Professional) designation preferred.Lean or Six Sigma certification.Reports Directly to: Supervisor: Director of Analytics, Supply Chain  Supervises: None  For reasonable accommodation information for an ADAAA qualified disability please see Belk Associate Handbook for policy and procedures.

Name: Airport Ground Transportation and Parking Contract Analyst
Description: Summary:This position will serve as contract manager for CLT ground transportation activities including without limitation contracts with transportation network companies, taxi companies, limo companies and off-airport shuttles. This position will also manage contracts related to airport parking from a business perspective which will be critical as the airport seeks to implement a new PARCS and on-line booking tools. Major Duties and Responsibilities:Assist the Business and Relationship Manager in generating optimum revenue through the effective management, marketing and development of the commercial parking systemProvide contract management support for airport contracts with transportation network companies, taxi companies, limo companies and off-airport shuttle services.Act as liaison among business and revenue, finance, operations, research lead, marketing, and systems supportPerform comparative analyses of fiscal and operational performance data; and analyze and interpret financial and statistical data and operating resultsPerform statistical analysis on occupancy and parking pricing model to track revenue trends, forecasts, and market sharesConduct analyses and asses market changes in local off airport parking facilities and other ground transportation options to ensure CLT parking remains price and value competitive.Conduct analyses and assess market changes related to ground transportation services at the airport including without limitation monitoring and evaluating transportation network company activity and rates.Track and analyze transactional data to ensure accuracy and completeness of financial reportingCoordinate activities between research manager and operations to monitor and track performance indicators to ensure parking is delivering an exceptional customer experienceMinimum Qualifications: Requires a Bachelor’s Degree and three years' experience with data processing and analysis, or an equivalent combination of education and relevant work, military, and/or job specific experience that provides the necessary knowledge, skills and abilities to successfully perform the essential job duties. Preferred Requirements: Experience must include data analysis in either the airport/airline field or a related or applicable field including without limitation government, ground transportation, finance and banking. Familiarity with municipalities and/or airports is preferred. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Familiarity with airports and airline operations and business models is preferred.Familiarity with ground transportation and airport parking models.Proficiency with Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint).Leadership skills with a group or organization preferred by not required.Effective communication and writing skills in communications within a large organization or work group (drafting newsletters, notices, policies, handbooks, etc.).Ability to learn and apply technology/computer skills as necessary.Ability to develop and implement creative new programs and activities.Ability to efficiently multi-task while maintaining personable skills.Ability to demonstrate initiative, creativity and innovative thinking in a rapidly changing work environment.Ability to proactively develop solutions to matters that may arise while maintaining an analytical open-minded approach.Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. Primarily works business hours, Monday - Friday. Schedule subject to calls and work during irregular hours, overtime, and emergency calls back to work. Valid driver’s license in state of residency and ability to obtain and maintain a City Driving Permit. Ability to pass a background check in advance of start date required. Certain convictions will disqualify individuals from unescorted access privileges and therefore exclude from employment. Salary Range: $66,913 - $74,348  The Aviation Department typically hires at a minimum rate. However, exceptions may be considered based on qualifications. How to Apply: If you need assistance completing your online application, you are welcome to visit the City of Charlotte Human Resources Department lobby where we have workstations available.  Our office is located at 700 East 4th Street, Suite 200, Charlotte, NC 28202. Our hours are Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. (EST), excluding official City holidays. Anyone seeking an accommodation to apply for a job may call (704) 336-2285 for assistance or you may email questions to careers@charlottenc.gov.  Conditions of Employment:  The City’s Background Check Policy requires background checks to be conducted on final internal or external candidate(s) applying for any position with the City of Charlotte. The type of information that will be collected as part of a background check includes, but is not limited to: reference checks, social security verification, education verification, criminal conviction record check, and, if applicable, a credit history check, sex offender registry and motor vehicle records check.  Background checks must be in compliance with all federal and state statutes, such as the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA). The checks must be consistent with the guidelines set forth by these laws requiring organizations to obtain a candidate’s written authorization before obtaining a criminal background report, motor vehicle records check or credit report; and to properly store and dispose of information derived from such reports.  Final candidates must pass a pre-employment drug-screening test. During the selection process, candidates may be asked to take a skills test, and/or participate in other assessments.  The City of Charlotte is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
