Name: Senior Financial Analyst (Remote in Eastern US)
Description: JOB SUMMARY Working under moderate supervision, conducts and documents moderate to complex financial analysis, financial reporting and ad hoc finance projects. Aids organization with financial functions, such as assessing, auditing, planning, budgeting, taxes, consolidation, cost control, and project control. Leads special projects and other assigned initiatives. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Evaluates and analyzes a variety of financial results and indicators such as capital expenditures, depreciation, proposals, investment opportunities, rate of return, profit plans, operating records, financial statements, etc. requiring advanced expertise.  Compiles budgetary and fiscal data received from assigned departments to prepare revenue  balance statements and historical comparisons of departmental expenditures with requested  appropriations.  Completes complex analysis of records of present and past operations, trends and costs, estimated and realized revenues, administrative commitments, and obligations incurred to project future revenues and expenses.  Conducts special studies as assigned to support senior management. Develops presentations of findings and results.  Advises management on matters, such as effective use of resources and assumptions underlying budget forecasts. Interprets budgets to management.  Prepares reports analyzing specific aspects of department structures, functions and operational procedures and recommends ways to improve efficiency and/or effectiveness.  Performs other duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May lead project teams and/or plan staff assignments. Duties may encompass technical guidance and/or training of co-workers as well as policy development and participation in special initiatives such as modeling, system implementations or acquisition integrations. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a four-year college or university in a business related field plus a minimum of four years related experience. CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES None. COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information in written and verbal form to subordinates, customers and supervisors. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires strong knowledge of financial terms, concepts and accounting principles and the ability to comprehend and interpret complex financial transactions. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex financial information and transactions and accounting principles. Ability to problem-solve, both independently and working as a team. Requires strong analytical and quantitative skills. OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES Strong computer skills, including specific knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.). Broad experience with other software and financial systems is desired such as HFM Consolidation, PeopleSoft Financials and Cognos Planning. Knowledge of real estate service industry and terminology is helpful. Strong work ethic and adaptable. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Name: ERP Security Support Analyst
Description: Join our growing team! National Gypsum Company is hiring technically savvy and motivated people to provide excellent ERP SECURITY SUPPORT to the ERP Security Team and ERP business users. Enterprise resource planning (ERP) is business process management software that allows an organization to use a system of integrated applications to manage the business. This full-time, entry-level position is geared for those looking to start and grow their career at our Corporate Office in the SouthPark area of Charlotte, NC. Candidates must be flexible and available to work an 8-hour workday between 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. based on manpower requirements and project demand.  National Gypsum Company is a fully integrated manufacturer and supplier of building and construction products worldwide including Gold Bond® BRAND gypsum wallboard, ProForm® BRAND joint treatment products and PermaBase® BRAND cement board. Job Summary: The ERP Security Support Analyst position is an entry-level position that introduces the candidate to ERP Business Functions and the Security access and roles associated with their respective functions. This position will be the Tier One support for all incoming ERP Security access, incidents, and trouble-shooting requests. The ERP Security Support Analyst must demonstrate excellent customer service support and communication skills.  The associate will be self-motivated with a can-do attitude, will follow directions, communicate results succinctly and work with senior team members to understand, troubleshoot, and resolve Business End-User access. Major Job Responsibilities (not all inclusive):Provide first line of contact for ERP Security Support at National Gypsum.Respond to all incoming contacts (calls, e-mails, direct contacts, service management system) for ERP Security support.Demonstrate exceptional customer service skills, coupled with excellent communication skills.Assist Business Users in determining the correct ERP User access.Assist Business Users in trouble-shooting access issues, either through direct or indirect contact.Reset ERP User Passwords.Assign and/or remove ERP Security roles to Users.Must be able to take direction, work as a team, and work autonomously.Must be able to define, troubleshoot, and resolve an issue from inception to completion.Must be motivated to continuously increase personal knowledge of and familiarity with National Gypsum's ERP business functions, to serve as a resource for answering questions regarding ERP Security Access.Prepare and maintain documentation as needed.Assist team members with data analysis as needed.Perform at or above the requested work performance level. Fulfill departmental requirements in terms of providing work coverage and administrative notification during periods of personnel illness, vacation or education.Qualifications:Four-year Bachelor's degree.Preference given to degrees in Information Technology, Internal Auditing, Business Administration with an IT focus, or Technology-related degree from a four-year college or university.Demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Office Products:Excel and WordDemonstrate excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.Knowledge of related technology or business concepts including some of the following:Microsoft O365Microsoft AccessSecurity Authentication versus Security AccessSegregation of DutiesDemonstrate time management skills.Demonstrate problem-solving skills from inception to resolution.Demonstrate professionalism within a professional work place.Strong commitment to safety and the ability to maintain an orderly and safe workplace.Responsive to changing priorities and committed to providing timely and accurate results.Ability to take direction, work as a team, and work autonomously.Benefits Include:Free parking in a modern, friendly, business casual office setting;Competitive wage rate;Comprehensive benefits to include:401(k) and matchRetirement Account10 paid holidaysLife InsuranceShort-term and long-term disabilityFlexible spending accountsWellness Program with medical premium incentivesAnd more Please apply online and answer the questions if you are interested in this exciting opportunity.  Local candidates only.  No phone calls or third-party recruiters, please.  Employment Ready Applicants Only.  The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment contingent upon successful completion of background investigation. Pre-employment drug screening is required. The Company participates in E-Verify. E-Verify is an internet-based system that compares information from an employee's Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification, to data from U.S. Department of Homeland Security and Social Security Administration records to confirm employment eligibility. www.dhs.gov/e-verify. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of an associate assigned to this position. Name: Sr. Treasury Analyst
Description: Are you inspired by "what's next"? So are we.  When you join the Albemarle team, you contribute to a better tomorrow. You will play a role in powering many of the world's largest and most critical industries, from energy and communications to transportation and electronics. We are putting innovation to work to improve people's lives and we want YOU to be a part of it. Job Description The individual is responsible for supporting a variety of treasury initiatives which may include risk management or foreign currency trades/settlements, global multi-currency netting, preparing cash flow forecasts, daily treasury operations management, and supporting analysis of treasury activities, as requested. The individual will lead and serve on various project teams and will have excellent process improvement, business acumen, and technical skills to support a variety of activities, including complex modeling for cash and interest forecasts. The individual is familiar with standard concepts, practices and procedures within the Treasury field, relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, performs a variety of tasks and works independently. The individual proactively reviews current processes and makes recommendations for improvements based on industry and company best practices. Name: Analytic Consultant 4 / Senior Data Analyst Wholesale Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Data Management and Insights (DMI) is transforming the way that Wells Fargo uses and manages data. Our work enables Wells Fargo to empower and inform our team members, deliver exceptional experiences for our customers, and meet the elevated expectations of our regulators. The team is responsible for designing the future data environment, defining data governance and oversight, and partnering with technology to operate the data infrastructure for the company. This team also provides next generation analytic insights to drive business strategies and help meet our commitment to satisfy our customers financial needs.  This Analytic Consultantfor Wholesale Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Data is being created as part of the strengthening of the Wholesale Data Office and its ability to strategically support the business objectives and initiative based investments for the continuous improvement and enhancement of the Customer Data Domain (CRM) for Wholesale Banking and in particular the common Wholesale CRM strategy and objective as part of Whole Relationship Management Foundations (WRMF) initiative.  The Analytic Consultant will be working under the direction and guidance of the WRMF/Wholesale CRM Data Leader and will perform the detailed capture, analysis and documentation of business data elements & taxonomy, business rules and other supporting data for the CRM data management. With input from Wholesale LOB representatives and WRMF process team, perform the necessary alignment and standardization of definitions for key terms and align with WRMF target state system definitions.  Support the data governance and data profiling work in concert with EIT and other resources. Perform data quality gaps analysis and capture data quality rules in support of target state.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Work closely with cross functional teams inclusive of WRMF Process & Tools teams, Wholesale LOB representatives, PPMG, EIT and other disciplines to align business and data strategies for CRM data.Establish and document data taxonomies and other data management artifacts like business glossary, lineage, data quality metrics for effectiveness of data related activities.Work with business to establish data standards in customer data / CRM domain and instrument the ecosystem with data quality measurements and drive continual improvement in data quality.Analyze CRM, Non-CRM and External vendor data.Identify and bring visibility to cross-LOB opportunities regarding CRM data. Enable common definitions and standardization.Data Profiling and Data Analysis.Perform Data quality analysis and profiling and enable the capture of data quality rules.Support the documentation of required data governance artifacts.  LOCATION(S): The preferred location(s) for this job opening is Summit, NJ; Charlotte, NC; San Francisco, CA; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZRequired Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling5 + years of experience gathering business requirements from various sources including end-users and stakeholders5+ years of experience with data analysis and documentation5+ years of SQL experience3+ years of data management experience including data modeling, data integrity and data quality3+ years of financial services experienceDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsOther Desired Qualifications Experience in business data information architecture (metadata), data governance, data analytics, data modeling, or a combination thereof accuracy SQL experience with data profiling and data analysis Experience with Data Quality tools like Informatica DQ 3+ years experience with capture / documentation of data requirements and other data artifacts and usage of Data Governance tools like Collibra Experience with Customer Relationship Management tools like Salesforce, MS Dynamics a plus Solid problem solving skills Experience working hands on with multiple teams in a matrix organization, including ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the company Good working knowledge of technology practices, including lifecycle management and technology risk mitigation techniquesDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

environmentExperience building and implementing model-driven, enterprise-level business solutionsKnowledge of all phases of software development including design, coding, testing, debugging, Name: SAP SuccessFactors Senior Application Business Analyst
Description: Requisition id: 20361  Additional Location(s): None  Sealed Air Corporation is a knowledge-based company focused on packaging solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals in the face of today's biggest social and environmental challenges. Our portfolio of widely recognized brands, including Cryovac® brand food packaging solutions and Bubble Wrap® brand cushioning, enable a safer and less wasteful food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.2 billion in sales in 2016 and has approximately 14,000 employees who serve customers in 117 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com. Job DescriptionPosition Summary: The IT organization of Sealed Air Corporation is responsible for the life cycle planning of business applications through selection, operation, refresh, migration, optimization, retirement and disposal. The Hire to Retire (H2R) tower has the specific responsibility for building or configuring, maintaining and enhancing Human Resource, Payroll, and other employee-facing applications through that life cycle.  The candidate will collaborate closely with other team members to provide the full set of functional services and technical services required to implement and support the company's global Hire to Retire systems.  The SF Employee Central Senior Applications Business Analyst position requires proven business acumen in the SF Employee Central domain. Enterprise technology experience specifically in the areas of SAP SuccessFactors is required. The position requires an education and/or training in computer science, human resources and/or business administration. Experience in configuring the SAP SuccessFactors system to deliver business functionality is required. Familiarity with conceptual solution and platform architectures and/or fundamental programming and/or project management concepts is highly advantageous  The position reports directly to the Director Hire to Retire (H2R) and could be based at our Charlotte, NC Global headquarters or in EMA or APAC regions. Name: Senior Treasury Analyst
Description: Our client is a growing $2.5B+ Global Manufacturer that recently relocated their HQ to South Charlotte. The incumbent has been promoted and they are eager to find their next Top Talent hire. The company prides itself on positive company culture and offers EXCELLENT benefits.Job Description  The individual is responsible for supporting a variety of treasury initiatives which may include risk management or foreign currency trades/settlements, global multi-currency netting, preparing cash flow forecasts, daily treasury operations management, and supporting analysis of treasury activities, as requested. The individual will lead and serve on various project teams and will have excellent process improvement, business acumen, and technical skills to support a variety of activities, including complex modeling for cash and interest forecasts. The individual is familiar with standard concepts, practices and procedures within the Treasury field, relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, performs a variety of tasks and works independently. The individual proactively reviews current processes and makes recommendations for improvements based on industry and company best practices. Responsibilities: Support FX exposure management and evaluate solutions in relation to financial risks (FX, interest rates and commodities); assist with hedge execution and hedge accounting documentation, as appropriate.  Execute domestic and foreign currency funds transfers  Administer and oversee the monthly inter-company multi-lateral netting, as primary or backup  Provide support to administer inter-company loan data, reporting, and documentation  Administer the disbursement files as a backup, including issuance of payments;  Works directly with company financial institutions to identify appropriate bank services/fees, establish and maintain bank account activity  Prepare and/or review general ledger accounts to ensure accuracy of cash, debt and other treasury related activities  Oversees proper internal control of cash assets; respond to audit inquiries in a timely manner; corresponds with banks to initiate or clarify adjustments  Provides analytical support and expertise for the development of liquidity strategies and banking structures.  Utilize and maintain treasury software applications  Provide analytical support for inter-company interest forecasts in support of the Estimated Tax Rate (ETR) calculation and cash flow forecast  Monitor and manage the communications between various internal and external people regarding treasury activities, questions or problems; respond and resolve inquiries in a timely manner;  Support the department to prepare and/or provide analytical support for the treasury department cost control/budget process  Lead and facilitate certain treasury projects, as needed  Serve as a backup to other financial services activities  All duties or treasury projects as assigned  BS Degree in Accounting or Finance  2+ years of treasury experience  CTP is a plus #LI-CQ1

and provides relevant information on current and emerging trends related to competitive labor markets and compensation programs.Participates in training and communication requirements of various documents relevant to human resources with high degree of confidentially, urgency and attention to detail.Ensures compliance with all federal, state and local wage and hour laws, as well as OFCCP Specialists, Finance partners and business management throughout the organization.Strong qualitative and analytical skills including manipulating data, querying, and reporting required. Includes ability to analyze and research compensation trends and partner with appropriate internal and external resources.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCERequired Education / ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Business or Human Resource Management or equivalent experience. Experience with HRMS systems preferred (i.e., SuccessFactors).About SPX SPX Corporation is a supplier of highly engineered products and technologies, holding leadership positions in the HVAC, detection and measurement, and engineered solutions markets. Name: Sr Risk Analyst, Ally Invest
Description: Ally Invest is looking for a Risk team member who is excited about strengthening business line risk and controls to ensure compliance with internal and external requirements aimed at the protection and support of our customers and shareholders. The Sr. Risk Analyst will report to the Risk Manager and support risk and control practices for Ally Invest. We are looking for a partner with strong collaboration skills who is comfortable working across multiple departments and business lines. This will be a hands-on roll, requiring someone who is comfortable working across multiple levels of leadership while also working at different levels of detail (from scheduling meetings and taking notes to challenging action plans and solutions to creating executive-level summaries.) As part of this team, the candidate will support the development, implementation and maintenance of our Risk and Control Self-Assessment activities end-to-end, not only coordinating the process and reporting, but helping identify areas for improved controls and working with the business to implement them. We want a team member to help us look for ways to challenge the status quo and improve efficiency and effectiveness of team processes with a focus on risk practices, operational compliance, trading, operations and customer service. Ally Invest includes a FINRA registered broker dealer, a SEC registered Advisor, Futures and Forex lines of business.  Job Responsibilities  Primary: Risk Self Assessments - Partner with business leads across Ally Invest to prepare for and conduct the annual risk self-assessment (and aligned WSP requirements)  Enhance Risk & Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) w/expansion of Control Inventory (partnering with business line compliance)  Continuously refine RCSA structure, within defined enterprise toolset, and support the conduct of the RCSA in accordance with Independent Risk Management (IRM) requirements, timelines, and hierarchy guidance  Set up appropriate calls / working sessions to evaluate risk controls and practices within each product and functional area  Document results, review with business leads, and support summarization of findings for leadership review  Identify opportunities for the business to incorporate more ongoing testing of controls  Evaluate existing business line controls against new and enhanced processes to identify gaps / areas of improvement  Work with compliance and business teams to define / build new controls and ensure they are in all appropriate inventories and risk / compliance assessments  Support RCSA activities initiated via regular annual schedule as well as when Trigger Events require it to be re-opened and revised  Create business leadership and executive / committee level reporting in accordance with requirements  Support integration of RCSA results into standard WSP / Invest Program assessments in support of the annual certification process  Supporting Responsibilities  Develop and maintain written procedures for risk reports and processes  Build feedback loops and work with teams across the Enterprise on corrective action resulting from internal risk and control reviews, external audits, and self-identified issues  Assist Risk team with risk and compliance training initiatives  Apply knowledge of company policies and standard practices to resolve problems and drive continuous improvement  Assist with other risk activities and administrative efforts such as on-boarding new team members, supporting issue management and resolution, and contributing to both routine as well as customized reporting for all levels of leadership Qualifications Education level: Bachelors Degree or higher  Total years and type of prior related experience: 5 Years Minimum  Prior experience with Risk management practices, whether directly on risk side or business side  Strong Excel skills; must be able to manipulate details in spreadsheets (merge data sets, run compares, create filters / status indicators, etc.)  Knowledge of Project Management methodologies and tools and the software development life cycles; Agile practices preferred  Demonstrate excellent interpersonal and communication skills (personal, written and presentation) and work cross-functionally with business and IT staff  Ability to work with complex problems in an ambiguous environment  Solid PowerPoint / presentation skills preferred  Brokerage & wealth management experience preferred, FINRA Series 7 licensed ideal  Able to prioritize and meet deadlines (project management skills a plus)  Proactive mindset in problem identification and resolution  Independent and self-motivated  Flexible/dependable  Results oriented team player  Organized, detail oriented, thorough and persistent

Name: Sr Fin Analyst-Rpt/Acct Policy
Description: Job Description: This is a highly visible role within Centralized Regulatory Reporting that will support Report Owners assessment of risk and data issues, ensuring assessments are compliant with established procedures and well documented. The role will support regulatory reviews and analysis with responsibility for monitoring key regulatory reporting processes, including data acquisition and validation, compliance with reporting instructions, controls and analysis, and alignment with other external regulatory reporting disclosures. The candidate will help to ensure process improvements by identifying opportunities to automate and standardize processes and effectively challenge how data is reported through analysis and explanation of business drivers impact period over period variances. The position will interface with other regulatory reporting teams to develop standard data sources and to drive a consistency with variance analysis.  Specific responsibilities include: Production of various regulatory reporting schedules and adherence with tight reporting deadlines.Monitor outstanding data and control issues and assess impact across regulatory reporting, drive remediation efforts and identify compensating controls to mitigate risk.Liaise with reporting Subject matter experts within regulatory reporting to drive centralized processes.Prepare business review packages, including governance processes that ensure the accuracy, completeness and relevance of reporting as well as variance analyses that explain fluctuations in terms of business events.Develop control reports for internal and external edit checks; review and validate business responses.Knowledge, Skills and Key Leadership Characteristics:In-depth understanding of financial and banking products including GAAP and regulatory reporting principles.4+ years of relevant finance experience in a large corporate environmentOrganizationally savvy; can work across organizational lines to gain consensus and buy-in from stakeholdersExecution-oriented; with ability to quickly organize work and execute with speedExcellent communication skills written and verbalStrong team engagement skills and organizational skillsStrong technical skills, ability to analyze large volumes of dataUnquestionable business and personal integrity and values congruent with those of the organization.Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Principal Analyst, Service Product Management

Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget.  As a member of the product development division, you will analyze and integrate external customer specifications. Suggest and justify product directions and specifications. Specify, design and implement moderate changes to existing software architecture. Build new products and development tools. Build and execute unit tests and unit test plans. Review integration and regression test plans created by QA. Communicate with QA and porting engineering to discuss major changes to functionality.  Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Founded in 1998 as THE cloud ERP pioneer, Oracle s NetSuite global business unit has transformed the business operations of our customers without the high costs and inefficiency of on-premise systems. Transform your career at NetSuite* At Oracle NetSuite we work hard and we work smart. We hire fierce competitors. We hire individuals that are fearless trail blazers. Oracle NetSuite employees take the hill, we prefer action over inaction, we are tireless in our mission and we pause only to celebrate our success. And we DO celebrate, because if you don t have fun along the way, then what s the point? *Summary:* Oracle NetSuite has an exciting service product management opportunity for a detail-oriented, self-motivated individual to build the next generation of service implementation offerings. Product Management Analyst will be responsible for executing on the Product Management strategy in the service implementation area of services including defining business requirements, working with service teams to translate these to delivery execution and the delivery of service offerings in specified timelines.  An ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication, prioritization, cross-functional team collaboration, and problem solving skills. Name: Senior Data Analyst

Name: Senior Merchandising Strategy Analyst
Description: Job DetailsLevel ExperiencedJob Location Driven Brands Franchise Support Center - Charlotte, NCPosition Type Full TimeEducation Level 4 Year DegreeJob Shift DayJob Category InventoryDescriptionPosition Overview: The Product Strategy team of Take 5 Oil Change is a key growth function focused on increasing both revenue and profitability by defining product/service strategies and optimizing the End-to-End supply chain for the business. The Senior Analyst role will be responsible for, among other things: developing and executing an analytics-based demand planning program, defining assortment and inventory strategies, optimizing retail pricing strategy and planogram design, collaborating with vendors to drive category growth while balancing cost, and implementing robust reporting and management tools to track results. This role reports to the Manager of Strategy and Corporate Development. Primary Responsibilities:Analyzing automotive and demographic trends to define product and service strategiesCollaborating with vendors and Marketing to co-develop category growth strategiesAnalyzing market and internal data to develop localized demand planning and inventory management programsPartnering with Marketing and Marketing Analytics team to optimize pricingPartnering with Marketing to define planogram design and in-shop merchandisingActively managing product quality while analyzing costs and service from vendors, identifying opportunities to improve current supply chainPartnering with the training team to build in-store merchandising program and tools to help ensure flawless execution of merchandising strategyDesign reporting and analytics tools to track performance and inform decision makingQualificationsUndergraduate degree requiredProficiency in Excel and PowerPoint; experience with BI tools/databases is a plus2+ years of post-graduate experience is requiredExperience in merchandising, product strategy, revenue management, inventory management or relevant consulting is preferred, but not requiredExperience in consumer, retail, services or automotive is a plus, but not required

Name: Senior Quantitative Finance Analyst
Description: Job Description: The Strategic and Asset Liability Management Group within Bank of America is seeking a senior quantitative analyst to join our Quantitative Finance (QF) team. QF is staffed by quantitative analysts that apply an extensive set of quantitative methods for effective asset liability management at Bank of America. Methods include but are not limited to behavioral and forecasting models for all loan and deposit products for the banks $2 Trillion balance sheet along with pricing and valuation tools for the banks traded discretionary portfolio. Key decision making activities supported by the QF team include Market Execution for discretionary portfolio and global funding, Interest Rate Risk Management, Balance Sheet Management, Liquidity Management, and associated CCAR processes.  This role will provide an opportunity to learn the QF analytical platform as well as advanced model development techniques. The candidate will join the Quantitative Finance team and will lead junior quantitative analysts on model development, testing, and documentation. Required Skills Strong academic background in econometrics or statistics (M.S. or PhD in a STEM/ Economics field)  Strong skills/intuition in Economics and Finance  Strong attention to detail  Excellent communication skills  Ability to work well in a cooperative, time-sensitive, market-driven environment  Ability to manage multiple priorities with minimal supervision  Ability to work individually and with the group on complex problem solving; analytical skills, critical thinking with a strong desire to learn  Expertise in Statistical Programming Software R, SAS Desired Skills Experience with financial markets, and banking  Places value on process automation with an eye for reproducibility of results  Experience working with Unix/Linux environment  Experience in one or more of the following languages: Python, SQL, Spark  This is not an application developer or programming role. The emphasis is on solid business acumen, data analysis, interpretation, quantitative modeling and creative problem-solving abilities applied to drive business results. Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: HRIS FUNCTIONAL ANALYST
Description: A family of companies and experiencesAs the leading foodservice and support services company, Compass Group USA is known for our great people, great service and our great results. If you’ve been hungry and away from home, chances are you’ve tasted Compass Group’s delicious food and experienced our outstanding service. Our 225,000 associates work in award-winning restaurants, corporate cafes, hospitals, schools, arenas, museums, and more in all 50 states. Our reach is constantly expanding to shape the industry and create new opportunities for innovation. Join the Compass family today!great people. great services. great results.Each and every individual plays a key role in the growth and legacy of our company. We know the next big idea can come from anyone. We encourage developing and attracting expertise that differentiates us as a company as we continue to raise the bar.Job Summary Compass Group, the world’s largest contract foodservice company, has a Great Opportunity for career development and growth here at its North America headquarters in Charlotte, NC as an HRIS Functional Analyst within Compass Group’s North America Division’s Business Systems department.The HRIS team at Compass is responsible for a portfolio of systems and 3rd party vendor relationships. Compass is looking for an experienced functional HRIS professional who will play a key role in the configuration and support of the recruitment process.Key Responsibilities:Participate in all HRIS assigned activities, including process definition and design, documentation, configuration, application testing, as well as some project management and internal communication activities as needed.Work with project team and implementation partners to support deliverables and organizational objectives.Conduct gap analysis, provide impact assessments, and make recommendations that offer workable, efficient options to users. Maintain accurate and updated configuration documentation. Define specifications, support, and monitor applicable integrations (with both core systems and 3rd party vendors).Provide updates to management, project managers and project teams. Escalate issues and risks appropriately and timely. Manage one or more system areas and modules by evaluating the current system’s functional configuration and proactively locate and correct potential problems.Stay informed and up to date on product release schedules and enhancement activities. Work with the appropriate business, HRIS, and vendor resources to define timelines, plans, and activities to support these changes.Provide second level support for all HR system products.Work with team members and vendors to meet defined service level agreements.Test and support products during scheduled ‘off business hours’ system outages.Qualifications:Committed and enthusiastic approach to supporting business customers in a systems environment.Demonstrated proficiency in system conversions, implementations, integrations with ERP and 3rd party solutions, and all SDLC activities.Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.Strong understanding of HRIS and ERP systems (SAP and Talent Management products preferred)Experience with change controls and release management (in both test and production environments).2+ years experience supporting and/or configuring systems or SaaS applications.Experience in application test planning and test execution.Knowledge of all HR business processes, including HR laws and data privacy standards.Effective organizational and planning skills.Proven ability to work independently to complete tasks.Availability to perform maintenance and testing tasks during off business hours.Bachelor’s Degree in HR, Information Systems, or significant equivalent experience is requiredPrevious experience with SAP, applicant tracking, talent management, and learning management system products desired.Apply to Compass Group today!Click here to Learn More about the Compass StoryCompass Group is an equal opportunity employer. Name: Senior Strategy Analyst
Description: The Senior Strategy Analyst is responsible to conduct extensive, accurate analysis of worldwide business performance. The main duties include gathering data, developing and maintaining key metrics for various areas of the business, and providing analytical insights to assist the business in making more informed decisions. This role will also analyze cross-departmental business processes for efficiency and P&L impact. The Senior Strategy Analyst will be responsible for partnering with the CEO and other key executives in all business areas to develop performance monitoring tools and dashboards that assist in driving business results. This role will have a broad range of responsibility from analyzing operational data, providing weekly/monthly Scorecards regarding key performance metrics, providing ad-hoc analyses to executive level management, driving process improvement initiatives and acting as a key liaison between departments to ensure alignment with short and long-term strategic objectives of the company. Your day to day...Analyze and prepare cross-departmental presentations, including variance analysis, trending KPIS and margin analysis.Interact with all levels of leadership to gather, analyze, and prepare recommendations regarding financial plans, new product introductions, variance analysis, and operating forecasts.Develop and deliver valuable and actionable business information directly to our internal usersLeverage advanced software functionality to create user guided dashboards, scorecards, reports, queries, and summariesSuggest improvements and enhancements to processes and systems in order to increase customer satisfaction and improve productivity & efficiencyRecognizing and acting on appropriate opportunities to increase benefit through additional analysisKeeping apprised of reporting best-practices, and recommending visualizations to best represent the dataExtract, combine, and filter data sets from source systems and warehouse, as well as utilizing external data sources to meet internal client specificationsP&L management responsibilityAdditional ad-hoc reporting and analysis as neededInteract consistently with Operational leadership to determine level of reporting needs and support · Gather, analyze, and prepare recommendations regarding variance analysis and operational performanceDevelop and delivers valuable and actionable performance metrics directly to internal stakeholdersManages daily/weekly/monthly KPI reporting which aligns with critical business objectivesManage monthly and quarterly pro-forma meetings and updates, provide leadership regarding business intelligence and interpretation. Deliver monthly reporting to Executive management.Assist in the preparation of presentation packages for the board of directorsAssurance activities Reviews reporting for correct coding, validates requests compared to budget and business requirementsWhat we are looking for...BS/BA in Accounting or Finance or equivalent work experienceMinimum 5 years of relevant experience3+ years of reporting and analytical experiencePresentation development as well as strong written and oral communications skillsOrganized and professionalSelf-motivated and resourceful with a driven mindsetAdvanced mathematical skills to initiate, review and generate graphs, numeric data as well as statisticsAbility to work effectively both individually and as a teamProficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint with the ability to quickly learn various in-house or common database reporting and analysis toolsSense of urgency ability to work well in high pressure situations and meet deadlinesExpert in creating dashboards and data visualizationAdvanced knowledge of Business Object or equivalent data visualization toolStrong overall ERP systems strengthsStrong analytical ability; able to clearly link financial results to operational activitiesStrong skills in building informative professional reports and providing template structures for businessAble to organize and prioritize workload while managing to deadlinesAbility and desire to wear many hats within the organizationPrevious financial analytical consulting experience preferred.Be part of something scent-sational...Competitive payMedical, dental, vision, and life insuranceCompany matched 401kFun, team-focused work environmentEmployee driven community outreach program

Name: Presales Technical Consultant
Description: What if you could shape the future of work and be part of the team that creates the digital workforce of tomorrow, using Robotic Process Automation?  In the beginning of the 20th century, Henry Ford had a vision of creating assembly lines and facilitating mass production.  100 years later, UiPath has a grand vision of liberating the human workforce from tedious, repetitive tasks, by means of Robotic Process Automation.  If you like to think ahead, like we do, then we must talk.  Here's what you would be doing at UiPath: Scope of activities: For your Client: Lead end-to-end presales activitiesCreate strong value propositionsEnsure delivery of strong RFx’s, contextualized demos and powerful POCsPerform tailored, high-level demos demonstrating business valueDesign high level solutions to fit client needs and environment during the deal processResolve client concerns around technical capabilities, information security, and platform architecture during the sales process For UiPath: Actively engage in product release cycles to market new releases and provide feedback on the product roadmapParticipate in deal shaping and sizing with the Sales teamCreate, update and maintain knowledge bankStay up to date on technologies in the marketplace, as well as competitive technologiesParticipate in knowledge sharing inside and outside of your teamJob Profile Critical Minimum Requirements:Basic programming knowledge – minimum 1 years programming experience in .NET (C#, C++ or VB) or JavaMinimum 4 years experience in a client-facing pre-sales, professional services or technical roleAvailable to travel up to 30% of the timeFluent written and spoken English is mandatory, competency in other languages is a plus Bonus Points for: Previous experience with working with UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, OpenSpan, WorkFusion or NiceIMPORTANT Note: You should have the profile of a Software Developer, who now wants to switch to a Consultancy role. Benefits We are offering the possibility to work from home or flexible working hours in a nice office plus free daily premium catering  Competitive salary, a Stock Options Plan and the unique opportunity of working with us to develop state-of-the-art robotics technology are just a few of the pluses  Healthcare plan and a 401K planWe must have caught your attention if you've read so far, so we should talk

Name: Strategic Business Analysis and Planning Specialist
Description: When the global aerospace community looks for ideas and solutions to its biggest challenges, they turn to the people of UTC Aerospace Systems. We design, invent and deliver the most advanced and diverse range of aerospace systems on the market. We are inventors. We are manufacturers. We work in space exploration, commercial air travel, defense and rescue applications. Always learning and pushing the boundaries, we are an undisputed industry leader that continually sets the bar higher and higher. Come soar with us.  At UTC Aerospace Systems, were ushering in a new era of customer service, with sophisticated tools that enable real-time customer connections and service anticipation techniques. We combine these innovations with responsive repair performance, product support and issue resolution for our global customers. Anytime. Any place. Its this kind of best-in-class support that has kept our customers coming back for the past 100 years. Want to join the largest aftermarket network in the industry, with more than 50 maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) locations across 26 countries? You can learn from the best while bringing your fresh perspective and enthusiasm for customer service to our team. If those closest to you would use the words reliable and dependable to describe you, you could be a good fit for our team!  The UTAS Worldwide Repair Organization is looking for individuals who enjoy problem solving with the intent of having significant impact on the strategic direction of a multi-billion dollar business. We are looking for people who like taking complex problems, breaking them down, and finding solutions that help us become a better business. This individual will be a key team member on a high visibility team who will help guide senior management in the development and implementation of the companys strategy. This individual will also be integral in the execution of the strategies as well. In this position, the individual selected will work projects with an interesting combination of finance, operations, and market dynamics that will have a big impact on the direction and future performance of UTAS Worldwide Repair. Primary Responsibilities:Interfacing with senior management to provide strategic direction for Worldwide Repair in the areas of market share growth, market share protection, and operational improvementIntegrating with the UTAS Business Unit repair network to develop companywide business insight and strategyDeveloping and implementing market trend and market share models, providing insight to the larger repair network, developing action plans to address identified gapsDeveloping sustainable tools that provide for efficient analysis of the business current state and lead to rapid decision makingInteracting with business stakeholders to understand their problems and providing cross functional guidance and expertise, working with employees from various backgrounds (finance, operations, supply chain, quality, engineering, sales, marketing, etc.)Qualification:Basic Qualifications:The ability to adapt in a fast paced environmentA strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially ExcelA familiarity with Aerospace industry or general Aftermarket businessStrong program management skills and the ability to run multiple projects simultaneouslyStrong problem solving skills, developing entrepreneurial solutions to problemsGood written and verbal communication skills Preferred skillsExperience leading in matrixed organizationsExperience in advanced data querying and analytics tools (e.g., SAS, SQL, Tableau, Vba)Education:Bachelors degree in Technical, Business or Finance related field required with 2-6+ years of experience in operations, engineering, or finance.Masters degree preferred. Nothing matters more to UTC Aerospace Systems than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen. Note:Background check and drug screen required (every external new hire in the U.S.)Drug Screens for re-hires only performed for previous employees who have been gone from company for more than 1 year. UTAS4220482United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Name: Corporate Treasury Business Controls - Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job Description: The Corporate Treasury Quality Assurance and Business Controls team is part of the Corporate Treasury. The primary focus of our team is validate effectiveness of processes/controls supporting Corporate Treasury functions, including Enterprise Capital Management, Global Liquidity Management, Corporate Investments, Global Funding, Treasury Finance, Balance Sheet Management, and Enterprise Insurance Management. Coverage also includes regulatory compliance (e.g., Basel - Capital and Liquidity) and related enterprise standards and policies (e.g.. Enterprise Data Management). Our business partners include various groups through CFO organization, GT&O, Risk and Compliance teams. Key priorities for our team are provide affirmative evidence supporting ongoing compliance with enterprise policies and standards, including applicable regulatory and reporting requirements, as well as Treasury Control Framework.  Support execution of Treasury Control Framework, including process and control design assessment, compliance with enterprise control frameworks and programs, various control strategic projects and assist in execution of Treasury QABC group's administrative tasks and routines.  The teammate in this role is responsible for:  1) Assist in designing and conducting design and operating effectiveness testing to ensure ongoing compliance with Basel rules (Liquidity and Capital)  2) Participating in discussions with process and control owners to develop approaches to resolve gaps, and/or address weaknesses or deficiencies when necessary  3) Identifying documents, and maintain evidence supporting process and controls objectives  4) Participating in teams conducting the validation work streams  5) Engaging key business partners to facilitate completion of assigned deliverables and explain results  Throughout the tenure of the role, the teammate should gain exposure and acumen in Basel regulations and business processes/controls relied upon for compliance with these regulations across the Corporation.  6) Ability to work in large team and work on long term projects while maintaining flexibility on deliverables.  Throughout the tenure of the role, the teammate should gain exposure and acumen in Basel regulations and business processes/controls relied upon for compliance with these regulations across the Corporation.  Enterprise Role Overview  Provide analytical support in executing internal control discipline and operational excellence within a LOB/ECF. Gather and organize data in order to monitor and test the effectiveness of key controls and status of mitigation and action plans. Prepare documentation for the tracking, monitoring, and escalation of risk related issues to management. Acts as an ambassador of the risk culture. Incumbents typically have over 5+ years of risk management and/or LOB/ECF experience. May manage staff. Required Skills and Experience:Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience3-5 years of large complex banking treasury experience3-5 years of direct Treasury Business Controls experienceOperational risk, compliance risk or audit within treasury experience also beneficialBig 4 experience auditing large complex bankUnderstanding of complex financial instrumentsExperience working with complex data setExcellent communication and presentation skillsExperience in a centralized cross-functional role, coordinating across many groups and presenting relevant information/ results.Desired Skills and Experience:MBA, CPA, CFA or equivalentBig 4 assurance experienceGovernance and oversight experienceRegulatory ReportingFinancial ReportingComfort with complex financial productsAdvanced data manipulation/Excel/ModelingSAP/eLedger

Name: Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities.  Business Unit:Enterprise/Operational RiskJob Summary Barings and its subsidiaries serve institutional investors around the globe and have over $305+ billion. Through proprietary research, analysis and a focus on investment fundamentals, the firm develops products and strategies that leverage its broad expertise in global fixed income, equities, alternatives, structured products, debt financing for corporations and debt and equity financing for commercial real estate. The firm maintains a strong global footprint with operations on four continents, and with major offices in Charlotte, Springfield, Boston, New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, London, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Sydney and Melbourne. Barings is a member of the MassMutual Financial Group.  Barings Enterprise Risk Management Department is seeking a Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst to provide ongoing support of the firm’s Investment Risk Management framework. As part of Barings broader Enterprise Risk Management program, the Investment Risk Management function is responsible for developing and implementing a standardized framework to identify, measure, and monitor market and investment risks on a firm-wide basis. The Analyst will work with associates across the firm to assist in the global implementation of advanced risk analytics using MSCI’s BarraOne, develop factor-exposure risk analytics of fixed income portfolios, expand the portfolio optimization efforts and provide ongoing support to the firm’s senior risk and portfolio management professionals. A successful candidate will have specific knowledge & experience with quantitative risk analysis around risk factor exposures for various asset classes. In addition, they must be able to build effective relationships with the key stakeholders in business & support areas and drive forward critical risk project implementations. Strong knowledge and experience with MSCI’s BarraOne, Barra Developer’s Toolkit and Barra Open Optimizer are essential. Experience with MatLab is highly desirable.  This position will report to Barings Head of Investment Risk and will be located in the Charlotte, NC office. Occasional travel to other Baring’s office locations may be required. ResponsibilitiesLead MSCI’s BarraOne deployment and spearhead the efforts for significant enhancements of the existing quantitative risk infrastructure around risk factor analysis.Deliver demonstrable improvements to investment risk processes and investment risk insights to our portfolio management teams.Increase the sophistication of the risk management processes and be the Subject Matter Expert for risk factor analysis & optimization using MSCI’s BarraOne and other quantitative tools.Perform risk analysis using factor models, build quantitative risk tools and support risk research to explain the key risk exposures that drive investment performance for our products.Support market risk report creation and analytics calculation and integration of risk models through broad projects (e.g., risk factor calculations, VaR, portfolio optimization, stress testing).Work with third-party vendors and internal associates around asset modeling enhancements.Partner with our Technology and Operations teams on broader firm initiatives such as those related to our risk and data infrastructure.Rapidly learn our existing risk infrastructure, databases and proprietary risk tools and handle detailed risk reporting and presentation requirements.QualificationsBachelor or Graduate degree (preferably science or engineering) with background and solid understanding of market risk concepts (multi-factor risk models, VaR, correlations, PCA) and their relevant applications. FRM/CFA designation is desirable.7+ years of experience in the financial services industry, preferably in a market risk function or in a quantitative portfolio analyst role at an asset management firm.Proven hands-on experience of MSCI’s BarraOne and knowledge of fixed-income portfolio optimization techniques.Advanced knowledge of fixed income products and their associated derivative instruments; this includes corporates, leveraged loans, CLOs and credit default swaps.Experience with MatLab programming and good working knowledge of SQL. Familiarity with BI tools (such as Microsoft Power BI) is desirable.Some experience with Intex Solutions for structured products is desirable.Self-starting and collaborative personality with a clear sense to move forward critical projects though teamwork in both functionally and geographically dispersed environment Barings is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; Minority/Female/Age/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply.

Name: Senior All Source Analyst - Charlottesville
Description: ZelTech is a veteran and minority owned professional services and information technology solutions business dedicated to bolstering US national security. We deliver expert advice, critical technologies and cost-effective solutions to help customers gather essential knowledge, collaborate efficiently, decide quickly and act decisively. Our staff includes experienced operational specialists, analysts, engineers, scientists, and program managers. ZelTech Team members and employees have the opportunity to connect with each other in a work environment of cutting-edge technology that is characterized by a strong sense of caring, community and mutual respect. We are committed to providing our employees with a comprehensive variety of elective benefits to include, but not limited to: Competitive Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Assistance Program, Basic Life and AD&D Insurance, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Holidays and Paid Time Off, 401(K) Retirement Plan with employer matching, Referral and Merit Bonuses, Computer Purchase Program, and Education Reimbursement. Name: Business Initiatives Consultant 3 - Wholesale Initiative Support
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. We focus on three key risk areas: credit risk, operational risk and market risk. We help our management and Board of Directors identify and monitor risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and take appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.Wholesale BankingWholesale Banking, led by Perry Pelos, provides financial solutions to businesses across the United States and globally, with annual sales generally in excess of $5 million. It has nine major business lines, including: Business Banking, Middle Market Banking, Government and Institutional Banking, Corporate Banking, Commercial Real Estate, Financial Institutions Group, Wells Fargo Commercial Capital, Wells Fargo Securities, and Principal Investments. It also has groups in credit risk, operational risk and compliance, finance, marketing, human relations, and the Wholesale Chief Operating Office supporting its businesses.The RoleThe Wholesale Financial Crimes Risk & Controls (WFCRC) team is responsible for the coordination, oversight and ultimate execution of Wholesale Bankings commitments to key internal and external stakeholders as it relates to the management of financial crimes risk with the Wholesale Bank. In addition to having responsibility for Wholesale Bankings execution of the Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML) program, WFCRC is also responsible for the remediation of the OCC BSA/AML Consent Order. This team will partner with line of business (LOB), operations, risk and compliance team members, Wholesale Control Executive Office, Enterprise Financial Crimes Risk Management, Wells Fargo Audit Services, and Testing & Validation to advocate and ensure alignment in scope, purpose, expectations and execution of the Wholesale Financial Crimes Program. The team will achieve this through a focus on strong communication, strategic planning, thoughtful and meaningful tracking/reporting, and timely escalation and change management.The Control Strategy & Implementation team within WFCRC is seeking a dynamic team player. This organization will help provide expertise and oversight specific to change management, initiative implementation and the control strategy.The Business Initiatives Consultant will lead coordination and delivery of WFCRC cross-operational initiatives; provide strategic planning and execution oversight, leadership support, and vendor / partner management. Responsibilities will include:Developing and sustaining relationships between the Control Strategy & Implementation Team and other WFCRC management programsProvide strategic level view on process-related activities across the WFCRC organizationDriving and reporting status and progress on Initiative efforts, including planning and completing deliverables, reporting executive level status, and engaging with stakeholders across the WFCRC footprintOverseeing and ensuring program, process and data quality and controls, and proactively implementing enhancementsFacilitating development of education, communication and other change management activities to evolve program understandingFacilitating critical discussions with key stakeholders, documenting key decisions and tracking follow-up actionsDeveloping presentation and other informational materials (e.g. executive reporting, pipeline reporting)Drive design and implementation of process improvements across WFCRC, through partnership with the WFCRC process engineers and core vertical SMEs, to increase efficiencies in operational processes and reduce risk through a standardized set of approaches to core WFCRC processesLend thought leadership to design, improve, support intake pipeline management routines including resource assignments as well as develop appropriate documentationParticipate in the design and management of key performance indicatorsIndividual ResponsibilitiesIn general a BIC3 is responsible for leading cross functional/virtual teams to strategize, plan and execute a variety of programs, services and initiatives that are larger in scope and complexity. Examples might include, but are not limited to: finance / operational / executive management review coordination, process improvement and redesign, change management initiatives, ongoing oversight of a leadership / diversity / recognition / Q12 or general program oversight. Provides leadership to other consultants and analysts in the integration/implementation of programs/services/initiatives with cross functional business partners, recognizing the significance of competing priorities and strategies, and adjusting as necessary. Develops metrics and tracks/evaluates performance of programs, services and initiatives. Ensures plans/programs adhere to appropriate policies and regulations. May manage a small team.Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. Name: Senior Finance Analyst BFC Product Associate
Description: Job Description: The Global Loan Portfolio Management (GLPM) Business Finance & Controls (BF&C) team is part of GBAM Finance and is responsible for coverage of the GLPM business - a public side trading desk tasked with credit risk hedging the firms corporate loan portfolios including both fair value and accrual accounting. GLPM manages potential default loss, mark-to-market volatility, and overall P&L associated with corporate loans and the cost of hedging.  The Finance team supports the desk in a Business Finance Officer (BFO) capacity, along with trade support and control functions to ensure proper reporting of the balance sheet and financial results. Core responsibilities include daily, weekly and monthly risk and P&L reporting, explains, reconciliations and commentary; quarterly accounting disclosures; balance sheet reviews; audit coordination (internal & external, SOX); month end close; reserve calculations; pricing adjustments; and planning/forecasting.  As part of the responsibilities of the role, the teammate will also develop business partner relationships with the various businesses, controller groups and other support partners. Throughout the tenure of the role, the teammate should gain exposure and acumen in funded and unfunded loan balances, various lending products, FTP, Allowance for Loan Loss, Capital (Basel 3A, Basel 3S, SLE), and several other areas of the organization. The candidate will develop or improve the following skills: Business Partnering, Management Reporting Focus, Process Control, and Capital Management.  This is a well-rounded role in which candidates have the opportunity to partner closely with the GLPM desk (Front Office), Risk and other senior finance managers. Candidate will learn to view complex traded products at a macro and micro level, as well as how to deconstruct balance sheet and P&L to provide analytical support to the desk and other business partners. The role also involves development and enhancement of financial analytics platforms. Required SkillsBS / BA Degree Required - (Accounting, Finance, or Economics Preferred)1 - 3 years accounting or finance experienceUnderstanding of accounting (debits / credits), reconciliation, balancingUnderstanding of ledger, and sub ledger systems (SAP/eLedger, Oracle, Finman, etc)Advanced in Microsoft Office suite of products with emphasis on strong Excel (macros, pivot tables, etc) as well as various Bank specific reporting tools (EPM, FMA, etc)Must be able to work across the organization to research and resolve issuesHighly organized, detail oriented, proactive, and able to multitask in a deadline driven environmentIndependent learner and thinker, Initiative, Insight, leadership skillsDemonstrated financial acumen with analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to communicate, partner and influence across a matrix organizationDesired SkillsMBA / CPA / CFAExperience with loans, derivatives and/or bondsExperience with Bloomberg, Loanrunner, ACBS, BUCS, Access, and/or SQLFASB / SEC ExposureExperience around regulatory reporting, Sarbanes Oxley, capital reporting and metricsShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Senior Finance Analyst - Business Support
Description: Job Description: This BFO (Business Finance Officer) will partner with Chief Operating Officers, Business Finance Officers, Application Managers, Forecasting Reporting and Analytics, Corporate Allocations  Engaging with partners to understand financial implications of key business needs. Identify develop and drive process improvements. Develop seller side reporting and analytics to drive efficient cost management. Develop impact analysis to review and validate changes to costing and buyer methodologies Create Proformas for review and approval by Tech BFOs prior to Forecast cycle. Serve as control point for updates to application cost and buyer distributions to ensure changes are fully assessed and communicated. Partner with Global Human Resources to analyze personnel trends and forecast as a key expense driver.
