Name: Analytic Consultant 4 / Senior Data Analyst Wholesale Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  Data Management and Insights (DMI) is transforming the way that Wells Fargo uses and manages data. Our work enables Wells Fargo to empower and inform our team members, deliver exceptional experiences for our customers, and meet the elevated expectations of our regulators. The team is responsible for designing the future data environment, defining data governance and oversight, and partnering with technology to operate the data infrastructure for the company. This team also provides next generation analytic insights to drive business strategies and help meet our commitment to satisfy our customers financial needs.  This Analytic Consultantfor Wholesale Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Data is being created as part of the strengthening of the Wholesale Data Office and its ability to strategically support the business objectives and initiative based investments for the continuous improvement and enhancement of the Customer Data Domain (CRM) for Wholesale Banking and in particular the common Wholesale CRM strategy and objective as part of Whole Relationship Management Foundations (WRMF) initiative.  The Analytic Consultant will be working under the direction and guidance of the WRMF/Wholesale CRM Data Leader and will perform the detailed capture, analysis and documentation of business data elements & taxonomy, business rules and other supporting data for the CRM data management. With input from Wholesale LOB representatives and WRMF process team, perform the necessary alignment and standardization of definitions for key terms and align with WRMF target state system definitions.  Support the data governance and data profiling work in concert with EIT and other resources. Perform data quality gaps analysis and capture data quality rules in support of target state.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Work closely with cross functional teams inclusive of WRMF Process & Tools teams, Wholesale LOB representatives, PPMG, EIT and other disciplines to align business and data strategies for CRM data.Establish and document data taxonomies and other data management artifacts like business glossary, lineage, data quality metrics for effectiveness of data related activities.Work with business to establish data standards in customer data / CRM domain and instrument the ecosystem with data quality measurements and drive continual improvement in data quality.Analyze CRM, Non-CRM and External vendor data.Identify and bring visibility to cross-LOB opportunities regarding CRM data. Enable common definitions and standardization.Data Profiling and Data Analysis.Perform Data quality analysis and profiling and enable the capture of data quality rules.Support the documentation of required data governance artifacts.  LOCATION(S): The preferred location(s) for this job opening is Summit, NJ; Charlotte, NC; San Francisco, CA; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZRequired Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling5 + years of experience gathering business requirements from various sources including end-users and stakeholders5+ years of experience with data analysis and documentation5+ years of SQL experience3+ years of data management experience including data modeling, data integrity and data quality3+ years of financial services experienceDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsOther Desired Qualifications Experience in business data information architecture (metadata), data governance, data analytics, data modeling, or a combination thereof accuracy SQL experience with data profiling and data analysis Experience with Data Quality tools like Informatica DQ 3+ years experience with capture / documentation of data requirements and other data artifacts and usage of Data Governance tools like Collibra Experience with Customer Relationship Management tools like Salesforce, MS Dynamics a plus Solid problem solving skills Experience working hands on with multiple teams in a matrix organization, including ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the company Good working knowledge of technology practices, including lifecycle management and technology risk mitigation techniquesDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Sr. PMO Analyst
Description: Logistics done differently.At XPO Logistics, we know that cutting-edge technology drives our success. As the Senior Project Management Office (PMO) Analyst, you will be responsible for effectively managing the IT Services and Solutions (ITSS) project health check, facilitating the financial vendor management, contributing to project intake and portfolio management, and developing processes for timely and accurate data collection and reporting. You will put your leadership skills and years of experience to use by training and communicating with employees, balancing multiple medium-sized projects, and developing collaborative working relationships with business partners and technical experts. In this role, you have the ability to positively affect XPO’s future through advice and counsel.Pay, benefits and more.We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability, and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.What you’ll do on a typical day:Actively participate in the planning process for the ITSS portfolioAssist PMO with creating dashboards to reflect project health, across schedule, cost, and scopeDefine reporting requirements for the ITSS organization to measure performance, working with the BI team to identify data sources and collection methodsEngage with the vendor management process, helping to facilitate the review of SOWs, cost estimations, and invoice resolutionDevelop and monitor project-based cost management methodology in order to accurately reflect expenditures against budgetEstablish metrics and reporting for managing financial performanceWhat you need to succeed at XPO:At a minimum, you’ll need:Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related field5 years of experience in financial and program management and analysisIt’d be great if you also have:Master’s degree in Business or finance-related fieldStrong strategic and operational planning skillsMeticulous attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skills; able to present clean, organized, and thorough information and data appropriate for intended audienceBe part of something big.#LI-CM2XPO provides cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies, including Disney, Pepsi, L'Oréal, Toyota and many others. We’re the fastest-growing transportation company on the Fortune 500 list and we’re just getting started.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran, or other protected status.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Name: Technical Analyst - SOA/ESB
Description: Req ID: 32643 At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. Name: Data Standardization Analyst
Description: Data Management is part of the Informational Services Division (ISD). The Data Management Team is a client focused, technology enabled team, producing High value & unique analytics & data derivations to drive insight and value to our internal and external stakeholders. Data Management is responsible for creating LSEG Intellectual Property by generating ICB Classifications, Free Float and similar data fields based on data standardization from raw data.  For our team based in Kuching / Fort Mill we are currently recruiting for an Analyst Position in our Data Management Team. Analysts manage a wide range of data & information on a universe of companies, and for ensuring quality and accuracy in all our products.  We are looking for individuals with very high attention to detail and who can work under strict delivery timelines. Besides data management you are expected to become a subject matter expert on capital markets and their operations, and information on companies and securities. Key ResponsibilitiesStandardize & Maintain quantitative and qualitative data from multiple information sources including annual reports, websites, and other filings of public and private companies to a high degree of qualitySupport analysis with brief comments and rationaleProvide appropriate references of source documents usedDevelop strong subject matter expertise on various parts of our data methodologyIdentify and suggest ideas for reducing effort spent on data management and analysis by using automation or by process optimizationContribute towards developing and maintaining methodology guidance and quality manualsThe ability to work effectively with peers, research analysts, and manager – both within the team as well as other teams in multiple time zones.Key Behaviours and Skills RequiredBachelor’s Degree or equivalent experienceExcellent Analytical SkillsExcellent English Language Skills (write, read, talk)Excellent problem-solving skillsAbility to work independently with high degree of ownershipAbility to meet strict weekly timeliness and quality standards established by the departmentAbility to multi-task and be results driven People are at the heart of what we do and drive the success of our business. Our colleagues thrive personally and professionally through our shared values of Integrity, Partnership, Innovation and Excellence are at the core of our culture. We embrace diversity and actively seek to attract people with unique backgrounds and perspectives. We are always looking at ways to become more agile so we meet the needs of our teams and customers. We believe that an inclusive collaborative workplace is pivotal to our success and supports the potential and growth of all colleagues at LSEG.  A career with London Stock Exchange Group offers you the opportunity to be at the centre of the financial community. As well as competitive salaries and a range of attractive benefits, we maximise each employee’s potential through personal development plans, training, coaching and mentoring.  Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information the London Stock Exchange Group (“We”) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained. If you would like this information to be removed from the London Stock Exchange Group HR database, please contact workday@lseg.com. If you choose to have your information removed, you will be removed as a candidate and we will not be able to progress your application for opportunities at the London Stock Exchange Group.

Name: Database Analyst/Developer
Description: AGDATA, LP is currently seeking a Database Developer (Oracle PL/SQL) to support one of our largest accounts. This position will sit at our corporate location in South Park, Charlotte, NC.  We are seeking an IT professional with Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Information Science or relevant degree with minimum of 3 years experience in Oracle (preferred) or Microsoft SQL database programming, reporting tools and data analysis. A successful candidate must also have solid SQL skills, be able to write and debug complex SQL statements and stored procedures, and be skilled at identifying and resolving problems.  A preferred candidate will also have a strong interest in business intelligence reporting and possibly have some experience with data reporting business intelligence tools such as Microstrategy, Sisense, or Tableau. Any experience with full-stack Microsoft technologies including C#, ASP.NET, or MVC would help the candidate become an integral part of our company’s future direction.  This person would become an important part of our growing development team that is using new and innovative technologies to rethink how we service our clients. If you enjoy solving business problems by creating inventive solutions then this may be the team for you. We are looking for an enthusiastic, creative developer with 3-5 years of experience who is not afraid to take ownership of a project and thrives working in a highly collaborative environment. Responsibilities:Create reports for analytic needs of the client using Oracle SQL and PL/SQLExecute quality control checks of Oracle SQL and PL/SQL based analytic reports created by other developersWork to develop a reporting platform using an industry-leading business intelligence tool that could eventually replace ad hoc query based reportsParticipate in client business needs discussions and translate those needs from a data perspective into technical executionsTroubleshoot errors as they occurCreate and maintain technical documentation, process flows, etc. as requiredWork with Development Manager to manage client interactions and expectations regarding development effortsAbility to multi-task and comfortable with quickly switching from one task to anotherComply with and help to enforce standard policies and proceduresMentor/train other team members as needed and be open to receiving the sameParticipate in weekly team meetings and conference callsTrack and enter time in time management toolQualifications:3+ years of experience with Oracle (preferred) and/or Microsoft SQLExperience with SQL Navigator or ToadReporting/Business Intelligence toolAbility to debug codeStrong written and verbal communicatorDocumentation skills for process flows, business rules and technical documentationWho we are: AGDATA is the premier provider of data collection and management, marketing program management, and analytical solutions for clients in the Crop and Animal Health industries. For more than 30 years, the talent at AGDATA has enhanced the technology and services that input manufacturers in the Agriculture world rely upon. Our clients trust us because of our data integrity, marketing program reliability, and our ability to optimize the analytics that inform their sales and marketing decisions. Backed by an entrepreneurial, creative and energetic work force, AGDATA is pushing the boundaries of technology to enhance our relationship with the leaders in Crop and Animal Heath. What we offer:Casual dressIn-house training seminars and resourcesContinuing education opportunitiesEmployee referral reward programAnnual Company Picnic and Holiday PartyCompany provided Coke productsPartner discounts (Verizon/ATT)Paid community volunteer opportunitiesMedical, dental and vision plansPet insuranceFlexible spending accountCompetitive compensationLife and AD&D insuranceShort-term and long-term disabilityTraditional 401(k)401(k) company matchPaid time offFlexible schedulingFamily medical leaveEmployee assistance program

Name: Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Analyst
Description: Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Analyst Job Description: Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Analyst Summary:Signature Consultants has an opportunity for a mid-level AML Analysts. Our client is seeking a candidate to perform customer due diligence of a large volume of AML-related case files and, when needed, escalate requests for further documentation to the Line of Business (LOB) to ensure compliance with internal policies.Responsibilities: Identify higher risk clients and obtain enhanced due diligence where appropriateAnalyze potentially suspicious activity, which will require the review of historical activity along with customer informationProvide opinions and advice to LOB related to BSA/AML/OFAC coverage and potential risks/areas of focusResponsible for assisting with the implementation and monitoring of a risk-based compliance program to assure compliance with federal, state, agency, legal and regulatory requirementsParticipate in and provide compliance support for projects and initiatives with low to high risk to identify, assess and mitigate BSA/AML risk in business activitiesCoordinate regulatory changes and impacts to the businessesAnalyze risks on escalated, referred, or alerted negative news. Signature offers IT staffing, consulting, managed solutions, and direct placement services. For more information on the company, please visit www.sigconsult.com.

Name: Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Data Warehousing
Description: Welcome to Curvature's Job SiteJob Description SummaryThe Sr. Manager of BI & Data Warehousing will lead a team of developers, analysts, and engineers, contributing to the advancement of the reporting and analytics function within the FP&A group. The ideal candidate thrives at delivering solutions to complex data problems, has an affinity for data and analytics in support of driving business decisions, is a strong team leader, and is comfortable working with stakeholders of all levels in the organization. This position will support the team in a non-developer role through analysis, data verification, and governance of Curvature’s data warehouse, while working closely with IT and the data warehouse development team on new projects and using in-depth knowledge of the business, source systems, and operational goals to achieve success. The Sr. Manager of Business Intelligence & Data Warehousing will apply BI expertise and best practices to ensure all Curvature BI systems provide the best delivery possible for reporting and analytics. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES• Capable of leading a team of business analysts• Partner with FP&A on business analysis and supporting business decision-making. • Work with business analysts, source system support teams, and other partners to prioritize and drive the technical deliverables across data warehousing work efforts such as data acquisition, data modeling, data distribution and reporting• support• Interface with business leaders, proactively communicating and collaborating with them throughout the entire delivery lifecycle• Provide leadership and guidance for developing and maintaining architecture and development standards which adhere to industry best practices• Provide direction and oversight for data modelers on data profiling, design of relational and dimensional models, and Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: The Senior Financial Analyst will be responsible for variety of finance related activities that may include assisting in the annual budget and quarterly forecast updates, the reporting and variance analysis of monthly and quarterly results, strategic scenario planning, reconciliations, and other business analysis.  Job Responsibilities  Responsible for the planning and analysis of various revenue, expense and balance sheet items  Develop new or enhanced financial models to support changing business needs  Partner with business leaders/budget owners in the bottoms-up development of key assumptions and financial performance metrics  Interpret financial and operational data and effectively illustrate/communicate links to business performance  Create and update management review materials (business plan and forecast update decks)  Drive audit compliance within the areas for which you are responsible  Contribute to ad hoc analytical projects as necessary both within and beyond your primary area of focus  Work collaboratively with Finance, Risk, Treasury and other partners to ensure enterprise objectives are met Qualifications BS/BBA degree in Accounting/Finance or related field required  Advanced degree or CPA/CFA (or working toward) preferred  Minimum 5-7 years previous work experience in Finance or related field required  Proven track record of driving for results with minimal ongoing direction  Proven track record of influencing decisions with great analytics and financial models  Attention to detail balanced with knowing the right altitude necessary to deliver on requirements  Energetic and inquisitive, quick learner, takes initiative  Ability to work in a complex matrix organization and to operate in ambiguity  Ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbal

Name: Foreign-Trade Zone Administrator\/Analyst
Description: Title Foreign-Trade Zone Administrator/Analyst  18-Sep-2018 Business US - GTS - Operations State / Country / Province Nationwide Job DescriptionTITLE: Foreign-Trade Zone Administrator/Analyst Joining the Stanley Black & Decker team means joining one of the world's largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. Stanley Black & Decker is a world-leading provider of tools and storage, commercial electronic security and engineered fastening systems, with unique growth platforms and a track record of sustained profitable growth. We have been globally recognized as one of the most innovative, sustainable, and rewarding companies in the world. Currently, our Global Tools and Storage Division is seeking a highly driven and results proven Foreign-Trade Zone Administrator/Analyst in Charlotte, NC.Scope: The Foreign Trade Zone Administrator (FTZA) will be responsible for the day-to day operations of our 3 FTZs within operations and manufacturing. This position will also support several on-going I/T projects supporting FTZ operations and assessments. The FTZA should be familiar with receiving inventory control and manufacturing (inverted tariffs), as well as domestic and export shipping. The FTZA will need to have knowledge of Foreign Trade Zones Board regulations, and Customs regulations, and how these apply to FTZ operations. The FTZA must be aware of all aspects of operating a zone. Primary responsibilities:Manages/processes daily Admissions into the FTZ (CF214) and weekly 3461 and 7501 filings.Ensures product movements into and out of the zone are properly accounted for in Customs filings.Performs daily inventory reconciliation between SAP and our FTZ software. Works with warehouse and within MRP software to troubleshoot discrepanciesWill work alongside our FTZ manager to support a FTZ software conversion project in 2019Will actively support any new FTZ implementations as neededMaintains FTZ files and retain FTZ records as required by Customs lawManages exports from the FTZ (CF7512)Provides quarterly Harbor Maintenance Fee paymentsPerforms quarterly internal audits of Zone operations and reports results to management.Additional Duties:Drive cross-functional development and partnerships within the organizationConsult with DC personnel on export procedures and documentation.Updating and maintaining the Operations Manual and exhibits.Will be responsible for maintenance of an audit system to verify compliance at the site.Monitors the savings associated with the FTZ operations.Provides annual FTZ reports as directedEmployee Specifications:4-year College Degree or Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis focusing on international trade compliance (Preferred)Able to pass background check with Immigration Customs Enforcement (Mandatory)Strong computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoints)>2 years of trade compliance experience; FTZ administration experience and/or a Licensed Customs Broker desirableSAP, EZFTZ, IP FTZ, WMS.net software knowledge required.Strong analytical skillsEffective communication skills (written and oral)Knowledge of distribution, transportation, warehousing, manufacturing operationsStrong attention to details; Detail and process orientedProblem solverTeam playerAchieves commitmentsAbility to work well independentlyBenefits:Competitive Salary3 weeks Paid-Time-Off (PTO)Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance401k Retirement PlanEmployee Stock Purchase PlanAdditional benefits available at discretion of associates participation (i.e. Home/Auto Ins, Employee Discounts, Legal Services and much more)Leadership Qualities:Courage & Innovation – Bravely innovate without boundaries. Generate and embrace new ideas. Drive cutting-edge digital solutions. Foster creativity for exponential growthAgility & Performance – Simplify to accelerate business results. Anticipate, adapt to and lead changes. Focus on the right things and act. Perform in ways that exceed expectations.Inclusivity & Collaboration – Respect and leverage all aspects of diversity. Make decisions with an inclusive, global view. Collaborate to amplify customer value. Communicate to drive meaningful outcomes.Integrity & Accountability – Operate with highest ethical standards. Be who you are, build trusted relationships. Act with transparency and positive intent. Live up to commitments and own the results.Requisition Number56445BRCity Charlotte EEO Statement All qualified applicants to Stanley Black & Decker are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran’s status or any other protected characteristic.

Name: Senior AML Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,South Carolina,Fort MillEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: Risk ManagementSchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: Yes, 10 % of the TimeJob ID: 18070497DescriptionAbout CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citis Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.Citi is seeking a Know Your Customer (KYC) Senior Analyst who can successfully contribute to the CBSU customer review process and work cohesively with other staff members throughout Citi, as well as in our other CBSU sister locations. Some of the duties include serving as a primary contact for questions from the other Citi Analysts in the CBSU, reviewing and assisting in determining the root cause of escalated issues and getting them resolved and validated in a timely manner. Lastly, Analyst needs to be able to lead and coordinate in training the other Citi Analysts on all issue resolutions and any impacted procedural changes and serve as a delegate in some tasks typically performed by the team manager, such as running team huddles and disseminating information to the team. Other opportunities are available to work on special projects and assist in project management activities within the CBSU department. The successful candidate will be required to maintain production goals and quality standards while seeking to identify best practices. The selected candidate may also be required to assist the team manager in gathering information for reporting purposes and assist with special projects, along with completing specified tasks from end to end. The selected candidate must maintain a strong level of independence and possess the ability to think quickly on their feet. Strong written and verbal communication skills are key components to succeed in this role. The selected candidate may assist in the on-boarding and training of new associates, as well as being a mentor to less experienced teammates. The selected candidate must maintain excellent organizational and time management skills with a high focus on attention to detail and accuracy.QualificationsMinimum 2-5 years of KYC, Financial Crimes, AML Investigations, or Operational Risk experienceBachelors Degree and/or equivalent experienceSubject matter expertise in AML, EDD and KYC regulatory requirements. Experience in a production and quality - focused environmentDemonstrated success articulating and delivering findings on AML high risk behaviors and KYC dataHigh level analytical research and investigative skill set including experience with customer research and transactional analysis High level of analytical skills and problem-solvingExcellent planning and organizational skills Strong PC skills (Microsoft Office with emphasis on Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)Advanced written and oral communication skills with the ability to summarize findings and present in a clear concise manner to peers, direct and senior level managementAbility to contribute, support, and lead efforts to achieve department/ business unit goals, up to and including recommendations to changes in policy and procedures resulting from review findings, participate in leadership level meetings, and quality assurance review of analyst case workAssist other Senior Level Analysts and management with escalating potential compliance driven risksSupports other Senior Level Analysts and management with additional duties including special projects, time driven deliverables, and High Risk Customer escalationsAbility to work independently and use a high level of independent judgmentPreferred Skills:Knowledge of Citibank branch processes and proceduresStrong knowledge of Citibank customer and transaction systems ( i.e., CitiKYC, Concierge, On Demand, etc.)CAMS/CFE certification

Name: Associate IT Applications Analyst - SAP Hybris Marketing Developer
Description: Recruiter Duke Energy  Location Charlotte, North Carolina  Salary Competitive  Posted 31 Oct 2018  Closes 30 Nov 2018  Ref R6412  Sector Power and Nuclear  Category Information Technology, Sales/Marketing, Skilled Trades  Contract Type Permanent  Hours Full Time  You need to sign in or create an account to save  More than a career - a chance to make a difference in people's lives.  Build an exciting, rewarding career with us - help us make a difference for millions of people every day. Consider joining the Duke Energy team, where you'll find a friendly work environment, opportunities for growth and development, recognition for your work, and competitive pay and benefits. Position Summary The Associate IT Applications Analyst will be a member of Customer Connect Engagement Delivery Team as part of the Connect Program. The individual fewill be responsible for leading portions of design, build and test of application components for the SAP Customer Engagement Platform: SAP Hybris Marketing.  Customer Connect will consolidate four legacy billing systems into one customer service platform to deliver the universal experience customers expect. Internally, this multi-year program will positively impact our business by driving efficiencies, consistencies and insights. Externally, the Customer Connect platform will transform how we serve customers, providing them with the easy, personalized experience they expect from service providers. It's the modernization we need. And the simplification customers deserve.  Customer Connect is a multi-release program that will implement the SAP product suite including: Hybris Cloud for Customer (C4C), Hybris Marketing, Hybris Commerce, Hybris Billing, HANA Analytics and ISU (on S4HANA). The program will be using a hybrid waterfall / agile methodology.  The successful applicant must possess knowledge and understanding of the fundamentals of application development, demonstrate good written and verbal communications skills - with peers, customers and management; and exercise good situational judgment as it relates to troubleshooting problems. Responsibilities Analyze, design, build and test of application components (including configurations, extensions and workflows, where needed)  Identification and definition of technical requirements, including performance, support and SOX compliance  Support the development of an application development standards  Collaborate with IT and business teams  Identify and escalate program issues / risks  Promote documentation, traceability, and best practices for future state system operations  Working Conditions  This position must sit in Charlotte, NC  Up to 10% travel  Basic/Required Qualifications  Bachelor degree in Computer Science or a related discipline with two (2) years or less of related work experience in addition to a degree Desired Qualifications Familiar with SAP Product Suite - Hybris Cloud for Customer (C4C), SAPUI5, Hybris Commerce, Hybris Billing, HANA Analytics and ISU (on S4HANA).  Development / configuration experience in Hybris Commerce, Hybris Billing, SAPUI5 or C4C  Practical experience with Customer Information Systems (CIS) or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) applications (delivery or support)  Demonstrated success in contributor roles  Collaboration skills  Demonstrated solution delivery lifecycle experience as a developer of an application on a delivery project team  Exposed to Agile delivery methodologies  Familiar with the Customer business functions.  Ability to learn/adapt quickly to a rapidly changing environment  Travel Requirements 5-15% Relocation Assistance Provided (as applicable)  No  Represented/Union Position  No  Visa Sponsored Position  No  Posting Expiration Date  Friday, November 2, 2018  All job postings expire at 12:01 AM on the posting expiration date.  Please note that in order to be considered for this position, you must possess all of the basic/required qualifications.

Name: Associate, CS Credit Analyst II
Description: Founded in 1908, CIT (NYSE: CIT) is a financial holding company with approximately $50 billion in assets as of Dec. 31, 2017. Its principal bank subsidiary, CIT Bank, N.A., (Member FDIC, Equal Housing Lender) has approximately $30 billion of deposits and more than $40 billion of assets. CIT provides financing, leasing, and advisory services principally to middle-market companies and small businesses across a wide variety of industries. It also offers products and services to consumers through its Internet bank franchise and a network of retail branches in Southern California, operating as OneWest Bank, a division of CIT Bank, N.A. For more information, visit cit.com.  This position is responsible for maintaining a portfolio of commercial accounts. Primary responsibilities include developing customer relationships, obtaining general business information as well as financials and banking information. With this information and information obtained from external sources, make informed credit decisions that mitigate risk and protect the assets of CIT while servicing our clients.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Prepare written reviews on Customer Credit Files relative to financial strengths and weaknesses of customers with opinions as to credit worthiness.Gather information for Customer Credit Files through inquiries and investigations with trade suppliers, financial institutions, professional firms or individuals.Establish and maintain a computerized Customer Credit Files.Spreading financial statements through the use of computerized financial software program and analyze reports produced by the system for preparation of written reviews and credit analysis.Analyze Customer Credits and highlight problems or questions.Assist the Collection Department in the collection of delinquent accounts.Follow the Corporate rules of Compliance as set forth by the Corporate Compliance Department.   • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.Three years of credit of underwriting experience is desired  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, managing time and resources to ensure work is completed efficiently and within established timeframes.Excellent written and oral communication skills.Strong math aptitude, organizational and analytical skillsComputer literate; fluency in Microsoft Office programs, Excel analysis requiredAbility to establish and maintain effective work relationships both internally and externally.Strong problem-solving and follow-up skills with the ability to make decisions.

Name: Sr Risk Analyst, Ally Invest
Description: Ally Invest is looking for a Risk team member who is excited about strengthening business line risk and controls to ensure compliance with internal and external requirements aimed at the protection and support of our customers and shareholders. The Sr. Risk Analyst will report to the Risk Manager and support risk and control practices for Ally Invest. We are looking for a partner with strong collaboration skills who is comfortable working across multiple departments and business lines. This will be a hands-on roll, requiring someone who is comfortable working across multiple levels of leadership while also working at different levels of detail (from scheduling meetings and taking notes to challenging action plans and solutions to creating executive-level summaries.) As part of this team, the candidate will support the development, implementation and maintenance of our Risk and Control Self-Assessment activities end-to-end, not only coordinating the process and reporting, but helping identify areas for improved controls and working with the business to implement them. We want a team member to help us look for ways to challenge the status quo and improve efficiency and effectiveness of team processes with a focus on risk practices, operational compliance, trading, operations and customer service. Ally Invest includes a FINRA registered broker dealer, a SEC registered Advisor, Futures and Forex lines of business.  Job Responsibilities  Primary: Risk Self Assessments - Partner with business leads across Ally Invest to prepare for and conduct the annual risk self-assessment (and aligned WSP requirements)  Enhance Risk & Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) w/expansion of Control Inventory (partnering with business line compliance)  Continuously refine RCSA structure, within defined enterprise toolset, and support the conduct of the RCSA in accordance with Independent Risk Management (IRM) requirements, timelines, and hierarchy guidance  Set up appropriate calls / working sessions to evaluate risk controls and practices within each product and functional area  Document results, review with business leads, and support summarization of findings for leadership review  Identify opportunities for the business to incorporate more ongoing testing of controls  Evaluate existing business line controls against new and enhanced processes to identify gaps / areas of improvement  Work with compliance and business teams to define / build new controls and ensure they are in all appropriate inventories and risk / compliance assessments  Support RCSA activities initiated via regular annual schedule as well as when Trigger Events require it to be re-opened and revised  Create business leadership and executive / committee level reporting in accordance with requirements  Support integration of RCSA results into standard WSP / Invest Program assessments in support of the annual certification process  Supporting Responsibilities  Develop and maintain written procedures for risk reports and processes  Build feedback loops and work with teams across the Enterprise on corrective action resulting from internal risk and control reviews, external audits, and self-identified issues  Assist Risk team with risk and compliance training initiatives  Apply knowledge of company policies and standard practices to resolve problems and drive continuous improvement  Assist with other risk activities and administrative efforts such as on-boarding new team members, supporting issue management and resolution, and contributing to both routine as well as customized reporting for all levels of leadership Qualifications Education level: Bachelors Degree or higher  Total years and type of prior related experience: 5 Years Minimum  Prior experience with Risk management practices, whether directly on risk side or business side  Strong Excel skills; must be able to manipulate details in spreadsheets (merge data sets, run compares, create filters / status indicators, etc.)  Knowledge of Project Management methodologies and tools and the software development life cycles; Agile practices preferred  Demonstrate excellent interpersonal and communication skills (personal, written and presentation) and work cross-functionally with business and IT staff  Ability to work with complex problems in an ambiguous environment  Solid PowerPoint / presentation skills preferred  Brokerage & wealth management experience preferred, FINRA Series 7 licensed ideal  Able to prioritize and meet deadlines (project management skills a plus)  Proactive mindset in problem identification and resolution  Independent and self-motivated  Flexible/dependable  Results oriented team player  Organized, detail oriented, thorough and persistent

Name: Omni - Implementation/Conversion Senior Analyst
Description: GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES • Develops understanding of and defines client products and services through information gathering sessions to determine how FIS systems must be established to meet client needs. • Through data analysis, product mapping and interviews, gathers forms and data files from customer and assesses requirements for software utilization and discusses any software customization requirements with programming team. • Creates data maps and transaction workflow documents showing exactly how every field of information will be converted. Data mapping forms the technical specification for the conversion and, in some cases, may generate code. Shares data maps with programmers, clients and others as appropriate to ensure successful conversion. Refines mapping through validation. • As part of the conversion process, tests customized software against customer specific needs sharing reports and application specific data with customers that reflect how conversion data will be processed. Reviews conversion results (reports, balancing, data load, software changes) with client to refine and confirm requirements. Obtains formal customer acceptance of results. • Examines client processes, forms and reports, determines operational needs and documents what software will do and all related processes, forms, reports, etc. to be used after conversion is complete. • May develop new procedures with client to ensure FIS software is used appropriately. • Carefully examines data and reports to make sure conversion is proceeding correctly, runs test scripts with various data to see how new or customized transactions process through the software and verifies and validates accuracy of data through the generation of a variety of reports. Validation may include completion of prior system to FIS balancing. • Coordinates and conducts readiness review. This includes directing the customer in the preparation and execution of test scripts to verify accuracy of data, training and procedures, system set-up and reports. The readiness review process ensures the customer training and procedures, the system, and the conversion data are correct and ready for actual conversion. • Customizes FIS software through the use of authoring tools to meet individual customer needs – modifies screens and data fields, creates new forms, screens, product sets, tables, etc. • Throughout project, provides expertise to answer questions and guide clients in the use of the system. • Conducts train the trainer sessions to instruct and train internal customers (employees) or external customers on changes, new systems or new procedures. • Acts as an on-site resource during conversion and answers questions, troubleshoots problems as they occur, supports implementation of new procedures, conducts last minute training if necessary and provides support during conversion week. Reviews the conversion results (reports, balancing of systems, balancing system conversion to associated General Ledger accounts, errors with the customer and obtains client sign-off. Coordinates and directs the completion of post-conversion maintenance potentially including error resolution, system or data changes and balancing adjustments. • Other related duties assigned as needed. EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in business or related field or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES • Communicates ideas both verbally and in written form in a clear, concise and professional manner • Requires advanced working knowledge of FIS systems as well as the industries in which FIS competes for business • Ability to understand, apply and explain concepts • Ability to handle project commensurate with job expectations • Ability to analyze and solve problems using learned techniques and tools • Requires human relations, negotiation and documentation skills • Requires high attention to detail • Positions involving data mapping require strong analytical and technical skills • Ability to translate client requirements to technical specifications and communicate to technical staff • Team skills, including the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships both internally as well as externally • Flexibility, versatility, dependability FIS JOB LEVEL DESCRIPTION Advanced professional role having broad expertise or unique knowledge. Uses professional concepts in developing resolution to critical issues and broad design matters. Works independently on significant and unique issues where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangibles. Exercises independent judgment in methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Expected to be primary mentor for others on staff and is a role model for rest of team. Effectively communicates with all levels of technical and non-technical personnel. Ability to provide communication on issues or complex information to a wide audience based on knowledge. Identifies and provides solutions to complex mapping or interface requirements of unique projects and examines data field conversion requirements. Evaluates and tests all complex processing and interface requirements of unique customization work. Identifies additional opportunities to provide more products, services or other resources to customer. Participates as a senior member in strategic planning and direction. Develops, documents and implements standards, guidelines, direction and education on process/procedures for staff. Assigned to the most highly visible, sensitive and critical projects and may be used in a consulting capacity. Typically requires a minimum of ten plus years implementation and/or conversion experience with a demonstrated ability to handle high project complexity.

Name: IT Security Analyst 5 (JoinOCI-SecGroup)
Description: Executes security controls to prevent hackers from infiltrating company information or jeopardizing e-commerce programs.  Researches attempted efforts to compromise security protocols. Maintains security systems for routers and switches. Administers security policies to control access to systems. Maintains the company s firewall. Uses applicable encryption methods. Provides information to management regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration or denial of access to information.  Provide leadership and expertise in evaluating and developing complex business problems, frequently operating at the leading edge of technology. Recommends and justifies major changes to existing automated systems. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. Eight or more years of related experience recommended.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law. OCI Security Go-to-Market Engineer* Are you interested in solving complex security problems in a new development organization? Oracle s Cloud Security Organization is working to increase product and platform capabilities that allow us to prevent, detect, and respond to threats to Oracle s Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) environment. The OCI Security Go-To-Market (GTM) team is partnering with our internal security architects, engineers, and developers to comprehensively own all external communications regarding OCI security & compliance.  OCI Security GTM takes a big-picture security view of what we do and what we are planning, covering product, platform, process, and people, covering all types of communication written, verbal, live, canned. We empower other groups to deliver & scale security capability and operations while we focus on telling the current story and future roadmap in an honest and compelling manner.  Understand and represent the Oracle security & compliance capability set against that of our competitors (internal sense of urgency vs. external view  As a Senior Security Engineer in the GTM team, you will need strong technical expertise, clear communication skills, and unending passion for information security. Qualifications: 5 years in information security and risk management solution architecture, engineering, development, and / or program management.  Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Security, etc.  Strong written / verbal communication skills.  Experience with security controls in cloud infrastructure / platform-as-a-service environments, either as a customer or provider  Proven ease at connecting the deep technical topics with the business case and priorities.  Knowledge of available security tools, vendors, and controls  Knowledge of regulatory compliance frameworks, including PCI, FedRAMP, etc.  Good interpersonal skills  Highly self-motivated and directed  Experience building and communicating roadmaps to customers, explaining priority rationale, and funneling feedback to accountable teams / management  Experience building and presenting executive summary content from highly technical capabilities and decisions  Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment  Job Responsibilities  Work with technical content owners to create accurate and impactful content across OCI security and compliance, including whitepapers, blog posts, customer presentations, capability demos, etc.  Deliver strongly against established objectives, such as increasing customer awareness of security and compliance, expanding mindshare with customers, driving adoption of OCI by using security and compliance as an enabler of sales  Educate Oracle field/sales on security and compliance functionality, controls, roadmaps, etc.  Collaboratively engage with security professionals among our key customers, so that they understand our capabilities and roadmaps, and so that we factor their feedback into our plans.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.-?xml:namespace prefix="o" /-> Please email your resume to cassandra.engle@oracle.com for immediate consideration. *Job:** **Information Technology**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *IT Security Analyst 5 (JoinOCI-SecGroup)**Location:** *WA,Washington-Seattle**Requisition ID:** *180015TW**Other Locations:** *United States, US-WA,Washington-Bellevue*

Name: Jr. Rebate Analyst
Description: Whatever your interests, whatever your talents, at Diversey there's a special career that's right for you. One that meets your goals and the company's objectives.  POSITION SUMMARY:  The Jr. Rebate Analyst completes and audits rebate fulfillment in accordance with contracts.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Process select fulfillment rebate claims on a monthly and/or weekly basis for designated large multi-location distributors for North America ensuring payments are accurate and paid within established turnaround timeReview distributor data, create load file and run daily queries on rebate orders to correct set up errors prior to posting.Review variances to determine root cause and resolve to avoid reoccurring issues. Work with Sales, Finance, Pricing and/or the distributor to resolve issues.Provide dedicated customer rebate related service/support to assigned distributorsAudit rebate claims to ensure payment is accurate and all variances correctly identified.Review rebate disputes and determine appropriate corrective action needed to resolve.Create and update process documentation for assigned distributors.Work with AR Deduction and Collections teams to research and resolve deductions. Respond to internal and external customer inquiries and clearly communicate findingsIdentify issues which may require deviation from standard practices and work with appropriate manager for solutions  INTERACTION REQUIRED WITH:Interact with Sales, Finance, AR, Customers  EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:Bachelor’s degree required (business, accounting or finance preferred)Associate’s degree plus 3 years relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a Bachelor’s degreeExperience with SAP, BI and Hyperion beneficial, proficiency with some manufacturing and finance systems strongly preferredAdvanced experience with Microsoft Excel required (pivot tables, vlookups)  OTHER REQUIREMENTS:Strong organizational, planning and critical thinking skills; high attention to detail.Ability to multi-task and handle high volume of work accurately and timely.Ability to understand processes at a conceptual level and execute correctly.Ability to identify alternative solutions to issues and recommend course of action.  Once part of the team, you'll have the opportunities to further yourself each and every day. From career discussions with supervisors and experienced professionals, to global, world-class training and development seminars, a career at Diversey is all about reaching the goals you have today, while setting new ones for tomorrow.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst - Consumer Card Direct Mail Strategies
Description: Job Description: The US Card Finance team is part of the Consumer Finance Organization. The primary focus of the team is to provide financial support to the line of business through profitability analyses, strategic planning, forecasting, and business case development. Business partners include the Card Product, Risk Strategies, Credit Risk, Quantitative Modeling and Optimization, Marketing, and broader CFO teams.  This role primarily focuses on supporting new account card acquisition in the direct mail channel. This teammate is responsible for ensuring sound financial discipline of marketing dollars in the channel through business case development, forecasting, and performance monitoring. Candidate is expected to attend stakeholder meetings as the Finance SME and partner closely with the product line of business, marketing, risk strategies, credit risk, and modelers. Analysis will utilize data from external credit bureaus, internal databases, and the Value Matrix model. The team member is able to combine this data with a strong financial acumen to guide strategic direction by presenting recommendations to business leaders.  Potential candidates will be expected to have a solid financial acumen, strong background in Excel and PowerPoint, and experience managing business relationships. SQL coding and SAS programming background are not required; however, the candidate will have an opportunity to advance these skill sets in the role.  The US Card New Account Acquisition Finance Team is split between Charlotte, NC and Wilmington, DE, with about a quarter of the team located in Charlotte. Required skills:Bachelor's degree2-4 years of finance experienceAdvanced excelShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Business Solutions Consultant - Fraud Technology
Description: Job Description:Position Summary Owns and manages a component of a portfolio of technology-driven initiatives for a single business unit/LOB partner. Typically aligned to a component of a business domain where responsible for management of a client / business area in a component of its information technology-related activities. Directs lower-level managers or team leaders or directly manages a specialty function. Accountable for the creation and development of technology solutions appropriate to business needs and objectives, and oversees implementation of programs, projects or processes. Involved in the coordination of translating business strategy into work programs and processes. Works with partners to develop and drive technology solutions and business case development across functional groups or within a business domain. Often serves as a single point of contact and the escalation point between the client/business area and internal IT management for the resolution of unresolved problems, complaints, and complex service requests. Name: Time and Attendance Systems Analyst - REMOTE
Description: When the global aerospace community looks for ideas and solutions to its biggest challenges, they turn to the people of UTC Aerospace Systems. We design, invent and deliver the most advanced and diverse range of aerospace systems on the market. We are inventors. We are manufacturers. We work in space exploration, commercial air travel, defense and rescue applications. Always learning and pushing the boundaries, we are an undisputed industry leader that continually sets the bar higher and higher. Come soar with us.  Do you want to be part of a new, exciting initiative to combine foundational IT with new digital technologies? Our IT team is leading UTC Aerospace Systems to empower digITal. With this initiative, the team is leveraging technology to make our internal work environment more efficient, productive and seamless. For our customers, were working to make aircraft more electric, intelligent and integrated. If youre an agile thinker who enjoys utilizing modern technology to make big improvements, then youre a perfect fit for this team. Join UTC Aerospace Systems and help us to empower digITal today!  The Business Analyst position will be part of the Financial Applications team in Digital Technology at UTC Aerospace Systems. You will be responsible for designing and implementing time, attendance and labor tracking solutions across the global organization. You will need to demonstrate a deep knowledge in time, attendance and labor collection processes as well as some software development expertise. You will work with cross-functional teams to ensure government and corporate policies are met and to enable the business to derive meaningful information through labor reporting as it relates to resource allocation and product costing. Principal Responsibilities:Support large projects including implementations, mergers, acquisitions and divestituresWork with cross-functional groups to design solutions and advise project teamsIdentify and deliver system operation improvementsDesign interfaces (improve processes, share data)Report Generation (build and modify reports using either sql or Crystal Reports)Support Information Technology audits focused on business, SOX and Government complianceManage, prioritize and resolve trouble tickets and user requestsAnalyze and troubleshoot software and interface issuesSupport month-end / year-end activity (load holiday calendars/banks, adjust processes based on payroll schedules)Other duties as assigned*This position can be 100% REMOTE with some travel. Qualification: Required Qualifications:Five (5) or more years of experience with AutoTime (or similar) Time and Attendance systemTwo (2) or more years of experience writing PL/SQLTwo (2) or more years of experience with Business Objects/Crystal Reports Development or equivalentStrong knowledge of financial accountingDemonstrate a Project Management Skill SetExperience designing interfaces with other environments (i.e. SAP, JDE, WorkDay/GlobalView)Up to 20% travel requiredAbility to develop and execute SQL scripts to gather data for analysisAbility to work on-call schedules, including weekends, if necessaryMust be highly organized, detail oriented, and able to multi-task customer and business prioritiesAbility to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical customers and team membersAbility to work well in a team environment and with a geographically diverse teamResults-oriented with intense focus on success • Self-directed and experienced with little management oversightPreferred Qualifications:SAP | FICO experienceAerospace and Defense experienceExperience with configuring Windows serversSolumina experienceFamiliar with continuous improvement methodologiesFamiliarity with government accounting, including total time accountingEducation: Bachelor's degree in Business or Information Technology-related discipline with seven (7) or more years of experience OR advanced degree with five (5) or more years of experience requiredUnited Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Name: Sr Risk Analyst, Digital Transformation
Description: Position Description  This position offers an exciting and challenging opportunity to apply financial risk management principles, as part of our Digital Transformation team, that operates in an Agile environment. The Digital team is seeking creative problem solvers that can help our Agile teams maintain their rapid pace of change, while avoiding risk, to provide a world-class digital experience. Aligned to multiple scrum teams, this role will serve as a 'Risk Guide' to help each team avoid material risks, establish controls and navigate the risk management landscape. With a focus on helping the Agile teams reach their goals, the Risk Guides will need to provide competitive research, gather data and propose the solutions that will reduce rework and achieve timely legal, compliance and risk approvals in governance routines. While assigned teams will be roughly grouped by business line, Risk Guides may be aligned to Deposits, Auto, Invest or Mortgage scrum teams. The role involves frequent interaction with all levels of the organization and with all Business Lines and Enterprise teams.  A key part of this role is leading several core risk management functions for the Digital organization as part of the overall risk framework and in compliance with the Enterprise Risk Management Policy. These functions could include regulatory change management, root cause analytics, new product assessment, developing training or tracking internal standards and controls. These areas of expertise will contribute directly to the increased emphasis on Risk Management at Ally and provide Digital Transformation with a subject matter expert to ensure consistent alignment to risk management programs  Job Responsibilities Serve as a Risk Guide (RG) to assigned scrum teams to support the strategy, objectives and structure of the new Risk Guide program.Provide assigned scrum teams with the creative problem solving needed to maintain their rapid pace of change while avoiding material risksPeriodically lead calibration sessions, LCR Chapter meetings and other risk routinesLead core risk management function(s), as assigned, and ensure compliance to Enterprise Risk Management Policy and other governing standards and requirementsCoordinate with Independent Risk Management (IRM) on requirements, review and challenge, ongoing monitoring and any reporting requirementsActively support the annual Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) programSupport training to Digital team on assigned core risk functionTraining and continuous professional development is expected to be an integral part of the roleQualificationsHigh level of problem solving capability and research-oriented skills to bring new thinking to business problemsMinimum 3 years of digital financial services experience with at least one year of Risk Management and/or Agile environment experienceUnderstanding of the regulatory and risk management requirements impacting the digital channel (e.g. fraud, security, accessibility, disclosures) across lines of business.Familiarity with current digital products and services to include web, tablet, mobile, chat, text and social platformsProven ability to establish programs that require coordination/collaboration across organizationsDemonstrated leadership ability as well as ability to develop and execute tactical plansProven ability to translate strategy into actionStrong organizational and communication skills, with the ability to communicate at all levels within the organizationConflict management skills and/or demonstrated the ability to handle difficult situations with other organizations or teammatesProven ability to lead / manage without formal direct reporting authorityExperience with building strong partnerships with oversight functions (e.g. Legal, Compliance)Expert proficiency with MS Excel, MS Word, and MS PowerPoint.Ability to learn specialized applications quicklyBachelor's degree in risk management, information technology, process engineering or related fieldProven ability to manage issues through to resolution; skilled at making sound judgment calls Ally Overview  Ally Financial Inc. is a leading automotive financial services company powered by a top direct banking franchise with the opportunity, experience and people to redefine the industry. Ally's automotive services business offers a full suite of financing products and services, including new and used vehicle inventory and consumer financing, leasing, inventory insurance, F&I products, commercial loans and vehicle remarketing services. Ally Bank, the company's direct banking subsidiary and member FDIC, offers an array of deposit products, including certificates of deposit, savings accounts, money market accounts, IRA deposit products and interest checking.  Business Unit / Global Function Description  Ally Financial's Risk function manages and analyzes Ally's exposure to internal and external risk factors. The function strives to achieve an appropriate balance between risk and return, to limit unnecessary risk, and to protect the company's financial returns.  Total Rewards Information  Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and bonus pay potential based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid-time-off program with an emphasis on work-life balance. Ally offers a variety of benefits to protect your health and well-being, provide financial security and balance your work/life needs including: Industry-leading 401K Retirement Savings Plan including Matching and Company ContributionsComprehensive wellness program and wellness rewards to help you reach your personal health goalsFlexible health insurance options including dental and visionPre-tax health savings, dependent care and commuter transit accountsLife and disability benefitsOther work/life benefits including tuition reimbursement, adoption assistance, weight watchers and employee discount programs. Ally is an Equal Opportunity Employer  We extend equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law. 3F Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/DisabledSDL2017

Name: Sr. Risk Analyst, Ally Invest
Description: Position Description  Ally Invest is looking for a Risk team member who is excited about strengthening business line risk and controls to ensure compliance with internal and external requirements aimed at the protection and support of our customers and shareholders. The Sr. Risk Analyst will report to the Risk Manager and support risk and control practices for Ally Invest. We are looking for a partner with strong collaboration skills who is comfortable working across multiple departments and business lines. This will be a hands-on roll, requiring someone who is comfortable working across multiple levels of leadership while also working at different levels of detail (from scheduling meetings and taking notes to challenging action plans and solutions to creating executive-level summaries.) As part of this team, the candidate will support the development, implementation and maintenance of our Risk and Control Self-Assessment activities end-to-end, not only coordinating the process and reporting, but helping identify areas for improved controls and working with the business to implement them. We want a team member to help us look for ways to challenge the status quo and improve efficiency and effectiveness of team processes with a focus on risk practices, operational compliance, trading, operations and customer service. Ally Invest includes a FINRA registered broker dealer, a SEC registered Advisor, Futures and Forex lines of business.  Job Responsibilities Primary: Risk Self Assessments - Partner with business leads across Ally Invest to prepare for and conduct the annual risk self-assessment (and aligned WSP requirements)Enhance Risk & Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) w/expansion of Control Inventory (partnering with business line compliance)Continuously refine RCSA structure, within defined enterprise toolset, and support the conduct of the RCSA in accordance with Independent Risk Management (IRM) requirements, timelines, and hierarchy guidanceSet up appropriate calls / working sessions to evaluate risk controls and practices within each product and functional areaDocument results, review with business leads, and support summarization of findings for leadership reviewIdentify opportunities for the business to incorporate more ongoing testing of controlsEvaluate existing business line controls against new and enhanced processes to identify gaps / areas of improvementWork with compliance and business teams to define / build new controls and ensure they are in all appropriate inventories and risk / compliance assessmentsSupport RCSA activities initiated via regular annual schedule as well as when Trigger Events require it to be re-opened and revisedCreate business leadership and executive / committee level reporting in accordance with requirementsSupport integration of RCSA results into standard WSP / Invest Program assessments in support of the annual certification processSupporting ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain written procedures for risk reports and processesBuild feedback loops and work with teams across the Enterprise on corrective action resulting from internal risk and control reviews, external audits, and self-identified issuesAssist Risk team with risk and compliance training initiativesApply knowledge of company policies and standard practices to resolve problems and drive continuous improvementAssist with other risk activities and administrative efforts such as on-boarding new team members, supporting issue management and resolution, and contributing to both routine as well as customized reporting for all levels of leadershipQualificationsEducation level: Bachelor's Degree or higherTotal years and type of prior related experience: 5 Years MinimumPrior experience with Risk management practices, whether directly on risk side or business sideStrong Excel skills; must be able to manipulate details in spreadsheets (merge data sets, run compares, create filters / status indicators, etc.)Knowledge of Project Management methodologies and tools and the software development life cycles; Agile practices preferredDemonstrate excellent interpersonal and communication skills (personal, written and presentation) and work cross-functionally with business and IT staffAbility to work with complex problems in an ambiguous environmentSolid PowerPoint / presentation skills preferredBrokerage & wealth management experience preferred, FINRA Series 7 licensed idealAble to prioritize and meet deadlines (project management skills a plus)Proactive mindset in problem identification and resolutionIndependent and self-motivatedFlexible/dependableResults oriented team playerOrganized, detail oriented, thorough and persistent Ally Overview  Ally Financial Inc. (NYSE: ALLY) is a leading digital financial services company and a top 25 U.S. financial holding company offering financial products for consumers, businesses, automotive dealers and corporate clients. Ally's legacy dates back to 1919, and the company was redesigned in 2009 with a distinctive brand, innovative approach and relentless focus on its customers. Ally has an award-winning online bank (member FDIC), one of the largest full service auto finance operations in the country, a complementary auto-focused insurance business, a growing digital wealth management and online brokerage platform, and a trusted corporate finance business offering capital for equity sponsors and middle-market companies.  Business Unit/Enterprise Function  Ally Invest, launched in May 2017, is the brokerage and wealth management offering from Ally. The offerings consist of a trading platform for self-directed investors, as well as a suite of automatically managed investment portfolios. The Ally Invest team is responsible for ensuring the technology and service of the platform with a focus on award winning customer service and outstanding user experience.  Total Rewards Information  Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. Plus, we have a flexible paid-time-off program including time off for volunteer opportunities. Ally's Total Rewards Program is designed to enrich your life at work -- and outside of it and includes: Industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributionsWellness program encouraging healthy living with financial rewardsFlexible health insurance options including dental and visionPre-tax Health Savings Account with generous employer contributionsPre-tax commuter benefitsOther work-life integration benefits including parental and caregiver leave, adoption assistance, backup child and adult/elder day care program, child care discounts, tuition reimbursement, LifeMatters® Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programs Ally is an Equal Opportunity Employer  We extend equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law. 3F Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/DisabledSDL2017
