Name: Sales Operations Analyst
Description: Job Overview: The Sales Operations Analyst is responsible for supporting the Sales and Marketing Management team by ensuring that data required for critical decision support is maintained to a high standard and accurately reported. The individual in this position is responsible for:Creating and analyzing sales-related statistics to drive insights, performance metrics and driving efficiencies that help our sales team meet their targetsAnalyzing data regarding sales performance, marketing activity and company trendsIdentifying error trends/patterns and isolate discrepancies in the dataCompiling month-end sales analysisIdentifying trends and recommend improvementsWorking closely with Management on important issues and projectsWorking with Sales Management to design and maintain dashboards and reports to provide visibility into sales, marketing and business metricsAssisting sales management on special projects (i.e. Territory Planning, Forecast & Revenue Projections, Productivity Analysis)Performing other relevant duties as assignedQualifications/ Experience: The qualified candidate must have: Bachelor's degree2 to 3 years experience as an analystStrong problem solving and analytical skills with strong business acumenStrong process and reporting orientation with a meticulous attention to detailAbility to work with management and staff to define and manage complex workflow rules, data validation, and triggersMastery level in Microsoft tools: Excel, Access, and other MS Office toolsUnderstanding of databases and data integration toolsStrong organizational, analytical and communications skillsAbility to multitask and prioritize competing assignmentsAbility to approach tasks with a sense of urgency and meet deadlinesAbility to work independently with minimal supervision, but also driven by team workSales department experience a plusCrystal Reporting experience a plus Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Analyst: 2 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Corporate Development Analyst II
Description: Apply Now Corporate Development Analyst II 1210 AvidXChange Lane, Charlotte, NC 28206, USA Req #435  Monday, October 22, 2018  By trade we are a technology company, but if you ask anyone that works here, they’ll tell you we are a people company. As the industry leader in Accounts Payable (AP) Automation, AvidXchange strives to provide an innovative and collaborative work environment. We do that through focusing on our people, our culture, and ensuring we run our business in a way that enables every employee to achieve their fullest potential and help us create a world class company. Our employees live by our core values, including “Innovate to Change the Game,” “Passion About Customer Success,” “Win as a Team,” and “Have a Blast.” Whether you live in Charlotte and can enjoy our corporate campus at the AvidXchange Music Factory, or you live across the country, AvidXchange has locations waiting for you. We are on a mission to create something different at AvidXchange. Love where you work. Live Avidly. Job OverviewAvidXchange seeks a Senior Financial Analyst to partner with the company’s corporate development organization and other senior business leaders. The person in this highly visibility role will be responsible for evaluating a wide range of business opportunities, including M&A, investments, partnerships and other strategic options. In addition, the person in this position will assist in leading due diligence efforts and conduct extensive research on industries, potential partners, and competitors and communicate findings and recommendations to senior management and the executive team. This position plays a key and active role on a small team that drives corporate transactions across AvidXchange. This person will own the financial analysis that guide decision-making among senior business leaders and Corporate/Business Development teams. Many assignments will be highly ambiguous and require an independent, intellectually curious individual who can frame situations through multiple lenses including the end-customer, business owner and corporate finance processional. About you: You thrive in a fast paced, team environment and look for ways to jump in adding value to the team. You have a knack to know what needs to get done do, before being told. You are not afraid to throw out new ideas or potentially a contradicting viewpoint to encourage a dialogue. You want the opportunity to grow and recognize a strong track-record will help achieve that goal. At the end of the day (which at times can be late in the day) if the team wins, you feel a sense of achievement with your teammates. And you like to have a little fun along the way.Job ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities will include: Financial analysis and modeling for acquisition targets, partnership candidates and internal initiatives.Assist with identifying potential M&A opportunities, performing preliminary research and maintain CRM profiles.Analyze business opportunities originating from internal and external sources.Proactively research and understand competitive landscape to identify new opportunities.Prepare communications and presentation materials for internal audiences with responsibility for the quality of content.Assist in due diligence process for various M&A projects including interaction with buyers, sellers and third parties.Performs other related duties as assigned or required.Support the overall business strategy and assist to drive new opportunities.Experience and QualificationsRequired Skills and Competencies: Bachelor’s degree in finance, quantitative analytics or business required, MBA preferred2+ years of corporate development, private equity, investment banking or other transaction-related/due diligence experienceCompletion of a 2-year investment bank or private equity associate programHigh proficiency with valuation modeling and techniquesDemonstrated understanding of the economic drivers behind a variety of business modelsDeep Excel skills including building financial and sensitivity models, joining together multiple data sources, verifying data integrity and use of advanced Excel functionsProficient in PowerPoint and Word with a proven ability to craft and deliver key messages and clear storylines with well-presented supporting data and analysis to all levels of the organizationComfortable balancing multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced ambiguous environmentStrong business acumen with a desire to learn and confidence to work across all levels of the businessMust be self-starter that can independently manage their tasks and welcomes chances to problem solveExceptional oral and written communication skills necessaryDirect experience working in mergers & acquisitions within a Software as a Service (SaaS) company preferred AvidXchange is an equal opportunity employer. AvidXchange is committed to equal employment opportunity in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. AvidXchange will not discriminate againstapplicants for employment on any legally recognized basis. This includes, but is not limited to: veteran status, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ageand physical or mental disability.

Name: Change Management Consultant
Description: Change Management Consultant Location: Charlotte, NC  Duration: 12 months Description:Education: Bachelor's Degree or a combination of education plus equivalent work experience This position supports Change Management and internal operations communications needed to help meet high impact, departmental goals for the Grid Solutions organization. Will be supporting the Grid Solutions Targeted Underground Program. Applies all aspects of program/project change management using consistent Change Management methodology and practices including but not limited to: resource planning, work breakdown, risk/issue management, implementation planning, communication, resistance management and integration with other projects and activities. Performs routine change management consultation for projects, processes and change initiatives. Supports development and implementation of strategic program engagement approaches. In addition to education requirements above, role requires: Proficiency of Microsoft Office products. Demonstrated excellent written and oral communication and group presentation skills. Additional desired qualifications:Demonstrated strong leadership skills: negotiation, conflict management skills, influencing skills, ability to give and receive positive and constructive feedback - Demonstrated ability to communicate a vision and obtain buy-inChange Management certificationAbility to adapt and change as business needs change.Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment .Minimum education: Bachelor's Degree or a combination of education plus equivalent work experience

Name: Mainframe Systems Analyst / Support
Description: Job Description: Position Summary The primary responsibility of this position is to provision user desktop IDs in non-production GWIM environments with security roles, using the LightHouse and SailPoint provisioning tools. Requests are submitted by users via a ticketing system as well as email and these requests have to be fulfilled and responded to within a pre-defined SLA. This process is critical in conforming to GIS standards related to associate access to individual applications.The role involves interacting with and providing direction to offshore resources performing a similar function, as well as interfacing with support teams onshore. Interaction with support teams is required in case of issues with provisioning tools, or changes to the list of roles and entitlements as new applications are on-boarded.The position also entails periodic coordination with release management and platform engineering teams to validate the provisioning tools each time a software release requires switching of key databases between testing pipelines.Flexibility in responding to process changes is very necessary since provisioning processes need to be tweaked when GIS rules and policies are amended, or provisioning tools are enhanced. Required Skills 5-7 years experience with Systems Analysis and Programming skillsMainframe Development experience required to run transactions and look up dataExperience with database design, SQLUnderstanding of SDLC and AGILE development practicesKnowledge of and experience with key Bank of America/ML GWIM applications, databases and frameworksExcellent oral and written communication skills; ability to create user documentation and document workflow processesProficiency in Microsoft Office applicationsAbility to work independently; communicate with and lead offshore resourcesUnderstanding of authentication and authorization techniques used in Bank of America/ML GWIM applicationsAbility to review new technologies as applicable solutions to new or existing problemsCOBOL, DB2, IMS, JCLBatch processing experience Desired Skills Knowledge of tools used for ID provisioning: LightHouse and SailPointShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Logistics Finance Analyst
Description: Logistics Finance AnalystJoin a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  Join a team of freight and logistics finance professionals to support transportation and distribution center financials with one of the Honeywell businesses. You will play a part to support the logistics finances thru budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis and reporting. You will play an important role in managing financial performance and implementing finance strategies to achieve committed business performance. You will support Honeywell business leaders and support to drive finance initiatives and decisions. You will also play important part to identify trends and developments in competitive environments and support the management outcome decisions.  Make an impact on management reporting, budgeting, forecasting and financial analysis.  Make an impact on financial performance of the business.  Execute strategies to achieve committed performance.Created with SnapPrepare and Analyze Monthly Financials and develop ForecastsPartner with Logistics leaders to optimize freightDevelop Analytics on Freight SpendsBuild Reporting and analytical capabilitiesYOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance.WE VALUEProficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.Experience with SAP / HFM / HSP are a plusDetail Orientation.Good problem solving skills.Good analytical skills.Ability to work with less supervision.Ability to work well under pressure.Strong business partnership and communication skills.Ability to prioritize and coordinate multiple tasks. Name: Financial Analyst - Assoc
Description: Job SummaryThe Financial Analyst - Associate provides financial and business related analysis. The individual is responsible for assisting the Sales Finance team research, interpret, develop, and implement complex financial concepts and/or techniques. The individual also assists the Sales Finance team develop and implement financial tools and analysis to provide strategic direction for financial and sales team leadership.Essential Job DutiesAssists in the development of volume/trade forecasting, & risk and opportunities.Assists with issues relating to customer deductions, post audits inventory, and other balance sheet accounts.Ensures policy compliance (trade manual & SOX) and adherence to financial controls.Conducts trade event / customer agreement reviewWorks with sales finance team on Analysis of ROI and Profitability of trade events.Works with sales finance team to assist Sales leaders with pricing and customer strategy decisions.Ensures reporting and controls in place to monitor and project team business results.Prepares reports and analytics on a periodic (weekly/monthly/quarterly/annual) and ad hoc basis, and provides associated explanations for findings.Ensures understanding of consumption data and consumer insights to identify trends and suggests improvements.Supports the annual operating plan process, providing financial and business guidance.Tracks and ensures delivery of operating plan commitment.Performs other duties as assigned.Scope of ResponsibilityThe individual acts as a business partner and consultant on all financial matters. The individual works under the guidance and supervision of other Sales Finance team members.Knowledge and Skill RequirementsStrong analytical and problem solving skills.High degree of accuracy and integrity and strong attention to detail are required.Continuous improvement mindset.Strong organizational skills.Ability to exercise discretion while managing confidential information.Strong computer skills including Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.Education and ExperienceBachelor's Degree; a minimum of 2 years related financial experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience required.Travel RequiredMinimal travel may be required.

Name: Consumer & Commercial Asset-Backed Analyst
Description: At Barings, we are as invested in our associates as we are in our clients. We recognize those who work diligently for us and reward them for personal and professional integrity, communication skills, distinct competencies and expertise in specific strategies, ability to collaborate as a team member and true dedication to the interests of our clients.  We thank you for your interest in joining the Barings team, and invite you to explore our current employment opportunities. Business Unit: Fixed Income  Job Summary  Barings is seeking an asset-backed credit research analyst to assist in the coverage of private consumer and commercial related asset classes. The candidate will work closely with and in support of Barings' senior origination and structuring analysts, with a focus on conducting a comprehensive opportunity driven credit analysis inclusive of evaluating capital structures, company fundamentals and industry trends. The candidate will need to work independently, as well as part of a team. The position will reside in our Charlotte, NC office, and report to the Head of the Global Structured Finance Group.  Primary Responsibilities Act as research assistant for senior origination and research analystsProduce research from primary and secondary sourcesSupport model development for analysis of sectors and securitiesTrack issuer and industry trends as well as macroeconomic performance driversConduct surveillance on portfolio holdings and identify performance drivers of portfolio performance.Qualifications2+ years of industry experienceBA/BS in mathematics, computer science, finance or economicsStrong technical and quantitative skillsExcellent attention to detail, and work ethicStrong written and oral communication skillsExperience with various analytical platforms including Intex and BloombergPrior credit experience requiredCFA designation desired Barings is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer; Minority/Female/Age/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply.SDL2017

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: SUMMARY: This Senior Financial Analyst role supports management in achieving business objectives, developing action plans to support the objectives and forecasting results based on the performance of, and changes to, these action plans. This position will play a key role in preparing the annual budget and periodic forecasts in concert with management. Additionally this role serves to identify operational drivers that impact results by analyzing data and converting it into meaningful KPIs and actionable business intelligence and making recommendations to support their continuous improvement.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:Prepare, analyze, interpret monthly and quarterly operational and financial results, including internal KPIs, external metrics and business drivers.Support implementation of global consolidation solution by participating in system design, implementation, user training and reporting development.Play a key role in the continued development of FP&A deliverables including reporting, budgeting and planning processes by partnering with the business leaders across key functionsPartner with the broad Finance function to develop sophisticated financial models and analyses to support strategic initiatives and help close the month and quarter in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting PrinciplesWork closely with the accounting function and SEC reporting function to provide input on management reporting, operational metrics and better understanding of financial resultsMaintain and refine the detailed financial planning and reporting modelsLead initiatives to refine and homogenize key financial and operational procedures across the organizationContribute with the collecting and analyzing of data for due diligence and acquisition integration activitiesContribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as neededEDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:Required:Bachelors Degree in Business, Finance or AccountingAdvanced Excel and PowerPoint skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsHigh degree of accuracy and attention to detailExceptional organizational, prioritization, project management, decision-making skillsSome travel (both domestic and international) may be requiredMinimum of 3-6 years of relevant experienceDesired:Experience in budgeting and financial planning within a corporate financial or a business unitAdvanced business and/or financial certifications/degrees preferred or desire to pursue (e.g. MBA, CPA, CMA, etc.)Experience with Hyperion Financial Management (HFM), OneStream and/or other consolidation software solutionsSkills/Competencies:Knowledge of accounting policies and procedures including GAAP, FASB and Sarbanes-Oxley requirementsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsProficient in Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word)

Name: Epic Bridges Integration Analyst - 5 months
Description: Title: Epic Bridges Integration Analyst - 5 months  Location: United States  Job Number: 18210817  CTG is seeking Epic Bridges Integration Analysts assist with an implementation and upcoming go-live for a client in TN. Analysts will work primarily remote, but may need to go on-site for occasional events.  The consultant will be required to coordinate the analysis, technical design, and all issue triage necessary to implement and support their assigned interfaces. The consultant will work closely with the application and technical teams to ensure that interfaces meet the needs of end users.  The consultant will be responsible for the following duties: Manage the entire cycle of interface application development, including analysis, design, specification, implementation, go-live, and support.Work closely with application teams, subject matter experts, and third-party application experts to determine the business needs for interfaces, document the requirements, and configure the interfaces per the requirements.Work to diagnose and resolve interface-related issues, and participating in their projects as needed.Coordinate various interface-specific tasks and activities like testing, build, cutover planning, and implementation by engaging subject matter experts and developers.Work with the team to develop methods to support Epic's and external systems' data and format needs.Provide proactive support by monitoring live interfaces and collaborating with experts to provide permanent resolutions to problems.Ensure that data coming across an interface into an Epic application meets the business need.Optimize the interface to provide more efficient processing of interface messages.Interface error analysis.Build/modify interface error work queues for application teams.Build and maintain translation tables.Manage Error work queues for trends in errors and working with the appropriate application team during go-live.Requirements:EPIC Bridges Certification with updated NVT'sA minimum of 3 years? experience with multiple Epic implementationsExperience working with HL7, SQL, Javascripting and other scripting languages is requiredStrong Excel experiencePrior consulting experience Location: Chattanooga TN & Remote  Duration: 5 months  Apply today or email your resume directly to kathy.moore@ctg.com Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.  Job: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Name: Principal Analyst, Service Product Management
Description: Lead a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget.  As a member of the product development division, you will analyze and integrate external customer specifications. Suggest and justify product directions and specifications. Specify, design and implement moderate changes to existing software architecture. Build new products and development tools. Build and execute unit tests and unit test plans. Review integration and regression test plans created by QA. Communicate with QA and porting engineering to discuss major changes to functionality.  Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.*Why Oracle NetSuite?*One word - transformation.* At Oracle NetSuite, we believe the cloud is here to stay and so do our 20,000 customers. We believe businesses should not be bogged down by the overhead of bulky data centers and expensive personnel to run it all. Businesses need to be lean, efficient and agile. NetSuite is literally transforming business around the globe by providing a cloud-based, unified system that delivers unprecedented capabilities to drive business forward. Founded in 1998 as THE cloud ERP pioneer, Oracle s NetSuite global business unit has transformed the business operations of our customers without the high costs and inefficiency of on-premise systems. Transform your career at NetSuite* At Oracle NetSuite we work hard and we work smart. We hire fierce competitors. We hire individuals that are fearless trail blazers. Oracle NetSuite employees take the hill, we prefer action over inaction, we are tireless in our mission and we pause only to celebrate our success. And we DO celebrate, because if you don t have fun along the way, then what s the point? *Summary:* Oracle NetSuite has an exciting service product management opportunity for a detail-oriented, self-motivated individual to build the next generation of service implementation offerings. Product Management Analyst will be responsible for executing on the Product Management strategy in the service implementation area of services including defining business requirements, working with service teams to translate these to delivery execution and the delivery of service offerings in specified timelines.  An ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication, prioritization, cross-functional team collaboration, and problem solving skills. Responsibilities:**Collaborate with customers to build the next generation of service implementation offerings that drive ARR and high quality service deliveryProactively define and drive the creation of new service implementation offerings that customers love.Create use cases, user stories, and detailed product requirements document that clearly articulate desired service capability.Collaborate with Professional Services, Education Services, Managed Services, and Support to deliver great products and tools for both the customers as well as partners.Develop a deep understanding of the marketplace and competitive environment.Manage the product backlog and prioritize product enhancements, customer and partner requests by making smart, decisive tradeoffs using data-driven analysis and sound judgment.Partner with Marketing, Sales, Services and Support to successfully rollout out products and ensure a great end-to-end customer experience.*Qualifications/Skills:**Must be a self-motivated team playerAbility to gather complex customer requirements and translate requirements into a detail plan for executionExperience in 2 of the following functional areas: Professional Services delivery, Consulting, or Technical Solution developmentOver 4 years of professional services, or IT business application, delivery and managementOver 2 years of consulting services delivery and managementExperience working in a matrix/collaborative environmentExperience with or knowledge of NetSuite s SuiteSuccess implementation methodology a plusBA Business Administration or BS Engineering required. MBA a plus.Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.**Job:** **Product Development**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Principal Analyst, Service Product Management**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *180017CG*

Name: Senior Consultant, IT Strategy, Advisory
Description: Senior Consultant, IT Strategy - AdvisoryAbout Avanades Advisory Practice The North American Advisory team is responsible for long-term strategy and business solutions, providing advice and leveraging technology advancements while steering our Clients through business transformations. We deliver a broad range of Advisory Strategic Services through an integrated yet collaborative approach between our clients and practitioners.  Avanade Advisory Practice specializes in engagements across four key Advisory Practice areas: IT Strategy which includes our Cyber Security practice area; Modern Workplace; Business Applications Strategy; Change Enablement and Data & AI.  Avanades Advisory Practice focuses on the Identification, Formulation AND Realization of business strategy objectives utilizing Best Practices Methodology while creating an exceptional Client experience. Overview: Avanade is seeking a Senior Consultant to expand its advisory capabilities. You will participate on IT Strategy engagements advising clients at the highest strategic level with big-picture and tactical guidance on how technology enables a wide range of business outcomes. You must possess exception analytical, interpersonal and creative thinking capabilities. You will need to be entrepreneurial, enterprising and personable, possessing exceptional leadership qualities, that allows you to assume a critical role in the Advisory Practice with an ability to scale over time. Key Role Responsibilities: Collaborating with Avanades management team and other senior client executives (C-levels, VPs, Directors), you will assist our clients in successfully defining their technology strategy, investments and operating models to support their business priorities. As a successful Senior Consultant, you will: Conduct detailed analyses to understand and explain client problems and utilize standard consulting management skills such as facilitation, interviewing, gap analysis, etc.Identify, develop and document issues, perform analysis, draw conclusions and formulate strategic recommendations, with assistance with management team membersCreate clear and Our professionals bring bold, fresh thinking combined with technology, business and industry expertise to help fuel transformation and growth for our clients and their customers. Avanade has 30,000 digitally connected people across 24 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate.  Avanade® Is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, marital status or any other protected status. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where our people can be the best at what they do. Name: Implementation Consultant 4
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. We're looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you'll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  The Payments, Virtual Solutions, and Innovation (PVSI) team includes Operations, Cards and Retail Services, Deposit Products Group, the Innovation Group, Treasury Management, Merchant Services, Payment Solutions, and Wells Fargo Virtual Channels and the professional services teams that partner with these businesses. PVSI's focus is on delivering the next generation of payments and deposit capabilities and advancing our digital and online offerings to design new customer experiences and products. Its guiding principles are to start with the customer, move faster, and partner effectively.  The Cards & Retail Services team helps customers achieve their financial dreams by providing a variety of products across the credit spectrum. We deliver industry-leading rewards, offers and benefits that recognize and celebrate our customers' relationship with Wells Fargo. Our customers all have unique goals and dreams - whether preparing for a home improvement project, shopping for a new sofa or kitchen table or meeting healthcare and dental needs. Others just want a financial tool that allows them to make everyday purchases while earning rewards. Our team works together with groups across the company, including the bankers in our 6,200 banking stores, to provide financing in the form of general-purpose cards, co-branded cards and private-label and industry cards. Our team is 6,700 strong, working in communities across the nation, and focused on doing our very best to help our customers succeed financially.  The CRS Service Communications Center of Excellence team is seeking an Implementation Consultant who thrives on identifying and analyzing a wide range of information and leading meetings and discussions to deliver accurate and customer-centric service communications.  Excellent fact-finding, project management, writing, and editing skills are required to manage complex customer-facing service communication projects and content from intake to final approval.  This role also requires the ability and willingness to collaborate and lead effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative, yet highly matrixed corporate environment.  Specific Job Duties Lead and manage all life-cycle activities associated with writing or re-writing customer-facing CRS customer service communications, from defining scope and requirements to obtaining final approvals and content testingConsult with business partners to clarify, define and document project scope, desired customer experience and business outcome, and operational and system impactsIdentify the impact of regulatory, operational and system changes and issues on the content of service communication projects; collaborate with product, operations, functional partners, compliance, and legal and system partners to improve communications and the customer experience while completing tasks that adhere to strict deadlinesApply critical thinking skills to analyze and track complex, highly matrixed system information to understand the current and desired business strategies, processes, systems, operating and compliance environments have on service communication strategy and content; provide issue resolution recommendations to move work forward and meet established timelinesEffectively organize detailed project files, including key meeting notes, project plans, and approvals for easy tracking to facilitate progress reports and support audit requirementsThrive as a member of a core team, as well as member of various project teams, facilitating content meetings with partners in a poised, professional manner and service oriented-attitudeExceptional writing and editing skills with ability to adapt writing style to transform bank/legal jargon into simple, concise language with a conversational tone while applying corporate writing standards and brand voice to improve the customer experience. **Preference for role to be in one of the posted locations; however, consideration will be given to candidates across the Wells Fargo footprint. Name: Senior Product Planning Analyst

The Senior Analyst role will be responsible for, among other things: developing and executing an analytics-based demand planning program, defining assortment and inventory strategies, optimizing retail pricing strategy and planogram design, collaborating with vendors to drive category growth while balancing cost, and implementing robust reporting and management tools to track results. This role reports to the Manager of Strategy and Corporate Development. Name: National Sales Analyst - (Emerging Channels)
Description: Job Summary  This position is responsible for providing in-depth research and analysis of market, category, sales, and inventory conditions to determine potential increased productivity and profitability. In addition, this role gathers data on competitors/consumer preferences and buying habits and develops and completes promotional planning, execution, and analysis of distribution gaps. This position will work with sales management throughout the regions and corporate groups in building analysis to understand business trends. This position will support emerging channels, to include Costco, Natural, National Convenience and Dollar/Drug.  Essential Job Duties Works with syndicated market data, including but not limited to Nielsen and IRI.Performs analysis, budgeting and planning activities for the account team.Performs ad-hoc analysis and reporting to the sales, retailer and internal teams to guide decision-making; collects, analyzes, evaluates, and reports data to increase general sales productivity.Collects sales trends and records and evaluates performance calculated against sales budgets.Presents results, analysis and potential solutions to the account team, retailer, and internal support teams.Manages and analyzes the account budget trade spend/net sales productivity and makes recommendations for improvement.Manages the promotional contracts submitted to the category managers.Assists with planning sessions and the assortment review process meetings by sharing analysis and recommending strategies to drive sales.Analyzes pricing (i.e. in-house vs. competitor pricing) and recommends strategy.Creates selling stories and selling sheets for internal and external business needs and opportunities.Tracks promotional execution; analyzes promotional execution performance and recommends action plans for improvement.Analyzes and tracks distribution gaps and works with region/sales/account teams to recommend, implement, and track solutions for improvement.Participates in projects and performs other duties as assigned. Scope of Responsibility  Minimal supervision; this position will be a thought leader influencing company strategy.  This role has no supervisory responsibilities.  Knowledge and Skill Requirements Strategic planning, market development and key account experience.Strong technical and problem solving skills; results and action orientedExcellent verbal and written communication skills; strong listening skills; ability to interact with senior executives.Excellent presentation and creativity skills; ability to prepare presentations, interpret data, and provide causal theories will be key elements from daily activities. Must be able to present and perform with an executive presence.Effective management of confidential data.Proven relationship building skills and capable of interacting with buyers and internal senior leaders.Broad understanding of P&L Financial Analysis, trade spending, and category management training. Education and Experience  Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, and/or Computer Science and a minimum of 5 years of related experience in sales and/or operations as a sales leader, key account manager or sales analyst require; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Master's degree in Computer Science, Finance, or Business preferred. Must be an expert at Retail Link, Excel, and PowerPoint; familiarity with Nielsen (Nitro) and Spectra is preferred; Shiloh experience beneficial.  Travel Required  Travel required 10% of the time.SDL2017

We work together as One HR to make Wells Fargo an employer of choice, where people are our competitive advantage. They will exercise independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criterion for obtaining results. Name: Trade Planning Analyst
Description: Position Overview: The Trade Planning Analyst is responsible for the implementation and execution of Trade Spending activity for our CPG clients, relative to the budgeting, planning, tracking and analysis of trade spending events. The Analyst is also responsible for providing this information to the manufacturing Client, and members of the Sales and Category Management teams.  The Trade Planning Analyst position supports the development of customer and client sales growth strategies by providing insightful analytics that support a mutually beneficial growth plan. This position interfaces with Clients, Customers, and various members of the Category Management and Client Experience teams. Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Analyze customer sales plan to determine opportunities and gaps while quantifying the financial impact to overall profitability and recommend changes to Sales Managers, Directors and VP-SalesBecome the subject matter expert of trade process and trade management systems; collaborating with Field Sales Managers/Broker Agency PartnersReport and analyze account pricing strategies and executionReport and analyze account promotional and merchandising strategies and executionDevelop a strong knowledge of customers' promotion tendencies and policiesImplement and lead initiatives utilizing analytic resources to provide trade promotions recap & analysisAssist in the annual planning with Fields Sales/Broker Agency partners and analytics teamContribute to the building of mid-year and annual customer business plansCollaborate on customer profitability and volumetric impact in support of trade strategy development and implementationAs directed, create business reviews and presentations dealing with specific needs as they pertain to category management, top line reports, and "New Client Interviews"Responsible for the use and understanding of IRI data and systems utilized to generate the information for category reviewsParticipate in local market presentations and assist in the operation of presentation equipment (computers, LCD Panel, overhead, etc.) as requiredClearly communicate to all downstream team members, the changes in tactics and implications thereofMiscellaneous duties as assignedQualifications, Experience, and Interests: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Name: Analyst - Public Finance
Description: Background Founded in 1928, George K. Baum & Company (GKB) is one of the nations most trusted privately held investment banking firms focused on public finance and taxable fixed income sales and trading. We are recognized as an industry leader in the structuring, underwriting and marketing of taxable and tax-exempt securities. As a registered broker-dealer, GKB provides underwriting and municipal advisory services to a variety of public and private sector clients across the country, as well as offering direct access to the institutional markets for our taxable fixed income clients. Our professionals possess in-depth knowledge and understanding of those services and markets, enabling the Firm to address and meet the specific needs of our clients and successfully manage their portfolio. GKBs Mission: To create enduring value for our clients, our people and our shareholders. Scope of Responsibilities: The Analyst/Associate will be an integral part of the Public Finance Banking team, assume a high level of responsibility, and actively participate in sourcing, developing and executing transactions for governmental and not-for-profit issuers in the Southeast. The Analyst/Associate will provide analytical and quantitative support, as well as prepare presentations and other written materials. The Analyst/Associate will be responsible for supporting senior bankers in providing analytics to government and not-for-profit clients in a variety of states.  The ideal candidate will desire a future in finance. He or she will have an interest in public policy and government, have a thorough understanding of mathematical concepts and a desire to understand and build complex financial models as well as superior writing skills. Responsibilities:Work with our local governmental and not-for-profit bankers on specific issuer relationships, whether municipal advisory, senior managed and co-managed bond issuances, to address any and all documentation and analytical requirements, prepare client briefings and material.Participate as an active and responsible member of deal teams to ensure proper communication flow whether relating to developing the plan of finance, responding to internal compliance and deal tracking requirements, periodic reporting and general transaction administration.Research available data sources to generate leads for potential new businessPrepare presentations for financing proposals and new business developmentAssist in drafting responses to request for proposals by governmental and not-for-profit clientsQualifications:Previous experience in working in public finance or with public agencies is a strong positiveSuccessful candidates will be highly self-motivated with plans for a long career in finance or governmentExcellent analytical and quantitative skills are a must and good understanding of financial markets is expectedWell organized, attention to detail and able to manage multiple projectsStrong user of Excel, PowerPoint and Word; experience with bond sizing software is a strong positiveStrong written and verbal communication skills and professional presence with clients requiredEducation:B.S. or B.A. with major(s) in business, accounting, mathematics, economics, public policy or related fieldsRole Requirements:Background investigation requiredSkilled in Microsoft Office suite requiredEffective communicator with strong passion for customer service skills requiredCompetencies:Strong organizational and follow-up orientationCommunication Skills: Communicates effectively, persuasively and appropriately in oral and written form by understanding the audiences needs, subject matter content and urgency, and assorted media with which to share informationTechnical expertise: Applies and improves extensive or in-depth specialized knowledge, skills, and judgment to accomplish a result or to accomplish one's job effectivelyEthics and Transparency: Understands and upholds the highest degree of ethical standards and maintains the integrity of the organization Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $55,000.00 to $65,000.00 /year  Experience: Public Finance: 2 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Location: Charlotte, NC (Required) Language: English (Required)

Name: Credit Risk Analyst
Description: Requisition Number 18-0086 Post Date 11/29/2018 Title Credit Risk Analyst City Fort Mill State SC Employment Type Full Time Minimum Salary $56,400.00 DescriptionCredit Risk Analyst  Summary:  Under limited supervision from the VP of Loss Mitigation, the Credit Risk Analyst will support the strategy and direction of Sharonview’s lending and underwriting practices. This position will be responsible for identifying, assessing, measuring, and monitoring  credit risks across the credit union, ensuring appropriate risk controls and responses are developed and recommending strategic changes in underwriting to senior management. This will include conducting various portfolio analyses using data from multiple sources  throughout the credit union. The Credit Risk Analyst role will focus on identifying risk trends, conducting due diligence, validating data sources, and effectively reporting key findings. Incumbent is responsible to develop, enhance and maintain, credit risk  analytics and tools in order to optimize the performance of business operations, through analyzing current and forecasting future performance supporting strategic initiatives.  Essential Responsibilities  1. Partners with senior management to analyze trends and make applicable changes to lending criteria to best support meeting Sharonview’s goals and objectives.  2. Perform qualitative and quantitative data analysis using analytical techniques, tools, models, simulation, etc.  3. Interpret results of analysis; present recommendations to senior management with alternatives and implications for recommended changes.  4. Partners with management, internal resources and third party vendors to effectively develop the strategic goals and objectives of the team.  5. Prepare/collaborate on presentations, reports, and captures key credit risk elements for trend analysis as a loss control measure.  6. Gather, analyze and synthesize quantitative and qualitative data of business processes to determine and promote data driven business decisions.  7. Create and manage dashboard reports for management review.  8. Provide ad-hoc reporting and analysis of data with the ability to demonstrate significant changes  9. Evaluates loan performance data for scorecard cutoff recommendations, scorecard validation purposes and underwriting recommendations.  10. Assist in the identification, development, and evolution of KPIs.  11. Familiarity with factors driving performance of the industry.  12. Reviews reports and performance trends on a monthly basis with Loan Collection Manager for the loan loss reserve calculations and charge-off report to the board.  13. Utilize performance measurements and indicators to identify areas for improvement; develop process improvement plans for each performance indicator or area identified.  14. Ability to manage multiple conflicting priorities across multiple projects/initiatives.  15. Other Duties as assigned. RequirementsQualification and Requirements  This Candidate should have the following experience and skills:  • Bachelor’s degree (BA or BS) from an accredited four-year college or university and five or more years of related asset recovery or loss mitigation experience.  • Must possess effective research, analytical and problem solving skills.  • Proficient with a variety of computer software applications, including MS Word, Excel and MS Outlook, experience with Temenos Lifecycle Management suite software highly desired.  • Must possess ability to maintain accuracy with attention to detail and meeting deadlines.  • Superior written and verbal communication skills with an outgoing, friendly personality. Information can be exchanged in person, in writing, by telephone or e-mail with a wide variety of persons, both internally and externally.  • Must accept empowerment to be accountable; must be willing to be coached and be moldable and teachable.  • Must be a self-motivator and have the ability to work independently.  • Demonstrate strong organization skills, high level of accuracy, and the ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment while able to give attention to details.  • Demonstrate complex problem solving skills - identify complex problems and review related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. Requires creativity, resourcefulness, strong decision-making and quick-thinking skills and abilities.  • Maintain knowledge of and comply with all banking related regulations and internal policies and procedures.

Name: Senior Consultant - Energy - Organizational Transformation - Remote
Description: Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant?s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant?s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.  With over 600 consultants, Navigant?s global Energy practice is the largest energy management consulting team in the industry. We collaborate with utilities, government and NGOs, industries and large corporations, product manufacturers, and investors to help them thrive in a rapidly changing energy environment. Our clients include the world?s 50 largest electric, water, and gas utilities; the 20 largest independent power generators; and the 20 largest gas distribution and pipeline companies. Navigant?s seasoned professionals and highly skilled specialists form exceptional teams to help clients transform their businesses, manage complexity and accelerate operational performance, meet compliance requirements, and transform systems and governance to address upcoming changes as the energy transformation takes hold.  Navigant was awarded the contract by the Government of Puerto Rico through the Central Office of Recovery, Reconstruction, and Resilience (COR3). Bringing reliable and affordable power to Puerto Rico is critical to the island?s economy and the well-being of its residents. With Navigant?s expertise across power systems generation, T&D, distributed energy resources, and grid modernization, Navigant is uniquely positioned to deliver on key objectives for a more resilient, customer-centric, and sustainable energy system for the people of Puerto Rico.  The Organizational Transformation Analyst is responsible for working with Navigant PMO, technical advisors and external stakeholders including clients to implement change management methodologies, build organizational capability and lead cultural adoption. The OT Analyst will support creation and implementation of change management plans (including the integration of communications and training) for raising awareness about energy system transformation, coaching sponsors and leaders, involving employees in the design of the change, getting employees ready for the change, accelerating the transition from current to future states and achieving the benefits of the change Responsibilities: + Manages the change management process and applies change management tools in support of a project or initiative  + Builds change management skills and supports other change management practitioners  + Assists with implementing provision change management tools  + Supports design, development, delivery, and management of communications  + Conducts impact analysis, assesses change readiness, and identifies key stakeholders  + Provides input, supports document requirements, and designs and delivers training programs  + Consults and coaches project teams on change management  + Creates change management strategies  + Work within a team environment to build internal capacity and efficiencies, as well as promote a culture of continuous improvement.  + 2 -4 years of experience in the electric utility or consulting industry  + Change management, process improvement experience preferred  + Excellent written & verbal communication skills  + Strong Presentation, PowerPoint & Excel skills (Advanced)  + Demonstrated organization skills with the ability to multi task effectively in a high-volume environment while maintaining adherence to deadlines and priorities  + Strong knowledge and experience working with large data sets, determining the key data points and being able to concisely summarize it for senior management.  + BS required/MS preferred  + MBA or Masters preferred  + PMP preferred  + Travel required  + Frequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectively  + Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills  + Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently  + Flexibility and responsiveness in managing multiple projects in sometimes high-pressure situations simultaneously  + Able to travel via airplane with minimal assistance to client sites across the US and potentially internationally  + Usually remains stationary for the majority of the day  + Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data  The company offers competitive compensation packages including an incentive compensation plan, comprehensive medical/dental/life insurance, 401(k) and employee stock purchase plans. *_Navigant does not accept Name: Data Analyst with Python Experience needed for CODE REVIEW Project
Description: Overview: One of our most prominent Banking clients is currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst with Python programming experience for a long-term contract role doing Data Analytics and Code Review work in their Charlotte, NC offices. This is NOT a programming role -- but rather, it involves reviewing code and making recommendations on how to fix coding errors to remediate various issues that have already been identified by an audit team. This is a long-term contract position with the possibility of it evolving into a full-time direct hire position. You would be working with one of the largest financial services institutions in the U.S. Their Audit Department alone is over 300 strong, and they are expanding at a rapid pace. There are great opportunities here for career growth. This company is focused on employee recognition and talent development. It is an award-winning workplace that has been recognized for its inclusive culture and commitment to employee engagement. The compensation plan is highly competitive. This is an exciting, growth-oriented position with a highly regarded company! Requirements:Must have Data Analytics experience and must understand basic Internal Audit / IT Audit processes and controls.Experience in a Banking environment would be ideal.Must have experience with Python programming language.Risk Management or Compliance experience is strongly desired.Must have strong communications skills.Please read the following before applying:NO CORP-TO-CORP sub-contracting. Candidates must be willing to work as direct W-2 employees.NO VISA SPONSORSHIP. Applicants must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer, without sponsorship.NO "REMOTE" WORKERS. Candidates must already live near and work on-site at our client's office in the Charlotte, NC area. If you feel you are qualified and interested in this opportunity, please include both an email address and a phone number with your resume and application. Note: Only qualified candidates with the above listed requirements will be contacted.

Name: Strategic Business Analysis and Planning Specialist
Description: When the global aerospace community looks for ideas and solutions to its biggest challenges, they turn to the people of UTC Aerospace Systems. We design, invent and deliver the most advanced and diverse range of aerospace systems on the market. We are inventors. We are manufacturers. We work in space exploration, commercial air travel, defense and rescue applications. Always learning and pushing the boundaries, we are an undisputed industry leader that continually sets the bar higher and higher. Come soar with us.  At UTC Aerospace Systems, were ushering in a new era of customer service, with sophisticated tools that enable real-time customer connections and service anticipation techniques. We combine these innovations with responsive repair performance, product support and issue resolution for our global customers. Anytime. Any place. Its this kind of best-in-class support that has kept our customers coming back for the past 100 years. Want to join the largest aftermarket network in the industry, with more than 50 maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) locations across 26 countries? You can learn from the best while bringing your fresh perspective and enthusiasm for customer service to our team. If those closest to you would use the words reliable and dependable to describe you, you could be a good fit for our team!  The UTAS Worldwide Repair Organization is looking for individuals who enjoy problem solving with the intent of having significant impact on the strategic direction of a multi-billion dollar business. We are looking for people who like taking complex problems, breaking them down, and finding solutions that help us become a better business. This individual will be a key team member on a high visibility team who will help guide senior management in the development and implementation of the companys strategy. This individual will also be integral in the execution of the strategies as well. In this position, the individual selected will work projects with an interesting combination of finance, operations, and market dynamics that will have a big impact on the direction and future performance of UTAS Worldwide Repair. Primary Responsibilities:Interfacing with senior management to provide strategic direction for Worldwide Repair in the areas of market share growth, market share protection, and operational improvementIntegrating with the UTAS Business Unit repair network to develop companywide business insight and strategyDeveloping and implementing market trend and market share models, providing insight to the larger repair network, developing action plans to address identified gapsDeveloping sustainable tools that provide for efficient analysis of the business current state and lead to rapid decision makingInteracting with business stakeholders to understand their problems and providing cross functional guidance and expertise, working with employees from various backgrounds (finance, operations, supply chain, quality, engineering, sales, marketing, etc.)Qualification:Basic Qualifications:The ability to adapt in a fast paced environmentA strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially ExcelA familiarity with Aerospace industry or general Aftermarket businessStrong program management skills and the ability to run multiple projects simultaneouslyStrong problem solving skills, developing entrepreneurial solutions to problemsGood written and verbal communication skills Preferred skillsExperience leading in matrixed organizationsExperience in advanced data querying and analytics tools (e.g., SAS, SQL, Tableau, Vba)Education:Bachelors degree in Technical, Business or Finance related field required with 2-6+ years of experience in operations, engineering, or finance.Masters degree preferred. Nothing matters more to UTC Aerospace Systems than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen. Note:Background check and drug screen required (every external new hire in the U.S.)Drug Screens for re-hires only performed for previous employees who have been gone from company for more than 1 year.
